Carmina Burana: Crush the two pieces of candy until they are pulverised. Pour the vodka into the shot glass before adding the powder. Stir it until the candy has dissolved in the liquor.
Roadkill: Pour all 3 ingredients into the glass and serve with a Coke back.
Gold Record: Shake and strain into ice filled highball glass. Garnish with a slice of lime.
Absolut Royal Fuck: Created by Ruby Tuesday, Ocala, Florida
Sancho Panza: Stir and serve neat. Add a cherry.
Irish Rickey: Pour Irish whiskey and juice of lime into a highball glass over ice cubes. Fill with carbonated water and stir. Add the wedge of lime and serve.
Kahlua #5: Use fifteen 12 oz bottles with tops (cork is prefered with liquor bottles). Make sure the bottles are clean. Mix the coffee, sugar, vanilla poweder in the largest bowl you have. Add the boiling water and make sure all of the ingredients are blended well. Let cool to room tempature and then add the brandy (make sure that you give it time to cool so you don't cook down the brandy). Get a funnel and bottle your Kahlua immediately. Let stand for a couple of days. Enjoy!!!!
Tiger Paw: Add vodka, lemon juice, ice, and sugar in a mixing glass and shake. Pour into a cup and add orange soda. Stir.
Zombie #4: Strain ingredients into collins glass filled with ice. Top with 151-proof Rum.
Purple Motherfucker #2: Club drink, people like it because of the name and the taste.
White Ape: Make hot chocolate, add Bailey's and ground cinnimon. Float whipped cream on top.
Horny Toad: Layer each part in glass first: Triple Sec second: Kahlua third: Cream
Mother Moo: The origal name comes from a childrens radioshow on swedish national radio called Mamma mu.
Tom and Jerry Punch: Beat egg whites to a stiff froth. Separately beat egg yolks until light in color, gradually add the powdered sugar and spices. Fold yolk mixture into whites. Divide mixture between four 8 oz. mugs. Add 1/2 shot brandy and 1 shot rum to each mug, fill with hot beverage. Stir well and top with nutmeg.
Blonde Ron: "Blonde" comes from how it looks, and my hair color is blonde. "Ron" comes from "Ron" Bacardi that is printed on the label and my name happens to be Ron. It is a light sweet drink that I like and so do alot of my customers at the last bar I worked. I never liked rum and coke because of the taste and just drank rum and 7up for along time till I happened to different juices, cranberry, and OJ are the other ones that taste OK.
Kentucky Shitkicker: Created at Cadillac Jack's Billiards in Edinburg, Tx.
Five in the Morning: Place ice in glass and pour in the five liquors. Next pour in the the orage juice and the sour mix. Finally shake and garnish with an orange slice.
Demon Drop: A nasty little drink guarenteed to mess you up with cheap and deadly everclear. You'll herdly taste the Everclear so it is easy to do 5 or 6. One shot equals about a beer or a beer and a half.
Banana Cream Pi: I invented this drink when I went down to Daytona a little after bike week. The place was deserted, but cheap! I wanted something tropical and ordered pineapple juice with Malibu Rum. It wanted something to round it out and I asked for a shot of banana liquor to be added. Moments later I came up with a name (the bartenders hadn't heard of this drink before) - Banana Cream Pi, that's what it tastes like Banana, Cream, for Coconut cream, Pi for the Pineapple.
Lemon Flip: Put several ice cubes in a shaker, add egg yolk, sugar syrup and lemon juice. Shake very well and strain into a highball glass. Serve with a drinking straw.
Ball and Chain: In shot glass, mix 1 part Gold with 1 part Rump, add a splash of Jager over the top. Manly shot with a tasty surprise.
Belize Rum Punch: This is a drink I discovered at the 1984 World's Fair in New Orleans at the Belize exhibit. It inspired me to take a trip to Belize that year.... and every year since!
Love For Toby: In a shaker half-filled with ice cubes, combine all of the ingredients. Shake well. Strain into a cocktail glass.
Illusion: pour all spirits in the shaker ... & top with a splash of pineapple juice
Sexoholic: If you like spicy food, you like spicy shots. (If you like Spice Girls, this is not a drink for you)
Butcherblock: Pour all ingredients over ice in a large (16 oz.)glass. Shake vigorously. Garnish with grated chocolate. YUMMM!
Yin-Yang: Layer white chocolate liqueur over coffee liqueur. Enjoy.
Moana Sands: From the Moana Sands Hotel in Waikiki.
Oxymoron: This is a late night invention that turned out surprisingly well. It is an intense but not unpleasant drink. The name comes from the fact that none of the flavors mask each other, despite being fairly contradictory in nature.
Quick's Killaritas: A strong drink that flushes your tastebuds with layers of sweet, then sour, then tequila, then bitter.
General Lee: My memorial drink to General Robert E. Lee. A damned fine drink that is present at our "Southern Bliss" parties. So, make everyone a drink, raise it high, toast to the South, and drink it on down...God bless the South! Enjoy!
Rum Toddy: Dissolve powdered sugar in water in an old-fashioned glass. Add rum and one ice cube and stir. Add the twist of lemon peel and serve.
Yellow Rattler: Shake all ingredients (except cocktail onion) with ice and strain into a cocktail glass. Add the cocktail onion and serve.
Lucky Driver: Prepare in a blender or shaker, serve in a highball glass with 2-3 ice cubes. Garnish with one orange slice, and one lemon slice. Use only fresh squeezed juice for best result!
Rum Dubonnet: Shake all ingredients with ice, strain into a cocktail glass, and serve.
Microwave Hot Cocoa: Combine sugar, cocoa, salt and hot water in 1-quart micro-proof measuring cup (or coffee mug). Microwave at HIGH (100%) for 1 to 1 1/2 minutes or until boiling. Add milk, sitr and microwave an additonal 1 1/2 to 2 minutes or until hot. Stir in vanilla, blend well.
Eye-Opener: In a shaker half-filled with ice cubes, combine all of the ingredients. Shake well. Strain into a sour glass.
Kalimocho: This wonderful party-drink is to be drunk directly from the bottle. It may appear disgusting, but I promise you, most of you will not be disappointed.
Sweet Temptation: fresh and sweet at the same time. Invented by Dag Fredrik Ramberg Nilsen. Bartender at Horoskopet.
Luxor Boom-Boom: Take a shaker and put in the alcoholic ingredients first with the ice. Fill up the space that's free for 1/3 up with apple juice and for 2/3 with jus d'orange. Shake it real good and enjoy the most popular cocktail of Luxor Plaza. (a disco in Deventer - the Netherlands)
Lime Time: If you live in Norway you should use a particular kind of beer. It is called AKA PILSNER and is sold in shops called AKA!
Dr. Debbie: Squeeze in the lemon slice and shoot it!
Kristi GreenEye: A refreshing fruity drink named after my good friend Kristi's green eyes.
Grape Crush: Small shaker with ice add ingredients stir strain into shot glass
Chocolate Martini: Pour ingredients into shaker filled with ice then pour into martini glass
Yucca: After the drink is gone, taste the lemons and limes!!
Jelly Bean: mix equal parts in pony glass-tastes just like a jelly bean!
Smarty: Mix all ing. over ice, strain and serve! Tastes like a sweet tart!
Peach Death: Pour ingredients on the rocks and enjoy.
Fog Cutter: Shake all ingredients and strain into a collins glass over ice cubes. Top with a teaspoon of sweet sherry and serve.
Cool Coco: Mix in highball glass. Stirr. Garnish with cherries.
Amaretto Stone Sweet: Since I don't like sour things - this is my version of it - only the sweet way. I drink this almost every night using Blanks non-alcoholic amaretto. It is very addicting!
Root Beer Float #3: Mix Galiano, Coca-Cola and ice. Float cream on top by pouring over the back of a spoon which is just touching the top of the Coke mixture.
Egg Nog - Katie's: Beat egg yolks until thick and lemon yellow, then beat in 1 cup sugar. Add slowly the rye, rum and peach liquer. Beat until smooth. Add the milk and half-and-half. Beat the egg whites until stiff but not dry, gradually adding 1/2 cup of confectioners sugar. Fold the egg whites into the batter. Just before serving, whip the cream and fold it into the other ingredients. Garnish with ground nutmeg. Serve in a punch bowl or another big bowl.
Long Island Iced Tea #3: Fill a Collins glass with crushed ice. Pour the spirits and the juice over the ice. Add cola until the drink becomes tea coloured.
Ladies Cocktail: Stir all ingredients (except pineapple) with ice and strain into a cocktail glass. Add the pineapple stick on top and serve.
Juicy Guiness Premier: A brilliantly fantastic concoction developed in Chamberlain Hall bar over the term of 98/99. Has to be poured correctly to taste nice otherwise the Premier takes the taste away. It does taste of shit to start with but it does get better as you reach the half pint mark. Also makes your mouth very blue... Rakish!!! Pilgrim says it's the way forward.
Monte Cristo: Moisten rim of glass with lemon juice: dip in sugar Pour Kahlua and Grand Marnier in glass Fill, almost to the top, with coffee Top with Whipped Cream and grated chocolate
Gorilla Fart #1: Pour in shot glass. Take a sniff and shoot!
Finlandia Coffee: Pour vodka and Lapponia Lakka into an irish coffee cup. Fill with hot coffee and float fresh cream or whipped cream on top.
Rip Griffin: Put ice in glass, add peppermint schapps, fill with orange juice, stir, add cherry.
Leprechaun: Pour whiskey over ice in a chilled glass. Top with tonic water and stir gently. Drop in lemon twist.
Sailor Mercury: Named after the Anime character Sailor Mercury.
Mike's Eggnog Wonderful: This drink came about when Mike was bored with regular eggnog. He was sitting at home on his couch drinking eggnog staring at his wetbar. He put two and two together to find this eggnog wonderful.
Passion Daiquiri: Shake all ingredients with ice, strain into a cocktail glass, and serve.
Eenytini: Pour blue curacao, gin and 7-Up into a shaker tin filled with ice. Swirl until tin is frosty. Pour into Martini (Cocktail) Glass. Repeat with the cranberry juice and add to glass so that an electric-purple colour is achieved. Garnish with a cherry on a sparkler stick.
Suicide #2: This works much better if you make it in large batches (try to fill up a two l iter pop bottle and go at it!) Great for shooter games!
Frenchie: Pour both ingredients into a cocktail or rocks glass and stir.
Sour Mix: Keeps no more than 7 to 12 days in the refridgerator. Known as both "Sour mix" and "Sweet and sour".
Kool-Aid Shot: Pour into a large glass with ice and stir. Add a little cranberry juice to taste.
Jitterbug: I was looking through the cabnet, and thought "There has to be something in here!" So I grabed out a few things and thats where this drink came from :-)
Apple Martini: If you want to make it look really nice, you can garnish it with a thin slice of green apple. Enjoy!!!
Tea-riffic: Pour in the 6 oz. of triple sec to the sweet tea and add the juice of 2 lemon wedges to it. Leave lemon wedges in drink then add 5 ice cubes. Stir gently.
Godhead: Pour Rum, Vodka, Raspberry Liqueur and Lime Juice a strainer glass. Chill with ice and strain into your shot glass. Float 151 Rum on top of shot. Throw down or ignite and throw down. (Igniting the 151 Rum will lower the alcoholic content.)
Spiced apple: In a shot glass pour in apple brandy first, then Goldschlager, then Captain Morgan's. Shoot!
Manila Fizz: Shake all ingredients with ice, strain into a highball glass over two ice cubes, and serve.
Irish Pride: Thick and freshening, just like every good Irishman.
Tsunami #2: A lovely evening drink by the pool/beach. Tangy and tantilizing, all in one!
Ariel's Frappe Punch: Blend all ingredients in blender and serve in Highball glass. Decorate with a Marashino chery and a grapefruit slice
Buckshot: The Tequila and Whiskey are mixed in the bottom of the shot glass. The Baileys is to act like the 'wax' in a shotgun shell and is layered on top of the whiskey/tequila mix. The fresh ground pepper is your 'buckshot' that creates the spice/burning sensation.
Kir Martini: Created by Di Pierno Roberto (Bar Gilli, Firenze, Italy). Come and have one! Ciao!
Raging Bull #2: This drink was made for countries that doesn't have Battery used in the original Battering Ram.
Participle: Mix liqueur, juice and vodka in a highball glass. Add ice and fill the glass with sprite. You can decorate the drink with a slice of orange, lemon or kiwi if you want.
Swimming Pool: Mix ingredients with some ice in a shaker. Strain into a glass over some ice.
Submarine (nuclear): Start with the gin, then fill up the glas with tonic water. And last, add the ginger ale.
Banana Colada #1: Blend 4 first ingredients with 1/2 cut cracked ice at high speed in 15-25 seconds. Pour into a chilled highball glass. Garnish with cherry and pineapple slice.
Clover Leaf Cocktail: Shake all ingredients (except mint) with ice and strain into a cocktail glass. Add the sprig of mint and serve.
Brooklyn Zoo: This shot is taken by two people through straws. Created by staff at Cafe' Arone bar in Wilson, NC
Inferno: Put the tabasco sauce in the bottom of a shot glass, pour equal parts Absolut Peppar and Everclear 190 then add salt. Set on fire and serve.
Casablanca #2: Shake not too short with enough ice.
Italian Margarita: Pour into glass. Stir. Add ice cubes.
Lolita: Shake and strain into a cocktail glass and add one or two ice cubes.
Nickler: Good luck to any person that can do this...it is fun watching people do this.
National Aquarium: Pour all ingredients into a shaker of ice. Shake well. Serve on the rocks.
Sauterne: Mix the cognac and curacao several hours ahead of time. When ready to serve, pour the necessary amount of this mixture over a block of ice or ice mold in a *cold* punch bowl, and add *thoroughly chilled* champagne. Stir and serve at once, WITHOUT LADLING BACK AND FORTH OVER THE ICE, as this will eliminate the bubbles.
Burning Sun: Pour over ice in highball glass, stir. Garnish with a fresh strawberry
Roxy Special: Give one good shake, add lemon slice and cherry, and serve over ice.
Vernal Equinox: Smooth, sweet, and springtime. Developed on the first day of spring.
Pistachio Cream: Combine all ingredients in an electric blender and blend at a low speed for a short length of time. Pour into a chilled champagne flute and serve.
Blonde Smoothie: This mix will freeze in layers. When you take it out (some time later) let thaw slightly and remix. I usually keep a plastic wrap layer pressed down atop the mix to prevent freezer burn of the ice-cream (that's when ice crystals form, it won't hurt, but I don't really like the texture they add).
Happy Skipper: Pour Captain Morgan's Spiced Rum over ice, fill glass to top with Ginger Ale. Garnish with lime. Tastes like a cream soda. Named for the Gilligan's Island reference ("The Captain" *in* "Ginger" is a Happy Skipper!)
Duncan MacLeod: This drink was named after the Highlander tv show character. It has both major aspects of his origin (Scotland and Japan), and his way with women. It's delicious, and has a slight taste of iced tea.
Bloody Smurf: Pour schnapps into glass filled with ice. Add cranberry juice and stir.
Zimadori Zinger: Pour Zima in a collins glass over ice and then pour the shot of Midori. Don't stir. Garnish with a cherry.
Green Weenie: Works great if you don't have any lime for your Corona.
Sloeberry Cocktail: Stir ingredients with ice, strain into a cocktail glass, and serve.
Southern Blues #2: Mix Schnapps and Southern Comfort together, chill, and serve cold. Tastes like Kool Aid.
Palmer Cocktail: Stir all ingredients with ice, strain into a cocktail glass, and serve.
Seattle Smog: Created this while experimenting with a friends bar. Dont let color scare you. It really does look like smog in Seattle.
Desert Water: This drink wrecks your stomach...learned it from a soldier in the middle east who said it cures sore throats.....
Big Bull: Mix tequila and kahlua in a whiskey glass and serve with lotsa ice...
Spanish Fly: Pour in glass and stir. Serve cold.
Pussy Foot: Shake or blend briefly, strain into a highball glass. Garnish with fresh fruit, cherry, and a drinking straw.
Bali Dream: Put all ingredients in shaker together with some ice-cubes. Shake well. Serve with piece of banana on top of the glass.
Windjammer: Stir first three ingredients together and pour over ice. Top with a marischino cherry.
Jell-o Jiggler Shots: From the Jell-o website you can order jiggler molds in various shapes and themes. They're relatively inexpensive and are great for theme parties (we used the halloween jiggler mold to make jiggler shots for a halloween party, they came out really cool) This recipe worked for four molds, but can be cut in half.
Pink Poontang: This drink is a shooter, so shake all ingredients with ice (in a mixing tin). Strain into a shooter glass.
Tom's Rum Runner: Pour all liquids except dark rum into glass. Fill with ice and stir. Float dark rum on top and stir gently.
Lady L: Shake with 4 oz. 7-Up and a splash of pineapple juice. Pour into tall glass over crushed ice. Color top with a splash of cherry syrup, add cherry for garnish.
The Bianca Pop: Pour coconut rum first then add amaretto.
Flageln: Pour the vodka into the glass first, then pour the Red Bull slowly into it. Add ice.
Carrol Cocktail: Stir vermouth and brandy with ice and strain into a cocktail glass. Top with the cherry and serve.
Limelight: Stir well with ice cubes and strain into a cocktail glass.
Exotic Finn: Fill a highball glass with cracked ice. Add the first three ingredients and stir. Top up with Sprite and garnish with mint leaves, a strawberry, a twist of orange and a straw. Ole Skeiedal, from Norway, took first place in the long drinks listing of the 1993 Finlandia Vodka International Drinks Competition.
Warsaw Waffle: It started as a drunken joke, then it spread like drunken wildfire.
Du Barry Cocktail: Stir all ingredients (except orange slice) with ice and strain into a cocktail glass. Add the slice of orange and serve.
Bye Bye Bahamas: We invented this drink after returning from our honeymoon in the Bahamas. We were trying to reproduce the tropical flavor of the drinks from the Caribbean.
Brass Balls: After hours creation with help of bartenders at BOOMERS in ST. Louis mo.
Fruit Fly: The fruit will hide the taste of the wisky. The flavor of the whisky mixes perfectly with the fruit.
Spark In The Night: In a shaker half-filled with ice cubes, combine all of the ingredients. Shake well. Strain into a cocktail glass.
Polonaise: Shake all ingredients with ice, strain into an old-fashioned glass over ice cubes, and serve.
Arcadia: In a shaker half-filled with ice cubes, combine all of the ingredients. Shake well. Strain into a cocktail glass.
Jockey's Choice Manhattan: This is a house specialty drink from the Bellagio Hotel and Casino in Las Vegas.
Snow Snake: This recipe is from skiing in the Northwest. Be careful it doesn't pull you down..
Ozone: Fill glass with ice Add Amaretto Add splash beer Add sweet & sour Top with sprite Stir lightly
Coquito: Boil the cinnamon sticks in the water. Take the sticks out when the water is yellow and has the smell and taste of cinnamon. Add the evaporated milk, condensed milk and egg yolks and cook at low temperature. While it's cooking stir to avoid it sticking to the bottom of the pot. When it is boiling for a few minutes, add the cream of coconut and rum. Stir well and take off the burner. Let it cool and it will be ready. Keep it in the refrigerator and it will last for a very long time.
Dixie Dew: In a mixing glass half-filled with ice cubes, combine all of the ingredients. Stir well. Strain into a coktail glass.
Shake That Ass: Can also be a drink, instead fill with sour and orange.
The Rollercoaster: This drink may not sound all that great, but believe me it is a wonderful ride. It was created at the University of Dayton during a cast party after an original show called Rollercoaster. Enjoy the wild ride!
Pysch Vitamin Light: Created by Lars Jensen (bartender at "Hjørnet Bar og Brasseri" in Trondheim, Norway) for Pysch, a radio show on NRK PeTre.
Spearmint Lifesaver: Mix 'em, garnish with a slice of lime (optional).
Green Scorpion: Mix Jack Daniels, vodka, blue curacao and ice cubes in cocktail shaker. Shake and strain into glass and top up to desired level with 7-up.
Phoenix Paradise: Place all of the ingredients into a blender and blend for about 20 - 30 seconds. Then pour into a hi-ball glass or a Gibralter 14 oz glass.
Good Morning!: Combine Vanilla Ice-Cream, Sugar, Ice, and Espresso in a blender and blend until smooth. Add Bailey's Irish Cream and Tia Maria then stir. Pour into coffee mug and serve.
Bailey's Cup of Coffee: Preferably drinken in front of an open fire.
Fancy Gin: Shake all ingredients (except lemon peel) with ice and strain into a cocktail glass. Add the twist of lemon peel and serve.
Cafe Savoy: Fill mug almost to top with coffee.Add milk, triple sec and brandy. Stir.
Atomic Watermelon: Mix ingredients in glass over ice and enjoy!
Judgette Cocktail: Shake all ingredients (except cherry) with ice and strain into a cocktail glass. Top with the cherry and serve.
Absinthe Suissesse: Shake with ice and strain into a cocktail glass.
Crimson Tide: combine all ingrediants, chill over ice, strain.
Zimaretto: Pour about 2 ounces of Amaretto into a 16 oz. glass and fill with Zima.
Pensacola Bushwacker: This drink is much better than the other one. If you ever pass through Pensacola Florida you have to go to Pensacola Beach and try the real thing at Jubilee's.
Valentine: Shake banana liqueur, vodka, and cranberry juice with ice and strain into a red wine glass.
Gin Sour: In a shaker half-filled with ice cubes, combine the gin, lemon juice, and sugar. Shake well. Strain into a sour glass and garnish with the orange slice and the cherry.
Puerto Apple: Shake all ingredients (except lime slice) with ice and strain into an old-fashioned glass over ice cubes. Add the slice of lime and serve.
Dreamsicle #4: This is possibly the best mixed drink I have ever had. It tastes like a dreamsickle or a melted push-up.
Acapulco Zombie: This came from the Palladium night club AND Carlos n' Charlie's of Acapulco.
Sour Apple #2: Compliments of the Merry Go Round Bradenton Fl.
Pink Panty Pulldowns #2: In a 2 gallon jug pour in 9oz of marciano cherries and the juice. Then pour in fifth of vodka over cherries and let soak for a few minutes. Then pour in lemon juice and fill jug with sprite. Pour mixture into serving container and strain out cherries. When serving drinks over ice drop cherries in.
Allegheny: Shake all ingredients (except lemon peel) with ice and strain into a cocktail glass. Top with the twist of lemon peel and serve.
Mudwrestle: mix in shaker, serve over lots of ice
Electric Screwdriver: dump the shots in glass then fill with oj to taste
Mardee Mine: In a mixing glass half-filled with ice cubes, combine the rum and vermouth. Stir well. Strain into a cocktail glass. Garnish with the lemon twist.
Sangria #1: Mix all together in a pitcher and refrigerate. Add cloves and cinnamon sticks to taste. Serve in wine glasses.
Coral Reef: The color of this drink reminds me of time spent on the coast of the Yucatan Peninsula. Add more sour mix if desired to offset the strong tequila taste if desired.
Jet Pilot: A nice fruit drink with a kick!
Coffee 43: Better version of Irish Coffee. Sweeter taste.
Shoot to the Moon: To your desire you may decrease the amount of cranberry juice and increase the amount of soda, if you like your drink to be more carbonized.
Papaya Driver: From a Detroit-area restaurant/bar no longer in business (burned down).
Chocolate Raspberry Martini: I made this drink up myself after hearing about chocolate Martini's and trying the new stoli razberi.
Soul Kiss Cocktail: Shake all ingredients with ice, strain into a cocktail glass, and serve.
Brown Cocktail: Stir all ingredients with ice, strain into a cocktail glass, and serve.
Buttmeister: Pour ingrediants into mixing glass, swirl and strain into shot glass.
Parrot Perch: Put liquor, juice, and syrup in blender. Add the sliced banana and ice. Blend for 45 seconds or until smooth.
The Jumpin' Black Jack: Invented (kind of by accident) aboard the Noordaam during the Bad Boys II Cruise. Sure it's sweet but if you like Jack and blackberries you'll love this. Wusses can add 7-up to cut it back a little.
Bambi's Iced Tea: Put ice in glass Pour in vodka Add splash of Sour Mix Half fill with cola Half fill with 7-Up Roll drink to remove fizz Drink!
Wayne's World: Fill the shot glass about 2/3rd's full of Jager, and then top it off with the Sambuca.
Flaming Nazi: If you puke after drinking this no matter what you ate or drank previously this is all you will taste.
Red Baron: Float schnapps on top of Rumple and enjoy!
Tiger's Milk: I personally cannot drink too many milk related alcoholic drinks...they don't settle well with me. But, if you can handle the milk, this is a very fine drink, indeed. Enjoy!
Stanley Cocktail: Shake all ingredients with ice, strain into a cocktail glass, and serve.
Midnight Cowboy: In a shaker half-filled with ice cubes, combine all of the ingredients. Shake well. Strain into a cocktail glass.
Girl Scout Thin Mint Cookie: Jack Jack Bravin, La Mirada California.
Exotica: The cocktail color is the jade. Oriental taste.
Rock and Rye Cooler: Shake vodka, Rock and Rye, and lime juice with ice. Strain into a ice filled collins glass. Top with lemon soda and stir gently. Garnish with a slice of lime.
C*m Shot: Blend liquors in shot glass. Top with whipped cream. Serve.
Downshift: Drink fast but beware of the consequences.
Apple Jolly Rancher: Created at Ruby Tuesday, Ocala, Florida
Satan's Revenge: It is better to mix this one in bulk. It does not matter if it is mixed or not so to make things easier mix equal amounts of J.D., Goldschlager, and Tequila in a large bottle and add about a shot to a shot and a half of Tabasco. Wath out this drink was properly named!
Shark Attack: Mix lemonade and water according to instructions on back of can. If the instructions say to add 4 1/3 cans of water do so. Mix into pitcher. Add 1 1/2 cup of Vodka (Absolut). Mix well. Pour into glass of crushed ice. Excellent!
Flying Teetsie Fly: Created at a Christmas party, this drink was named by Jeff "Hershey" Wright. The name was supposed to be a joke, but I decided to make a drink after it. It became a huge success at the party.
Halfway Special: Combine with ice. Strain. serve in hollowed out pineapple.
Meiner: Pour gin and fill with orange juice, leaving room for the Campari. Stir a little bit. Add a slice of orange, then pour the Campari gently on the slice.
Umbrella Man Special: Invented this summer -97 on the party island Ios in Greece. A real party drink wich has a real good effect if you have problem to get in the mood
Vampyre Brew: Fill glass with ice, add all ingredients, stir well.
Brandy And Soda: Pour the brandy and club soda into a collins glass almost filled with ice cubes. Stir well.
Blue Smurf Piss: Strain through Ice, Tastes better chilled
Chicken Drop: Mix all three in shaker with ice. Pour cold
Rusty Screw: Combine Scotch and Grand Marnier in snifter. Twist lemon peel into mixture. Sip and enjoy.
Penguino: Fill collins glass with ice, add one shot light rum and one shot Cointreau or triple sec. Fill with tonic. Serve ungarnished, or with cherry.
Stinger: Shake ingredients with ice, strain into a cocktail glass, and serve.
Zorro: add all and pour black coffee and add whipped cream on top.
Quick-sand: It doesn't look too good, but it tastes grand. Cheers!
Ginger Syllabub: Put the sherry, sugar, spices, and lemon juice into a large mixing bowl. Stir until well-blended, then leave to soak for at least half an hour. Beat the cream until it is stiff. Fold in the chopped ginger. Chill thoroughly. Before serving divide into four serving bowls and top with crumbs of crystallized ginger and a shake of nutmeg.
Northern Europe Mongrel: Layer vodka and irish cream in a shot glass. Pour beer to fill.
Captain Do: Put shot in then add Soda
Gin Cocktail: Stir gin and bitters with ice and strain into a cocktail glass. Add the twist of lemon peel and serve.
Long Island Tea: Combine all ingredients (except cola) and pour over ice in a highball glass. Add the splash of cola for color. Decorate with a slice of lemon and serve.
Thal on the rocks: Taste: refreshing ideal summer drink although highly alcoholic. Origin: got the idea while working as a bartender, was asked to create some fresh but nonetheless strong alcoholic mix.
Electric Lemonade #2: fill collins glass with ice pour in rum and blue curacao pour in sweet & sour mix splash cola lemon twist garnish
Basic Bill: In a mixing glass half-filled with ice cubes, combine all of the ingredients. Stir well. Strain into a cocktail glass.
B-53: Layer the Kahlua, Sambucca and Grand Marnier into a shot glas in that order. Better than B-52
Pink Pysch: Created by Lars Jensen (bartender at "Hjørnet Bar og Brasseri" in Trondheim, Norway) for Pysch, a radio show on NRK PeTre.
Pirate's Tea: Great for lovers of Long Island Iced Teas & Captain Morgan's Spiced Rum! Just one of the creations invented at The RoadHouse NightClub in International Falls, Minnesota
Green wave: Great beach drink. Changes colors as you add ingredients. Ride the wave, don't get caught up in it!
Herbal flame: Im an average college student, so one hot summer day I peeked in the fridge and only had tea, bologna, and Hot Damn 100. Well i left out the bologna but what was left got mixed and BINGO, all my friends love it. Its one of those drinks that are great with meals.
Twin Hills: Shake all ingredients (except lemon slice) with ice and strain into a whiskey sour glass. Add the slice of lemon and serve.
Mock Pink Champagne #2: Combine all but ginger ale and ice. Chill. Add ginger ale and ice before serving.
Cranberry Frog: Add vodka for a Cranberry Toad, rum for a Cranberry Newt.
Real Pisser: The Mountain Dew's handy when ya wanna stay awake :)
Apple Pie with A Crust: You can substitute the Coconut Rum with Vodka (Absolut preference, of course)to make a simple Apple Pie, but I prefer the mellower taste of the Apple Pie with a Crust. Another drink from the Bangkok Boys.
Tequila Twilight: Adjust the amount of tequila for your own tastes.
Tsunami #1: Fill glass with ice, add Capt. Morgan and malibu. Fill with the pineapple juice. Float 1/2 oz of grenadine and then add 1/2 oz of a dark rum (meyers) for color. Found this to a very popular drink at my bar.
Port Wine Flip: Shake all ingredients (except nutmeg) with ice and strain into a whiskey sour glass. Sprinkle nutmeg on top and serve.
Tennesee Mud: Mix Coffee, Jack Daniels and Amaretto. Add Cream on top.
Cassis Screwdriver: Pour vodka, orange juice, and lemon/lime juice into a shaker half-filled with ice. Shake. Strain into a collins glass with several ice cubes. Add a splash of creme de cassis and of grenadine. Garnish with a lemon/lime wedge and a straw.
Lucky Seven: Usually drinks with this many ingredients taste like shit, but these go surprisingly well with each other. Also been called, at least at one bar, as "The Unholy Seven." Cheers.
Nudge: Flavor is strong toward chocolate side. Vodka adds a zing and can slightly diminish the heat of the coffee. This recipe is "borrowed" from Johnny Angel's - Sandusky, Ohio, which I've heard is no longer open for business.
Old Pal Cocktail: Stir all ingredients with ice, strain into a cocktail glass, and serve.
Screaming Nazi: Add ingredents with ice and shake.
Baby Doll: My ex-girlfriend drank sidecars religiously and I started thinking of top shelf bastardized versions. She loved it and it became a favorite at my bar.
Allies Cocktail: Stir all ingredients with ice, strain contents into a cocktail glass, and serve.
Orange Kiss: Mix vodka and Orancio, add Sprite and garnish with a slice of orange.
Drum Cocktail: I created this drink in August 98 for a new cafe-bar that I am working now. The name of the bar is "DRUM" and when the boss asked me for a special drink I created "Drum Cocktail". It has a light and very pleasant taste that makes it good for everyone, and it is rather a summertime drink. Kisses to everyone on Webtender from Chios Island - Greece
Drink with as many friends as possible. When done, shout "Shoot the GOAT!!!"
Seaweed: Tastes fruity, looks blue-greenish which is where is got its name (looks like dirty lake water).
Brandy Sling: In a shaker half-filled with ice cubes, combine the sugar, water, lemon juice, and brandy. Shake well. Strain into an old-fashioned glass. Garnish with the lemon twist.
Dirty Dick's Downfall: In a mixing glass half-filled with ice cubes, combine the gin, vermouth, and Campari. Stir well. Strain into a cocktail glass and garnish with the lemon twist.
Flaming Spanish Fly: Serve with a florish, but sip slowly, it's hot and potent! This is a great hot coffee drink for those cold nights. Very intriguing to watch being assembled but, watch out, it can sneak up on you.
Pineapple Punch: Put the pineapple pieces in a punch bowl and pour the sherry over them. Chill for 2 hours. Put tea and sugar in a pot, add red wine, lemon juice and rum. Heat but do not boil the mixture. Pour over the pineapple pieces.
Jack the Ripper: Buttershots takes away the bite to Crown Royal leaving a pleasant aftertaste unlike any other.
Bloodhound Cocktail: Shake all ingredients (except strawberries) with ice and strain into a cocktail glass. Decorate with the 3 crushed strawberries and serve.
RumRunner's RubyRed: Fill large glass with ice Add Vodka and Ruby Red juice Top with Tonic Pour from one glass to another to mix
Hot Nun: Pour Frangelico into glass, then honey, next lemon peel and cloves and fill snifter with hot water.
Coke and Drops: Take a glass, pour the Coke in the glass, then you take 7 drops of lemon juice. Granish with a lemon slice on the rim of the glass.
Peppermint Pattie: fill glass with ice pour creme de cacao and the creme de menthe over ice. stir and enjoy. Is best after dinner but can be enjoyed anytime.
Blackbeard: Pour the Captain Morgan's, and root beer schnapps over ice in a highball glass. Fill with Coke or Pepsi and serve.
Beam Me Up: Fill cocktail glass with ice. Add Jim Beam Bourbon and Amaretto. Then add Coca-Cola and stir.
Calm Voyage: Combine all ingredients with 1/2 cup crushed ice in an electric blender and blend at a low speed for a short length of time. Pour into a champagne flute and serve.
Sexual Chocolate: Found on the Bailey's web page
Japanese: Shake all ingredients (except lime peel) with ice and strain into a cocktail glass. Add the twist of lime peel and serve.
Emerald Martini: Stir with cracked ice in a shaker and pour into a chilled cocktail glass. Twist a lemon zest over the drink and float the zest on top.
Spencer Cocktail: Shake brandy, gin, orange juice, and bitters with ice and strain into a cocktail glass. Add the twist of orange peel, top with the cherry, and serve.
Bobby Cocktail: Shake well and strain into a large cocktail glass.
Snowflake: Blend Pear Liqueur, Milk and Ice Add 7-up to taste
Schnider: Pour schnapps in a pint glass, top up with cider. Drink and enjoy.
Jack Rogers: Origin: Mutsu Officers Club, Misawa Air Base, Japan.
Aftershock: Pour the ingredients into the glass and stir.
Sicilian Kiss: Pour both ingredients into 1 ounce shot glass Take as a beer chaser when arriving late at the bar
Lynchburg Lemonade: Mix ingredients into a punch bowl.
Fu-Cha: Put in large container (fu-cha bottle) with ice and shake vigorously. Drink rapidly. Buckets on hand would be advisable.
Sake Bomb: It's real easy. Drop the shot of Sake into a glass of beer and the just SLAM IT !!!!!!!!!!
Octapussy: My invention of this smooth tasting drink originated at Vitoz Nightclub and Sports Bar in Rutland, VT.
Bjorns Moscow Mule: mix lemonjuice with vodka, fill with ginger ale.
Rattlesnake: Layer Kahlua, Creme de Cacao & Bailey's. Can be made in Shot glass, test tube, or tumbler - I sometimes use a wine glass.
Bahamas Rum Punch: Mix it up varying the ingredients to taste. Balance the Orange and Pineapple, add a little Malibu rum till you can slightly taste the coconut, then enough Campari to redden it and then make up the rest with rum. A delicious and authentic island drink that will make you very drunk if you aren't careful ('cuz its so good to drink!).
Palmetto: This is a house specialty drink from the Bellagio Hotel and Casino in Las Vegas.
Harakiri shot: This is not a joke drink, it is strong and very few people actually enjoy it, but some of us do, after you shoot the drink start poring down the beer, or else you will be lighing under the water tap the rest of the evening. :)
The Colombian: Coffee taste with a smooth kick!
Long Summer Night: Pour over ice in glass, stir and serve.
Island Jack: This drink is very tropical. It comes from the TGIfridays franchise.
Blue Thrill: It's a fun shot that I learned in a bar in Europe. It's a fun one to do with your friends.
Obadoba: Mix the o'boy n' the salt in a tall glass, add the heated milk. Put some whipped cream at the top and serve.
The Bronx Ain't So Sweet: In a shaker half-filled with ice cubes, combine all of the ingredients. Shake well. Strain into a cocktail glass.
The \"Liquerice\" Dream: Add all ingredients in shot glass. Mix well before drinking.
Multiple Orgasm #1: Build over ice. Garnish with strawberries or cherries.
Peach Punch: Really nice for parties and for drinking together with Sangria.
Champagne Punch #2: Mix sugar, brandy and 5 bottles champagne in a punch bowl. Then stir in orange, lemon and lime sliced thin into rounds, pineapple chunks and ice. Stir until well mixed. To complete, garnish with strawberries and pour a final bottle of champagne theatrically over the top.
Broken down golf cart: Shaken and strained through ice !!! Mmmmm.....
Silver Cocktail: Stir all ingredients (except lemon peel) with ice and strain into a cocktail glass. Add the twist of lemon peel and serve.
Port And Starboard: Pour carefully into a pousse-cafe glass, so that creme de menthe floats on grenadine. Serve without mixing.
Clamato Cocktail: Shake all ingredients with ice, strain into an old-fashioned glass over ice cubes, and serve.
Wooly Mitten: Put Coaca mix in the mug fill half way with hot water - stir. Pour in Southern Comfort, peppermint schnapps and Bailey's - stir. Top off with hot water. Top with whipped cream (optional) .
Freddy Fudpucker: Pour the tequila and orange juice into a highball glass almost filled with ice cubes. Pouring slowly and carefully over the back of a teaspoon, float the Galliano on top of the drink.
Absolut Stress #2: Mix well. Garnish with Orange and Cherry. Enjoy
Alaskan Pipeline: This drink was created by a group of friends at the Silverado Bar in Tomahawk, WI. Share with your closest friends as a tradition.
Hell Mary: The drink was originally invented by Joseph Chironno at Celebrity in New York
Black Feather: This is a French inspired cocktail, using specifically French ingredients (except for the bitters). The Cointreau should not be too strong in this drink, it should just add a background note. When in doubt, increase the brandy, and decrease the Cointreau. If you are lucky enough to have Abbott's Bitters, that is what this drink was originally designed to use.
The Classic: Shake with ice. Strain in a cooled cocktail glass. Decorate with a maraschino cherry on a stick.
Malibu Bay Breeze: Mix ingredients and serve over ice.
Galliano Hotshot #2: Pour 2 cl Galliano into a shot glass, float 2cl hot filter coffee over it and top with lightly thickened cream as to create three layers.
Long Sigh: Sip. Let the aroma help you along.
Battering Ram: Battery is an energy drink that's become a very popular in drinks in Europe the past year or two. It contains, like the similar Red Bull, a vast amount of caffeine, making it a hit for late night partying.
Ginger Swing: This is a sweet drink invented at a BBQ hot tub party, it tastes extra special in warm water on a cold night!
Three-Legged Monkey: Shake and strain, into rocks glass.
Oatmeal Cookie: With ice, shake/stir and serve in shot glasses. The original drink called for the Goldslager but I actually like it with HotDam better..
Electric Watermellon: Add equal Parts Vodka, Rum, and Melon in a tall cocktail glass with ice. Add a couple of splashes of triple sec (orange Liquor). Fill to the top with sweet and sour. Add a splash of 7 up and grenadine.
Coppertone Punch: Combine Creme de Banana, Malibu Rum, Pineapple Juice & ice in mixing tin. Shake or flash blend. Strain over ice and float Midori. Garnish with watermelon wedge.
Rudolph the Red Nose Reindeer: This can be done with other flavour mixed in with the Cranberry like Cranapple juice etc.
Baby Aspirin: Can also be used as a mixed drink.
Malihini Punch: Combine orange juice, lilikoi syrup and guava syrup, blend well. Chill. Serve over ice cubes.
Horny Mohican: Free pour each ingredient into a test tube or shot glass
Nanc's Iced-Coffee: Sugar may be added, if desired, but not needed.
Wild Wendy: Pour each ingredient in a shaker. Shake well. Serve over ice.
Wet Snatch: Add blue raspberry to ice, add vanilla, pinapple, and coconut, then blend. Add tequila, blend again. Whipped cream on top optional.
Orange Flamingo: First fill glass 4/5 of the way up with orange soda. Then add your grenadine. Finally add the whipped cream to the top.
Brain Tumor: pour the peach schnapps into the shot glass, almost to the top. Slowly, and gently layer the Bailey's in on the side of the glass, to almost full. Add a touch of grenidine,down the middle and a touch of cherry brandy down the middle.
Dr. Pepper #3: fill shot glass with amaretto and gin. Drop shot glass into half glass of beer. Then, slam. It tastes just like Dr. Pepper (the soda)!!!!
Millennium Knockout: This drink has a very potent taste of aniseed from the galliano but mixes well with the orange juice. It is very strong and I would not recommend drinking more than two. It is a self invented drink that I tried out on the family for the Millennium. It will knock your socks off!
Knock-Out Cocktail: Stir all ingredients (except cherry) with ice and strain into a cocktail glass. Top with the cherry and serve.
Quagmyre: Add ingredients as shown in any order. Shake until drink becomes clear.
Jolly Jumper: Just put it together, fill with orange juice, add ice and drink it.
Acapulco: Combine and shake all ingredients (except mint) with ice and strain into an old-fashioned glass over ice cubes. Add the sprig of mint and serve.
Harley Davidson #2: Mix it all togheter and stir it up.
Brave Bull: Pour tequila and coffee liqueur over ice cubes in an old-fashioned glass and stir. Add the twist of lemon and serve.
Flaming Dragon: Warning: DO NOT BREATH WHEN DRINKING!! This highly alcoholic drink should be revered. Failure to pay the dragon proper respect will result in nausea at the least and alcohol poisoning at the next least.
Jack Daniel's Lynchburg Lemonade: Add ice and stir. Garnish with lemon slices and cherries.
Melonball (Spanish Style): Maybe this drink has another name to you, but if you ask for a melonball in Spain this is what you get.
Hairy Buffalo: Have your friends all bring a fifth of alcohol over the night before to give the fruit time to absorb the alcohol. Surround container with ice until the next night. Still good if made the same day, but the fruit won't absorb as much. The fruit is perfect to take to the beach, concerts, and other places.
Absolut Tooch: Chill with ice and strain into shot glasses.
Sex On Acid: Shake ingredients with ice. Strain. Serve as a shooter.
Pan Galactic Gargle Blaster #3: Pour all ingredients into a cooler, chill, and serve. As with most punches, it's hard to be specific about the amounts used. A general rule: pour as much of everything as tastes good, then add more vodka! To make life more interesting, throw in pieces of fruit, and add dry ice to the cooler before serving. Small plastic animals also make a nice garnish (but don't drink them)!
Rum Highball: Pour rum into a highball glass over ice cubes. Fill with carbonated water and stir. Add the twist of lemon peel and serve.
Electric Margarita: Also excellent on the rocks in a highball glass.
Southampton: Pour tonic water over ice in a highball glass. Add a squeeze of lime and Angostura bitters. Stir gently and garnish with a lime wheel.
Green Beaver: Nice and smooth, but not as smooth as Brad Sandidge, who came up with the drink!
Patton Martini: A very smooth martini, only recently released to the civilian world.
Bermuda Rum Swizzle: Stir or shake vigorously until a frothing head appears. Strain into sour glasses. Garnish with a slice of orange or a Maraschino Cherry.
Masala Chai: Masala Chai is Indian for Spiced Tea
The Graveyard: I give this drink to everyone on thier 18th birthday when they're already drunk. It's spicy, it burns, and it's swe-eet.
Natalie Nosedive: This drink was made during a girls' night and the name fits it because you will surely take a nosedive after you finish off the pitcher by yourself!
Echo Hemoraging Tumor: Pour blue Curacao and strawberry schnapps very slowely to achieve the tumor effect.
Melberry: Pour Midori, Chambord and raspberry juice in a shaker. Add a squeeze of lemon and lime juice. Shake. Strain into highball half filled with ice. Garnish with fresh raspberries.
Dew-Driver: Fill glass with ice add Vodka and Mountain Dew...If drinking the Dew-Driver the way God intended (out of a Big Gulp cup) adjust ingredients appropriately...Remember to say "I only had 2 drinks!" whern retching later in the evening.
Barrier Breaker: Pour all of the ingreedients into an Irish coffee glass filled with crushed ice. Stir well.
Hair Raiser: Shake all ingredients with ice, strain into a cocktail glass, and serve.
King of Denmark: Stir the Pernod&Black;, add several big icecubes.
Rubbermeister: I created this because nobody ever mixes with Jägermeister, it seems. Note that Dr. Pepper or one of the generic cherry sodas will work as well, for less $$$.
Golden Apple: Mix the two ingredients in a shot glass.
Kalimotxo: Originated in the Basque Country, nowadays is considered the queen of the drinks by the spanish youngsters.
Mandrin Sprite: Get the Mandrin and Sprite as cold as U can get it. I mean COLD. ITs GREAT & smooth. Tracy loves it late at night.
Chartreuse and Tonic: In glass filled with ice, mix Chartreuse and Tonic water. Garnish with lime slice.
Organ Grinder: Blend. Pour over crushed ice. Sprinke coconut shavings on top.
Jameson St. Patrick's Day: Orange juice should be added to taste, but also to get a nice green color.
Flaming Asshole: Drink fast with a straw. If you are slow your straw will burn. Be careful!
Vodka Stinger: Shake ingredients with ice, strain into a cocktail glass, and serve.
Kentucky Mule: Inspired by the "Moscow Mule" or just plain "Mule", which is the same drink with vodka.
Cabaret: In a shaker half-filled with ice cubes, combine the gin, vermouth, Benedictine, and bitters. Shake well. Strain into a cocktail glass and garnish with the cherry.
Black Samurai: Drink this one fast...don't taste test...just shoot it down then you'll know what it feels like to be stabbed in the guts by an ancient Japanese Warrior...Domo Arigato...
Whiskey Fix: Shake juice of lemon and powdered sugar with ice and strain into a highball glass over ice cubes. Add blended whiskey and stir. Add the slice of lemon and serve with a straw.
Emerald Vodka Martini: Stir with cracked ice in a shaker and pour into a chilled cocktail glass. Twist a lemon zest over the drink and float the zest on top.
Bald Pussy: Start at the top and venture your way to the bottom. Pour over ice and shake it on home! Pour in a highball glass and give 2 or 3 big gulps.
Fruit Salad: Combine all ingredients and serve as a shot or mixed drink.
German Hooker (Die Deutsche Nutte): In a shaker, half filled with crushed ice, combine Tequila and Apfelkorn. Shake well. Strain into a high-ball glass filled with a few icecubes. Fill up with orangejuice. Serve with salt and lemon as a usual Tequila shot. The first German Hooker was served under our graduation week in june 1994. Long live, Anders Hansson!! The technician class of 1994 Brinellskolan, Fagersta, SWEDEN
Wu Wu: If a big bloke asks you for one, don't shout it out all over the bar like I did in the Blarney Stone Too in San Diego.
Polkagris: Polkagris is originally a traditional Swedish candy that tastes like peppermint and cherry. This is a cocktail that tastes something like it. This is probably originated from the Swedish-speaking little towns of the Finnish southern coast, where I noticed it. A sweet, candy-like alcoholic drink.
Green Death: Serve in plastic Champagne Glasses without the plastic bottoms
Cowboy Killer: Similar to a Colorado Bulldog in volume.
Strawberry Soak: Invented by a baker from Hawaii. Created as a by product while marinating strawberries for a dessert. Serve shaken on the rocks with no ice.
Japanese Slipper #2: Shake with ice in cocktail shaker. Strain into cocktail glass.
Beautiful: Pour each ingredient into the snifter and serve.
Maestro: In a shaker half-filled with ice cubes, combine the rum, sherry, and lime juice. Shake well. Strain into a collins glass almost filled with crushed ice. Top with the ginger ale. Garnish with the lemon twist.
Purple Pancho: Shake with ice and pour into salt-rimmed cocktail or margarita glass. Garnish with a lime wheel.
Razzleberry: Tastes like a raspberry tootsie pop with a little kick.
Pink Fix: Nice drink to start off the evening before moving onto stronger libations.
Xanthia Cocktail: Stir all ingredients with ice, strain into a cocktail glass, and serve.
Fridays Frozen Mudslide: This mudslide approximates the delicious (but expensive) mudslide offered by the restuarant named after everyone's favorite day of the week. It is rich in chocolate taste and packs a hidden punch behind its rich decadent creamy flavor. I got the recipe from the bartender at the restuarant. Be sure to use a high-quality ice cream. For those that dislike the strong slightly bitter coffee flavor imparted by Kahlua, reduce the Kahlua to 1/2 oz and add 1 oz milk.
Schlag-n-nog: Add the egg nog and Goldschlager together in a bowl. Add nutmeg if desired.
Super Sangria: A very successful party drink, that everybody likes. Tastes like fruit juice more than alchohol. Careful as it goes to your head very quickly. Excellent when used for party games like coinage, etc.
Brutal Hammer: Put them in a glass; Pray to God; Then slam it!!!
Grapple: Place all ingredients in the blender jar - cover and whiz on medium speed until well blended. Pour in one tall, 2 medium or 3 small glasses and drink up.
Eat Hot Death: Find a room with a soft floor and consume very fast. Great initiation drink.
Fontainebleau Special: Shake all ingredients with ice, strain into a cocktail glass, and serve.
A Dixon Thing: Made up one night with Squid (Cory Thornton), Ossifer Chris Thorn and my brother Jamie Dixon in Peterborough, Ontario Canada.
Torridora Cocktail: Shake light rum, brandy, and cream with ice and strain into a cocktail glass. Float 151 proof rum on top and serve.
Purple Devil: This also works great as a punch. Tastes just like juice!
Island Girl: If you got the guava, this is good stuff
Cuba Libra: Fill tall glass with ice cubes. Add rum. Rub cut edge of lime on rim of glass then squeeze juice into glass. Fill with Coca-Cola. Garnish with lime slice. Enjoy!
Long Iver Iced Tea: This is a fruity troppical twist on a poppular classic.
Thanksgiving Special: Shake all ingredients (except cherry) with ice and strain into a cocktail glass. Top with the cherry and serve.
Mexican Mudslide: Mix kalhua, amaretto, and ice-cream. Swirl chocolate in the glass and add whip cream on top.
Fall of Rome: pour vermouth and brandy into glass, add lime and fill with orange juice, and stir. Splash brandy on top, and serve with straw.
Liberace: Be careful not to spill the 151 proof rum, or you will wind up with your hand, the shot glass, and anything else near you on fire.
Vincent Vega: Add ice cubes to a glass. Mix the ingredients.
Jack Rose: An old family recipe, which we generally serve as a festive drink prior to holiday dinners. For mass production, I find that a fifth of Applejack, a 12 oz. bottle of grenadine, and eight lemons work well. Use only freshly squeezed lemon juice for best taste. Enjoy!
Donna Reed: Called a Donna Reed for two reasons: (1) it's pink (2) it was originally created in a 1950's-vintage blender. Fairly mild taste, not much alcohol.
Ritz Fizz: Fill champagne flute with chilled champagne. Add blue curacao, amaretto, and lemon juice. Stir, add the twist of lemon, and serve.
Bubble Gum: Layer in order into a shot glass.
Waikiki Beachcomber: Shake all ingredients with ice, strain into a cocktail glass, and serve.
Gypsy Cocktail: Stir gin and vermouth with ice and strain into a cocktail glass. Add the cherry on top and serve.
Burning Cherry: Combine the George Dickel, Jack Daniels, and Jim Beam into a 2 ounce shot glass. Splash in the grenadine. Give a quick stir-spin with a straw or stir rod. Slam fast and hard. Exhale.
Warp Core Breach: Put 1/2 ounce of Goldschlager in 1 1/2 ounce shot glass. Then put Tequila on top followed by Jack Daniels. Down it and party till she's cute.
Screaming Orgasm (San Francisco Style): BTW, its the Cognac that makes it 'screaming' for a standard Orgasm, no Cognac.
Blue Whip: This a light cocktail with a smooth orange taste and an eye-catching blue hue.
Stan's Surprise: This drink is recommended in particular for hot summer evenings. It is cool and refreshing, and not very strong in taste. Nor alcohol. Mix and enjoy!
Galliano Hotshot: Layer Galliano, then hot coffee, then cream. Sprinkle with a pinch of nutmeg.
Flaming Dr. Pepper #2: Fill the shot glass about 3/4 full with Amaretto and top it off with enough 151 to make it burn. Put the shot glass in another glass and fill the new glass with beer (right up to the level of the shot glass). Light the Amaretto/151 and let it burn awhile. Blow it out (or leave it burning if you're brave) and slam it. Tastes just like Dr. Pepper.
Big Apple: Pour vodka into a collins glass over three or four ice cubes and fill with apple juice. Pour creme de menthe, stir, and serve.
Comforting Tiger: In a mixing glass, half-filled with crushed ice, combine the brandy, Southern Comfort, and vermouth. Stir well. Strain into a cocktail glass and garnish with the lemon twist.
Lasky Cocktail: Shake all ingredients with ice, strain into a cocktail glass, and serve.
Swedish pinkie: Great for big parties! If you want to do it for a big party, blend all ingredients in a big bowl. Fill a mixer and mix thoroughly. Pour into glasses and then take another round and mix, until you have filled all your glasses. The origin is a Donna Reed, but this variation improved it, to my opinion!
China White: Pour ingredients into shaker filled with ice, shake, strain into shot glass.
Aviator Fuel: Proportions can be altered to suit taste. I reccommed that all ingredients be chilled, but it is not necessary.
St. Clement's: Comes from the rhyme - oranges and lemons say the bells of St Clement's
American Dream: Chill with ice. Strain into shot glass.
Baron Cocktail: Stir all ingredients (except lemon wedge) with ice and strain into a cocktail glass. Add the lemon wedge and serve.
Thunderclap: Shake all ingredients with ice, strain into a cocktail glass, and serve.
Brown cow: In a champagne flute with ice, add kahlua and top with milk. Stir. Garnish stirrer, nutmeg.
Snakebite and Black: Some types of blackcurrant squash do curdle in the drink but most of them are ok to mix in.
Almost Heaven: Build in a collins glass over ice.
747: pour kaluha, then Baileys, then Frangelico not chilled and not layered -- SERVE!!!
Dance With A Dream Cocktail: In a shaker falf-filled with ice cubes, combine all of the ingredients. Shake well. Strain into a cocktail glass.
Jersey Shore Cherry Lemonade: Add sugar, vodka, and sour mix over ice and shake. Then fill with sprite/7up. Top with grenadne or cherry juice. Garnish with cherry and lemon wedge.
Sunny Sex: Hope y'all have fun with my drink, I invented it on a New Years Party 1995 in Germany (Oberndorf to be exact!).
Richards family: This drink, strange as it it may seem is now the most popular among my fellow law students!
Rock Lobster: Fill glass with ice. Add Razzamatazz and Crown Royal. Fill with Cranberry Juice.
Miss Belle: In a mixing glass half-filled with ice cubes, combine all of the ingredients. Stir well. Strain into a cocktail glass.
187 URge: It tases amazingly good. We named this while listing to the URge then everone got wasted (187).
Silver Bullet #2: Pour scotch in iced glass and coat sides empty scotch out pour in vodka
Lambada: Shake all indrigiens in a shaker on ice in poorthem on crushed ice in a fancy glass.
Mint Russki, or Spearmint Ivan: 1. Place 3 to 6 twisted or crushed fresh mint leaves into a medium sized cocktail glass 2. Add 2 to 3 shots of your favorite frozen vodka 3. Add ice if desired 4. Stir lightly
Suntan Lotion: Tastes like the smell of suntan lotion.
Black Unicorn: Pour in kahlua, then butterscotch schnapps. Layer Irish cream on top.
Mad Cow: Mix in a shaker 1/4 filled with ice and pour into liberal shot glasses.
Sloe Gin Rickey: Pour sloe gin and juice of lime into a highball glass over ice cubes. Fill with carbonated water and stir. Drop the wedge of lime in glass and serve.
Strawberry Punch #2: Put the sherbet in a bowl and pour the 7-up over the sherbet. Stir until the sherbet is melted. This makes a pretty pink punch. You can use diet soda for a punch that is less sweet.
Glicktail: I accidentally "discovered" this drink one summer when we were mixing Mint Juleps and we had a whole bunch of sugar syrup and bourbon, but ran out of mint. It's tangy and sweet, but you can modify the sweetnes by substituting club soda for ginger ale. Both add a nice bubbly character.
Campton Place Cafe Sonia: Lightly beat cream with few drops vanilla. Reserve. To warmed 7-oz. mug, add Metaxa, amaretto, and Tia Maria. Pour in coffee. Taste for sweetness: add sugar if desired. Top with beaten cream.
Little Black Devil: Our regimental drink, easy to drink.
Wild Wild West: Take ink pen and stir well!
Vermouth Cassis: Stir vermouth and creme de cassis in a highball glass with ice cubes. Fill with carbonated water, stir again, and serve.
Less Than Jake on The Rocks: Its a drink if ya dont wanna get too wasted
Scotch Daisy: In a shaker half-filled with ice cubes, combine the Scotch, lemon juice, sugar, and grenadine. Shake well. Pour into an old-fashioned glass. Garnish with the cherry and the orange slice.
Turbulence: Pour in amaretto and southern comfort. Add 7-up and ice as desired.
Grateful Dead: shake ingredients and pour over ice...
Almond Cooler: Excellant if you like Creamy drinks. Discovered it vacationing in Barbados (Caribbean)
Russian funk: Blend vodka, lime and sugar, top with soda water, serve in a higball glass.
Pink Panther Shake: Place all ingredients in a blender. Mix until smooth. Garnish with fresh of frozen berries.
Texas Rattlesnake: Mix all ingredients and Shake well. Sweet at first, with a BITE at the end...
Nikki Delight: Poor all ingredients over ICE and STIR don't Shake....
Daiquiri #2: This is the recipe from La Florida Cafe, Havana, 1953. Never, never use Rose's Lime Juice in this drink.
Karsk: Put a copper coin in a coffe-cup and fill up with coffee until you no longer see the coin, then add alcohol until you see the coin. Norwegian speciality.
Pan Galactic Gargle Blaster: You'll have the taste of an innocent lemonade, but don't try to drink more than two ! This drink was invented on Malta (a little island in the Meditterenian). But it's brought by my sister to the Netherlands and I put it on Internet. Good luck with it and enjoy!
Neuralizer: I made my sour mix from 3 parts sugar added to 2 parts water, then heated till boiling. This syrup mixture was then added to equal a equal part of Lemon or Lime juice. The ginger ale was to make the drink less sweet. My twist on the Whiskey Sour. I suggest using Rye Whiskey. - D.G. Dec/97.
Cyberlady: Shake well and pour in a cocktail glass, frosted with strawberry.
A Little Dinghy: Created by bar staff at Houlighan's, Troy, MI.
Liquid Love: Fill high ball glass with ice. Pour vodka and amaretto into glass in equal parts. Then add two parts sour and pineapple juice.
Wong Tong Cocktail: Pour liquids into a strainer glass with 4-6 ice cubes. Strain into a cocktail glass. Garnish with cherries.
Emerald Eye: For a color variation, float each ingredient on top of the previous with a spoon. -- Good shot for girls. Not too harsh, with plenty of kick.
After Eighteen: Tastes just like the After Eight shot, only weaker.
220 BTU: Created one night because several guys were commenting about a new shot that should be called a two-twenty and it needed to be blue. Add up the proof of alcohols to equal 220.
Green Casa Noble: Shake ingredients in mixing glass with ice, except lime twist, then strain into a cocktail glass. Add a lime twist.
Communicator: Pour all of the ingredients into an old-fashioned glass almost filled with ice cubes. Stir well.
Delmonico: In a mixing glass half-filled with ice cubes, combine the gin, brandy, sweet vermouth, dry vermouth, and bitters. Stir well. Strain into a cocktail glass and garnish with the lemon twist.
Iguana: Shake all ingredients (except lime slice) with ice and strain into a chilled cocktail glass. Add the lime slice and serve.
Green Devil: Shake gin, creme de menthe, and lime juice with ice and strain into an old-fashioned glass over ice cubes. Decorate with mint leaves and serve.
Caleigh: In a mixing glass half-filled with ice cubes, combine all of the ingredients. Stir well. Strain into a cocktail glass.
Midnight Flight to Malibu: This is a very sweet drink that goes down easy. Be careful or your flight may just crash!
Apple Cider Punch #2: Make sure ingreadients are well chilled. Cut unpeeled apples 1cm cubes. Combine fruit and mint with apple juice in large punch bowl. Mix well, cover and refrigerate until serving. Before serving add chilled apple cider and lemonade.
Shag by the shore: This drink should be served in three layers, Orange at the bottom, Red in the middle, and Black at the top. It was created in the memory of El Don, the best Bartender ever to grace the bar at Via Vita Didsbury.
Surgedriver: Mix ingredients and pour into highball glass over ice
Absolut Evergreen: Taken from a pamplet by Vin & Sprit AB. The Makers of Absolut.
Sneaky Pete: Put Kahlua on the bottom over ice. Then add milk Then add Rye. Stir before drinking.
Kahlua #3: Boil water. Add cofee. Add sugar. Simmer, 20 min. Remove from heat, add chocolate. Alow to cool. Add vodka (or don't cool if you want some of the alcohol to boil off).
Morro: Rub rim of old-fashioned glass with lime juice. Dip rim in powdered sugar. Shake all ingredients with ice, strain into the sugar-rimmed glass over ice cubes, and serve.
Ruby Relaxer: Combine shots of peach schnapps, vodka and malibu rum. Fill glass almost to top with pineapple juice and splash in cranberry juice for a touch o' color.
Beth's Own: Mix alcohol first, then add cola.
The Miki: Put the ice on the glass first and then pour the Campari. The grapefruit juice is next. The soda is the last ingredient to add. Stir only once.
Vodkalenius: Stir all ingrediences with ice cubes and drink in a real Grogg-glass to get the wanted and expected effect. Let the lingonberry jam chill before mixing and make sure the vodka is below freezing to get a real lingonberry taste. One can us a straw if needed.
Man Of The Moment: In a shaker half-filled with ice cubes, combine all of the ingredients. Shake well. Strain into a cocktail glass.
Godiva Peppermint Patty: Excelent hand warmer for cold nights plus some alcohol to warm the spirit. If Hot Chocoalte is made with milk, the milk will have a tendency to react with the Schnapps. Whole milk reacts more but gives a creamier taste. The whip cream will give a better (creamier) texture and taste to water based hot chocolate.
Grinch #2: Its a flavorful drink with plenty of alcohol that you cant taste. It also looks ood for the customer, when its layered.
Five dollar shake: "It may not be worth five dollars, but it's pretty f@#*ing good!"
Purple Nasty: This is a sweet and deceptivley strong pint. It is the drink of Loughborough University in England.
Affair: Pour schnapps, orange juice, and cranberry juice over ice in a highball glass. Top with club soda and serve.
Shark Bite #2: The splash of Grenadine will give a sunrise effect to the drink.
Cayman Sunset: This is a popular and pretty drink that I learned while staying in the Cayman Islands. It looks nice when served and it tastes great! A wonderful "island" drink.
Oaxaca Jim: In a shaker half-filled with ice cubes, combine the gin, orange juice, grapefruit juice, and bitters. Shake well. Strain into an old-fashioned glass almost filled with the cubes. Garnish with the lemon twist and the cherry.
Green Ferrit: All the way from Limerick Ireland. A cool drink!!!
Seaside-Summerbliss: Excelent when it's warm out side in the sun, and you just want to relax!
Pimp Punch: Good party drink! Brought to you by the Pimp Squad, Berkeley, California, on a lonely Saturday night!
Slap Your Mama: Shake one part o.j. and one part vodka together. Pour over ice and add one part Mountain Dew, then stir slightly.
Green Creeper: Tastes like Kindergarten Kool Aid with a little kick, but be careful. -- Created by Mr. Day-Man at my bar in El Paso, Texas.
Standard Cream: stir & strain in a cocktail glass
Sex On The Beach - Jersey Style: Makes 1 gallon of punch -- mix all 4 liquers in 1 parts and fill rest with pineapple and cranberry juice
Apricot Anise Collins: Shake gin, brandy, anisette, and lemon juice with ice and strain into a collins glass over ice cubes. Fill with carbonated water and stir lightly. Decorate with the slice of lemon and serve.
110 in the shade: Drop shooter in glass. Fill with beer
Strawberry Kir Royale: Mix strawberries and sugar in a bowl and let stand for 5-10 minutes. Stir occasionally. Divide into two white wine glasses, add champagne and creme de cassis.
Sunsplash: This is a house specialty drink from the Bellagio Hotel and Casino in Las Vegas.
Tampon String: I was bored in english class so I invented this shot after trying it I had to add it.
Malibu Dreams: It should have a light, not dark, pink color. And should tast like an Ocean Water from Sonic Drive throughs.
Red Royal Shot: It tastes like a cherry coke with a kick. It should warm you straight down the middle. If not, drink another. The best we can figure this drink came from a tavern in Carlinville, Illinois called the "Lost Dutchman." (A civilized tavern)
Whippet: Is to be drunk whilst upside down and against a wall. It is preferable to have a crowd of drunken revellers chanting "Whippet, Whippet" during the drinking process. As far as I know only ever drunk at the Stirling Hotel, Adelaide Hills, South Australia, during the late 80's early 90's.
Peach Treat: Shake brandy and orange juice with ice and strain into a collins glass over several ice cubes. Top with chilled champagne, add the peach slice, and serve.
Prince's Smile: Shake all ingredients with ice, strain into a cocktail glass, and serve.
Russian Candy: The drink has a very sweet taste. However, it can can be ruined by adding too much grenadine. So, be careful.
Pecker Head: In a strainer add all three ingredients. Fill half full of ice. Shake well. Strain into a double shot glass.
Rocket Fuel: Mix all in glass and drink rapidly
Midori Mimosa: Pour Midori and sweet&sour.; Add champagne.
Crooked Golf Cart: Found this one in a hotel bar in Toronto. It's got a sweet taste to it, perfect for those who don't like to taste the alcohol but like to get drunk. Larger amounts of amaretto can be used because the cranberry juice sort of eliminates the taste of it. Enjoy!
Disco Ball: This drink can also be served without the chill, but cold tastes better.
Pit Bull on Crack #2: Mix all three ingredients in mixing tin with ice. Serve in a shot glass.
Cricket: Close relative of the grasshopper (when you don't have the right color liquers)
Raspberry Release: Pour ingredients in snifter and stir.
Cubano Coffee: Nice alternative at the irish coffee with a superbe taste of caraibe land. I have prepared it the first time about in 1989 for a customer that she did'nt like irish whiskey, she enjoyed it so much that I introduced it in the list wherever I use to work with a lot of success.
Freddie's Naughty Neopolitan: Layer in a shot glass. First Kahlua, then white creme de cacao, and finally Baja Rosa Tequila.
Manhattan Bella: This is a house specialty drink from the Bellagio Hotel and Casino in Las Vegas.
Colorado Rattlesnake: Pour chilled Tequila in shot glass and put to the side. Pour Tomato Juice in a second shot glass and dash pepper and Tabasco in the Tomato Juice. Shoot Tequila and chase with tomato juice shot.
Stiff Pounder: This drink is usually best with Bud Light. I created this drink because beer was just filling me up and wasn't getting me drunk.
Fire Ant Torture: Pour all the contents into a shot glass at once.
Royal Cocktail: Shake all ingredients with ice, strain into a whiskey sour glass, and serve.
Flash Gordon: Mix everything into a glass, add ice and lime on top.
Alfie Cocktail: Combine and shake all ingredients with ice, strain into a cocktail glass, and serve.
Fuzzy Faser: This is really good, it tastes like a little bit of peach and orange.
Flaming Citrus Action: Pour ingredients over ice in an ordinary glass
Knockout Punch: pour all three together, mix well
Tropical Sunrise: Half fill glass with crushed ice. Add rum, triple sec, orange juice, and pineapple juice. Stir. Add Grenadine and top with cherry and other fruit.
Van Vleet: Shake all ingredients with ice, strain into an old-fashioned glass over ice cubes, and serve.
Perfect Cocktail: Shake all ingredients with ice, strain into a cocktail glass, and serve.
Greek Tycoon: This drink was made in Cresskill, NJ. Designed for the "Greek Tycoons" in all of us.
Comfort Driver: Pour orange juice over 3 cubes ice in a highball glass add Southern Comfort and stir lightly
La Cafe: Created by Virgil Tropea. Third place in the 1998 United States Bartender's Guild Cocktail Competition.
White Jamaican: Fill a Collins glass with ice and pour in with all ingredients. Speed shake and serve.
Sweet Patootie Cocktail: Shake all ingredients with ice, strain into a cocktail glass, and serve.
Cherry Blossom: Garnish with a cherry on the rim of the glass.
Grand Gold Margarita: This drink is extremely potent and is not intended for the feint of heart.
Raspberry Trouffle: This drink is smooth, creamy and a great dessert drink.
Pour all ingredients over ice into a glass, sit back and enjoy.
Ocean Drive: Pour liquour first over ice. Add juices cranberry last down side of glass.
Rum Milk Punch: Shake all ingredients (except nutmeg) with ice and strain into a collins glass. Sprinkle nutmeg on top and serve.
St. Petersburg: Pour vodka and bitters into mixing glass with several ice cubes. Stir until very cold and pour into a chilled old-fashioned glass. Score peel of orange wedge with tines of fork and drop into drink.
Fairytale: I invented the drink this very night. Tastes fantastic.
Bull Shot #3: Shake with ice and strain into an old fashioned glass.
Rugburn: Stir or shake ingredients together: serve with ice in old-fashioned glass or strain into cocktail glass.
The Dire: Mount Gay Rum can be substituted for Captain Morgan's which was the original drink. Also yummy!
Paisano: Invented in Hudson, NY. Probably a drink that a White Russian drinker would like.
EKG: EKG? Erinn's Kahlua and Godiva. Enjoy!
Pink Pussycat: In an old-fashioned glass almost filled with ice cubes, combine the gin and pineapple juice. Stir well. Drop the cherry brandy into the center of the drink.
More Orgasms: Stirr it together until it just looks like dark Bailey's.
Tequini: Stir tequila, vermouth, and bitters with ice and strain into a cocktail glass. Add the twist of lemon peel, top with the olive, and serve.
Tokyo Ice Tea: Mix the alcohol. Add 1 oz sugarsyrup, ice, 7 up and some pieces of lemon. Stir.
Dirty Girl Scout: Mix the vodka, Kahlua and Bailey's and pour over ice. Pour the Creme de menthe down the center of the glass. Looks gross, but tastes delicious!
Fresh Mint Liqueur: Wash leaves in cold water several times. Shake or pat dry gently. Snip each leaf in half or thirds. Discard stems. measure cut mint leaves, packing lightly. Combine mint leaves and vodka in aging container. Cap and let stand in a cool place for 2 weeks, shaking occasionally. After initial aging, strain leaves from liqueur, discard leaves. In a sucepan, combine sugar and water. Bring to a boil, stirring constantly. Let cool. Add cooled syrup to liqueur base, stirring to combine. Add glycerine and food color, pour into aging container for secondary aging of 1-3 more months.
Dirty Bong Water: Pour all ingredients in a glass with ice. Mix and enjoy
Maiden's Prayer #2: Shake with crushed ice and strain into a chilled wine or cocktail glass. Garnish with a lemon twist.
Kansas City Ice Water: Nobody has ever heard of this drink away from Penn State (Cafe 210 West). If you like Gin and Tonics. . . you'll love a K.C. Ice Water.
Rugmuncher: Made as a companion shooter to the Cowboy Cocksucker.
Bloody Bull: Pour vodka, tomato juice, and beef bouillon over ice in a highball glass and stir. Add the slice of lime and the wedge of lemon and serve.
Sex On The Beach #6: Highball glass 1/2 full ice. Add vodka and schapps. Fill to near top with OJ, amount depends on ice and glass size. Add cream last and stir. May be served up after mixing. The amount of OJ and dairy cream may be adjusted taste.
Sweaty Goat's Ass: If it is mixed right it will taste like salt water and not tequila.
Jim's Special #1: Use grenadine to sweeten to taste.
Exotic summernight: Mix vodka and orange- and pineapplejuice and pour over ice in a glass. Layer a little grenadine on top. Garnish with a slice of orange.
Black Devil: Stir rum and vermouth with cracked ice and strain into a cocktail glass. Top with the black olive and serve.
Kir: Combine ingredients in a large wineglass. Twist the lemon peel to release the oil and drop it into the glass.
Gibson: Stir gin and vermouth over ice cubes in a mixing glass. Strain into a cocktail glass. Add the cocktail onions and serve.
Richie 50: Named after it's creator and his infatuation with getting drunk quickly.
Vodka Salty Dog: Pour all ingredients into a highball glass over ice cubes, stir well, and serve.
Krypto Kami: Created by the bar staff at TGI Friday's, Fargo ND
Brian Sinnott Family Punch - Leaded: I was first introduced to this drink in its "unleaded" form while attending some 1997 holiday festivities. Brian Sinnott is an ex-fiance of Kristine Hunter, middle sister of Beth Hunter, who is my ex-wife. Anyway, his family created this tremendously wonderful "kool-aid" punch, and used it for all of their family occasions. Through careful scientific experimentation, I have created a wonderful and magnificent champagne-kool-aid punch to use for parties, New Year, Christmas, birthday celebrations, etc. Printed above are instructions for the "leaded" version of the drink. Be careful, it can pack quite a blow, especially if you add more vodka, as suggested. This is a sweet drink, so cheep Andre "pink" champagne or any other sparkling wine will do. I would recommend using a good brand of vodka, then potency adjustments are less noticeable. This is a wonderful tasting champagne punch, despite its Kool-Aid roots. One batch is probably good for a party of 5-10 people. Make two batches for medium parties of 10-20 people. (This also maximizes the fact that frozen juice usually comes in 12oz sizes anyway.)
Harlem World Seven: Just drink it as soon as you mix it, and it might taste funny because of the prune juice but you should get an effect out of it.
Four Twenty: I would also suggest that you use the cheap white wine- the boxed stuff. This makes it a bit more authentic and keeps it in the College Student style. If done correctly, one should not taste the vodka and it should be quite smooth. This drink was originated at Maine Martime Academy and is a favorite of the school's sailing team.
Holiday Cheer: Mix champagne and frozen cranberry juice (undeluted). Slice lime and garnish each wine glass. Serve with breakfast to start the day right. Note: Mix right before serving to retain the bubbles. Yo may use non-alcoholic champagne.
Velvet Hammer #1: Shake all ingredients with ice, strain into a cocktail glass, and serve.
Nay-Nay Strohmeyer: Can't taste the alcohol at all, and you will be on the floor in a couple of drinks. Has a fruity taste.
Disco LemOnade: My friend suggested making a drink called a Dicso Lem-O-Nade, from a line in the Marcy Playground song "Sex and Candy." This is the result.
Apple Slammer: pour into a shot glass and present to consumer, they are expected to cover the top of the shotglass with thier palm, raise the glass, slam it on the bar and the swallow quickly.
Wonder Woman: Sweet drink -- ladies love it. Party Punch Originated in Corvallis, Oregon at the Royal Pacific Lounge. Has swept the state and is a popular drink at virtually every bar. Enjoy!
Ludvika Walker: The drink was invented on a cold winter day by a friend of mine. It taste very good just before leaving home for town after watching Premier Leage on TV.
Yaka: Combine the water and lemonade mix, following the directions on the lemonade mix. Add everclear and absolute vodka. Then add the lemon slices and shake to mix. serve cold
Green Hope: Created by Sven Aage Joansbråten, Norway. Winner of the 1979 I.B.A. international cocktail competition. Slightly modified from the original recipe.
The Game: For a "Strange game" add 1 oz vodka.
Eliminator: The first one is awful. By the third you will be begging for more. There won't be a fifth
Dixieland Tea: It doesn't taste alcoholic, just sweet and smooth.
Somebird: Mix ingredients in random order and shake on ice.
Back Shot: Have a designated driver ready before you start shooting this one.
Rye Whiskey Cocktail: Shake all ingredients (except cherry) with ice and strain into a cocktail glass. Top with the cherry and serve.
Fox River Cocktail: Stir all ingredients with ice, strain into a cocktail glass, and serve.
Doh: Just throw them all together add some ice and drink. If you can't get Tahiti Treat use pineapple juice
Windex: Combine in a mixing glass half-filled with ice cubes. Stir well. Strain into cocktail glass.
Fubar Kool-Aid: Mix in shaker over cracked ice, pour into highball glass with ice and enjoy.
Black Death: A great tasting shot, that looks fancy, and does not require a chaser!
Candy: Fill a glass with ice. Pour the 151. Pour the Dr. Pepper. Pour the Amaretto. Stir.
Cream in da Panties: Pour all ingredients into a shaker half filled with ice, shake and then strain into shotglass
Hot Springs Cocktail: Shake all ingredients with ice, strain into a cocktail glass, and serve.
American Flag: This is a very smooth shot and it tastes a lot like a chocholate covered cherry, only better.
Summer Sky: Fill glass with crushed ice. Add gin and triple sec, and fill with pineapple juice. Add a splash of grenadine on top.
UFO: It's a refressing drink not to be underestimated. When you drink several UFOs you will see things fly.
Hawaii Five-O: This is what happens when you have a bunch of whacky ingredients sitting around. Amazingly, it tastes fairly good.
