Singapore Sling #2: This drink taste better than original Singapore Sling because of the pineapple juice. It has a more tropical and sweeter taste.
Cool Cucumber: It's a nice cool-off for a hot summer night...
Golden Cadillac with White-Walled Tires: This drink is great for people who say, "I don't know what I want. Give me something sweet, but not TOO sweet. And strong. But not TOO strong." This drink is also deceptively strong.
Rotten Pussy: shake all ingredients and serve as a shooter
Between The Sheets: In a shaker half-filled with ice cubes, combine all of the ingredients. Shake well. Strain into a cocktail glass.
Sackville Surprise: Rum first, syrup second. Mix well in shot glass.
Fraustadt: Fill the Boston shaker with all the ingridiens and a lot of icecubes, then shake untill your hands goes into hypothermia. Pour up in a highball glas and put a lemonslice on the edge.
Cranberry Tea Hot Punch: Make strong tea with 8 teabags and 4 cups of boiling water. Add cranberry juice, apple cider, brown sugar, and spices. Stir until the sugar dissolves. Garnish with orange slices. Serve.
Kick me in the Jimmy: Combine in mixing tin with ice, shake and strain.
Red Hot: Also known as a "Liver transplant in a glass".
The End of the World: Serve warm. Straight into the shot glass.
Belgian Brownie: Pour the gin, cognac and chocolate liqueur over the ice cubes. Fill with heavy cream. Stir gently.
Ultimate Margarita: I prefer this version over the original. You can drink it like punch.
Radioactive Long Island Iced Tea: Served to me by Jenny at Cactus Jack's when I asked for something "a little different". Me and my big mouth.
Watermelon Slice: This drink may already exist with another name, but not that i know of. I mixed it up one day and it tastes great.
Bull's Milk: Shake rum, brandy, milk, and powdered sugar with ice and strain into a collins glass. Sprinkle nutmeg and the pinch of cinnamon on top and serve.
LeFreak: Not much punch to this one, but a great sipper.
The Drink Without a Name: Stir with cracked ice ans strain into a chilled cocktail glass. Garnish with a twist of orange.
Hashi Bashi: Pour gin and campari over a couple of icecubes. Fill up with russian!
Scotch Holiday Sour: Shake all ingredients (except lemon slice) with ice and strain into an old-fashioned glass over ice cubes. Add the slice of lemon and serve.
Journalist Cocktail: Shake all ingredients with ice, strain into a cocktail glass, and serve.
The Lucky Stud: These ingredients can be mixed in a glass with ice before you put into a shot glass, or poured right into the shot glass.
Mix all ingredients in tin over ice. Strain into shot glasses and enjoy!!!!
Speedball: just pour the alcoholic ingridents in a shot glas and when you done that squeze a little amount of lime juice on top
D-Roy: Drink should taste similar to that of a Capriana and Mojito if made in the proper way.
Lassi Raita: Blend the yoghurt and ice cubes together, until the yoghurt becomes more liquid. Add sugar to taste. The lemon/lime is optional but it gives it a slightly tart taste. Dash of salt. Raita is also good for the summer. Instead of having a traditional salad you can make raita instead.
Cape Of Good Will: In a shaker half-filled with ice cubes, combine all of the ingredients. Shake well. Strain into a cocktail glass.
Pain Killer: Fill cup with ice. Pour Pusser's Rum to fill about 1/4 of the glass. Fill with an equal amount of Cream of Coconut (Coco Lopez is good. Add some pineapple juice and a good splash of orange juice. Shake well. Add cherry and sprinkly nutmeg. Grab a staw and get ready! This was originally made in the Britsh Virgin Islands -- Pussers is the official rum of the Royal British Navy. Alter the amount of rum to your taste. Sorry about the inexact measurements -- that's the way we do it down in de islans mon!
Frogster: Fill highball glass with ice, add the blue curacao, add the tequila and finally for that yummy green color, fill the glass with the orange juice.
Crispy Crunch: Excellent Smooth Shot. Invented at the Pig 'n Wistle on Whyte ave in Edmonton.
Seduction on the Rocks: This is a very sweet but very good drink!
Cosmopolitan #1: Shake liquid ingredients like hell in a shaker with ice. Place lime wedge on the rim of a Martini glass. Pour mix into the glass, up. Enjoy!
Vulva: Over rocks, combine schnapps, rum, and triple sec in Collins glass. Fill with orange juice and shake. Serve.
Rheingold: Created by Rocco Di Franco, Italy. Winner of the 1984 I.B.A. international cocktail competition.
Zombie #2: Shake over ice in a shaker, and strain into a large highball glass over crushed ice.
Baltimore Zoo: add the liquors and grenadine. Mix. Strain. Add splash of Sprite. Add lemon squeeze. Drinker adds shot of beer.
Bolduc On The Beach: Mix in glass. Serve on the rocks (optional).
Alternate Root: Mix Schnapps and juice in glass of ice. Place in blender. Blend until smooth. Serve in chilled glass.
The Perfect Margarita #1: If a margarita is your drink, then this is one for you. I got this preparation out of a book that came with the Jimmy Buffett box set ( Let's give credit where credit is due!).
Tequila and Tonic: Pour 2 1/2 ounces Cuervo Gold over ice cubes in a highball glass. Fill with tonic. Garnish with lime wedge.
Nazi Taco: Mix all the ingredients together and pour into shot glasses.
Texas Rose: Mix all ingredients and pour over ice. Wonderful smooth tasting drink. But watch out it will knock your socks off!
Red Royal: if you try it,you will love it.
Dew: You mix the two ingredients and you have your drink!
Rooster Tail: Lick hand and put a dash of salt on hand, then lick salt and drink Cuervo first, then orange juice, then tomatoe juice.
Mule: Pour 1 1/4 ounce of Smirnoff Vodka in glass, fill with ginger beer, add ice and squeeze lime.
Dixie Cocktail: Shake all ingredients with ice, strain into a cocktail glass, and serve.
Bourbon County Cowboy: In a shaker half-filled with ice cubes, combine the bourbon and cream. Shake well. Strain into a cocktail glass.
Rok-Shasa: It may take quite a few of these to get drunk
Olive in an Olive: I discovered it in 1999 in Ljubljana, Slovenija.
Bahama Mama: Combine all ingredients and pour over cracked ice in a collins glass. Decorate with a strawberry or cherry and serve.
Black & Tan: Fill pint glass half full with Bass. Next pour Guiness over a spoon slowly until glass is full. If done correctly the Guiness will stay on top and the Bass on bottom hence the name Black & Tan.
Electric Tea: Combine in a pint glass, shake and serve with a lemon wedge
Blue Slammer: Put drop of lemon in first, then add Blue Caracoa, and Sambuca. Then slowly add vodka. Sit down, shoot back, and enjoy!
Creme De Gin Cocktail: Shake all ingredients with ice, strain into a cocktail glass, and serve.
Woodward Cocktail: Shake all ingredients with ice, strain into a cocktail glass, and serve.
Sherry Flip: Shake all ingredients (except nutmeg) with ice and strain into a whiskey sour glass. Sprinkle nutmeg on top and serve.
Jock Collins: In a shaker half-filled with ice cubes, combine the Scotch, lemon juice, and sugar. Shake well. Strain into a collins glass alost filled with ice cubes. Add the club soda. Stir and garnish with the cherry and the orange slice.
155 Belmont: Blend with ice. Serve in a wine glass. Garnish with carrot.
Fireball #2: Mix the Schnapps, Southern Comfort, and Tabasco. Pour into cocktail glass. A cherry may be added.
Tropical Teaser: Place in a cold shaker with ice. Shake for one minute and serve over ice.
Liquid Bubble Gum: This drink has a slight bubble gum flavor, yet has a little kick. I discovered this drink just by playing with some leftover alcohol I had in my bar.
Thanksgiving Cocktail: Fill Collins glass one-half full of ice, add ingredients and stir. Garnish with a lime wedge, if desired.
Sucker punch: Put crushed ice in glass about a quarter of the way up. Pour in vodka, peach schnapps and the three juices (apple, orange, and cranberry.) Stir through a couple of times.
Karlsson's dream: Just blend and drink. It's deadly.
Cucci: Fruity, with nectar like qualities. This is truly one of the great summertime pleasures. Mix a pitcher and watch the sunset. Originated on July 18, 1998 in upstate NY.
Donnington Brainstorm: Mix well the Thunderbird with the Vodka and pour into an empty litre coke/lemonade bottle. The exact ratio of vodka:thunderbird can be altered to the creator's taste. Fridge for at least 12 hours. Donnington Brainstorm is best at temperatures between 2-4 degrees centigrade. If the drink is too cold it will tend to be too bitter; if it is too warm, it will tend to be too sweet. At just the right temperature, it should be light, refreshing, slightly peary and the alcohol taste minimal. Drink (with friends) VERY CAREFULLY.....
SkyLab: For a powerful kick, add 1 oz. gin & 1/2 oz. Raspberry Liqueur to your SkyLab. The raspberry should be added to the already mixed drink.(The purple looks great against the turquoise drink!) Beware..two will knock you off yours!!
Hot Chocolate #1: Combine sugar and cocoa, add milk and a dash of salt. Makes 8 servings. For 1 serving place 1/3 cup dry mixture in a coffee mug, add boiling water and stir.
Scooby Snack #1: Shake ingredients in a mixing cup with ice. Strain into 7 oz. rocks glass and serve.
Celebration: In a cocktail shaker add ingredients and fill with ice. Shake with gusto for half a minute, and pour/strain into a cocktail glass. Garnish with lemon peel, or lime peel if you use fresh lime juice.
Mexican Rose: Shake & strain into glass or blend.
Adam: In a shaker half-filled with ice cubes, combine all of the ingredients. Shake well. Strain into a cocktail glass.
Power Drill: fill equal parts of orange juice and vodka almost to the top of a shot glass. splash some beer into the glass to fill the glass.
Sex on my face: Mix in tall glass with ice.
Chocolate Cocktail: Shake all ingredients with ice, strain into a whiskey sour glass, and serve.
Powdered Chocolate Donut: Created at the Fireside Tavern in the poconos, PA, as yet another collaborative effort by Fireside's resident Barkeep, and Mitch, of the Moose Head Lounge in West Nyack, NY. After mixing many experimental shots, only a few made the grade. This was probably the tastiest of all of them. After trying the shot, Mitch did not even hesitate on the name. Immediately, he blurted, "Taste's just like a chocolate donut." The other patrons there at the time tried it, and all agreed... The confectioner's sugar came later, but it truly is the crowning touch to the flavor. This shot is a must, for those partygoers with a sweet tooth...
Bongs Anfield Slammer: Just Mix it together, with the most alcoholic drinks in the end.... Good luck!!!!
Urine Sample #2: strain over ice. serve in shot glass
Cloudberry Dream: Fill the glass with crushed ice. Stir and garnish with cranberries.
Cardicas: Jarl Ahvenainen, F.B.S.K., Finland 1. I.B.A.s I.C.C. London 1956. Category: Pre Dinner.
Charlie Shaker: Wery tasty0coctail. Recommended before dinner. Made for a Bar contest in Norway 1991 by Ole Alex Wetten.
Glaucoma: Can also be blended in blender!
Banshee Berry: pour each of the three ingredients into a shot glass. Stir.
Call of the Snowfields (Lumikenttien Kut: Thanks to Juri Ahokas for translating this one from Finnish for me.
Southern Beamy Brain Damage (SBBD): In shot glass, pour 1/3 Southern Comfort and 1/3 Jim Beam. Add 1/3 Tia Maria and let set and form. Do not mix. Add a couple drops of grenadine (or as sweet as desired).
Cadillac Margarita: Shake tequila, triple sec, sour mix, and lime juice with ice. Pour over ice in salt-rimmed margarita glass. Float Grand Marnier on top. Garnish with slice of lime if desired.
Surputte: Add some 7-UP and ice A slice of Lime on the edge
Beeaauu's Rum and Coke: Mix all ingredients in a tall glass with ice. Garnish with a lime wedge.
Bikini: Shake rum, vodka, milk, sugar, and juice of lemon with ice and strain into a cocktail glass. Decorate with a twist of lemon and serve.
Resolute Cocktail: Shake all ingredients with ice, strain into a cocktail glass, and serve.
Vaughn Purple Haze: This drink was created on New Years Eve of 2000, at the mixology department of the Vaughn Bay Bar and Grill. The Creators names are Ryan and Travis.. (Two students from Central Washington University..) Enjoy!!!
Phi Psycho Psycho: This drink was created by the Zeta Beta chapter of Phi Sigma Sigma, located at Rowan University in Glassboro NJ. We enjoyed it at many social functions, hope you like it!
Copperhead: Combine in an ice cube-filled Collins glass. Garnish with a lime wedge
White Parrot: The drink will taste just as good with fat free half & half if you prefer fewer calories. You may also substitute the sugar with one packet of Nutrasweet or leave it out all together. I prefer Captain Morgan's Parrot Bay because it is a sweeter and richer tasting coconut rum.
Banana Cream Pie #2: For a more creamy refreshment, blend with ice and half-and-half.
Egg Nog #1: Beat yolks until light in color. Slowly add bourbon, cognac, while beating at slow speed. Chill 3 hrs. Add salt to whites, beat to peaks. Whip s cream until stiff. Fold whipped cream into yolk mixture, then fold in the beaten egg whites. Chill one hour. Serve with nutmeg sprinkled on top. For thinner mixture add 1 or 2 cups of milk. Serve in a punch bowl or another big bowl.
Freson: This was invented by Chris Freson - hence the name (pronounced Freeze-On) - at a party at my house 4 years ago.
Pink Cream Fizz: In a shaker half-filled with ice cubes, combine the gin, lemon juice, sugar, cream, and grenadine. Shake well. Strain into a collins glass almost filled with ice cubes. Add the club soda. Stir well.
Southern Special: Just mix it! Have a slice of lime on the top. Served with lots of ice...
Apple Berry Smoothie: Throw everything into a blender and liquify.
Tie Me To The Bedpost (Hawaiian): Shake with ice and strain into an over-sized martini glass. There should be a slight amount of foam from the 7-up.
Weakness: The reason I call this weakness should be pretty clear.
Hot Peppermint Chocolate: Make hot chocolate (preferably using water) according to instructions. Mix in Rumple Minze and enjoy.
Weekend On The Beach: Comes from the FlorBama Lounge, Gulf Shores, AL.
Redcoat: In a shaker half-filled with ice cubes, combine all of the ingredients. Shake well. Strain into a cocktail glass.
Avocado Milkshake: Blend on medium for 3 to 5 minutes.
Rum Collins: Shake rum, juice of lime, and powdered sugar with ice and strain into a collins glass over ice cubes. Fill with carbonated water and stir. Add the slice of lemon, top with the cherry, and serve.
Tap that Ass: This wonderful drink was created by Angela the bartendar at the World Famous Townhouse in Los Angeles.
Fox Trot: For a Blue Fox Trot, use Blue Curacao.
Modified Duck Fart: Layer liquors in order listed from top to bottom in shot glass. Drink all at once.
The Beavis: Pour all the shit together, and hope it don't explode! Drink as fast as you can, with no food, and say your prayers.
Black Cherry: Fill highball glass with ice. Add ingredients, shake, and serve. Top with a cherry.
Sex on the Beach #8: Coco-Rum can be substituted for Malibu Rum.
Burgundy Bishop: Shake rum, juice of lemon, and powdered sugar with ice and strain into a highball glass over ice cubes. Fill with red wine and stir. Decorate with various fruits and serve.
3-Mile Long Island Iced Tea: Fill 14oz glass with ice and alcohol. Fill 2/3 glass with cola and remainder with sweet & sour. Top with dash of bitters and lemon wedge.
Los Angeles Cocktail: Shake all ingredients with ice, strain into a whiskey sour glass, and serve.
Gravedigger: Fill shot glass half and half with bacardi 151 and Jim Beam whiskey in any order you want.
Sunset (Night Club): Few of us 'tenders at the 'club' decided we needed a namesake drink. Watermelon Schnapps was fairly new in the area and just tossed a few things together...
Chi-Chi: Blend vodka, pineapple juice, and cream of coconut with one cup ice in an electric blender at a high speed. Pour into a red wine glass, decorate with the slice of pineapple and the cherry, and serve.
Singapore Sling: Pour grenadine, gin, and sweet and sour into a collins glass over ice cubes and stir well. Fill with carbonated water and top with cherry brandy. Add the cherry on top and serve.
Out of Africa: Invented in the Golden Palm Bar, Grand Hotel Krasnapolsky, Amsterdam.
Dreaming in Antalya: The colour is extremely like early evening time in Antalya, Turkey.
Mexican Hillbilly: This drinks name can change determined on what the country of orgin your beer is from (i.e. Jamaican Hillbilly if you use Red Strip or German Hillbilly if you use Becks). I know this sounds exactly like a Boilermaker but look how much more fun it can be if you make it a global drinking game. The first time I did this was in 1991, Holland Hillbilly (Heinekin and Jack Daniels), at a bar in Naples, Italy.
Damn-The-Weather Cocktail: Shake all ingredients with ice, strain into a cocktail glass, and serve.
Hole-In-One: Shake all ingredients with ice, strain into a cocktail glass, and serve.
Berry Patch: Smooth, fruity taste! Great for social drinking. Tastes great and shouldn't give you a hangover (unless your drink a hell of alot). Made the first one for my girlfriend the day we first met :)
Green Monster: Into an old fashion glass, pour vodka over ice. Add pickled pepper, and stir around with its stem. Devour pepper after draining drink.
Stone Fence: This is actually a very old drink, probably at least two and a half centuries old. It was popular in New England & New York in the 1700's and early 1800's.
California Iced Tea: Shake or roll. Garnish with an orange slice.
Strawberry Blonde: Stir gently with a swizzle stick before serving.
Mutated Mothers Milk: Mix all ingredients in a shaker filled with ice. Let stand for 3-5 minutes to chill. Pour into shot glass and enjoy.
Mexican Cappuccino: In coffee mug (a large one, if you have one) pour Kahlua and Tequila into the bottom. Brew cappuccino per the instructions for your machine. Fill cup with espresso and top with the frothed milk. Enjoy
Sigma Nu Ball Buster: Can use low quality Tequila if you're brave!! BE CAREFUL THIS DRINK HAS CAUSED ALCOHOL POISONING!! You have been warned, but trust us it's worth it!! ENJOY
Three Miller Cocktail: Shake all ingredients with ice, strain into a cocktail glass, and serve.
Citrus Coke: Pour half of coke in a glass. Then add Bacardi and top it off with the remaining coke. Stir and drink up!
Fuzzy Balls: Mix alcoholic ingredients one part each - and add 7-up. Eight shots of each requires a 2L bottle of 7-up.
Dirty Moma: Pour ingredients over ice and stur.
Bullvodka: If you want to decorate, Use a red cherry on the bottom of the Glass. Be careful, it goes straight into your blood.
Green Beret: This drink was created as a toast to present and past friends and fellow soldiers. Much like the true Green Beret Special Forces soldiers, this drink sneaks up on you and hits you silently. Enjoy!
Bushwacker #4: I first tasted this about ten years ago in Belfast at a wedding. It is very potent and very palatable.
B-51: This drink is best when shaken and strained, but the proper way is to layer the drink. Kahlua is poured first, then Bailey's is next, and Frangelico is layered on top.
Kretchma: Mix all ingredients with cracked ice in a shaker or blender. Strain into a chilled cocktail glass.
Appled Rum Cooler: In a shaker half-filled with ice cubes, combine the rum, applejack, and lime juice. Shake well. Strain into an old-fashioned glass almost filled with ice cubes. Top with the club soda.
Campari Orange: Mix over ice in highball glass.
Groader: Aaron attempted to make a White Russian one night, but in his drunken stupor he was unable to find any milk. Therefore he added ingredients haphazardly. Although he was unable to taste his creation due to his impaired senses, one Christopher Schrader was amazed by the sweet, smooth texture. Variants: Frozen Groader
Becky's Bomber: We were looking to make something out of raspberry vodka, and this was our creation. Real smooth but watch out!
Tequila Canyon: Pour first 3 ingredients over ice into collins glass and stir gently. Top with pineapple and orange juices. Garnish with a lime wheel. Serve with a straw.
Tijuana Taxi: Pour tequila, curacao, and schnapps over ice into large highball glass. Fill with lemon-lime soda and garnish with orange slice and a cherry.
Slugger's Delight: This drink dates back to the old party days after baseball practice. The traditional Rum and Coke became too boring and weak, so ordinary rum gave way to 151 rum. Then one night there was no more Coke, so we settled for Rock & Rye. We never bought Coke again. As you'll see, the taste is far superior and the product packs a punch.
Earthquake #1: This drink realy bears it's right name, it has broken more than one rooky.
Tequila Pink: Shake ingredients with ice and strain into cocktail glass.
Bushranger #2: Stir all ingredients with cracked ice, strain into a cocktail glass, and serve.
Hot Georgia Peach: Chill and pour in shot glass. Serve.
Red Horn: RedRum can either be mixed with the cider, or floated on top. Serve cold.
Santiago Cocktail: Shake all ingredients with ice, strain into a cocktail glass, and serve.
Otter Pop: mix all ingrediants into a shaker filled with ice, then strain out drink into shot glass
Floaty: First pour in the pear soda. Then take the Fanta and the juice. Please use a cognac bowl when mixing and drinking the drink. Then attach the cucumber slice to the rim, as you would do with a lemon slice. Blend and serve instantly!!!!
Bambus: Pour the ingredients into a glass.
French Martini: This is a great change from the traditional Martini!
Spiking coffee: Incidentally, a pinch of cinnamon is indeed a nice addition to coffee but true heaven is a cardamom seed. Of course, you serve it in a coffee mug.
Cotton Candy #2: The drink is not as sweet as one might think, as long as it is served cold. I've found that even 'tough guys' like it a lot.
3001: Combine blue curacao, vodka, tonic water, and splash of lime juice. Stir. Fill with sprite. Stir. Add pineapple slice and ice cubes.
Candy Corn #2: The drink should look like a liquid candy corn, hence the name.
Boomer: The "specialty" shot at Sgt. Preston's in Lafayette, IN
Lyndy: This was named after my friend Lyndy because as far as I can tell she invented it!
Fifth Avenue: Pour ingredients into a parfait glass (in order given) so that each ingredient floats on preceding one. Serve without mixing.
Whitney: The Whitney was constructed by me for the purpose of helping a friend with his girl. She requested to get drunk quickly and so I went to work. A few moments later I dubbed my concoction The Whitney which is her name.
Chelsea Hotel: In a shaker half-filled with ice cubes, combine all of the ingredients. Shake well. Strain into a cocktail glass.
Stevie Wonder: Dark, rich, and smooth. My personal favorite. I made this myself
Caribbean Punch: Mix in shaker, top with grated nutmeg.
Canadian Zombie: A Canadian bartender gave me this drink in a bar in Uppsala, Sweden. Expensive, but well worth it. You'll only need one per night.
Bluetail Fly: I have my own group of patrons for this original
The Italian Job: Whisk with a fork, untill all mixed in. Add cream after mixing.
Southern Smile: This is a fine shot going out to you from, THE BAD HABIT, Gresham, WI 54128.
Mango Orange Smoothie: Throw everything into a blender and liquify.
Caribbean Orange Liqueur: Pare very thinly the bright-colored rind from the oranges (no white). Blot the peel on paper towels to remove any excess oil. Put peel in a 4 cup screw-top jar. Add 2 cups vodka. Close jar. Store in a cool, dark place for 2 days or until the vodka has absorbed the flavor. Remove peel and add remaining vodka. Close jar and add remaining cup of vodka. Close the jar and store in a cool dark place at least 1 month to age.
Telegraph: In a shaker with ice, combine rum and vodka. Shake well and strain into a highball glass filled almost to the top with ice. Top off with ginger ale and stir gently.
Saketini: In a mixing glass half-filled with ice cubes, combine the gin or vodka with the sake. Stir well. Strain into a cocktail glass. Garnish with the olive.
Peregrine's Peril: In a shaker half-filled with ice cubes, combine all of the ingredients. Shake well. Strain into a cocktail glass.
Grumpier Old Man: Pucker up! It's more tart that "The Grumpy Old Man"!!!
Nitro: This stuff will power a small car !!!
Ruby Slipper: Drank on the first floor of Perry King Guest House on the Campus of Mount Union College. First Floor Guys- Rich, Dan, Dave, Jess, and Jim
Paralyzer #2: Above amounts are for an 8 oz glass. Build over ice: Kahlua, then Vodka, milk, then Coke.
Mandeville: In a shaker half-filled with ice cubes, combine the light rum, dark rum, anisette, lemon juice, and grenadine. Shake well. Strain into an old-fashioned glass almost filled with ice cubes. Top with the cola. Stir well.
Shattered Dreams: Add the vodka if you wish to make the drink a little stronger, but you'll never taste the difference either way. Without the vodka, you have a light, refreshing drink with just a slight alcoholic kick. With the vodka, you have just a little more of a kick.
Fuzzy Irishman: Pour Raspberry first, Butterscotch next and Irish cream last. Need not be layered but pour in order given. Top 'O the Mornin' to you!
White Way Cocktail: Shake ingredients with ice, strain into a cocktail glass, and serve.
Lewie: Adjust rum and amaretto to taste
Shamrock Juice: I like to shake it to get that right Green color. The fresher the O.J. the better. -- First had this at the Irish Pub in Frankfurt, Germany. They were served in excess on Saint Patty's day.
Russian Sarin: Pour the vodka and the liqueur in a (long drink) glass with one or two icecubes in it. Fill it up with Schweppes Russchian.
Twisted Screw: Nothing special. Vodka, then oj, then twister. Add a splash of raspberry sparkling water if desired.
Deerslayer: Put a few ice cubes in a highball glass. Add the Jägermeister and Windsor, stir, then fill the glass with the 7-Up and give it a small stir.
Rocky Mountain Bear Fucker #2: A small varyiation from the norm, but definately worth the extra zip.
Mocha Mint: Shake all ingredients with ice, strain into a cocktail glass, and serve.
Tuaca Nutter: Another great creation from Tuaca HQ in the UK.
Nightboat to Recife: Shake with ice and pour into tumbler with crushed ice.
Loch Ness Monster: Layer in order shown, Midori, Bailey's, Jager.
Cina Polada: After one of these special pina coladas, you'll be asking for another Cina Polada. One per person.
Welcome delight: Simple: Just put them into a bowl, and mix then together.
Kiddie Cocktail: Kind of like a Shirley Temple with 7-up/Sprite.
Froth Blower Cocktail: Shake all ingredients with ice, strain into a cocktail glass, and serve.
My Johnson is Ten Inches Long: Best to tell a woman, when she says "what" say "okay it's really 8." The best response I've heard from women is "what does it taste like?"
Arizona Sunrise: Add ice into a tall-stemed cocktail glass, pour grenadine over ice, add enough that some settles on the bottom of the glass Add tequila, orange juice, and lime juice into shaker with ice. Shake thourghly. Garnish with a straw, lime wedge OR orange and cherry.
Satin Sheets: This inspiration came from (of all things) playing games on the Internet. We were conjuring up drinks and this was my contribution.
Mortuary Mix: This drink gets better the more errors you make in the "add everclear" part of the recipe. This will get you drunk very quickly and the wonderful taste of the collins mix kills not only the taste, but the smell of our good friend everclear.
Original Sin: Add crushed ice to snifter or gobblet. Add Triple Sec, Brandy, Cherry Heering, Grenadine and Sour Mix. Stir contents. Add sliced fruit. Top off glass with Champagne.
Stiletto: Pour all ingredients into an old-fashioned glass over ice cubes, stir, and serve. (Bourbon may be substituted for blended whiskey, if preferred.)
Granny Apple Blossom: Tastes just like those little green granny apples we all had as a child over at grandmas house. Self designed.
Coast-Line: Pour 1/2 oz. of Blue Curacao and a 1/2 oz. of vodka in a highball glass. Top with Pineapple juice and a splash of 7-up. Garnish with a cherry.
AJ's Bubbling Brew: This drink originated with me AJ at my house in Roseville CA one night i took my favorite drink, The Flaming Blue Jesus, and added a beer to it, and then stirred it up, and so was born AJ's Bubbling Brew. ENJOY
Ante: Stir all ingredients well with cracked ice, strain contents into a cocktail glass, and serve.
Gin Balalajka: Mix the gim and juice and fill up with russian. The gin and juice may be shaken for better taste.
Whiskey Milk Punch: Shake all ingredients (except nutmeg) with ice and strain into a collins glass. Sprinkle nutmeg on top and serve.
Moulin Rouge: Stir ingredients with ice and strain into chilled glass.
Strawberry Daiquiri: Shake all ingredients with ice, strain into a cocktail glass, and serve.
Cinnamon Caramel Apple: The taste is sweet yet powerful. It's a great holiday cocktail, and a succulent substitute for eggnog.
Pink Gin #2: Add cranberry juice to gin and pour into shot glass.
Dianne-On-The-Tower: In a mixing glass half-filled with ice cubes, combine all of the ingredients. Stir well. Strain into a cocktail glass.
Sidecar: In a shaker half-filled with ice cubes, combine all of the ingredients. Shake well. Strain into a cocktail glass.
Sex on an Arizona Beach: If you drink enough of these, you will know that Arizona truly has beaches.
Apple Brandy Sour: Shake apple brandy, powdered sugar, and juice of lemon with ice and strain into a whiskey sour glass. Decorate with a half-slice of lemon, top with the cherry, and serve.
Three Wise Men (vodka): pour 2/3 of an oz. of each ingrediant into a shot glass and drink.
Blue PolarBear: Shake schnapps and vodka together until well-mixed. Add crushed ice, shake lightly, then pour to shot glasses.
Midori 2000: I got this from Midori's Melon Liqueur Homepage... it is a good tasting, good looking drink. Women that I have served it to love it! (Ok, guys like it too!)
Copper Camel: Add Bailey's to shot glass and and add Buterscotch on top.
Modern Cocktail: In a shaker half-filled with ice cubes, combine all of the ingredients. Shake well. Strain into a cocktail glass.
Party Slush Punch #2: Put the ingredients into a container in the freezer (stir occasionally while freezing). To serve: put 2/3 slush to 1/3 7-up in each glass or same ratio in punch bowl.
Cowboy Cocksucker #2: Mix with ice and strain into a shot glass
Candied Sever St. Special: A variation on the Sever St. Special (born of the same party). It tastes surprisingly different with just a little Midori added in.
Cherry Godet: Godet is a really rich and sweet liqueur so you probably won't want to drink more than one of these. Try Godet on ice instead of dessert!
Bailey's Dream Shake: Blend ingredients for 30 seconds. Definitely refreshing for a hot summer's day !
Jeremiah: Makes a nice foamy drink with a chocolate-mint flavour, which is quite rich tasting. Was made in an Irish pub in the Annapolis valley of Nova Scotia. Became a local favorite and specialty.
Caffine attack: Fill blender with coffee ice-cream and the amount of kahula to your desire. Blend until drinkable, pour into a beer mug and garnish with a cinnamon stick.
White Rabbit: It was made to be like the White Rabbit from Alice in Wonderland, cute little creature that leads you into the unknown. It looks like a harmless glass of milk and taste kind of like vanilla ice cream but, have a few and get ready to loose your head.
Nicky Finn: Shake with cracked ice and strain into a chilled cocktail glass. Garnish with a cherry and a lemon twist.
Extraterrestrial: Pour the jigger of Midori first. Then, very gingerly, slowly pour the Irish Cream on top of the Midori. If done properly, the Irish Cream will sit on top of the Midori without mixing. Repeat the procedure with the Stoli over the Irish Cream. This will give you a very attractive three layer drink. Optional - add a teaspoon or so of Bacardi 151 on the top of the drink. Then, light the 151 and let burn for 5-10 seconds. Put out with a napkin. Shoot the drink and enjoy!
Creamsicle #3: This recipe has been brought to you by Nick at The Basin Martini Bar in Saratoga, Ca. Stop by and try one or three of our specialties!
Radler: Pour beer into large mug, slowly add the 7-up (or Sprite).
Hunter Mountain: New Year's Eve milineum a group of us were up at Hunter Montain, New York. Remembering back to college days we wanted to make Russian Qualudes, only we did not have any Kaluha. We adjusted the proportions of the rest of the ingredients and came up with this delicious drink, the "Hunter Mountain". (Can also be used for shots.)
Whop Me Down Sweet Jesus: I know this is basically a Long Island, but this was the house drink at The Boro Bar in Edinboro, PA, where I spent seven years of my life and earned two degrees. It holds a lot of memories.
Boston Burn-out: Too large to put in your average shot glass. "Boston" is because that's where I'm from, and after you've tasted this...you'll understand the "Burn-out"!!
Cookies 'n' Cream: Add the creme de cacao and vanilla schnapps and then fill with milk.
Sweet Tommy: The drink came from my first job bartending when I needed to spice the lounge up a bit and I had more than a few comments on how sweet my drinks had come out. So I named one not only for the taste I was becoming known for, but after myself as well.
Bitch Slap: I made this drink at College and served it to my friends. They got hammered and called it the bitch slap cause it knocks you on your ass. Be careful though, it is really strong!
Blonde's Death: Mix in the glass. Serve cool!
Polynesian Cocktail: Rub rim of cocktail glass with lime and dip into powdered sugar. Shake vodka, cherry brandy, and juice of lime with ice, strain into the sugar-rimmed glass, and serve.
Tropical Pear Fizz: Not many liqueur based drinks out there that use pear or banana liqueur. This one is fun, light, and quite refreshing!
Strip and Go Naked: In a LARGE pitcher, pour in 3 cans of beer, then the vodka and lemonade, then the last 3 beers. Mix gently and pour into a tall glass over ice. It sounds horrible, but the beer taste is hidden. It tastes like lemonade!
Purple Fantasy: Make sure you serve over ice. Taste great.
The Real Cuba Libre: sit outside on balcony, fill glass with crushed ice, sqeeze lime, hold glass up to the sky (best effect during sunset), pour rum up to horizon , add some coke to cover the sky (no overflow), stir smoothly, lean back & ENJOY! Maximum effect with bass heavy dub reggae in the background
Black Martini #1: Poor ingredients over ice. Shake gently. Strain into cocktail glass.
Cinnamon Stick: My friends and I were experimenting with various types of drinks and this one was one of the best. If you like cinnamon, you'll enjoy this!
Lemon Shooters: Cover lemon slice with sugar. Shoot, then suck (on the lemon)!
Penalty Shot: I saw it on the side of the melon liquer bottle and it was very good and sweet. Enjoy!!
Bavarian Alps: Shake together all ingrediants and serve in a frosted glass.
252: Add both ingredients to shot glass, shoot, and get drunk quick
Applejack (Jack Daniel's original recipe: This is the recipe Jack Daniel's gives for this drink.
Bullfrog: Shake well (preferably in a closed container). Stir (preferably with a spoon in an opened container)
White Spider #2: Shake ingredients with ice, strain into cocktail glass.
Vodka Passion: It took me many years to locate a good source for passion fruit syrup. If you have a real interest in tasting this drink, and need the passion syrup, e-mail me.
Angel Face: Stir all ingredients well with cracked ice, strain into a cocktail glass, and serve.
Orange Mule: Add into glass over ice and mix well. Garnish with slice of lemon.
Red Drink: Also known as: Chief's game day
Pocima: If you like strong drinks, then add only one gallon of orange juice.
Bloody Maria: Shake all ingredients (except lemon slice) with cracked ice and strain into an old-fashioned glass over ice cubes. Add the slice of lemon and serve.
Mocha Frappe: Garnishes may include whipped cream on top, Nutmeg, cinnamon, or chocolate shavings.
Sloe Gin Fizz: Drink comes from the back of Creamy Head Sloe Gin bottle.
Irish Cream Special: Put ice in bottom of glass. Slowly pour Baliey's Irish Cream over ice Next pour in milk and then stir gently. Add more to taste. For chocoholics add Hearshy's Chocolate sauce.
South Of The Border: Shake all ingredients (except lime slice) with ice and strain into a whiskey sour glass. Add the slice of lime and serve.
Betsy Ross: In a mixing glass half-filled with crushed ice, combine all of the ingredients. Stir well. Strain into a cocktail glass.
Mulled Madeira: Combine first 6 ingredients in a large saucepan and bring almost to simmer over medium heat. Reduce heat and cook for 10 minutes (do not simmer). Add Cointreau and stir until hot. Serve warm in heat proof glasses or mugs, leaving peel and spices in pan.
Mistolin: The measurements of the orange and cranberry juice vary according to the persons taste. You may add more cranberry than orange or pour them evenly. This is a typical drink found here in Puerto Rico. Enjoy!
The Twister: This drink was created by my friends after the movie Twister, it has great and fresh taste speacially for the summer at the beach were we actually created. This drink was made proudly at Acapulco and has got more that a drunk out of it.
Dancing Leprechaun: Shake with ice. Strain into glass with ice cubes. Add a twist of lemon.
Skylab Fallout: Drink is strong - if your out at a club - limit yourself to two drinks - There is always another day.
Screaming Multiple Climax: This is a combination of 3 variations of the tradition Orgasm which has Bailey's instead of Vodka.
Agua de Valencia: The Agua de Valencia come from Valencia (Spain). Is a typical drink for the hollidays, specially for the populary fiesta "Las Fallas". We it drink very cold. In groups and is perfect for to offer the happiness Mediterranean.
Kansas City Ice Water #2: Less bitter that Kansas City Ice Water with lime juice. Best made with Stoli raspberry flavored vodka. Once again, a true Penn State original.
Oasis: One night a friend tray to teach to the bartender a new shot, the bartender pick up the drink and remaker. The story don't finish, because of that o must came to Amnésia Cáfe in Vila Franca de Xira, Portugal
Caramilk: Tastes great and sells like a charm in bars!
Rainbow Brew: Serve unstirred with a stir stick for presentation. Then tell drinkers they have the option to stir. Good for close company!
Lucky Stiff: Simple, bright red, and very tasty.
Zimamazing: It's tastes like an Electric Lemonade with Zima instead of lemon-lime soda and more sour mix. Instead of Triple Sec, you can also use Blue Curacao. It makes it a pretty blue-green drink. Also, keep a LOT of extra ice on hand because this drink has so much alcohol it melts the ice immediately, which is why you should not put ice in the shaker, it will dilute the drink.
Prairie Chicken: Open egg without breaking the yolk and put into a red wine glass. Pour gin on top of egg, add salt and pepper to taste, and serve.
Sprawling Dubinsky: This drink was created in honor of famed Chicago Blackhawk Steve Dubinsky. Its inspiration came from a night of drinking and watching the Mighty Blackhawks. In an overtime thriller, Steve made a "sprawling" attempt to stop a shot. While his attempt to be hero failed miserably(and the Hawks lost), it still looked pretty cool. In honor of this moment we drank the innagural "Sprawling Dubinsky" one part Johnnie Walker Red and one part Johnnie Walker Black because of the Hawks colors. One part Citron, because the Hawks suck, and finally a touch of amaretto for flavor.
Chocolate Raspberry Delight: Serve on ice or blend for a milk shake effect.
Veteran: Pour the rum and cherry brandy into an old-fashioned glass almost filled with ice cubes. Stir well.
Jeweler's Hammer: This drink is sooo good you will probably want to add 2 oz. of Vodka to 8 oz. of white grape juice. Add more or less Vodka to taste and pour over ice. Enjoy!
Tattooed Smurf: Taste like Raspberry. The only complaint is that your tongue will look like a smurf's beacuse of the Blue Tattoo.
Executive Sunrise: Pour the tequila and the orange juice into a collins glass almost filled with ice cubes. Stir well. Drop the cassis into the center of the drink.
Moment Brutale: This is for 4 cocktails. If you use lime take two, else use one lemon or orange, for instance.
Smurf #2: Put ice in cup and fill it half full with sprite. Add maui filling the glass. Stir.
Italian Sunrise: This is a house specialty drink from the Bellagio Hotel and Casino in Las Vegas.
Diesel: Drink several of these and watch the room spin around! N.B. Only the cheapest lager and cider from the students union bar should be used.
Chocolate Monkey: blend liqeuors with ice-cream, milk and syrup. pour into parfait glass, top with whipped cream and garnish with banana and cherry.
The Angry German: Orgin of The Angry German: Named after Geneva, Illinois native Scott Hallahan. While at Beloit College, Scott was nicknamed Hans Gruber by Beloit Collge alum Eric Emery, due to excess swearing and threats of violence. At last count, Scott has appox. 26 different nicknames (including 'The Angry German). The drink was created at Bert's Other Place in Beloit, Wisconsin on July 10, 1997. The Angry German should taste like your least favorite cough syrup.
Alice in Wonderland: I mix a mason jar full at a time and keep it it the refrigerator. Pour when required and sip away.
Winter Breeze: It tastes kind of like a chocolate milk with a kick. It makes a good bedtime drink.
Notre Dame Pick-Me-Up: This drink will pick you up after a Notre Dame Football Game Loss. Taste's just like a orange juice drink. GOOD LUCK
Gagliardo: Shake well and serve in a cocktail glass. This is a home cocktail of American/Internet Bar del Pozzo, Pavia, Italy.
G Bomb: Chill both ingredients by placing the bottles in the freezer for at least 1 hour. You should also chill the shot glasses you will be using the same way. Pour both ingredients into a chilled shot glass and enjoy.
End of the Road: Put all the ingridiants in the shaker (except the nuts), add ice, and shake well. Pour in the glass, and add the nuts on-top.
The Antichrist: Pour each of the first 3 ingredients into a shot glass and then add the Tabasco sauce on the top.
Merry Widow Fizz: Shake all ingredients (except carbonated water) with ice and strain into a highball glass over two ice cubes. Fill with carbonated water, stir, and serve.
Creamy Orange: Shake all ingredients with ice, strain into a cocktail glass, and serve.
Sweet Italian Bastard: Simply mix all the ingredients together in a cocktail mixer full of ice cubes. Shake well, strain and serve. Enjoy.
L\u00e4chler: I learned it at Empire bar in Walldorf, Germany, as an exchange student in the 9th grade.
Eggnog - Spiked: Separate the eggs. In an electric mixer, beat the egg yolks with the sugar until thick and lemon colored. Slowly add the bourbon and cognac, while beating at slow speed. Chill several hours. Add the salt to the egg whites and beat until almost stiff, or until the beaten whites form a peak that bends slightly. Whip the cream until stiff. Fold the whipped cream into the yolk mixture, then fold in the beaten egg whites. Chill one hour. When ready to serve, sprinkle the top with freshly grated nutmeg.
The Brett Schroeder: Shake, then add Orangina and ice cubes.
Seaboard: Shake all ingredients (except mint leaves) with ice and strain into an old-fashioned glass over ice cubes. Decorate with mint leaves and serve.
DJ Shooters: To Pitcher full of Ice, add Peach Schnapps, Rum, Vodka, Gin, and juices. Stir well. Serve.
Blue Bay: Mix in highball glass. Stirr. Garnish with slice of lemon.
Frozen Mudslide: Blend alcohol with ice-cream. Serve in frosted glass.
Blue Fox Trot: Shake with ice and strain into a chilled cocktail glass.
Fuzzy Logic #2: Mix all ingredients together and mix vigorously. Pour into glass and enjoy!
Orange Cooler: Put several ice cubes in a large tumbler, add sugar syrup and orange juice, top up with ginger ale. Stir.
Casa Blanca: Shake all ingredients with ice, strain into a cocktail glass, and serve.
Cuban Crime of Passion (CCP): Drink this slowly, because it is high octane. Invented the recipe when I was bored relaxing to Jimmy Buffett. It tastes like pinapples and coconuts.
Mocha Maria: Half fill a shaker with ice. Add ingredients, shake, and pour over ice.
Hawaiian Punch: Looks and tastes like the non-alcoholic well known brand named juice "Hawaiian Punch".
Bourbon Swizzle: In a shaker half-filled with ice cubes, combine the lime juice, sugar, bourbon, and bitters. Shake well. Almost fill a collins glass with crushed ice. Stir until glass is frosted. Strain the mixture in the shaker into the glass and add the club soda.
Bacardi Cocktail: In a shaker half-filled with ice cubes, combine all of the ingredients. Shake well. Strain into a cocktail glass.
Carmel Candy Apple: The Carmel Apple is typically a "shot" drink. This variation makes a nice "sipper".
Panther Sweat: Inspired by Harry Turtledove science fiction novel, and made by a bartender somewhere in either Chicago or Milwaukee one very long road trip ago in 1980.
Lemon Lift: Serve chilled straight or on the rocks.
Black Wolf: This drink has a habit of smelling like airplane fuel and can burns like crazy but is best chased with a glass of water.
Guinness Float: My friends and I had these one night at Manhattan's Pizza in Burlington VT. Great from start to finish.
Guinness Punch: This is a Jamaican drink that may also be found in some Jamaican restaurants in the US and UK. It tastes a lot like Chai Tea, but not as sweet. The malty bitterness of the Guinness is there, especially in the aftertaste, but it's softer than straight Guinness. If Sam Adams Cream Stout is used, there is almost no bitterness at all, and the drink seems sweeter.
Pineapple Cocktail #2: One of those little umbrellas for decoration is optional. I'ts better do do about five or six at the same time..
Bailey's Hot Shot: - Put Irish Cream in large glass and microwave on HIGH power for half a minute or so. - While that's going, rim the shot glasses with sugar - Pour heated Bailey's into shot glasses and serve immediately
Holy Doodle: Sweet but yummy. Good for people who can't drink vodka (like me).
Kalabreeze: This shot began as a Lotto 649 that turned out to taste great, who knew?
Pepper Slammer: add southern comfort to glass with ice. fill with dr. pepper pop.
Fruitopia: Invented by Ernie at Bennigans in Miami, FL (Sw 88th Street and 117th Avenue).
Instant Death: Put in all alcohol first and water last, then salt
Acid Rain: The taste of the Snapple masks the alcohol so well, you can hardly taste it! The perfect drink for those who have the tastebuds of a five-year-old girl, like me.
Bloated Bag of Monkey Spunk: Shake and strain into collins glass with ice. Garnish with a cherry.
Bit of Russiaan Honey: Add ingredients shake and pour over ice
Carrot Cake #3: Recipe from Dr. Feelgood's, Conneaut, Ohio.
Kioki Coffee: Stir. Add whipped cream to the top.
Prince of Norway: Fill glass with Icecubes, pour all ingrediences into glass. Garnish with orange slice.
En s\u00e5nn en: "En sånn en" is norwegian an means "One of those". If you are in Oslo, Norway and you happen to be a guest at "Zipper" they know for sure what U want. It's grrrreat!!
Vermont Maple Blaster: Great drink for after skiing or anything else. Famous traditional drink at the "Backhome Cafe" in Rutland, Vermont. The Backhome Cafe is also 20 minutes (on a bad day) from Killington, Vermont.
Cranberry Tart: Far too drinkable. Originally from a party at ChezBOFH in Cambridge (UK).
Buttery Nipple #2: Pour Butterscotch Schnapps halfway in shot glass. Pour Cream Whiskey down the side of the glass to fill the shot the rest of the way . Object is to float the Irish Cream on the Schnapps
Tom and Jerry: Very sweet body warming drink for the holidays. Passed down from My father. Children enjoy the drink too. Of course without the Alcohol
Electric Lemonade #3: Combine all ingredients except 7-up in a shaker filled with ice. Pour into a hurricane glass. Top with 7-up. Garnish with lemon slice.
Carmel Coke: Fill a rocker glsa with ice add the Coca-Cola then the schnapps
Seelbach Cocktail: A very sophisticated, but potent cocktail. Perfect to start off a classy evening on the town.
B-53 #2: Layer each ingredient in the order listed.
Zombie #5: Mixed in a shaker on ice. Serve in a Tumbler on crushed ice
Rum Shrub: It is a fine drink on a cold day, and you can use it a week after you have made it.
Kenny: Its a bit sweet of a vodka drink to be. Super
Cherry Spitfire: If done correctly, produces a fruity flavor that's guaranteed to get you where you want to be!
Chocolate Cake: Fill glass with ice. Add vodka then all other ingredients. Stir.
Fuzzy Comfort: Also known as Sloe and Sweet Fuzzy Comfortable Screw.
Shittin' Blue: Mix in this order: blueberry schnapps, blue caracoa, vodka. Carefully drop in the blue syrup. Drink down and enjoy!
Rieber Red Margarita: An extra strong and extra delicious Margarita, guaranteed a party hit!
Dreamsicle #1: In a lowball glass combine the two and stir.
Southern Gin Cocktail: Stir all ingredients (except lemon peel) with ice and strain into a cocktail glass. Add the twist of lemon peel and serve.
Hot Brown Lizard: This drink tastes much better than it sounds and goes down very smooth.
Mikado Cocktail: Pour all ingredients over ice cubes in an old-fashioned glass, stir, and serve.
Cazuela: This is a mexican drink straight from the heart of La Barca, Jalisco, Mexico. It is important to use a clay bowl that is approximatly 500 ml. You can find cazuelas in the Balneario San Juan Cosala in Chapala, Jalisco, Mexico.
Diablo's Blood: Pour both ingredients together and mix well. Serve cold.
Thug Passion #1: This drink originated in early 1996. It was created by the rapper Tupac Shakur at a party in Los Angeles, Ca. He raps about "Thug Passion," claiming that is guaranteed to make the "[girl] wet and the [guy] hard." Drink this as a toast to Tupac!
Charmer: This is a personal favorite of mine. And it looks cool too. Try it out
Lara's Russian Qualude: Can also be reduced to serve as a shot.
Hawaiian Volcano #2: Women enjoy the flavor of this drink. It does not have a strong alcohol taste. So Kick back, Relax and Enjoy!
Insomniac: You can add nutmeg or cinnamon on top.
Black Cow #2: You wouldn't think Kahlua and cola would go together in a drink, but this is good.
Finnish Passion: Shake all ingredients,pour in longdrink glass. Garnish with a boat of orange and red cherry.
East India Cocktail #1: Shake all ingredients (except cherry) with ice and strain into a cocktail glass. Top with the cherry and serve.
Palm Beach Cocktail: Shake all ingredients with ice, strain into a cocktail glass, and serve.
Asphalt: Pour brandy over ice the glass. Fill with Coke. Garnish with a slice of lemon.
A Better Melonball: This is like the melon ball, only not quite as fruity.
Milky Way: Hisashi Kishi, N.B.A., Japan 1. I.B.A.s I.C.C., Tokyo 1996 -- Category: Long Drink
Jim Beam's Redneck Friend: Pour all ingredients in bowl and mix well.
Screaming Orgasm: Pour first vodka, then Bailey's, then Kahlua into a cocktail glass over crushed ice. Stir. Caution: use only high quality vodka. Cheap vodka can cause the Bailey's to curdle. Test your brand of vodka by mixing 1 Tsp each of vodka and Bailey's first.
Jet Black: In a mixing glass half-filled with ice cubes, combine all of the ingredients. Stir well. Strain into a cocktail glass.
Red Lion: It's not too sweet, and if you really like gin, you will love this variation. I recommend Tanqueray extra dry.
Whiskey Eggnog: Shake all ingredients (except nutmeg) with ice and strain into a collins glass. Sprinke nutmeg on top and serve.
The Juice: Pour into a five gallon pitcher, the canister of lemonade, water, everclear and mix. serve on ice.
Bible Belt: This drink was the staple of the "Church of the Fallen.... Down Drunk" at Osan AB, Korea.
Wildfire: Someone told me this was created in honour of the bushfires in Australia. Any excuse for a drink! All I know is, after a few of these, you're toast. (And yes, it can be done - I thought it was only a joke at first too.)
Moranguito: first you put rhe absinthe, then put tequila, then put the Granadine syrup.
Magnum: This sounds like a lot of ingredients but it really does taste good!
Nazi Cola: Combine Jägermeister and Rumple Minze over ice in glass. Fill to top with Cola.
RumBubble: I would like to thank Karen (you're the best) for the idea, and her knee for the name of the drink!
Hawaiin Punch from Hell: Pour all over ice -- shake and strain into a large shot glass.
Brain Destroyer: Bacardi 151 is essential to the proper effect of this drink. The taste of the 151 should be hidden by the Bailey's, Kahlua, and Amaretto. The shot will go down smooth and hit hard a couple of minutes later - thus, the brain destroyer. How hard this drink hits depends on big a dash of 151 you add. Don't add too much or the shot won't go down smooth. Much respect must go out to my boy, Armand Aquino, who showed me how to make this shot. Enjoy!
Just Shoot Me: Beleve it or not, this is actually quite smooth, but it will sure sneek up on you fast. More than one and you better call a cab fast.
Wrightsville Sunset: Pout all ingredients in a shaker with ice. Shake. Strain into large white wine glasses half-filled with crushed ice.
Chocolate Banana: It doesn't have much of a kick, but those of you that like bananas will love this drink.
Unknown Warrior: This drink should be used with caution. The drink was invented by the Royal Swedish Navy.(me included)
Kim Special: Invented by Kimberley T. Nelson December 1997 at the Moby Dick Lounge In Prince Rupert, B.C. Canada "Hi Tony & Rob in Victoria!"
Gangbuster Punch: With its deceptively smooth taste, this shooter is an excellent remedy for post exam stress disorder.
Cranberry Margarita: Drink was originally made to celebrate cinco de maya.
Gr\u00fcngeist: It tastes better if you can find plain grapefruit soda (not mixed with lemon or lime). We do have in México that sort of soda. It goes easily to the head, refreshing for hot days.
Tattooed Love Goddess: After 2 or 3 of these-You won't know what hit 'Ya !
49er Gold Rush: If you want to get wasted fast, with less volume in a sweet and warm drink, this is the perfect drink for you. No drinking party should be complete without a shot of 49er Gold Rush!
Milk of Amnesia: This will taste like a delicious raspberry soda. Make sure you use a decent champagne but don't waste your money on expensive stuff. However I strongly recomend using Chambord. I know it hurts $$$ but the other (cheaper) brands never taste as good.
Super Smoothy: Chunk up the two bananas and put them in the bottom of a blender. Place the two large wedges of pineapple, strawberries and ice on top. Add rum if desired. Puree until smooth (a little water or fruit juice might be required). Pour into glass and serve immediately.
Silver Bullet #1: In a mixng glass half-filled with ice cubes, combine the gin and Scotch. Stir well. Strain into a shot glass. Carnish with the lemon twist.
Thunder-And-Lightning: Shake all ingredients with ice, strain into a cocktail glass, and serve.
Westwood Ice Tea: Equivilent to about 6 or 7 drinks, the wild combo of hard liquors will get you drunk, guarranteed, nothing's left to chance with this one!
The Cornell: This is submitted by Trisha Cornell.
Nicolalas: Mix Absolut Mandrin with Passoa in a highball glass. Put ice in the glass and fill it up with orange juice
Jade Isle: Originated in small bar in Powell, WY new years eve 1992, after my head waitress got married.
Brown Pelican: Combine in a mixing glass, stir gently and pour over ice cubes in a highball glass
Apple Cobbler: This drink is actually the way that a bar I go to incorrectly made an Oatmeal Cookie. This name suits it much better.
Tango Cocktail: Shake all ingredients with ice, strain into a cocktail glass, and serve.
Miner's Lung: You are supposed to slam it all down at once!
Dignified Iced Tea: Use Citron or other Citrus flavored vodka. Mix in highball glass and enjoy.
Purple Hooter Shooter: Pour ingredients into a shot glass Enjoy!
Blue Screw: Use less OJ and make a Martini out of this drink. Another drink invented from Yucatan Liquor Stand of Columbus.
Irish Cream: Mix scotch and milk. Add half-and-half. Add rest.
Whippersnapper: Unusual but good! Ran out of vodka, tried rum instead.
Little Green Frog: Prepare Lemon-Lime mix in a large pitcher or punch bowl and add the other ingredients and pour over ice.
Lemon Cocktail: Stir orange juice and lemon juice with ice in a mixing glass. Strain into a cocktail glass.
Brandy Alexander: Shake all ingredients (except nutmeg) with ice and strain contents into a cocktail glass. Sprinkle nutmeg on top and serve.
Rolls-Royce: In a mixing glass half-filled with ice cubes, combine all of the ingredients. Stir well. Strain into a cocktail glass.
Roswell: Should look like an alien lifeform, hence the name Roswell.
Bourbon Highball: Pour bourbon into a highball glass over ice cubes. Fill with carbonated water and stir. Add the twist of lemon peel and serve. (Ginger ale may be substituted for carbonated water, if preferred.)
Hot Dick: This drink was created for Mr. Richard Leady of Salt Lake City, Utah: the best criminal defense attorney in the West.
An Arif: Combine everything together in order it is listed, you may add Kool-Aid mix if desired, but make sure to add the lemon juice last. It is called an Arif because it will tend to block your nuts from getting off if you have too many of these.
Tahitian Tea: This is a fun drink with a delayed kick. Great for parties & can be adapted for punch easily.
Martini (Dry) (5-to-1): Stir gin and vermouth with ice in a mixing glass. Strain into a cocktail glass, add the olive, and serve.
C*m Shot (B-Street Bar): Made famous by Michael Gaines at the B-Street Bar in San Mateo.
Concrete: First you drink the vodka (no swallowing), then you drink the Baileys. You mix it in the mouth and swallow.
Scotch Sour: Shake scotch, juice of lime, and powdered sugar with ice and strain into a whiskey sour glass. Decorate with 1/2 slice lemon, top with the cherry, and serve.
Orange Julius: Blend all ingredients in a blender for 30 seconds. Serve immediately.
Orgasm #2: 1. Pour the two evenly into a 1-ounce shot glass.
Alligator: Fill glass half way with ice. Add o.j. and Midori and give a little stir.
Royal Bill: I prefer a dry or extra dry type of champagne to add a bit of sweetness to this fine after diner treat.
Alebrije: It is a sweet drink that is originally from Acapulco, actually from a club with that name. I recomend it frozzen. Caution: As you drink and enjoy the mix, you would probably start thinking in how this thing would get me drunk, but trust me, be carefull cause suddenly you are going to start asking wath hit you. If you would like more receipes from acapulco clubs, just ask me, and I would gladly send them to you.
Whisky Mac: Pour both of the ingredients into a wine goblet with no ice.
Holloween Punch: Take a bunch of grape juice and a bunch of fizzy stuff (club soda, ginger ale, lemonlime, whatever). Mix them in a punch bowl. Take orange sherbet and lime sherbet. Scoop out scoops and float them in the punch, let them melt a little so that a nasty film spreads all over the top of the punch but there are still "bubbles" in it in the form of sherbet scoops. Looks horrible, tastes just fine.
Long Slow Comfortable Screw Against the: Mix all ingredients in a glass.
Screaming White Orgasm: fill up the shaker with ice and put the ingredience in it. Shake it until it gets frosty on the outside. Before you start shaking,put icecubes in the glass and fill it up with water so the glass is cold when you have shaked the drink. Take the icecubes and water out of the glass,and fill the glass again vith icecubes and pour the drink in the glass.
Fidel Castro: Fill the glass with ice. Add the rum and lime juice. Fill with ginger ale.
Scotch Rickey: Pour scotch and juice of lime into a highball glass over ice cubes. Fill with carbonated water and stir. Add the lime peel/rind and serve.
Smirnoff Snapple Spikage: This is the type of drink where you can barely taste the Vodka unless you mix more than 1/2 oz. of Vokda in with the Snapple. If you like Snapple and have ever thought of mixing alcohol with your favorite non-iced tea flavor, then this is the drink for you.
Dr. Kevorkian: This drink was invented by a friend at Carnegie-Mellon University. It's a great party drink! Thanks to Evan Benoit!
Torombolo: Perfect drink for hot summer if it is served realy cold. Enjoy it.
Jan's Jello Shots: These are really great at a party....especially in the summer!
Starseeker: Pour all of the ingredients into a highball glass almost filled with ice cubes. Stir well and garnish with the lemon wedge.
Whiting Sunset: Pour vodka, tequila and orange juioce. Finally, add a dash of grenadine.
White Mistress: Instead of using chilled hot chocolate, cola can be used it then becomes a Black Mistress.
Phreaker Cocktail: Takes practice and alot of work, but once perfected, an excellent drink. Let me know if you perfect a way to make just one at a time.
Milk Shake 43: This is also nice when made with ice cream in a blender.
Venom: You may have to add more or less sugar depending on how sweet it tastes.
Vodka And Apple Juice: Pour vodka into a highball glass over two or three ice cubes. Fill with apple juice, stir, and serve.
Parappa the Drunk Rappa: Pour shots over ice, add coke and strain into glass
Fruity Pebbles: I created this drink on Spring Break in Ft. Lauderdale. I just mixed together everything we had and this was the result. Everyone who has ever tasted it loves it!
Lethal Weapon: Combine all into a tall glass and serve with ice. As an option, use two cans of Mountain Dew if the drink seems too strong for you.
Something Peachie #2: Serve in a tall glass over ice. Garnich with a cherry and orange slice
Cinnamon Toast Crunch: This is a delicious drink. Drink it with your girlfriend/boyfriend, or a close friend, with slow jams in the background.
Scarlett Martini: What a slick looking drink! Popular amoung teens trying to look sophisticated. Cheers.
\u00d6xn\u00e4s Temptation: Start by adding the vodka and the banan liqueur. Fill the glass with sprite or similar soft drink. Pour some conc. orange juice. Stir. Add some grenadine for that nice Tequila Sunrise effect, or don't if you think it will be to sweet. Add a slice of orange for decoration.
Pendennis: In an old-fashioned glass, dissolve the sugar in a few drops of water. Almost fill the glass with crushed ice. Add the bourbon. Stir well and garnish wth the lemon slice.
Porch Crawlers: Combine all ingredients in a punch bowl.
Blue Skies: The cointreau and ice should create a cloudy effect (precipitates) with the bubbles in the lemonade and rise to the top of the glass... blue skies!!
Prickly Pear: It has a nice taste - In New Orleans, it was primarily a Bartender's drink - Not too sweet, not too tart, and the effects of Tequila!
Fruitloops: Stir all ingredients and serve over ice. Garnish with an orange slice and a cherry
Coffee Crisp: Flavour is very, very similar to a popular chocolate bar in Canada called, of course, a Coffee Crisp. The rich, if slightly thick drink is optimal for the winter months.
Pimm's Cup New Orleans Style: The addition of lemonade to the Pimm's Cup is a practice founded by the Napoleon House in New Orleans. It simply adds another level of flavor to this classic English drink.
Dreamy Winter Delight: Add Irish Cram to the Hot Chocolate and add Amaretto to your taste. Stir.
Big Red: Pour ingredients into 1 ounce shot glass
Blue Peach: Really peachy but the Blue Curacao gives it a nice after taste.
Widow's Kiss: Shake all ingredients with ice, strain into a cocktail glass, and serve.
Monk on Coke: This is a VERY sweet drink. I created it one time when my liquor cabinet was rather bare and wanted to try something new. It sounds wierd, but is very good if you like sweet things.
Arizona Twister: this is a fruity, tangy interpretation of a southwestern style long island iced tea. Enjoy
Tiatip: Chill Tia Maria and Baileys Irish cream 20 degrees In shot glass fill half way with Tia Maria then very carefully add Bailey Irish cream on top. Do not allow them to mix. Keep them seperated. There's your shot. Enjoy!
Malibu Pop: Combine Malibu Rum and Blue Curacao shake, then add juices.Serve over ice in highball glass.
Snowshot: Great if you like lemons. Name comes from the drink's similarity to yellow snow. Dont eat it, drink it. Cheers.
Sloe Gin Collins: Shake sloe gin and juice of lemon with ice and strain into a collins glass. Add several ice cubes, fill with carbonated water, and stir. Add slices of lemon and orange, top with the cherry, and serve with a straw.
Border Crossing: Pour the tequila, lime juice, lemon juice, and cola into a highball glass almost filled with ice cubes. Stir well and garnish with the lime wedge.
Sweet Pea: A wondering mind created a delicious drink.
Harry Alligator: Layer ingrediants in order listed above. Then squeeze lemon over layered ingrediants. Be sure to mount lemon wedge on side of glass or place in glass.
Dudley's Damnation: If you get this one right you are in for a good time. it is very hard to get any taste of alcohol form this drink even though it will knock you on your ass in a heart beat. It tastes like a lemony lime type drink. This bevarge was the result of week long drunken escape at the beach with all of my friends. We found that everyone we brought to our place to party loved this drink, guys and girls equally. I promise this is a great party drink and everyone will love it. You can either dip it out of the cooler or drink it right from the drain plug. The latter of the two will more than likely get you a nice bill form local hospital though.
Glitch: Mix in order listed. The blue splash at the end makes the drink aquamarine colored, which is lovely.
Ladies Cocktail #2: Stir well with ice. Strain into glass. Serve with piece of pineapple on top.
Flaming Dr. Pepper (alternative): Put Amaretto in bottom of shot glass, top with Rum. Pour Beer into glass. Light shot, pick up shot by the sides and drop entire shot glass (bottom first) into beer. When bottom of shot glass hits bottom of beer glass chug (the beer will put out the flame).
All Night Long: Mix all together in hurricane glass. Shake well. Garnish-orange flag
Silver Stallion Fizz: Shake gin and vanilla ice-cream with ice and strain into a highball glass. Fill with carbonated water, stir, and serve.
Paddy's Caffeine: The common Irish Porter drinker came back from France after a long affair with their rich coffee. Unable to decide between his two loves-Guinness or coffee he came up with a delicious compromise
Million-Dollar Cocktail: Shake all ingredients with ice, strain into a cocktail glass, and serve.
Fuzzy Ass: This drink is very potent... Be careful ! ! ! >=) You can add as much Vodka as you wish, I just used 2ozs. as a Basic amount.
Kahlua #6: Old family recipe. great taste and easy to make. Put in a neat container if want to use for gifts or just let it stay put and enjoy with friends and neighbors.
Pat: It hits all of your taste buds. Tastes Sweet, sour, salty, and bitter. Very refreshing after a days work.
Waverunner: This drink supposedly originated at The Daily Planet restaurant in Fresno , CA.
Screaming Purple Jesus: Don't drink to many of these, or you won't remember what you've done the next morning!
Swervin Mervin: Originated in Dave and Busters of Philadelphia.
Opera House Special: Put all ingredients into a metal mixer and strain into shot glass.
Field Of Hearts: This drink comes from CROWN CASINO in Melbourne, Australia. We invented it and it has won several awards, so now we'd like to share it :) Hope you enjoy your "Field of Hearts".
Sammy Slammer: It is really sweet.. an actual good-tasting shot
Scope #2: Place ice in a tin then pour 1/2 oz. of Midori melon liqueur and 1/2 oz. of Rumple Minze. Shake and then strain into a rocks glass.
Mogadon: This is an easy drink to make, and it tastes good, too.
Root Canal: Too much peppermint schnapps gives the drink a very distastefull mouthwash flavor, although the soda and rootbeer schnapps hides this. There is still a hint of peppermint. The cherry brings out the other flavors
The Drink of Champions: Dedicated to the Vermillion Trip of 1996. To be drunk at the beginning of a trip or vacation or to celebrate the end of an event or journey. -- Also known as The Celebratory Drink.
Aussie Riviter: Shake all four ingredients and strain into cocktail glass. Dash of lime is optional. Recipe can be doubled if needed.
The Fuzzy Magnum: Drink created by Joshua D., Timothy J, and Misty L. at HOPS of Chattanooga, Tennessee.
DewRunRum: These drinks are great! 2 of them is like a 6 pack. You can easily slam 4 or 5 before you even start to feel the effects, so watch out. They will catch up to you.
Purple Love: A sweet, creamy cocktail in an attractive shade of purple. It will be a popular drink among the ladies. -- *NOTE* You can subsitute the whipped cream with either vanilla ice-cream or vanilla milk. It will be sweeter if ice-cream is added. The ingredients would be quite costly. For cheaper Purple Love, you can subsitute the Chambord with cranberry juice or red grape juice.
Cherry Candycane: Tastes like cherry, but the after taste is minty
Apricot adventure: Crush part of the mint together with the sugar and some Zwack. Shake the rest of the Zwack with the Lime Juice and ice and pour into the glass. Fill up with club soda and decorate with the remaining mint and perhaps some lime.
Ponche de Pina: Peel pineapples, chop or shread. Add water and let stand overnight. Put in large saucepan with spices, sugar, and coconut milk. Boil for 5 minutes. Strain liquid into large pitcher. Add rum and serve hot.
Lemon Squash: Mix lemon juice with sugar syrup in a highball glass, stir well and fill up with soda water. Serve with drinking straw.
Dressed Up Pina Colada: This is something that I saw someplace one time and I thought that I would try it at home. It turned out to be pretty easy and can be made a very decorative drink with practice. Have fun. And drink responsibly.
Daiquiri Liqueur: Pare very thinly the bright-colored rind from the limes (no white). Blot the peel on paper towels to remove any excess oil. Put peel in a 4 cup screw-top jar. Add 2 cups of the rum. Close the jar. Store in a cool, dark place for 2 days or until rum has absorbed the flavor. Remove the peel and add the sugar. Shake vigorously until the sugar dissolves and add remaining cup of rum. Close jar and store in a cool, dark place at least 1 month to age.
Florida Rum Runner: Mix in blender until ice is crushed into slushy form. Serve while frozen.
Amaretto Shake: Combine all ingredients in a blender and blend at high speed until smooth. Serve in chilled glass garnished with bittersweet chocolate shavings.
Crase: Shake hard and fast, strain over ice.
Green Iguana Margarita: Blend and pour into a salted glass.
Nelson special: Excellent drink any time of day.
Fontainebleau Sidecar: Came from a special history of Bourbon distilleries. -- Note: Use quality bourbon.
El Presidente Cocktail #2: Shake with ice and strain into a cocktail glass. Add a cherry.
Red Beard: This comes from Panama City Beach, FL.
Lucky Lindeman: Empty one can of Tropicana strawberry/orange/banana into a blender and 1/4 gallon vodka. Mix well. Pour half of this into a pitcher and set aside for later use, leaving the other half in the blender. Fill the blender with ice and blend until it resembles a slurpy. Drink up and start mixing the other half.
French 75 (Cognac): Combine cognac, sugar and lemon juice in shaker. Add ice and shake till chilled. Pour into champagne flute. Pour champagne over cognac concotion. Garnish with lemon curl.
Parisian: Shake all ingredients with ice, strain into a cocktail glass, and serve.
Tequila Sunset: Pour tequila into a collins glass filled with ice cubes. Fill with orange juice and stir well. Top with blackberry brandy and stir lightly. Add the cherry on top and serve.
Fuzzy Buccaneer: Add rum to a Fuzzy Navel for a kick. And of course since navel refers to the Navy?? And Pirates are sort of involved in Naval affairs. The name Fuzzy Buccaneer truly fits especially after five or six of these suckers. Then try saying the name of this drink, and you may become a bucky fuzzaneer or a buzzy f----aneer.
Boat drink: To a glass of ice add Captain Morgan's spiced rum. Add a splash of tonic water. Rim glass with lime. Drink. Repeat.
Irish Hammer: Shake with ice and strain into shot glass.
Mexican Madras: Pour juices and tequila into shaker 1/2 filled with ice. Shake well and strain into old-fashioned glass. Garnish with an orange slice.
Slippery Eggs: Yummy stuff: basically just a slippery nipple with eggnog. Enjoy!
Earthquake Cocktail: Shake with ice and strain into a Collins glass.
Sir Knight: Shake with cracked ice and strain into a chilled cocktail glass. Garnish with a twist of lemon.
Irish Monk #2: Pour ingredients into the shot glass in the following order: - Baileys first, - Frangelico next, - Brandy on top.
Kvas: Put the slices of rye-bread in the oven (200 degrees Celsius) for about 45 mins, until they're dried. Boil the 8 liters of water. Crumble the dried rye-bread, put it in the boiling water for about 5 mins. Let it the water, and rye-bread rest for 4 hours, covered with a tea-cloth. Crumble the yeast, 15 mins before the 4 hours are over. Mix the crumbled yeast with some sugar and the luke warm water. Let it rest for 15 mins. Filter the water-rye-bread mix in a kitchensieve. Carefully extract all water from the rye-bread. Wash, and peel the lemon. Add the lemon-peel, the sugar, the yeast and the mint. Stir the solution, and let it rest (covered) for 8 hours. Sieve the solution (tea-cloth). Bottle it. Put some raisins, a bit of lemon-peel, and a fresh leaf of mint in every bottle, close the bottles, and keep them in a cool place. Ready when the raisins start floating. Sieve the stuff one more time in a tea-cloth. Put the Kvas in the fridge 4 hours before drinking.
Buck Jones: Pour rum, sherry, and juice of lime in a highball glass over ice cubes. Fill with ginger ale, stir, and serve.
Space Odyssey: Fill glass with ice and add shots of Bacardi and Malibu. Add splash of pineapple juice and top with orange juice. Add grenadine for color and garnish with cherries.
Homemade Ginger Beer: Combine the crushed ginger,lime peel,juice and sugar in a jar or bottle larger than 32 oz with a lid that can be tightly sealed. Pour in the boiling water. Cover loosely and let cool to room temp. Dissolve the yeast in the lukewarm water and add. Seal the jar as tightly as possible and let stand at room temp overnight. Chill, strain and serve.
Southern Fruity Passion: This shot came from Matt Marder and Jon Fugitt. One night we were drinking we decided to make a new shot and there it was. The smoothest shot in the south, Southern Fruity Passion.
Tiger Woods: Fill a highball with ice, add the vodka, lemon juice and cran. Garnish with a lemon wedge and serve.
Ponderosa: Throw it all into a glass, shoot as fast as possible. Do this repeatadly until very inebriated!
Ruby In The Rough: In a mixing glass half-filled with ice cubes, combine all of the ingredients. Stir well. Strain into a cocktail glass.
Ice Palace: Shake all ingredients (except orange slice) with ice and strain into a collins glass over ice cubes. Garnish with the slice of orange and a cherry (if desired) and serve.
Black-Eyed Susan: Chill all ingredients. Just before serving combine in a punch bowl. Unmold ice ring and float in bowl. Serve in tall glasses. Makes 10 large servings.
Fireball: Pour the cinnamon schnapps in shot glass and add the dash of Tabasco Sauce. Then shoot.
Mexican Coffee Liqueur: Heat water in medium saucepan. when hot add coffee and stir until dissolved. Add sugar and vanilla bean, stirring well to combine. Bring to boil, stirring constantly. Imediately reduce heat so that a very low boil is maintained for one minute. Remove from heat and cool to lukewarm. Pour vodka and brandy into aging container. Add the cooled coffee mixture and the chocolate extract. Stir well. Cap and let age in a cool dark place for 3 weeks. After initial aging, strain liqueur through a cloth-lined wire-mesh strainer over a large bowl. Repeat until desired clairity is reached. Stir in food coloring. Bottle, cap and let age an additional 1-3 months.
Hot Cider: Stud the oranges with cloves. (Push the pointy end into them until the flower part is flush with the peel.) I use about 10 per orange. You may want to peel the top layer of skin off the orange if you don't want to ingest the dyes they put on them to make them orange. Put the cider into a large saucepan, and add the oranges and some cinnamon sticks (one or two will do). Heat for hours (you can just leave it on all day for a party). It gets better with age. Just pour in more cider when it starts getting low.
Lugger: Stir all ingredients with ice, strain into a cocktail glass, and serve.
Italian Screw: I'm more of a baker and chef than a bartender. I put one of these together while making a Harvey Wallbanger Cake. The first time I made it, it had equal parts Galliano and Vodka. This made it lose alot of it's screwdriver taste. Oh, and the cake turned out fine, even after a couple of these. Enjoy. - Cody
Bite of the Iguana: Mix ingredients and shake. Strain and pour into shotglass. Share with a friend.
The Power of Milk: Stir sugar and vodka together. Add milk. Serve cold with a straw.
Neopolitan: Combine all ingredients in glass mixer, chill and strain into cocktail glass. Garnish with lemon twist.
Apple Pie Shot #2: bang glass on table and immediately take shot
Hurricane Leah: Pour over ice into hurricane or parfait glass, stir. Garnish with orange peel.
Voodoo Sunrise: If poured properly, the grenadine will create a red to orange effect from the bottom of the glass to the top
Indigo Blues: This is a house specialty drink from the Bellagio Hotel and Casino in Las Vegas.
Poop Deck Cocktail: Shake all ingredients with ice, strain into a cocktail glass, and serve.
You may can serve this drnk in a chilled cocktail glass without ice. The ice is nice in the summer, but it is not needed to make a good drink.
Sweet Solution: I made this up one day at my brother's house when I was very drunk and I had tequila and juice. And now it is my drink of choice, probably one of the best drinks I have ever had. And my friend Anna helped me make up the name when I could'nt think of anything cool. So give it a try, I promise you will not be disappointed.
Calypso: Fast shot for a cold night warming sensational feeling! Try it, Love it!
Sneeky Sucker: My friends and I came up with this drink on my birthday with the ingredients I already had in my house. This drink is very sweet and the vodka is virtually undetectable if mixed in the right proportions. So beware this one sneeks up on you hence the name. Best if consumed through a straw with lots of ice, or well chilled.
Ice bolts: Very good to take after you have drunk a very hot drink. It cools you down to the core!
