Zoksel: This is a dutch drink, served only in cafe Booze&Blues.;
Aperol Schuhmann: Shake with ice. Serve in a longdrink glass.
Net surfer: shake well and pour in a cocktail glass frosted with strawberry.
Franziska: Heat and stir until the honey is dissolved.
Carlitos: Pour over ice in a tall glass. Stir.
A Fuzzy Thing: This is a fruity drink that was invented by a friend of mine and i should give him credit for it. He introduced it to me, so here's to you Bobby!
Cran-Collins: The mix of cranberry juice and Collins mix covers the taste of vodka very well. This is an excellent drink!
Acapulcos malibu: This mix was created by me in Acapulco.
Jamaican Cabdriver: Put ice in glass. Add orange juice and coconut rum. Add 1 to 2 oz. of cranberry juice, depending on your taste. Stir well.
Beach Bum: Created on September 24, 1999 in Maryville, Missouri
Blue Chili: A very nice blue colour drink that is certainly a class higher than Blue lagoon & Blue cowboy.
Champagne Celebration: Created by Tony Abou-Ganim of the Bellagio Hotel in Las Vegas.
Dragon's Blood: This is a very tasty drink I made up one night. ENJOY!!
Lady 52: This cocktail won an Israeli contest in 1990.
Tropical Kermit Piss: Just happened (couldn't find sweet and sour mix, so we used cointreau).
Fuzzy Peachclari: Pour vodka, then orange juice, then peach schnapps. Drink.
Maiden's Blush: In a shaker half-filled with ice cubes, combine the gin, triple sec, cherry brandy, and lemon juice. Shake well. Strain into a cocktail glass. Garnish with the cherry.
Tweaked: It'll make you tweaked out after a couple.
Hornet: Combine over ice and add cola soda, top with lime slice.
Grain Punch: First and foremost, BUY A NEW GARBAGE CAN, and wash it out thoroughly!!!!! (Preferably the big ones 40-55gal). First Pour in all of the Grain (10 bottles of 1.75ml [Handle]), keep in mind that this recipie is for a Large Party, not 10 people sitting around getting loaded.....Anyway, next add the dry packets of mix. We used to get the largest industrial bags we could, don't go for quality, you're not going to remember anyway. Now this is the most critical part, the fruit. This is why I put this on here...any joker can make punch, but I figured I would distibute my years of fruit research for free....the Best friends you have in the Fruit community are the Orange and the Apple. This is because they absorb the grain better than anything else I tested. So make sure you get some of these in every glass you get, and eat them, DON'T EVER THROW THESE OUT, this is the best part of the drink. Bananas suck, they get gushy, watermellon works ok but the seeds get to be a pain in the ass when you can't see so well, pineapple is good, basically you get the point. Cut the fruit into wedges and throw it in the mix and let it sit around for a minute...Now throw in the bags of ice and fill it up to desired potency with water, mixing can be done with a canoe paddle or a 2x4 or anything else you've got lying around...a disposable camera is usually a good partner while drinking this concoction, people get really outta hand and go off the deep end.....This goes well as an iceblock shot too.
Gulyuz: It tastes delicious and I dedicate this drink to my girl-friend, so you can imagine how good it is.
Buttsex: The word "buttsex" is an inside joke with a select few friends. This was created for New Year's Eve 1999, and drunk as the ball dropped. It's really an acquired taste, and if you have a weak stomach I suggest leaving out the triple sec and lemon. Be sure to get some whipped cream with every drink or this will kick your butt.
Spiced Peach Punch: Combine peach nectar, orange juice and brown sugar in a large saucepan. Tie cinnamon and cloves in a small cheesecloth bag. Drop into saucepan. Heat slowly, stirring constantly, until sugar dissolves. Simmer 10 minutes. Stir in lime juice. Serve in hot mugs.
Banana Punch #2: Boil water and sugar for 5 minutes. Cool and add the remaining ingredients except ginger ale. Freeze. Remove from freezer 2 to 3 hours before serving. Mix with ginger ale. Float assorted fruit in punch bowl. Vodka could also be added.
Green Zone: Pour all ingredients with an ice cube into a shaker.
The Army John: I made this for my friend, John. He's a hardcore kind of guy, so we call him Army John. He's the one who thought this up - he loves Southern Comfort. Its a strong drink, esp when you use 100 proof So Co. Enjoy
Passionate Kiss: Born in Gaslamp Billiard Palace, San Diego.
Sweet Heart: Kazuhiro Takagai, N.B.A., Japan 1. I.B.A.s I.C.C. Tokyo 1996 -- Category: After Dinner
Mussaka: an old new drink in Canada
Sex on the Beach #10: shake like hell whith some ice
Captain Crunch: Can be made as a drink by adding more cream
Owen's Grandmother's Revenge: Add ingredients and mix in blender.
Madras: Pour all ingredients (except lime wedge) into a highball glass over ice. Add the lime wedge and serve.
Pineapple Liqueur: Crush pineapple pieces *very* finely. Put together with the pineapple juice in a pan, add the sugar. Leave to stand over night. Drain syrup and strain pineapple pieces through a cheese cloth or in a food processor. Mix juice with rum and vodka, add lemon juice to taste. Pour in a 0.7 l bottle and fill to the brim with pineapple juice or water. Leave at least one week.
Orange Surfboard: This drink was created by Chad Spooner at the Ore House restaurant in Vail, Colorado. If you are in town, stop by and have an Orange Surfboard with him!
Sweet Old-Fashioned: Pour liquor over ice, add other ingredients. Garhish with cherry and lemon peel.
Champagne Cocktail: Place lump of sugar and bitters in a chilled champagne flute. Fill with chilled champagne. Add the twist of lemon peel and serve.
Clam Eye: The perfect drink to wake up to the morning after a big bender. Put you back in shape again. Bon appetit!
Sweet Tooth: If you are a chocoholic, you'll love this drink. Hint: Makes a great dessert. Don't try to get waisted on them.
Opening Cocktail: Stir all ingredients with ice, strain into a cocktail glass, and serve.
Jamaica Hop: Shake all ingredients with ice, strain into a cocktail glass, and serve.
Irish Cactus: Tastes alot better than it sounds. I came up with this out of nessesity. The wife likes Irish cream and brandy and I like Tequila so I put the Tequila in her Irish Cream to try it out,Yumm. While traveling I asked a Bartender for Irish Cream and Tequila on the rocks and he said,"you whant what!? what do you call that"? I said, "I don't know what do you think it should be called"? The Bartender replied "Irish Cactus" and thats what I have called this drink ever since.
Homemade Southern Comfort: Variations: add 2 cinnamon sticks and 4 whole cloves.
Jelly Bean #2: Pour ingredients in the above order into highball glass. Tilt glass until mixture is close to top of glass and light. Wait a few seconds, then right before shooting it, blow it out so you don't burn your face off!
Dutch Flag: Layer. Blue curacao first, then pina colada and last grenadine on top.
Torpedo: This drink is from the musical/movie "Follow the Boys" In the movie the navy guy walk up to the bar, the bartender looks at him, saying "You don't want me to make that, the navy drink?", and the navy guy must make the drink himself... He is charged 40 $ for 4 of these.. "That should about cover it"
Pan Galactic Gargle Blaster #5: Anyone who has read the Hitchhiker's Guide to the Galaxy can appreciate the name of this drink. Most of my customers have trouble pronouncing it. But you can have a lot of fun forcing people to remember it when they order. This one is very popular with the ladies, as it is VERY easy to drink, and hey, I just like the name of it.
Napalm-Death: Take a shot glass and take equal amounts of the liquor. First the Kahlua, then slowly pour down the Drambuie, then the Bailey's and last the Cointreau. Try to get fine layers.
Stormcloud: Build in shot glass. Float Bailey's in amaretto and top with 151. The Bailey's should float in the middle.
Sex under the boardwalk: Shake with ice and strain into an old fashioned glass.
Painter's Delight: After a hard day at work, cool down with this Swedish specialty.
Tropical Passion: Favorite summer shot at Solomon Grundys in Saratoge Springs, NY.
Skid Marks: A fun little shot that I invented with a few of my friends when we were running high on Kahlua and low on ingredients
Blackjack #2: Shake all ingredients with cracked ice, strain into an old-fashioned glass over ice cubes, and serve.
Southern Dew: basically put ice in glass, add 1 oz. southern comfort, then fill glass with mountain dew and enjoy!
Back-up Goalie: A buddy of mine and another goalie came up with this after being demoted to back-ups.
Rocky Mountain Bear Fucker: Pour into shot glass starting with tequila, followed by J.D. and finally Southern. Shoot it.
Flat Tire: Created at Giuseppe's in Meredith, NH. A great shot if you run out of Jägermeister.
Smut: Throw it all together and serve real cold.
Scotch Old-Fashioned: In an old-fashioned glass, muddle the bitters and water into the sugar cube, using the back of a teaspoon. Almost fill the glass with ice cubes and add the scotch. Garnish with the orange slice and the cherry. Serve with a swizzle stick.
Thunder Quake: For added effect, light the brandy.
Vodka Fizz: Perfect for Sunday brunches, hot afternoons.
Shit On Grass: First add half a shot of Midori Melon Liquer, then pour Kaluah to top it off.
Cherry Bomb, Traditional: Place all 6 8oz jars of cherries (drained), mixed with EVERCLEAR into sealable cannister for approx. 2 and half months, serve by the shot. To drown out flavor of everclear, put one cherry in shot glass, and fill with sprite or 7up. Take cherry and soda into mouth at same time, chew cherry, and swallow all together. Enjoy!!
Red Snapper #2: Mix it all over ice, strain into shot glass.
Red Eye: fill glass 1/2 to 3/4 full with beer add vodka if wanted top with tomato juice
Fuzzy Melonberry: Add all ingredients to a highball glass filled with ice
Yellow Strawberry: Shake all ingredients (except banana slice) with ice and strain into a chilled whiskey sour glass. Garnish with the banana slice and serve.
Far East: A new cocktail. One of my experiments.
Pear Martini: Garnish with a slice of pear.
Veterinary: Pour alcohol over ice cubes in tall glass. Add lime juice and Sprite / 7-UP. Stir well.
Blitz: Try it, has good rep among new customers.
Hot Shot: Pour the hot coffee in the shot glass and gently add the Galliano, so it floats on the coffee. Then add some lightly whipped cream over it.
Gladiator: Mix 1/2 oz Amaretto with 1/2 oz Southern Comfort. Drop into glass of 2 oz orange juice mixed with 2 oz 7-up.
Ten Quidder: In an old-fashioned glass almost filled with ice cubes, combine the gin, triple sec, and bitters. Stir well. Pour the Curacao into the center of the drink.
Peach Tequila: Pour ingredients into collins glass filled with ice. Add lime juice. Stir and drop lime slice into drink.
Amaretto And Cream: Shake well with cracked ice, strain contents into a cocktail glass, and serve.
Purple Peril: Got this drink from my ex girlfriend, the only good thing she left me.
Rhino: This is a B-52 clone. You should put the shot on fire before drinking it with or without a straw. Amarula is a South African product. There are Rhinos in South Africa. I do not know if it is a myth but I've heard that when a rhino see a fire it tries to put it out. The same here... Eliminate the fire by drinking it!
Sizzler: Mix all to gether until fizzing.
Scooley Slammer: Light drink for those days you're sitting by the pool.
Egg Nog - Cooked: Here's an egg nog recipe using cooked eggs, so no one has to be paranoid about salmonella. Mix granulated sugar, 2 Tbl. of water, and lemon juice in a med. sized sauce pan. Let boil, cook 5 min, until it turns dark amber. Remove from heat, and slowly stir in remaining 1/4 c. of water. Beat eggs and milk together in a bowl. Stir into sugar mixture, cook over med.-low heat for about 10 to 12 minutes. (It should thicken enough to stick to spoon) Poor into a clean bowl (punch bowl or something), stir in vanilla, nutmeg and salt. Refigerate, covered, until cold. Before serving, beat together cream, liquer, adn 10x sugar, until soft peaks form. Pour chilled eggnog into a serving bowl, fold in whipped cream with a whisk.
Riprock: I'm in a band called Dash Rip Rock and when people are buying drinks at the end of the night I get everyone a round of these. Its a purty damn foul drink but you can get to like them after 4 or 5 of them.
B And B: Float brandy on top of Benedictine in a cordial glass without mixing and serve.
Golden Blizzard: A good christmas drink. -- Use Peppermint Super Schnapps, a 100 proof schnapps made by Arrow.
Scorpion: Fill a 12 oz wine glass with ice, add a lime wedge and transfer into shaker. Add ingredients, shake and pour back into glass. Garnish stirrer, straw, cherry-pineapple, parasol, and mint.
Little Brother: Pour all the ingredients in blender. If preferred add an ice cube. Mix thoroughly. Pour into glass.
Mistletoe: Just one of the creations invented at The RoadHouse NightClub in International Falls, Minnesota -- Bailey's Irish Cream can be substituted for the Swiss Mocha Cream Liqueur.
Fuzzy Logic: Beware. You can't taste the alcohol, so drink it and drop.
Toro: This drink was invented on a very good wendsday night at Middlebury College's summer French school.
Tequila Matador: Shake all ingredients with ice, strain into a champagne flute, and serve.
Shocking Chocolate: This is a great drink for cold, winter nights by the fire! It's also good if you add a smashed peppermint to the cup.
Incredible Hulk: pour ingredients over ice in normal glass
Farmer's Cocktail: Stir all ingredients with ice, strain into a cocktail glass, and serve.
Limonaide: This drink is really good you don't even really taste the rum so its just lemonade with a hidden kick.
Three Wise Men #2: Pour over ice in a shaker. Shake well. Strain. would be very smart to split this drink at least 2 ways...maybe three.
Alien Nipple: Tastes best when all ingredients are chilled prior to making drink. Tastes like one of those peanut butter kisses.
Apple Blossom: Pour ingredients into a mixing glass nearly filled with ice. Stir. Strain into an old fassion glass over ice. Garnish with fruit.
Rum Martini: In a mixing glass half-filled with ice cubes, combine the rum and vermouth. Stir well. Strain into a cocktial glass. Garnish with the lemon twist or an olive.
Montezuma: Blend all ingredients with 1/2 cup crushed ice in an electric blender at a low speed for a short length of time. Pour into a champagne flute and serve.
Clover Club Cocktail: Shake all ingredients with ice, strain into a cocktail glass, and serve.
Harvey Cowpuncher: Same as Harvey Wallbanger. (Yes, it is MILK!! Believe it or not, it doesn't taste that bad) Say hello to Jan Henning, will you?
French Pirate: Pour Orange curacao into champagne flute, add Dark rum, top off with Champagne, I recommend Brut
Peaches and Cream: Pour Kahlua and peach schnapps, fill rest with milk. Shake.
Apple Colada: Blend schnapps, cream of coconut, half-and-half, and 2 cups of crushed ice in an electric blender at a high speed. Pour contents into a collins glass. Decorate with an apple slice and a cherry. Serve with a straw.
Gingervitas: This drink was pulled out of my ass when I didn't have anything to do.
Sangrita: Fill one shooter with Tequila. Take a second shot glass and fill it with clamato. Then add a couple drops of tabasco and worchestershire sauce. Shoot the tequila and chase it with the second shot. Enjoy!
North Pole Cocktail: Shake all ingredients (except whipped cream) with ice and strain into a cocktail glass. Top with whipped cream and serve.
Sweet Sangria: I tend to take out the lemons and limes before serving because they get slimy and no one wants to munch on them anyway.
Dirty Banana: blend ice and ice-cream in the blender until smooth. add liquers and continue blending until smooth. if needed add more ice-cream to acheive milk shake type consistency.
Hollywood: Drink may be poured over ice or swigged like large shot. Good luck on the shot!
Pan Galactic Gargle Blaster #4: This is "the best drink in existence." Drinking one is like having your brains smashed out by a slice of lemon wrapped around a LARGE gold brick. Drink...but...very carefully....
Marvellaid: Chill martini glass. Mix equal parts stoli and Cointreau. Chill and strain. Garnish with orange slice.
Romulan Ale: Mix all ingredients together. Pour into a tall, narrow glass. Add a grain of salt.
Russian Tea #1: First make tea in the water. Then add all the other stuff. Simmer at least 1/2 hour. Makes a nice smell in the kitchen at Christmas parties.
Algonquin: Combine and shake all ingredients with ice, strain contents into a cocktail glass, and serve.
Chilton: Fill a salt rimmed cocktail glass with ice. Pour in vodka and add lemon juice. Fill with soda. Insert straw and stir slightly. Garnish with a lemon wedge.
Blow Job #3: Enjoy -- One catch, no hands allowed.
Palmetto Cocktail: Stir all ingredients with ice, strain into a cocktail glass, and serve.
Nevada Cocktail: In a shaker half-filled with ice cubes, combine all of the ingredients. Shake well. Strain into a cocktail glass.
Braindead: Originally invented in a disco called Van Gogh in Ølstykke in Denmark.
Slimer: Add liquer first. Use a glass beverage container to highlight the the green color.
Irish Cream Liqueur #2: Place all ingredients in a blender, blend well. Bottle and let mellow in refrigerator at least one week befor serving. this has been found to be best after 1-2 weeks. Store in refrigerator. Liqueur at room temperature by removing form refrigerator 1-2 hours before serving.
Carolina Iced Tea: You can add a splash of lemon and garnish with a twist for a classy drink or serve in a mason jar for real down home feel. My personal favorites are a chipped coffee mug and the plastic hotel bathroom cups.
Lifesaver: Shake well. Serve in rocks glass
Chocolate Paradise: Simply pour over ice into a tall glass.
Sima: Boil water, sugars, beer and the yellow part of the lemon's peel. Let the mixture cool down. Peel the white part of the lemon's peel carefully and cut the fruit part of the lemon in small pieces and add to sima. Disolve the yeast in a bit of sima and add to sima. Put 5-6 raisins and 1 tablespoon sugar in every bottle. Put sima in bottles and close the bottles carefully. Leave sima in a cold place for a couple of days. Sima is ready when the raisins float. Sima will keep in cold place for 1-2 weeks.
Cheat's Pimm's: Mix. Pour into tall glass. Add ice-cold 7-Up or ginger ale. Garnish with one slice each of orange, lemon and cucumber. Serve.
Coffee Crisp Shot: Pour first three in order, layer Bailey's on top.
Aztec Gold: Look for the star shaped film on the surface of the drink!
Siberian Dutchman: This is basically a glass of iced coffee with a White Russian and a shot of VanderMint
Gin Highball: Pour gin into a highball glass over ice cubes. Fill with carbonated water. Add the twist of lemon peel, stir, and serve.
Lusty Lisa: My friend Amanda and I invented this one! It should be done as a body shot. One person lays on the ground/bed/table/etc. with the shot glass held in his/her mouth. The drinker "mounts" the holder and must take the shot without using her/his hands! It's a lot of fun, and a great icebreaker!
Transmission Overhaul: Mix all the ingredients in a large container. Shake or Stir Well. Server Chilled or over Ice. This will sneak up on you :)
The Frad: This is a great party drink with excellent flavor. But you must make sure that it is sered up nice and cold.
Partymeister: Since it's a self-made drink, the proportions are not exact. Try for yourselves and you will soon find that, if properly mixed, the Partymeister is a good refreshening drink.
Spicy Buttery Nipple: Mix Hot Damn and Butterscotch Schnapps in shot glass first, then carefully add the irish cream without mixing.
Brave Bull Shooter: Pour Tabasco into bottom of shot glass and fill with tequila.
Scottalian: In a shaker half-filled with ice cubes, combine all of the ingredients except the Grenadine. Shake well. Strain into an old-fashioned glass. Add ice if you like. Drop the Grenadine into the center and serve.
Witch's Brew: Sure to cast a spell on you.
Kentucky B And B: Pour the bourbon and Benedictine into a brandy snifter.
Ski Shooter: This is a smooth shot and easy to drink, the ladies love it, but be careful, the vodka you forgot was in it will come back to bite.
Pineapple Gingerale Smoothie: Throw everything into a blender and liquify.
Gator Piss: Pour Midori and Rum over ice, and top off with sweet and sour mix.
Irish Coffee (Simple): This simpler version of Irish coffee is reputedly to the original, made famous in the Buena Vista Café at San Francisco's Fisherman's Wharf after World War II.
London Fog: Shake Gin and Pernod with cracked ice. Strain into a red wine glass packed with shaved ice.
Buzzard's Breath: Tasty for a shot, and the shaking with ice calms the overwhelming stun of room temperature peppermint schnapps with anything lol. Bottoms up, and enjoy!
Kori's Saturday Night Special: Bacardi may be substituted for the dark rum if desired.
Louie Louie: Created when a friend of mine poured some of his black russian into my glass of southern comfort. To our surprise, it was good.
Mongolian Motherfucker: Add ingriedients over ice. shake and enjoy
Black Monday: In a shaker half-filled with ice cubes, combine all of the ingredients. Shake well. Strain into a cocktail glass.
Green Label: Build in an ice filled glass. Serve. Great as a frozen drink.
Cafe de Paris: In a shaker half-filled with ice cubes, combine all of the ingredients. Shake well. Strain into a sour glass.
Slippery Box: Drink cold and fast and stay away from glass and lawn furniture
Flaming Moz: You can substitute just about anything for the blue curacao and white sambucca, as long as they flame. A mixture of blue and red Galliano Sambucca makes a particularly good looking drink. Try adjusting the colour to suit your customer. Ask customer "what's your favourite colour?", and make it that colour. Great for birthdays and similar celebrations. If you're soft, you could probably do it without the chatreuse.
Texas Prairie Fire: Pour 3/4 shot of Tequila in shot glass, top off with lime juice, splash in tabasco sauce, and shoot.
Siberian Sunrise: Mix all ingredients with cracked ice in a shaker or blender and pour into highball glass.
Pineapple Bomb: Very Sneaky drink if prepared properly. tastes great with a decent punch after a few...
Cranberry Zamboni: Add ingredients to shaker with ice, shake, strain, and serve.
C-MOB: Two ice cubes , 2oz of crown, 1 shot of vodka, and fill the rest with coca cola
Brendan's PUnch of happiness: POur ingredients into large pot, stir, serve as punch disappears continue to add more rum..
L'aird Of Summer Isle: In a shaker half-filled with ice cubes, combine all of the ingredients. Shake well. Strain into an old-fashioned glass almost filled with ice cubes.
Madeleine: This Cocktails is freely invented by me (Christoph Daugaard) This Cocktail is dedicated to a lovelely girl.
Tequila Sunrise: Pour tequila in a highball glass with ice, and top with orange juice. Stir. Add grenadine by tilting glass and pouring grenadine down side by flipping the bottle vertically very quickly. The grenadine should go straight to the bottom and then rise up slowly through the drink. Garnish stirrer, straw and cherry-orange.
Bankers Doom: It was reported as being the drink favoured by the man who crashed Berings bank. According to the story he went to a bar at Clifford Pier in Singapore and drink it.
Junior Mint: This drink tastes almost exactly like a junior mint. The Malibu rum can be left out. Be sure to use light creme de cacoa. This also works best with light creme de menthe. This was invented in 1998 at a neighborhood bar in Humble, Tx.
Mango Mint: Combine in a blender at low speed for 15 seconds. Strain, add ice.
Ershammar Dream: Mix all ingredientes in a shaker ( with ice) and shake it !! enjoy....
Monkey Spanker: Pour around 2-3 oz. of Whiskey into a glass, then fill the rest up with Vernors.
Wobbler: Pour the vodka in a glass 1/4-full off ice. Fill 2/3's of the glass with grape juice. Fill it up with the russian water. Ad just a little of grenadine.
Smurf fart: This shot taste like blueberry cream and is very smooth
Red Velvet: Build. Top with grenadine. Lime boat garnish.
Strawberry Kiss: This is a cool, refreshing strawberry flavoured drink. The Brandy serves to reduce the sweetness of the drink and it makes the overall taste less overwhelming.
The Green Wave: pour all ingredients into shaker with ice. Chill and strain into glass. Serve immediately.
Cokahlualicious: I made this by accident, and ended up liking it... a lot.
Red Wine Punch: You may use non alcoholic red wine to make the punch non alcoholic.
The Pink Drink: Amazing tastes like a strawberry milkshake.
Bootzilla: Fill glass with ice. Add liquors. Fill with Pineapple juice. Shake. Garnish with Orange slice. Serve.
Warm and Fuzzy: Pour southern comfort, triple sec, and then cherry brandy
Equity's Darling: This drink was invented by four law students at the University of New Brunswick. The name 'Equity's Darling' is a term used in Property Law. The drink is very, very smooth and goes down far too easily! You can hardly taste the Creme de Banane but it provides a nice subtle background.
Missle Pop: Fill glass with ice and add vodka, pineapple juice and fruit punch. Fill with orange juice.
Paralyzer #1: As a bartender in Kelowna B.C.Canada its one of the most popular drinks I make.I hope you enjoy!
Gimlet #2: Fill the glass to 2/3 with ice cubes. Shake the gin and lime and pour into the glass.
Death in the afternoon: Pour the Pernod into the champagne flute and top off with the champagne.
Nan's special: Originally invented by a friend, Prosenjit Mandal : perfected by my husband Nan during the course of innumerable parties we had in Bombay, that the name was changed from "Mandal's special" to "Nan's special".
Absinthe Cocktail: Shake well with cracked ice. Strain into cocktail glass.
Apple Cider Slider: Pour over ice. Shake and strain into shooter glass.
Pixie Stick: Pour gin, then midori, then 7-up (to fill) over ice in a Tom Collins glass. Shake in cocktail shaker, add straw, cherry. Tastes like candy.
Peppermint Crisp: Blend the creme de menthe and the kahlua together, then top up the rest of the glass with ice cold milk. Also nice with ice cubes.
Tropical Itching: Shake with ice and pour into a highball glass half-filled with ice cubes. Garnish with a slice of orange, a cherry and a sprig of mint.
Good Morning To You My Love: You may user other kinds of fruit if you don't have the above available. -- Created by Lars Jensen (bartender at "Hjørnet Bar og Brasseri" in Trondheim, Norway) for Pysch, a radio show on NRK PeTre.
Mount Red: Ice tall glass, follow ingredients. Top off with cranberry juice. Garnish with lime.
Rhubarb Syrup: Remove strings from rhubarb, wash, and cut into 1/2" pieces. Wrap rhubarb in cheesecloth and tie shut. Bring sugar and water to boil. Put cheesecloth in the syrup and simmer over medium heat for 30 minutes or until it thickens. Remove cheesecloth, squeeze it to get the juice out. Pour syrup into a clean, dry bottle and cork tightly. To mix add 1 part syrup to 3 parts water and add 2 ice cubes per person. Serve well chilled.
Royalty Fizz: In a shaker half-filled with ice cubes, combine the gin, lemon juice, Curacao, sugar, and egg. Shake well. Strain into a collins glass almost filled with ice cubes. Add the club soda. Stir well.
Caribbean: fill glass with ice add rum and triple sec add juice and stir
Penguin: Tastes like a tropical koolaide, the banana is the kicker! My girlfriends favourite!
Fruit Sensation: Fill glass with ice add all the ingredients- mix well add straw and garnish if required.
B-52 #4: This is the B-52 drunk in Portugal. Note that Absinthe is banned in a lot of countries. Anisette or Pernod can be used as substitutes.
Spikey Hedgehog: Add all ingredients to a highball glass with ice and stir.
Coon Dawg Punch: Put in punch first, then add everclear. For added flavor, soak the fruit wedges in everclear about an hour ahead of time. Fruit wedges make excellent snack. Best served in ice chest or jantorial trash can for mass comsumption.
Fong Juice: Good light drink that not only tastes fruity now, but also in the morning!
Just pour off the amount into a shot glass Shoot and Enjoy!
Vegan - Hot indian \"milk\" drink: In a large cooking pot (at least twice the size needed to contain your soy milk), mix everything together and heat on high while stirring constantly. Bring to a boil (remember to stir constantly!), and the concoction will froth up. Remove from heat, let the froth subside, and repeat this cycle three more times. This is why your pot has to be bigger: the frothing would cause a major spill if you used a smaller pot. Serve and drink while hot. You can also adjust sweetness in your cup. Some people may want to strain this, as the ground spices sometimes have some coarse particles. This is a very nice hot drink, with a definite indian-food flavour, spicy-sweet and rich. The original recipe using milk also called for a tablespoon of butter for each serving (yuk!), and that was intended to make the drink rich-tasting. The thicker soy milk already has that thick rich texture, and is much lower in fat content.
Fluffy Duck: This one's been around for ages, very popular with girls' nights out. -- VARIATIONS: add 1 shot of vodka (Leg opening fluffy duck) Some bars use icecream also (I've never tried it) (I've seen this drink served in a giant glass with a rubber duck floating on top!)
Fuzzy Pusser: It might look like hell, but it tastes pretty good. This drink is a variation on a theme of a "Pain Killer" which comes from the British Virgin Islands.
Fruit Hippy: Pour the liquor. Fill with juice to taste.
Ken and Kirsten's top shelf Margarita: Mix all ingredients and add ice. Shake well pouring ingredients into a second glass. At this point coat the rim of the first glass with salt. Repour your drink into the salted glass. Add fresh squeezed lime, kick back and enjoy!
Vodka Sling: Dissolve powdered sugar in mixture of water and juice of lemon. Add vodka. Pour into an old-fashioned glass over ice cubes and stir. Add the twist of orange peel and serve.
Chocolate Otis: This is the official shot of Alpha Tau Omega Fraternity.
Alexander's Big Brother: In a shaker half-filled with ice cubes, combine all of the ingredients. Shake well. Strain into a cocktail glass.
Twister: Pour vodka and juice of lime into a collins glass over several ice cubes. Fill with lemon-lime soda, stir, and serve.
Motor Oil: Pour Jager into triple shot glass. Add Perpermint schnaups then Goldshlager. Top with Malibu.
Joey F's Grape Ape: Shake two parts Vodka with one part of raspberry liqueur and one part Cranberry Juice. Chill and serve as shots.
Black Bird Cider: Add the Cider to the liqueur. Serve Cold
Romulan Ale #3: Makes one huge shot or several smaller ones.
Tropic Heat: If passion fruit syrup is a hard item for you to find, e-mail me.
Brandy Daisy: In a shaker half-filled with ice cubes, combine the brandy, lemon juice, sugar, and grenadine. Shake well. Pour into an old-fashioned glass and garnish with the cherry and the orange slice.
New Orleans Salty Dog: Coat the rim of a highball glass with salt. Mix Vodka and Grapefruit juice in another glass with ice and pour into glass with salted rim.
Rattlesnake Shot: Since this is basically a shot drink, mix to your own taste
Bourbon Milk Punch: In a shaker half-filled with ice cubes, combine the bourbon, half-and half, sugar, and vanilla extract. Shake well. Strain into a highball glass and garnish with the nutmeg.
Brandy Sangaree: Dissolve powdered sugar in 1 tsp. water. Add brandy and pour into a highball glass over ice cubes. Fill with carbonated water and stir. Float port on top, sprinkle lightly with nutmeg, and serve.
77 Sunset Strip: Mix vodka, gin, rum, triple sec, pineapple juice and grenadine together in a highball glass over ice. Top it with a splash of Sprite. Garnish with a strawberry and an orange slice.
Cement Mixer: Take shot of Bailey's. With Bailey's in your mouth take shot of lime juice. Mix rapidly in mouth by shaking head vigorously. Swallow before it congeals totally.
Jimtini: A tasty variation of the chocolate martini.
Whiskey Cocktail: Stir all ingredients (except cherry) with ice and strain into a cocktail glass. Top with the cherry and serve.
Farmer Giles: In a mixing glass half-filled with ice cubes, combine the gin, dry vermouth, sweet vermouth, and bitters. Stir well. Strain into a cocktail glass and garnish with the lemon twist.
Zoo Station: Shake ingredients over ice. Strain into shot glass.
Long vodka: Shake a tall glass with ice cubes and Angostura, coating the inside of the glass. Por the vodka onto this, add 1 slice of lime and squeeze juice out of remainder, mix with tonic, stir and voila you have a Long Vodka
Punch #2: Stir the 1 1/4 cups water and sugar over medium heat until sugar is dissolved.Bring to boil and boil for 5 mins. Cool pour into screw top jar and chill over night . Just before serving pour into a punch bowl all except ginger ale Now pour ginger ale now put in the fruit.
Neon Iguana: I had this great drink at a party in a hotel room at a comic book convention. The editor in chief of Slave Labor Comics was mixing them up in the coffee pot. He served this with ice.
Button Hook Cocktail: Shake all ingredients with ice, strain into a cocktail glass, and serve.
Purple Margarita: You can either drink this one the rocks or frozen. Salt to taste.
Hat Trick #2: In a mixing glass half-filled with ice cubes, combine the rum, vermouth, and bitters. Stir well. Strain into a cocktail glass and garnish with the lemon twist.
Jello shots: Be extremely careful if you use Everclear instead of vodka in this recipe. It will be very potent.
Black Watch: We're making our scottish fore-fathers turn in their graves with this one!
Rail Splitter: Mix sugar syrup with lemon juice in a tall glass. Fill up with ginger ale.
Blue Dragon: Very smooth, great color (attracts dates!), and delightful orange flavor.
Bellini Martini: Add ice cubes to shaker. Add vodka. Add peach schnapps. Add peach nectar. Shake. Strain into glass. Add lemon twist.(peel)
Ankle Breaker: Combine all ingredients with cracked ice in a cocktail shaker. Shake well. Strain into a chilled old-fashioned glass.
Grateful Dead #1: Order on the next time you go out.
Screwed Banana: It tastes similar to a Fuzzy Navel but with a banana flavor. I was experimenting one day with different drinks and just tried this and came up with it.
T N T Cocktail: Stir with ice and strain into a cocktail glass.
Mike Tyson: Mix it and serve with ice
Auburn Headbanger: Mix in spread glass over ice. Strain and pour in shot glass. Sit down before shotting. ENJOY!!
Four Fine Friends: This drink is also known as "Four Favorite J's" since it is made with Jose, Jim, Jack and Johnnie.
Country Club Cooler: Pour grenadine and 2 oz. carbonated water into a collins glass and stir. Add ice cubes and dry vermouth. Fill with carbonated water and stir again. Add the twist of lemon peel and the orange spiral so that the end dangles over rim of glass.
Horny Girlscout: Taste best when both ingredients are cold prior to being served.
Sunrise: If you like fresh long drinks with fruity but not too sweet taste, this is the right one for you! I didn't invent this drink but it's one of the best drinks I've ever tasted so I wanted to add it here.
Cherry Lover: This drink like its name is great for those who like cherry flavour. I combined several cherry-base alcohol to create this drink.
Prince: Created by Melitta Ciunis in the Meyer Lansky's Bar in Hamburg (Fischmarkt) in 1991. The name derives from the pop star then called 'Prince' whom Melitta was a great fan of.
Sonny Gets Kissed: In a shaker half-filled with ice cubes, combine all of the ingredients. Shake well. Strain into a cocktail glass.
Multi-coloured Smurf: I had this in a bar once in Sydney about 5 years ago. I probbably got the glass type wrong but the ingredients are pretty close to correct.
Little Beer: Pour 43 in shot glass. Layer cream slowly on top so that it resembles the 'head' on a beer.
Russian Cocktail: Shake all ingredients with ice, strain into a cocktail glass, and serve.
Bulldog Highball: Pour gin and juice of orange into a highball glass over ice cubes. Fill with ginger ale, stir, and serve.
Rum Eggnog: Shake all ingredients (except nutmeg) with ice and strain into a collins glass. Sprinkle nutmeg on top and serve.
Pink Pillow: Pour the Vodka in first and add Grenadine till it is nice and pink. Then add equal parts of Sour Mix and Ginger Ale until the glass is full.
French 76: This was created by the brilliant bartenders at Zig Zag restaurant in Seattle, Washington.
Vicious Sid: In a shaker half-filled with ice cubes, combine all of the ingredients. Shake well. Strain into an old-fashioned glass almost filled with ice cubes.
Montmartre Cocktail: Stir all ingredients (except cherry) with ice and strain into a cocktail glass. Top with the cherry and serve.
Russian Shamrock: This is the type of drinks you get when put a Comrade and an Irishman behind a bar!! Shoot it and then swap "Fish Stories"
Electric Jam: It's a light drink that is very popular in the summer. It's also very pretty, and good to give to a customer if you're a working bartender.
Red, White and Blue: Will create a red, white and blue layered drink.
Chowning's Tavern Wine Cooler: This makes a colorful as well as refreshing drink if the liquids are not mixed together. Pour the lemonade over crushed ice, then add the red wine. Garnish with a sprig of mint and a cherry. Good for hot days.
The Chocolate Martini: Combine ingredients in cocktail shaker with ice. Shake well and strain into chilled martini glass.
Sweetie: Pour cream soda last: this gives a foam similar to that on an ice cream float.
Champagne & Mango: Mix Champagne and Mango juice together, add cubed Mango and ice.
Southern Bride: Shake all ingredients with ice, strain into a cocktail glass, and serve.
Joel's Pet Monkey: Mix in shot glass in order of appearance in ingredients list.
Bourble: In a shaker half-filled with ice cubes, combine all of the ingredients. Shake well. Strain into a cocktail glass.
The Triple: Guarenteed to surge the alcohol into your blood. Cool combo of flavors. Use Citron, Kurrant, or Peppar for a different kind of kick.
Celebration #2: Shake vigorously over ice, pour into cocktail glass and garnish with either lemon or orange peel.
Kahlua Kiss: Fill the glass with crushed ice. Fill half the glass with Kahlua. Add a dash of Creme de Noyaux. Top with Cream.
Brainteaser: layered erin first, then sambuca and then avocart(should sit in middle of other two. To drink: use a straw to suck up avocart then shot the rest and then suck fumes up through straw.
Wooholly Fuck: Put ice in a glass, add the rest in order. Drink through a straw.
Ruby Fizz: Shake all ingredients (except carbonated water) with ice and strain into a highball glass over two ice cubes. Fill with carbonated water, stir, and serve.
Rum Runner #2: This is the original recipe that hails from the Holiday Isle Tiki Bar in Florida Keys
Giraffe: Pour Midori into a hurricane glass over ice, add Vodka, Pineapple juice, then float cranberry juice.
Irish Cup O' Joe: I love making this drink in the barn after a winter's horseback ride!
Green Bomber: This drink got it's name because of it's unique effect on the digestive system. You may find yourself dropping a green bomb early the next morning!
Cynar Cocktail: Pour over ice cubes in a cordial glass. Stir and squeeze in an orange wedge. Serve.
Pink Panther #2: Add all the ingredients into the glass, and stir for a moment.
Grapes of Wrath: It tastes like grape kool-aid but with barely any taste of alcohol in it. I work as a bartender at a brewery and I was just messing around one day with different alcohol.
European: In an old-fashioned glass almost filled with ice cubes, combine the gin, sherry, Dubonnet, vermouth, and Grand Marnier. Stir well. Garnish with the cherry.
Florida: Shake all ingredients with ice, strain into a cocktail glass, and serve.
Rocky Mountain Mother Fucker: Combine ingredients in shaker over ice and chill. Strain and pour in shot glass.
Liquid Valium: This drink really has quite a kick to it, but the alchol used doesn't really leave that alchol taste in your mouth. It is a good stout drink for people who don't care overly for the taste of alchol. I suggest it all the time to my coustomers, and while hesitant at first, they always want another.
Tuxedo Cocktail: Stir all ingredients (except cherry) with ice and strain into a cocktail glass. Top with the cherry and serve.
Banana Rum Cream: In a shaker half-filled with ice cubes, combine all of the ingredients. Shake well. Strain into a cocktail glass.
Hot Chocolate #2: Mix milk, cocoa, sugar and coffemate. For 1 serving place 1/3 cup dry mixture in coffee mug, add boiling water and stir.
Poison Milk: Don't drink too many! The Jägermeister is potent. I got horribly sick after shooting 9 of them one Fourth of July.
Hologram: place ingredients into shaker with ice. shake and strain into shot glass
Bat Bite: A drink I found in Spokane, WA. I have yet to find a bartender that has made one before, or a customer that didn't find them delicious.
Blind Russian: Fill glass with ice. Add all liquers. Add milk. shake.
Bullshot #4: Add all ingredients to a cocktail shaker or pitcher with several ice cubes and stir. Strain into glass straight up or on the rocks and garnish with a stick of celery.
Hawaiian Redneck: Be careful with this one... it's stronger than it tastes!
Coffee Dreamer: Shake all ingredients and strain over a large ice cube in a Red Wine glass.
Devil's Advocate: In a shaker mix all ingredients. Pour over ice.
Lava Lamp #2: The Advocaat drops pull the Baileys down into the other spirits, creating an effect similar to that of a Lava Lamp, hence the name!
Earthquake #2: Pour vodka, gin and creme-de-menthe over lots of ice.
Kahlua Fudge Shake: Just like making a milk shake, but add the Kahlua. This drink is very rich, but it tastes great. We invented it one summer day!!
Tequila Collins: Shake with ice and strain into collins glass. Add several ice cubes, fill with club soda and stir. Decorate with slices of lemon and orange, and a cherry. Serve with a straw.
Hot Summer Breeze: Soak several slices of Habanero pepper in the bottle of vodka for 3 months before using. It will give you that feeling of a summer hot breeze.
American Pie: This drink has the same ingredients as a Purple haze or Purple hooter. The key difference is in presentation. When properly made, it becomes a tall semi-layered drink that can be produced with minimal effort. I came up with this drink after a request the bar owner had to make a pretty drink that was simple and all our own.
Piper At Arms: In a mixing glass half-filled with ice cubes, combine the Scotch and vermouth. Stir well. Strain into a cocktail glass. Garnish with the lemon twist.
Fruit Lush: I was bartending at a party, and we ran low on liquor and mixers. It was right then that a gorgeous woman asked for something fruity, so on the spot this drink was invented.
Dutch Velvet: Shake all ingredients (except chocolate) with ice and strain into a chilled cocktail glass. Garnish with the shaved chocolate and serve.
Chameleon: May be odd to look at, but tastes delicious, (definitely for the sweet tooth) and goes down very well.
Pepito Lolito: Invented on Gran Canaria 1996. Suits that type of climate very well.
Blarney Stone Cocktail: Shake Irish whiskey, anis, triple sec, and maraschino with ice and strain into a cocktail glass. Add the twist of orange peel, top with the olive, and serve.
Jack-In-The-Box: Shake all ingredients with ice, strain into a cocktail glass, and serve.
Southern Doctor: Pour Southern Comfort in mason jar, fill with Dr. Pepper, chill with ice, and throw a party!
Dark and Stormy #2: The ginger beer makes the drink.
Killer Sniff: First, pour the Blue curacoa in the glass followed by the Sambucca. Then light this mixture. Let it burn for a few seconds and then put your hand on top of the glass (keep it on the glass) as soon as flames go out, bring the glass to your nose and sniff the alcohol. Then drink it. After this: relight the glass and sniff again. cheers!
Monkey Spam: A nasty disquesting drink. But it's a party hit
Spunky Monkey: Add above ingrediants in a blender. Blend on high until the ice is crushed. Enjoy!
Green Motherfucker: Hang on to something with one hand. Slam it with the other.
Malibu Screw: Add chilled orange juice to the vodka and Malibu. Ice is optional.
Cristianne: Feel the delicious flavor and see the beautiful color spectrum from red to blue.
Rebel Russian: Treat it like a white russian, but add some rebel attitude!
Creamy Snatch: This drink should be tasted and sipped slowly and luxoriously, as one would partake of its namesake.
Stop Light: Line up three shot glasses. Pour 1 shot of vodka into each glass. Add a splash of midori to one, a splash of orange juice to another and a splash of cranberry juice to the third. Drink them down Red, Yellow, Green. It's a stop light!
Jewel Of The Nile: In a mixing glass half-filled with ice cubes, combine all of the ingredients. Stir well. Strain into a cocktail glass.
Naked Twister: Build into a Pint Glass and cheery garnish. It's a real lady killer in San Diego.
Bacci Ball: This is a common drink and may be listed under different titles. This is the Northern U.S. name for it.
Asthma Attack: If asthma attack occurs, quickly follow with a Purple Motherfucker.
ACID: It taste pretty smooth for having 151 & 101 mixed.
Neon Nightmare: Drink should have almost glowing colour and the green should almost be lime. May be converted into a shot. It should definately be on the sweet side.
Electric Fuzzy: This is also good fixed in a punch bowl for large groups.
Backseat Boogie #1: Pour Gin and Vodka over ice, followed by the cranberry juice and then the ginger ale.
Hot Buttered Rum Batter #1: Blend all ingredients in a food processer or mixer and store in the fridge or freezer. To make a drink add a shot of good dark rum along with 1 or 2 tbl spoons of batter to a mug of very hot water. Serve in irish coffee cup.
Hiroshima Bomber: This drink was shown to me by a friend who created it with his fraternity brothers. They are the ones who deserve the credit. I placed it in here so all could try this tasty drink.
Patat\u00fas: I was trying to make a variant of the Mai Tai with orange juice, since no orgeat was at hand I decided to try with amaretto.
Tequillya: Pour ingredients together into glass, over ice. Mix well. Serve with lime and salted glass if desired.
Prairie Fire #1: Fill shot class with rum, Float Tabasco Sauce on top, Drink
H2O: Amounts may vary to taste. Best fuckin drink I ever had! This drink was invented by a swimmer, hence the name "H2O".
Jinx: Only do this if you have enough people that can handle their alcohol
Luftschlange: If you love coconut, try this!
Vodka Martini: This is the martini that James Bond drinks in the books and films. (Although he drinks it somewhat drier than this - more Vodka, less Vermouth).
Gold Baron: Float Goldschlager on top of Rumple and enjoy!
Bleeding Snatch: Add ingredients together in highball glass stir with cinnamon stick, and enjoy your very own beeding snatch
357 Magnum: Pour vodka and rum over ice. Add 7-up and stir. Add Amaretto (without stirring) and enjoy.
3 Wise Men: Tastes like chicken, only with hint of liquer!!
Antifreeze: chill with ice cubes in shaker. Pour into rocks glass or split into two shots
Robin's Nest: Shake all ingredients with ice, strain into a cocktail glass, and serve.
Wild Thing: Pour over ice into old-fashioned glass. Garnish with a lime wheel.
Cookie Monster #1: It has the bite of the blue monster
Black Swedish Virgin: Black Haus is a new Blackberry Schnapps that is made by the same company that makes Rumple Minz.
Russian Qualude #3: First ran into this in Reno Nevada after searching for the best B-52 in Reno. Bartender finished us off with a B-52 and adding the Frangelica and Vodka as two additional layers. Warning: This is a *very* potent potable.
Absolut Symphony: Shake. Pour into glass and add Sprite. Garnish with a strawberry.
Dickie Ward: Pour the Scotch, bitters, and ginger ale into a highball glass almost filled with ice cubes. Stir well and garnish with the lime wedge.
Swamp Frog: Wonderful drink to serve at party. Left overs can be saved in milk jugs. Add fruit and happy trails
Watercolour: The appearance of the drink resembles that of when a child mixes watercolor paints in a glass. A couple of us were bored one night and just started mixing things together and this came into being.
Quantum Theory: Pour Rum, Strega, and Grand Marnier into collins glass. Add Pineapple and Sweet and Sour until full. Garnish with a Lemon Cherry Flag.
Lassi Khara: Blend (frappe) in blender until frothy. Add torn curry leaves and serve cold.
Woody Woodpecker: Shake Cachaca and juice with ice. Fill it in the glas. Add Galiano.
Graveyard: WARNING: Very strong stuff. Do NOT attempt to drink it if you're not a good drinker. You'll be sending yourself to your own graveyard, thus the name of the drink.
Cinco de Rob-o: Tastes surprisingly sweet for a Tequila drink. Invented by Rob at my Cinco de Mayo party.
9 1/2 Weeks: Combine all ingredients in glass mixer. Chill and strain into Cocktail glass. Garnish with sliced strawberry.
Brain Eraser #2: Pour ingredients in shotglass. (Try it in a frozen shotglass.)
Caribbean Smoked Torch: Be careful when lightning up the rum, and wait until it extinguishes, before pouring the contents of the shaker. or else the optical effect will not be that noticeable.
Chocolate Black Russian: Combine all ingredients in an electric blender and blend at a low speed for a short length of time. Pour into a chilled champagne flute and serve.
Karla's Creation (KC): Taste like a sour apple Jolly Rancher with a kick. Karla Emerling created this drink when running out of liquor at a party. A favorite at the Point After Sports Bar & Grille, Tampa, Fl.
Sorrento Caf\u00e9: Pour Limoncello and Grand Marinier into coffee cup or glass. Fill with coffee and top with whipped cream.
Rum Coke Float: Place two scoops of rum flavored ice-cream in a hurricane glass, add rum and fill with Coke. Garnish with a cerry and serve with a straw.
Sex at my House: Everytime I ask "How was the sex!", I get "Great!"
St. Squiggle's Divorce: Just pour the glass 9/10's Coca-Cola, and add 1/10 Jolt Cola, and guzzle.
Drainpipe: If this excellent database had a category called disgusting drinks I guess that this drink would appear there, but it taste better than it looks.
Feliz Natal: Feliz Natal is Portuguese for Happy Christmas and the cocktail is inspired by the flavours of a rich liqueur chocolate cake eaten at this time of year. The heady flavours of Brandy and Port from the Douro region of Portugal, some dried cherries, wrapped in Marzipan and coated in chocolate. Let christmas last all year! Feliz Natal!
Blue Hawaiian: Blend light rum, blue curacao, pineapple juice, and cream of coconut with one cup ice in an electric blender at high speed. Pour contents into a highball glass. Decorate with the slice of pineapple and a cherry.
Gila Monster: Mix all ingredients in shaker, top with orange juice.
Power screwdriver: Make a plain old screwdriver, but add Coca-Cola.
Gailwarning: Pour vodka over ice in a collins glass. Add Sprite and top with lemon juice. Garnish with a lemon slice.
Skinhead Paramedic: This is a drink in the same category as a 'Singapore Sling'. It's meant to be consumed quickly, preferably at home. I concocted the original Skinhead Paramedic of leftover ingredients from a party. It has a strong, charismatic taste and a profound kick. I drink it at room temperature but you may choose to add a little ice if you want.
Irish Gold: Mix half an ounce of Goldshlager with half an ounce of Bailey's Irish Cream in a regular shot glass and stir.
Sensation Cocktail: Shake all ingredients (except mint sprigs) with ice and strain into a cocktail glass. Add the sprigs of mint and serve.
Walk Me Down: This was a favorite drink of mine in a local bar I went to. I recommend shaking it...but either way, it's good stuff after bout three or four it's considered a Lay Me Down! => Have fun and make sure you have a driver!
Canadian Manhattan: Shake well and pour over ice or "up" in a martini glass. Garnish with cherry.
Blood Clot #2: Pour Cointreau into glass. Using a spoon, drop the Cherry Advocaat in so it sits on the bottom of the glass. Making sure you have a straw handy, throw the shot back, place the glass on the nearest table and quickly cover the opening of the glass with your hand. Stick the straw between the fingers covering the glass and suck!
Betonimylly: Fírst you take Vodka but don't swallow it and then you take Cream in you mouth and mix then in your mouth and swallow.
Mother Pucker: Pour in appropriate amounts in mixing container to your liking. Enjoy!
Colorado Cider: Good for those cold nights in the Rockies!
Mexican Surfer: First, put Malibu rum into glass. Then add Tequila and pineapple juice. Last add ice and stir.
Gin-Cassis Fizz: In a shaker half-filled with ice cubes, combine the gin, lemon juice, and sugar. Shake well. Strain into a collins glass almost filled with ice cubes. Add the club soda. Stir well. Drop the cassis into the center of the drink.
Strawberry Lemonade: Throw everything into a blender and mix until fairly smooth. Serve over ice.
Geting: Start with the ice then you take the vodka then the liquor then the ginger ale
Syllabub: Combine wine, lemon rind, and juice. Stir in 1 cup of the sugar and let stand until sugar dissolves. Combine milk and cream, add wine mixture, and beat with a rotary beater until frothy. Beat egg whites until stiff, add remaining 1/2 cup sugar, a little at a time, beating constantly until whites stand in peaks. Pour wine mixture into punch bowl, top with puffs of egg white, and sprinkle whites with nutmeg.
Santorini Sundown: Shake and strain the drink into a well chilled margarita glass. Garnish with a red cherry.
Quikster's Delight: My signature drink while bartending. A nice smooth drink without a strong alcoholic taste to it.
Amaretto Liqueur: Combine sugar and 3/4 cup water in a small saucepan. Bring to a boil, stirring constantly. Reduce heat and simmer until all sugar is dissolved. Remove from heat and cool. In an aging container, combine apricot halves, almond extract, grain alcohol with 1/2 cup water, and brandy. Stir in cooled sugar syrup mixture. Cap and let age for 2 days. Remove apricot halves. (Save apricot halves, can be used for cooking). Add food coloring and glycerine. Stir, recap and continue aging for 1 to 2 months. Re-bottle as desired. Liqueur is ready to serve but will continue to improve with additional aging.
Gent Of The Jury: In a mixing glass half-filled with ice cubes, combine the gin and vermouth. Stir well. Strain into a cocktail glass. Garnish with the onions.
Cary Grant: Rumour has it this was what Cary Grant drank, hence the name.
Flaming Huscroft: Throw all in a glass, light it: When flame goes down, chug but make sure you have a chaser, or your in trouble.
Coconut Pie: Another U of Illinois original. Created by Kris and Nick. Should taste like a coconut-cream pie.
491: Pour the spirits over some ice cubes in a highball glass. Fill it up with Ginger Ale. Place a slice of lime in the drink and serve.
Electric Popsicle: Pour both the melon liqueur and blue curacao in the collins glass and fill with 7-up. Place the slice of lime on the top of the glass.
Malibu Mocha Milkshake: For a fun variation, skip the ice and top with whipped cream. Someday I want to try this one warm!
Chulitro: First goes Pisco, then the ice cubes, fill with coke, little bit of beer (any kind), and the lemon juice
Pineapple Bomber: Fill a glass with ice, then add amaretto and Southern Comfort. Fill rest of glass (at least 1/3 of volume) with pineapple juice.
Bob Dylan: Combine all ingredients in a blender, mix until smooth. Be careful surge is carbonated, it will foam up. Enjoy!!!!
Screwdriver Boricua: Extremely important if you are goin to the beach (Puerto Rico), And nesesary if going to Culebra, Puerto Rico.
Very popular amongst UN soldiers in FYROM area.
Afterlanche: Layer liquors in a shot glass.
Lady's Punsch: Pour red wine and blue curacao in a punsch glass and fill up with boiling water. Garnish with orange slice.
Cognac Highball: Pour cognac into a highball glass over ice cubes. Fill with carbonated water. Add the twist of lemon peel, stir, and serve. (Ginger ale may be substituted for carbonated water, if preferred.)
Absinthe Flip: Shake ingredients well with ice. Strain into a prechilled Delmonico glass. Sprinkle nutmeg on top.
Hot Scott: Taste: A great hot aftertaste. Origin:Universal Girls "Brisbane, Australia"
Scarlet Fever: mix together and shake, pour into a draft glass add 3 ice cubes and garnish with a lemon wheel on the side.
Ambijaxtrious: My friends and I love White Russians and tequila shots...so we figured why not combine both!!!! The word ambidextrious means "able to write with both hands" at once, so ambiJAXtrious means able to get "jacked up" with two drinks at once!!!! hee, hee!
Popper: Pour tequila into shot glass. Fill the rest of glass with 7-up. Cover top of glass with hand and slam hard onto counter or bar. This causes shot to fizz, so drink quickly!
California Root Beer: Put Kahlua and Galliano in highball glass fill with soda
Chocolate Beverage: Boil milk in the top of a deep double boiler five minutes. Remove from fire and add chocolate, mixed with the cinnamon, a little at a time, beating with molinillo or egg beater after each addition. When the chocolate is thoroughly blended, heat to the boiling point. Place over bottom of double boiler and add eggs, whipping constantly, until they are thoroughly blended and the mixture is frothing. Serve in coffee mug. Serves eight.
Barton Special: Shake all ingredients with ice, strain into an old-fashioned glass over ice cubes, and serve.
North Mymms Mirage: This stuff is real fire water! But it goes down a treat on a summer day. Sometimes you need to convice people it is alchoholic, it tastes like fruit juice, but enjoy enough of the stuff and beware!
Devastating Body Rocker: Created by Dave & Baldy at Papa Joe's.
Mikado: In an old-fashioned glass almost filled with ice cubes, combine all of the ingredients. Stir well.
Greenland: I made this cocktail for a bartender competition in Lisbon (ABP 1999). Enjoy it.
Christmas Tree Water: Gather two neon bulbs and fasten them to the rim of the cocktail glass. Connect two lengths of fabricated steel wire ... one end to each bulb ... the other to you nearest outlet. Flip the switch ... and enjoy! -- Not to be confused witht he very similar Zwikker's Wonderful Wound.
Sunny Holiday Punch: Combine all ingredients in a punch bowl.
Hot Jose: Tastes better when Hot Damn has been chilled.
Fruit Sangria: I prefer mixing 750ml of Chianti with 250ml of Boujeaulais for the wine.
Haywire: Haywire is the name of my boat. This drink was invented at a boat warming party for my crew.
Limeade: In a large glass, put the lime juice and sugar, and stir well. Add cold seltzer water to fill. Put the lime peels in the glass. Drink. Repeat until limes or soda run out.
Shriner Cocktail: Stir all ingredients (except lemon peel) with ice and strain into a cocktail glass. Add the twist of lemon peel and serve.
Apple Karate: Place all ingredients in the blender jar - cover and whiz on medium speed until well blended. Pour in one tall, 2 medium or 3 small glasses and drink up.
Alexander: Shake all ingredients (except nutmeg) with ice and strain into a cocktail glass. Sprinkle nutmeg on top and serve.
69 Special: Credit for this drink goes to Daniel Jay. Created, tested and approved at 69 Whisperwood Ave.
Magic Woman: Mix all ingridients and serve over ice.
V's With Sauce: Originated in a dorm room at a small Kentucky private college. Seems like you're getting relaxed and staying healthy at the same time!
Shark's Mai Tai: This drink is one of those that will sneak up on you. If mixed right you won't be able to taste the alcohol. Make sure you got room for you party guests to sleep. Enjoy
Frozen Vanilla Honey Bee: An extremely good shake on a hot summer day.
Safari Juice: Add Cointreau and Midori Melon Liqueur to stirring glass and top up with orange juice. Stir threee or four times rapidly and pour drink into cocktail glass. Add grenadine one drop at a time and garnish with tropical fruits.
Alabama Riot: Pour fruit punch and ice into a glass, add southern comfort, peppermint schnapps and vodka. Stir. Finish with lime juice.
Jock-In-A-Box: In a shaker half-filled with ice cubes, combine all of the ingredients. Shake well. Strain into an old-fashioned glass half-filled with ice cubes.
Dubonnet Fizz: Shake all ingredients (except carbonated water) with ice and strain into a highball glass over two ice cubes. Fill with carbonated water, stir, and serve.
Belles Of St. Mary's: In a shaker half-filled with ice cubes, combine all of the ingredients. Shake well. Strain into a cocktail glass.
Irish Coffee #3: This should be enough to serve two.
Liquid Courage: Pleases women. Makes men bold. Serves 2.
Banana Sunrise: Thanks to the inventor: Bas V. from the "Lindenboom" pub in Alkmaar.
Temptation Cocktail: Shake blended whiskey, Dubonnet, triple sec, and anis with ice and strain into a cocktail glass. Add the twists of orange and lemon peel and serve.
Key Largo OJ: Add ice and then equal parts of Key Largo and Orange juice. Mix and enjoy
Chocolate Honeybee: Pour Barenjaeger in a shot glass and top with Godiva.
Pyro: Mix as normal, pour in shot glass, and set on fire. Put it out any way you want.
Moosemilk: Usually made in a large batch using above ratios and served punch style at parties.
Neopolitan martini: In a mixing glass with ice, pour stoli vanil, stoli oranj, grand marnier, parfait d'amour and lime juice. Stir and strain into a chilled cocktail glass. Garnish with orange peel
Kiltlifter: Shake gently and pour over ice in old fashioned glass.
Canadian Rum Punch: An easy way to remember the recipe: 1 part sour (lemon juice) 2 parts sweet (sugar) 3 parts strong (rum) 4 parts weak (water)
Silent Broadsider: In a shaker half-filled with ice cubes, combine all of the ingredients. Shake well. Strain into a cocktail glass.
Passed Out Naked on the Bathroom Floor: Pour each ingredient into the shot glass, in this order: Rumple Minze, Jägermeister, Jose Cuervo Gold Tequila, then Bacardi 151 Rum. No need to mix, it mixes fine in this order.
Peppermint Aztec: Designed, tested and approved by the brave men and women of the West Virginia University Drink Research Center.
Geeba: Can be made into a shot by eliminating the Sprite. Best if Absolut Citron is used, but regular Absolut/vodka can be used.
Very Berry Tonic: Fill collins glass with ice. Add the vodka & the chambord. Fill with tonic water. Garnish with a couple of fresh raspberries.
Wisconsin Lunchbucket: In a beer mug large enough to hold a shot glass, mix beer and O.J. Drop in shot of Amaretto (depth charge) and slam.
Peach Bowl: Mix in highball glass. Stirr. Garnish with slice of orange.
Montreal Club Bouncer: Pour ingredients into an old-fashioned glass over ice cubes, stir, and serve.
Casa Noble Margarita: Pour all ingrediants over ice and stir.
Thug Heaven: Fill cocktail glass with ice and mix the two ingredients.
Godfather: Pour ingredients into an old-fashioned glass over ice and serve. (Bourbon may be substituted for scotch, if preferred.)
Maiden Head: All sodas and alcohol should be chilled an mixed with a stirring stick before topped with whipped cream and a cherry.
Apricot punch: If you wish for a little different taste substitute orange juice with apple juice and oranges with apples.
Coconut Cream Pie: Use a sweet cream if available.
Nuts & Berries: I was introduced to this drink on the island of Antigua while sailing around the West Indies with some frinds of mine, and it still reminds me of the best vacation anybody could ever imagine. Yah mon!
Black Rose Bacardi: Shake or stir, pour it into a cocktail glass, add some crushed ice and serve.
Fruit Punch: Make up the kool-aid ahead of time, by dissolving in a small amount on water (as little as possible). Don't add sugar! Cool this mixture. With everything cold, mix it all together, just before the party. You can add sherbert to keep it cold, or make ice cubes, or an ice cube ring, using the kool-aid mixture. You probably won't need to add any sure to this, as the soda, lemondade, and pineapple juice should contain plenty.
Fairy Belle Cocktail: Shake all ingredients with ice, strain into a cocktail glass, and serve.
Amor de Cosmos: Not too sweet, not too tart.
Unicorn: Created in honour of a bride-to-be
Oriental Cocktail: Shake all ingredients with ice, strain into a cocktail glass, and serve.
Hot Bitch: This should be drank in one go. Be warned it is not too pleasant.
Green Summer: A bunch of friends and I figured this drink out at a party in the fall of '97, and we pretty much all like it.
Fruit Loop: This may not sound very good, but it really does taste like fruit loops cereal!
Rum Aid: Skaking Serves with ice an a Lemon
Piscola: It's basiclly the same as the Cuba Libre but instead of Rum it has Pisco. You can use not only Coca-Cola, instead you can add almost any kind of other soda drinks (sprite, fanta, etc.)
Cherried Cream Rum: In a shaker half-filled with ice cubes, combine all of the ingredients. Shake well. Strain into a cocktail glass.
Orange Bomb: Created by Jack Willard. Second place in the 1998 United States Bartender's Guild Cocktail Competition.
Cherry Garden: Grenadine is optional. It may sound grim, but a nice alternative is to swap the cream for cola. If you do this, please leave out the grenadine! (cola variant name - Cherry Forest)
Camen Miranda: Squeeze lime wedge over ice Pour rum, juice, & cola Stir lightly Add club soda or tonic to taste
Krazee Keith: In a shaker half-filled with ice cubes, combine the rum, anisette, cherry brandy and lemon juice. Shake well. Strain into a highball glass almost filled with ice cubes. Add the cola and stir well. Garnish with the lemon wedge.
Rum Sazerac: Soak sugar cube in Angostura bitters. Crush it with a pestle in an old-fashioned glass. Add ice cubes, pour in rum, add a few dashed of Pernod and fill with water.
EDO Cocktail: House cocktail of the Golden Palm Bar, Grand Hotel Krasnapolsky, Amsterdam.
Sloe Gin Cocktail: Stir all ingredients with ice, strain into a cocktail glass, and serve.
Billy Taylor: Pour gin and juice of lime into a collins glass over ice cubes. Fill with carbonated water, stir, and serve.
Nummer 10: Nummer 10© was created on a beautiful summers day the 4:th of July 1997 under a blurry sunroof on Raspberry Alley number 10 in the southern of Sweden. The inventors are Janne and Johan.
Dominican Goddess: Add a pinch of salt for extra tingle. Garnish with a slice of grapefruit and/or lemon.
Bronx Golden Cocktail: Shake all ingredients (except orange slice) with ice and strain into a whiskey sour glass. Add the orange slice and serve.
Kurant Tea: Pour Absolut Kurant into a comfortably big tea-cup. Add the not too hot(!) apple tea and, if you like, some sugar. Enjoy!
Leap Year: Created by Harry Craddock at the Savoy Hotel in London, in the late 1920s. Is said to be so smooth that you are easily lured into having one too many :)
Long Island Iced Tea #1: Mix all contents in a highball glass and sitr gently. Add dash of Coca-Cola for the coloring and garnish with lemon or lime twist.
Ramos Fizz: Can also be made using a blender with about 1/4 goblet of fine ice. Then add soda and stir.
Fancy Scotch: In a shaker half-filled with ice cubes combine the scotch, triple sec, sugar, and bitters. Shake well. Strain into a cocktail glass and garnish with the lemon twist.
Brain Hemmorage: This is a great drink to serve on Halloween. First, pour the peach schnapps. Then, slowly pour the Irish Cream. Do not mix! The Creme will clump together and settle at the bottom of the schnapps. It will have the appearance of an internal organ!! Pour the grenadine over the Creme for a completely disgusting looking, yet thoroughly tasty party drink!
Yellow Parakeet: fill glass with ice and build drink top with splash of sour
Puckerita: Combine ingedients and shake in a tall glass with ice.
Army special: It is said that it comes from the ranks of the Indian Army. It tastes slghtly sour and makes a very nice afternoon cocktail
The Swamp Water: Concocted in beautiful downtown San Ramon, CA. *T.G.I.F.*
Mississippi Planters Punch: Shake all ingredients (except carbonated water) with ice and strain into a collins glass over ice cubes. Fill with carbonated water, stir, and serve.
Volvo: Mix in the order mentioned. You can use what ever kind of cognac, and vodka you prefer.
Shaft: Pour Apoerol and gin over ice in a highball glass. Stir. Fill with sparkling white wine.
Crackhouse: I discovered this drink (and Blackhaus) on a recent trip to the east coast. Thank you, New York.
Pink Passion: Nice pale pink color. A "summertime" drink
Hot Shot #2: Mix vodka and peppermint schnapps and add a dash of Tobasco.
Jufu Cocktail: Made by Joe Wright and Gary Croll.
White Splash: This drink comes from The Netherlands and has a surprisingly taste.
Frozen Matador: Blend all ingredients (except pineapple stick) with 1 cup crushed ice in an electric blender at a low speed for a short length of time. Pour into an old-fashioned glass, add the pineapple stick, and serve.
PMS Special: Shake with ice and strain over ice in a martini glass.
Brandied Madeira: Stir all ingredients (except lemon peel) with cracked ice and strain into an old-fashioned glass over ice cubes. Add the twist of lemon peel and serve.
Pierced Nipple: Shake with ice, strain into shot glass.
Snowshoe: Pour peppermint schnapps in shot glass, top with Wild Turkey, drink it up!
Chocolate Cake #2: Pour 3/4 oz of vodka and 1/4 oz frangelico into a shot glass. Cover the slice of lime with powdered sugar. Bite on the lime with powdered sugar on it and hold the juice in your mouth. Then take the shot while the lime juice is still in your mouth. You now have a chocolate cake shot.
Absolutely Cranberry Smash: Stir ingredients together. Serve over ice.
Mind Eraser #2: Do not stir or shake, drink with straw all at once. Drink should be layered. Substitute tonic water for sprite for different taste. Large diameter straws work best, never use very thin ones.
Leche de Monja: Delicious drink typical of southern Peru. Reputed to increase fertility.
Snitchee's Cider: Used crushed ice. Can be made in anysizefrom punchbowl to personal serving.
Stock Market Crash: Ice first, next is the liquor and then the pop.
Diplomat: Stir all ingredients (except lemon and cherry) with ice and strain into a cocktail glass. Add the lemon slice, top with the cherry, and serve.
Blue iguana: Bend smooth. Serve in a frozen mug.
Coco Rush: Add OJ, Cranberry juice, and Malibu into a mixing glass and pour into the highball glass.
Spider's Web: put alchohol in shot glass, drop strawberry into glass, then try and make cream float on top.
Warm Witch's Blood: Make sure it is not tooooo hot when you serve it to the kiddies.
Joe Cocker: A strong but tasty shot. Warning: Too many of these will put you in the Hospital or someone else's place (most likely in the bedroom)!!!
Warsaw Cocktail: Shake all ingredients with ice, strain into a cocktail glass, and serve.
Green Iguana: Mix Tequila, Melon Liquor and Sweet and Sour Mix in Blender. Add ice. Serve in glass.
Opera Cocktail: Stir all ingredients with ice, strain into a cocktail glass, and serve.
JTDelight: Put in the Vokda first then the Tropical Schnapps then add the OJ and the Cranberry Juice.
Bluebird: In a mixing glass half-filled with crushed ice, combine the gin, triple sec, Curacao, and bitters. Stir well. Strain into a cocktail glass and garnish with the lemon twist and the cherry.
Watermelon Shooter #4: Mix ingredients in a cocktail shaker full of ice. Strain into glass.
Italian Nut: Drink has a sweet fruity taste.
Captain's Treasure: Knock it back and give a pirate's "Arrr!"
Artillery: Stir all ingredients with ice, strain into a cocktail glass, and serve.
Purple Mexican: I invented this drink at a bar called ETC. in Memphis, TN in the mid 80's. All you taste is the Grand Marnier. Doesn't take many. Have a nice trip.
Lysekil's groggen: First you take vodka then you take O j then ster then you fill it up with russian and ice cubes
Limelon: Mix all liquids then fill with ice. Finally cap with powdered sugar.
Strawberry Fields Forever: Pour brandy and schnapps over ice in a highball glass. Fill with carbonated water and stir. Garnish with a strawberry and serve.
Hawaiian Sunset: Excellent drink and doesn't taste like vodka at all.
Orgasm: Shake all ingredients with ice, strain into a chilled cocktail glass, and serve.
Highball: fill a medium glass most of the way with ice, pour in 1 shot, about 1.5 ounces of whiskey, fill the rest of the way with ginger ale.
Elephant Shake: Blend on high until smooth. Pour into a tall glass.
Ragnar #1: Put the liquor in a tall glass, add a few drops of lime. Fill up the glass with 7-up so it suits you.
Lazy Haze: It may sound nasty but is very good. Came about by accident on a very busy night. Glad I had to drink my mistakes! :o)
Captain's Cream Soda: Pour the Captain Morgan over plenty of ice in a highball glass. Top with the seven-up, stir and enjoy!
Pour the rum, vodka, triple sec, and orange juice into a highball glass almost filled with ice cubes. Stir well and garnish with the orange slice.
Quick F**K: In a shot glass add 1/3 Kahlua first. Then 1/3 Miduri, topping it off with a 1/3 bailey's irish cream
Irish Coffee #2: Mix cofee and chilled Irish Cream and half & half. Add sugar and stir. Serve hot in an Irish coffee cup.
Peach Tea Cooler: Guarranteed to quench your summertime thirst for intoxication.
Hop Skip and Go Naked Punch: Take a Cooler and throw a bag of ice in it. Add beer, white liquor and frozen Lemon-Lime Daqueri mix. Stir until Daqueri mix has liquified. Enjoy.
Surrey Slider: Pour the rum, peach schnapps, and orange juice into a highball glass almost filled with ice cubes. Stir well and garnish with the orange slice.
Red Rattlesnake: Pour all ingredients over ice. Shake.
Malibu Massage: You may also build this cocktail if required. This drink is a great alternative to a Pina Colada or a Chi-Chi.
PB&J; #2: Drink your Peanut Butter and Jelly Sandwich and get your date drunk at the same time.
Slow Screw up against a Red Wall: Will taste much like a Slow Comfortable Screw up against a Wall, except less cherry and more fruit flavor. Hard to taste the alcohol in this if mixed well. Also try with 50/50 orange juice/pineapple juice.
A Day at the Beach: Shake Rum, Amaretto, and Orange Juice in a shaker filled with ice. Strain over ice into a highball glass. Add Grenadine and garnish with a Pineapple Wedge and a Strawberry.
Fire And Ice: Layer the Rumple Minze on top of the Firewater (as best as possible)
Lassi - Sweet: Put all ingredients into a blender and blend until nice and frothy. Serve chilled.
Puerto Rican Monkey Fuck: Mix Kahlua and Creme de Banana in a shaker with ice. Strain into a shot glass. Float the 151 on top.
Queen Soda: Fell upon it late one night when we had nothing else to drink. Can also be mixed with OJ if desired
Oreo Mudslide: I got this recipe from Kathy Hamlin, the Cocktail host at About.com, when I visited her in 2002.
Bad Habit: Combine in a shot glass, vodka first.
Sol Y Sombra: Shake ingredients with ice, strain into a brandy snifter, and serve. (The English translation of the name of this drink is "Sun and Shade", and after sampling this drink, you'll understand why. Thanks, Kirby.)
Jamaican Screw: Good for hot days and evenings.
Little Princess Cocktail: In a mixing glass half-filled with ice cubes, combine both of the ingredients. Stir well. Strain into a cocktail glass.
Hawaiian Sunrise: Came up with this on the spot at the last party. Best if the juice is chilled.
Presbyterian: Pour blended whiskey into a highball glass filled with ice cubes. Fill with equal parts of cola and ginger ale and stir well. Add the slice of lemon and serve.
Green Russian: May add cream for taste or for the hard drinkers, try without it.
Jimmy's special: -A good drink that reminds you about sleeping beuty.
Spear Chugger: Simply add in order vodka, ice, orange juice, lemon, and vinegar. Ice can be crushed.
Lemonade Lush: This is good mixed in a punch bowl for parties too. Just remember, half of the drink is alcohol.
Scotch Bishop Cocktail: Shake all ingredients (except lemon peel) with ice and strain into a cocktail glass. Add the twist of lemon peel and serve.
Fuzzyberry: Mix ingredients together and top with ice
Metropolis: In a shaker, combine Vodka and blue curacao. Chill until cloudy. Pour into martini glass. Tilt glass and pour in raspberry schnapps (will sink to the bottom). Float cranberry vodka on top. This will give you levels of color: red - blue - purple.
Italian Soda #2: Pour chambord into bottom of glass. Top with soda water. Do not stir. Serve with straw.
5 Pm: Pour rum and Cointreau into tea cup, fill with English hot tea and top with milk.
Pineberry: Mix vodkas in a cocktail shaker over ice. Strain into shot glasses. Squeeze juice from the lemon wedge into each glass.
Ball Hooter: TO DRINK: Throw back the shot. Suck down the chaser then holler at the top of your lungs "BALL HOOTER!" (which means absolutely nothing)
Nord-Norsk Depresjon: Made by a former bartender at a place called Landstrykeren in Bodø. -- ("Nord-Norsk Depresjon" = "North-Norwegian Depression")
Gin Sling: Dissolve powdered sugar in mixture of water and juice of lemon. Add gin. Pour into an old-fashioned glass over ice cubes and stir. Add the twist of orange peel and serve.
Southern Belle: Pour the brandy into a pousse cafe glass. Tilt the glass to a 45-degree angle and slowly pour the creme de cacao down the side of the glass so that it floats on the brandy. Repeat this precedure with the Benedictine.
Tipperary Cocktail: Stir all ingredients with ice, strain into a cocktail glass, and serve.
Monster Slime Juice: Mix juice and Kool-Aid, add 1 gallon water, stir and watch it turn green!
The Jack Hammer: Excellent birthday shot with a cool name!
Hurricane flint: Shake all ingredients with ice, strain into a cocktail glass and serve.
Lemon Drop #5: Shake vodka, Cointreau and juice of a lemon wedge well with plenty of ice. Strain into a sugar rimmed cocktail glass. Garnish with lemon zest.
Smooth Black Russian: Maybe also be enjoyed with ice cubes or Kahlua can be substituted with any other coffee liqueur.
LimLer: Squeeze the 8 parts of the lime and the brown sugarwith a wooden muddler, fill up with Apple Juiceand crushed Ice.
Malibu Sunrise: Pour malibu rum in a highball glass, and top with orange juice. Stir. Add grenadine by tilting glass and pouring grenadine down side by flipping the bottle vertically very quickly. The grenadine should go straight to the bottom and then rise up slowly through the drink.
Tropical Tease: It has a suprising taste. Not what you would expect
Under Kurant: Tastes good and is highly effective!
Malibu and Soda: Mix above ingredients in cup with ice.
