Rumka: Mix it half and half and serve chilled. Enjoy!
Jillionaire: In a shaker half-filled with ice cubes, combine all of the ingredients. Shake well and strain into a cocktail glass.
Elephant Lips: In a shaker half-filled with ice cubes, combine all of the ingredients. Shake well. Strain into a cocktail glass.
Jim's Nuts: Equal parts Jim Beam and Amaretto over rocks. Stir.
Slippery Nipple #2: pour sambuca into shot glass float Bailies on top enjoy
Snow Blinder: Best made in a big quantity! Watch for overflow, as the lemonade tends to make the vodka/ice cream increase in volume.
Party Death: Just mix them together, softs first, then the vodka. Serve ice cold.
Italian Heather: Pour the scotch and Galliano into an old-fashioned glass almost filled with crushed ice. Stir well. Garnish with the lime wedge.
Absolute Heaven: The taste is very tropical tasting and be careful you do not taste the alcohol but it's deffinatly there! A top shelf vodka is used so its a good drink to have without a bad hangover. (with a certain amount of moderation that is) A friend and myself accidentally made the drink and loved it. We are both from Maryland(I am a bartender)and we are bringing this to you where ever you may be! Enjoy!
Banana Strawberry Shake Daiquiri-type: Blend all together in a blender until smooth.
Flaming Goat: This drink is named after a very good Laser Quest player. His player name is Goat.
Beal's Cocktail: Stir all ingredients with ice, strain into a cocktail glass, and serve.
New York Lemonade: Serve in a chilled cocktail glass. Lemon and sugar the rim. Stir and Strain.
Bittersweet with a twist: The taste is difficult to explain. It is initially tart and dry, then developes a sweetness at the finish. I had never heard of Tequila being used with grapefruit juice, so I thought that I would try it. I think that it tastes very different and very good.
Gator Wizz: Put ice in glass, add ingredients and stir.
Midori Sour Ultra: Mix ingredients in boston shaker with cracked ice. In a highball glass or champagne flute (optional), fill glass three quarters full with ice. Pour one tablespoon of cherry juice in glass before pouring in mixed ingredients. Garnish with two maraschino cherries and lemon wedge. Drink through a straw.
Harvey Wallbanger: Pour vodka and orange juice into a collins glass over ice cubes and stir. Float Galliano on top and serve.
Grand-Ma in a Wheelchair: Add ice. Shake it. Strain it. Shoot it.
Bloody Chicken: Make sure you have a chaser for this one!
Light Sangria with Pineapple: In a pitcher, dissolve the sugar in the apple juice. Add lemon juice, wine, pineapple and apple in chunks. Mix. Add ginger ale and ice right before serving.
Italian Ice: Shake Well - Do not stir. Best if served with crushed ice.
Midori Chan: Just pour it all into the blender and mix until desired consistency is achieved.
Good 'n Plenty: A cocktail version of the Good 'n Plenty candy!
Monkey Gland Cocktail: In a shaker half-filled with ice cubes, combine all of the ingredients. Shake well. Strain into a cocktail glass.
Liquid Snickers: E-mail and let me know what you think.
Chapman: Take the pisang ambon in the glas, and then the milk. Then shake it... Enjoy...!
ATP: Pour Southern Comfort into a shot glass, then add the amaretto. Stir.
June Bug: Tastes like a tropical delight...try it!
Slacker's Slammer: Add 1 oz. vodka in a glass, then add 1 oz. of Root-beer snapes mix with Root-beer add one scoop of ice-cream at top of the glass.Enjoy.
Bruja Mexicana: Must be tequila "Agavero" 'cause it's mixed with Damiana liquor (suposed to be aphrodisiac). Strega means witch in italian. Bruja is witch in Spanish.
Screaming Multiple Orgasm On The Beach: This drink was conceived at a party in Falmouth on Cape Cod during the summer of '97.
Dirty Irish Whiskey: Mix in a mixing cup with ice and shake. Pour through a strainer, and drink
Midnight Mint: Midnight Mint as created by Jamie Terrell of London's Atlantic Bar & Grill.
Coffee Grinder: Use rocks glass, this isn't a small shot.
The Icelandic way: Mix a normal glass of vodka and fanta lemon, drink down to half and fill up with beer and coke.
Amarita: Pour Amaretto and margarita mix over ice. Stir well and serve.
Southern Brain Damage: Somehow an alternate version of the Bloody Brain, really hits the spot. Sweet and corrosive.
Whiskey Collins: Shake blended whiskey, juice of lemon, and powdered sugar with ice and strain into a collins glass. Add several ice cubes, fill with carbonated water, and stir. Decorate with slices of orange, lemon, and top with the cherry. Serve with a straw.
St. Patrick's Day: Stir all ingredients with ice, strain into a cocktail glass, and serve.
Lil' Johnson: Just mix them up however you want.
Stiletto Manhattan: Add 1/2 oz dry vermouth in a chilled cocktail glass, and roll the vermouth around the glass and throw away the excess. In a mixing glass with ice, pour crown royal, amaretto, and orange bitters and stir. Strain into cocktail glass, and garnish with orange peel and maraschino cherry.
Tequila Fizz: Shake all ingredients (except ginger ale) with ice and strain into a collins glass over ice cubes. Fill with ginger ale, stir, and serve.
Butter Cream: Let it sit for just a minute to mix well.
Brioni: My variation on the "Negroni". It's less alcoholic switching dry vermouth for gin, and with club soda it makes for a very refreshing summer drink!
8th Birthday: A special day in your second grade class. Your special day. The raspberry tootsie pops your mother gave you to share with the rest of the class. You're older now, and your tastes have changed, but there's nothing like a soothing drink to take you back to your 8th Birthday.
Macbeth's Dream: In a shaker half-filled with ice cubes, combine all of the ingredients. Shake well. Strain into a cocktail glass.
Mint Gin Cocktail: Stir all ingredients with ice, strain into a cocktail glass, and serve.
Toblerone #2: A very popular cocktail in the CROWN CASINO, Melbounre Australia. Definatly a winner :)
Purple Cow #2: Shake and serve in highball glass filled with ice.
Snakebite Jack: This is a very potent drink if downed, so take it easy! I have seen a lot of people in very bad states who have dared to down this. Snakebite Black is the same drink as Diesel, and snakebite Jack was dreamed up by me, some friends and a lot of alcohol!
Colorado Coolaid: Mix ingredients in a shaker with 1 skoop of ice then pour into highball glass
Gauguin: Combine all ingredients (except cherry) with 1 cup of crushed ice in an electric blender. Blend at a low speed for a short length of time. Pour into an old-fashioned glass, add the cherry on top, and serve.
Tequila Bom-Bom: Place a coaster on top, pound on table twice, guzzle it!
Bourbon Milk Punch #3: In a shaker half-filled with ice cubes, combine the bourbon, creme de cacao, and milk. Shake well. Pour into a highball glass and garnish with the nutmeg.
Kamakazie Razzberry: Pour Welch's concentrate into a pitcher, then add vodka and finally Raspberry Schnapps. Add crushed ice and stir.
Red Dwarf: Mix rum, lemon juice, orange juice and peach schnapps together with plenty of ice in a shaker. Pour in to a chilled glass. Then pour the Creme de Cassis in to the glass allowing the red liquor to form a layer at the bottom of the glass. Garnish with cherries, orange or lemon to taste
Strawberry Quick: Mix the contents so that the color of the drink is a pink color. Serve and enjoy
Velvet Crush: This drink comes from a song by a band called Soul Coughing, off their Ruby Vroom album.
Green Meanie: A great hit. Taste like apple Jolly Ranchers
Carrot Cake #2: Fill mixing cup up with ice Add ingredients Shake and strain
Irish Spring: Pour all ingredients (except orange slice and cherry) into a collins glass over ice cubes. Garnish with the slice of orange, add the cherry on top, and serve.
Gin Fizz: Shake gin, juice of lemon, and powdered sugar with ice and strain into a highball glass over two ice cubes. Fill with carbonated water, stir, and serve.
Coffee-Vodka: Boil water and sugar until dissolved. Turn off heat. Slowly add dry instant coffee and continue stirring. Add a chopped vanilla bean to the vodka, then combine the cooled sugar syrup and coffee solution with the vodka. Cover tightly and shake vigorously each day for 3 weeks. Strain and filter. Its also best to let the sugar mixture cool completely so the vodka won't evaporate when its added. If you like a smoother feel to the liqueur you can add about 1 teaspoon of glycerine to the finished product.
Blue Bahama: This drink was made up while experimenting on my time off
Heavy \"G\": Pour all ingredientsa in a mug or glass with a salted rim like a Margarita, fill with ice and 7-up or Sprite.
Blow Job #1: Pour Amaretto into shot glass, top with whip cream. Drink with hands behind back in one smooth motion
Porky Bone: When you're done, try some of the syrup at the bottom for a strong surprise.
Nolan: Created at the Westin Hotel, Providence RI, on Dec. 17, 1999
Cactus Bowl: I use Jose Cuervo Margarita mix in place of lime juice
Golden shower: Stire Rum and Banana liqueur with ice. Add Sprite
Scooby Snack #3: Pour all into shaker with ice. Shake until cold. Strain into highball glass.
Rick: First, you must pour the Sambuca in your shot glass and then slowly pour the orange juice. You may now enjoy Rick's fruity taste!
Born to be Wild: I created this drink one evening, 2 minutes before a radio show, since I had to come up with "The Drink of the week". Pretty cool. It turned out to be a really good drink. Hope noone ever tasted any of my other last-minute-drinks :)
Violetta: Created by Matti Harju, Finland. Winner of the 1987 I.B.A. international cocktail competition.
Caipirissima: Same as Caipirinha but instead of cachaca you add WHITE RUM. It's great!!!!!!!!
Astropop: Layer all three liqours into shot glass.
Liquid After-Eight: Pour the Creme de menthe in a Highball glass Fill the glass with the cold chocolate-milk.
L.A. Riot: Invented by Jamie Blake in Wellington, New Zealand over summer 1999/2000.
Canadian Funky Electric Cider: Place 3/4 oz. of whiskey in an old-fashioned glass. Add 2.5 oz. of optinally warmed Canadian Apple Cider. If served cold, crushed ice is optional.
Dublin Driver: A version of the classic Screwdriver taken from the label of an Irish Mist bottle. Can substitute Cranberry Juice for Orange Juice.
Cherry Blow Pop: Should taste excatly like a cherry blow pop or cherry kool aid!
360 degress: Pour two of each ingredients in a shot glass then use a coaster to put one shot glass over the top of one another.
Beam Me Up Scottie Mac: Chill rum. Then layer. Creme de Banana first, then Bailey's and float rum on top.
Lemon Twister: Very sweet. Good in the summer.
Snyder: Shake all ingredients (except lemon peel) with ice and strain into a cocktail glass. Add the twist of lemon peel and serve.
Esirnus: If you follow these directions, you get a drink that looks brown, but slowly changes color so you have a green layer above a yellow layer. The cherry at the bottom of the glass adds to the reverse sunrise effect. -- The name: Esirnus = Sunrise backwards.
Crystal Virgin: I made this up for a few guys at T & C or Town & Country Inn in Orwell, Ohio. Now everyone drinks it.
Almond Chocolate Coffee: Pour in order into coffee cup. Top with whipped creme and chocolate shcvings.
Barcardi Volcano: Put the juice of 1/2 Lime in glass, then pour in cola and barcardi dark. Top up with Everclear. Light. Figure out how to drink it!
Brandy Vermouth Cocktail: Stir all ingredients with ice, strain into a cocktail glass, and serve.
Midori Jello Shots: Very easy recipe that is a hit at parties. I usually pour the mixture into a cake pan and slice it into cubes like finger jello.
Atomic Lokade: In a shaker, place lemonade, vodka, blue Curacao, and triple sec together. Shake with ice and strain into glass. Add sugar to taste
Iron Butterfly: Pour vodka over ice, add kahlua and irish cream. Stir add 1 to 3 filbert nut(s).
Bonsai Pipeline: As with all flaming drinks, please make sure drink is out before drinking!
Columbia Gold: Taste's like a orange/strawberry slush with a hidden kick.
Grape Nehi: Local recipes vary. Lemon is more commonly used than orange.
The Liver Transplant: One of the house drinks at Sports Fans, A bar and nightclub where I work in Washington, D.C.
Vanilla-Coffee Liqueur: Combine sugars and water. Boil for 5 minutes. Gradually stir in coffee. Cool. Add vodka and vanilla and mix thoroughly. Cover and let ripen for 1 month. Remove vanilla bean.
Barbie Shot: A girlie shot for the ladies, and pink makes it perfect.
Apple Slut: Pour shots in glass and add Sprite to your taste.
Summertime: Just mix the ingredients. It can also be served without alchohol. Just mix equal amounts of sprite light and orange juice.
Brass Funky: This is a permutation of the classic 'Brass Monkey', adapted to a more ghetto lifestyle.
Limoncello: If the lemons are yellow the drink will be yellow, if they are green it will be green. Also try it with peaches
Bruce's Puce: In a regular-sized shot glass, layer, with a spoon or cherry, the grenadine , the Kahlua , then the Bailey's Irish cream in equal portions. It goes down really smooth ,and you don't even need a chaser. It tastes just like chocolate milk.(Really!)
Niagara Falls: For this cocktail bartender Markku Raittinen won first prize in the "Cocktail Olympics" held at the 1992 Finlandia Vodka International Drinks Competition in Toronto.
Blue Russian Kiss: Modified Blue Kiss, Sweeter but still a good buzz
The Velvet Kilt: A smooth and buttery cocktail with just enough scotch to bite back.
Apricot Cocktail: Shake all ingredients with ice, strain into a cocktail glass, and serve.
Bouzo: the Bourbon cuts the edge off the Ouzo nicely
Bomb: This drink is made to get a person very drunk very fast. Drink in moderation.
Navy Seal: Combine Jägermeister and Cuervo tequila together on the rocks and hold on.
Easter Bunny: Shake creme de cacao and vodka with ice. Strain over ice in an old-fashioned glass. Float chocolate syrup and cherry brandy.
Americano: Pour over ice into an collins glass. Garnish with lemon and orange twists. You may fill with some club soda.
Orange Bliss: Optional: Cut a 1/4 inch slice of orange and place at the bottom of the glass before pouring.
Troutie: A surprisingly good drink that was discovered entirely by accident - mixing with grapefruit juice alone was too sour, 7-up alone was too plain, but when I added a splash of grapefruit to the 7-up mix, I was pleasantly surprised. It was named for a roommate at her suggestion.
Jamaican Qualude: This may also be made as a drink by adding more milk and serving over ice in a collins glass. A variation on this recipe calls for Kahlua in place of the Frangelico.
Scooter: Shake all ingredients well with cracked ice, strain into a cocktail glass, and serve.
French Sailor: Mix 1 part warm Cointreau and 1 part Vodka into a tumbler with a cube of sugar. Stir until sugar is disolved.
London Town: In a mixing glass half-filled with ice cubes, combine all of the ingredients. Stir well. Strain into a cocktail glass.
Robot: Mix well, add ice last. Serves two normal people or one alcoholic.
8 iron: Pour equal parts of each in the the shot glass
Passcack Valley Orgasm: Put in iced shaker and mix well, strain in to a Highball glass
Gangreen: Created in an outside bar in Thailand following the Gulf War
Purple Motherfucker #3: Mix vodka, blue curaco, blueberry schnapps. Add cranberry juice until the solution is purple. Pour in shot glass.
Pink Gin: Pour the bitters into a wine glass. Swirl the glass to coat the inside with the bitters, shake out the excess. Pour the gin into the glass. Do not add ice.
Hot Nuts: 1 ounce of brandy mixed with a small cup of hot coffee then add a few drops of tobasco sause
Kevin's special blend: Put iced tea mix into glass and fill about half full of water.Add 2 ounces of rye, then fill remainder of glass with water.Stir.Add ice cubes.The colder this drink is...the better.
Coco Cabana: Shake with ice cubes. Strain into ice filled highball glass. Garnish with a cherry and a pineapple piece.
Dr. Pepper #5: This combination of liqeur & beer tastes just like Dr. Pepper. It is important to drink it as soon as you drop the flaming shot glass into the beer in order to "Be a Pepper." WARNING: When lighting the Bacardi & Amaretto, make sure there is no Bacardi spilled on the counter or your hands!
Yuppidoo: Shake all on Ice and strain into a Highballs Glass.
Cherry Fizz: Shake juice of lemon and cherry brandy with ice and strain into a highball glass over two ice cubes. Fill with carbonated water and stir. Top with the cherry and serve.
Titty Excreation: This is the best drink ever made. Make a shit load of it in a big glass, and then take turns chugging it with your friends.
The Perfect Ten: The best drink I have ever tasted!!!
Scandanavian Sun: Grand Marnier can, of course, be substituted in lieu of Cointreau. A lemon twist or orange and lemon wheels can be substituted for the orange spiral. A dash of orange bitters can be added for some extra zing.
Dead green frog: You may also want to add amaretto or southern comfort.
Creamy punani: Fill blender about 3/4 with ice-cream (not solid). Add 2 oz of amaretto and kahlua and 3 oz of bailey's. Blend. Drink.
JEE Sweet: Mix all ingredients with cracked ice in a shaker and serve in a chilled martini glass.
Shore Breeze: Build over ice in a hurricane glass. Garnish with a lime wheel.
Irish Cream, Home Made: WARNING: This is tremendously fattening and very high in cholestorol!! Drink sparingly if you are on a low-fat or low cholestorol diet!
Branded Nipple: We were working on variations of the Slippery Nipple that we could set on fire. We came up with the Branded Nipple and found it delicious! Hope you like it!
King of Poland: Served to the hardcore drinkers in bars in Warsaw, Poland. Not meant to be sipped like your everyday cocktail drink, but drank fast like a shot.
Zadarade: Originated at club Zadar by bartender Ken Miller.
T.N.T. No. 2: Pour ingredients into an old-fashioned glass over ice cubes. Stir well and serve.
Oatmeal Cookie with Raisins: Blend, add ice, strain into rocks glass
The Celt: Tattoo is a blueberry schnapps that leaves a blue coloring inside your mouth, do NOT get any on your clothes it won't come off. Most people will only drink 1 or 2 of these
Ginger Spice: Pour spiced rum over ice in highball glass. Fill with ginger ale.
Banana Cream Pie: Mix in a shaker with ice then strain.
Wallick Cocktail: Stir all ingredients with ice, strain into a cocktail glass, and serve.
Martini (Sweet): Stir gin and vermouth with ice and strain into a cocktail glass. Add the olive and serve.
Mexican three wise men: Serve straight up, on the rocks, or as one hell of a shot
Shakes \"Party To Go\": Preferably drink fast and in public. The comercial bottle allows you to take it anywhere, hence "party to go" baby!
Red Gin: In a mixing glass half-filled with crushed ice, combine the gin and Cherry Heering. Stir well. Strain into a cocktail glass. Garnish with the cherry.
Dick Wells: Fill shot glass 2/3 full with Bailey's and then top it off with Crown Royal.
Eskimo Joe's drink: Using blender, add rum, fruits, ice, juice, yoghurt. make sure the orange is peeled and seeds taken out. Cut seeds out of apple. Now blend for 1 minute and your ready for the eskimo.
Brass Skunky: Mix it all together. Serve cold, but not with ice.
Danbooka: pour it in and mix it.
Sunburn: Pour eveything in a big punch bowl or cooler with a big block of ice. Throw in some cherries and a half bottle of 151 for good measure. Have a good time!
Cream Cordial: In blender container, combine all ingredients, blend until smooth. Serve over ice if desired. Store tightly covered in refrigerator up to one month. Stir before using.
Pink Millenium: A variation of a drink created for the change of the millenium.
Whiskey Flip: Shake all ingredients (except nutmeg) with ice and strain into a whiskey sour glass. Sprinkle nutmeg on top and serve.
The Chalise: Throw all ingredients into a blender, and blend to your hearts delight. After, pour into an iced punch bowl and drink immediately!
North Polar: Mix and server over ice with a slice of orange
Cherry Popper: This smooth drink is the brainchild of my sexy girlfriend Brenda.
Pour both into a pint glass, mix and drink.
Wild Sex: This drink was contributed by Nathan Davis, with the following commentary: This drink is designed for very hot girl that you want to take home.One reason is that she'll love the taste,second she'll love the name,third she can't taste the alcohol and that my friend is what will get her to your place.
Liquid Cocaine #4: It is quite strong, and you will be quite drunk after a couple of these.
Crystal Cranberry: Invented by the best bartender at "Friends", me! This is the product of a really slow night and I was bored.
Ideal Cocktail: Shake all ingredients (except cherry) with ice and strain into a cocktail glass. Add the cherry on top and serve.
Longaberger Lemonade: Created at the Hyatt Regency Columbus for a Longaberger Basket convention (and to burn off dead stock!)
Player's Passion: The Alizé and Champagne should be cold because the drink is better served chilled not with ice. I prefer to use Hennessy for the cognac and Moet & Chandon for the champagne. However any champagne and cognac will work.
Chocolate Drink: Melt the bar in a small amount of boiling water. Add milk. Cook over low heat, whipping gently (with a whisk, i would assume) until heated well. Don't let it boil! Serve in coffee mug.
Wet Kiss: If you like watermelon Jolly Ranchers, you'll love this drink!
Lute\u00e5td\u00e6: Try also with 1 dash of ouzo.
Bennett Cocktail: Shake all ingredients with ice, strain into a cocktail glass, and serve.
Shannon on the Beach: Mix the two alcohols and fill with orange and cranberry juice
Rockin' Killer Koolaid: Put alcohol in shaker with ice, shake. Put in hurricane glass over Grenadine to taste. Add in orange juice, pineapple juice and sprite to taste. Garnish with candied cherry.
Sweaty Irish Whiskey: Pour whiskey and cinnamon schnapps into shot glass. Add dash of tobasco.
Wedding Belle Cocktail: Shake all ingredients with ice, strain into a cocktail glass, and serve.
Pimm's Royal: Pour Pimm's over ice in a large highball glass. Fill with champagne and garnish with lemon and cucumber peel.
Kill Me Now: Mix all ingredients in hurricane glass.
Screaming Nazi #2: This is the version I learned. Enjoy, but be careful of the high boot factor.
Start Me Up: This is a result of one week of hard partying and the only things left was vodka, tequila, absolut kurant and dark rum. I figured, what the hell... Taste it and tou'll love it!!!
Super Allez: This is a very tasty drink formulated by a WVU student who was a little lit and had a few too many ingredients laying on his desk. A favorite of all of the First North boys.
Galway Gray: Stir all ingredients, except for the cream, together. Pour into cocktail glass and float cream on top. Sprinkle some grated orange peel on top.
Shellshock: Shell as in clams, shock as in large amount of Tabasco sauce. My standard cocktail after an evening of Curling. This is pretty spicy and not for the fainthearted!
Pamoyo: Great drink for parties. Good drink to make new friends. Drink it just like if it was a tequila shot!
Oreo Cookie: Layer Kahlua, Creme de Cacao, and Bailey's (on top), then top with a splash of vodka.
Kona Village Mai Tai: This recipe was created by Mr. Kono, one of the original bartenders at Kona Village Resort in Kailua-Kona, Hawaii. We saw the recipe in Bon Appetit, tried it, loved it, went to Hawaii to try one in person, have returned to Kona Village every year since!
Frankenjack Cocktail: Stir all ingredients (except cherry) with ice and strain into a cocktail glass. Add the cherry and serve.
Son Of Adam: In a shaker half-filled with ice cubes, combine all of the ingredients. Shake well. Strain into a cocktail glass.
The Fuzzy Pissbomb: Pour all inggredients in rocks glass(with silver polka dots on it if ya got one) Stir. Watch it fizz for thirty seconds Drink it fast
Blue Caboose: I was being not very nice and trying to make a shot that would make a friend of mine sick. She drank the shot and said that it was good she then decided that she would get to name and it was dubbed the "Blue Caboose".
Bannister: In a mixing glass half-filled with crushed ice, combine all of the ingredients. Ster well. Strain into a cocktail glass
Razberi Sunsplash: Put liquor in first than add juice and grenadine. Shake well .Garnish with a flag.
Squashed Frog: For those who like a sweet quick fix. (Have a few in a row!)
Buttery Nipple with a Cherry Kiss: Very popular with the ladies. You let them have the cherry after your done. Maybe you might get a kiss for your efforts!!!
A Splash of Nash: Drop shot glass with banana & melon liquers into a 9 oz hi- ball glass containing soda water and cranberry juice. Drink in one shot.
Sailor Moon: Named after the Anime character Sailor Moon.
Jewel Cocktail: Stir all ingredients (except cherry) with ice and strain into a cocktail glass. Top with the cherry and serve.
Orancio Royal: Pour Orancio into a champagne flute and fill with Brut Champagne. Garnish with a slice of orange.
The Phantom: Take a longdrink glass and fill it with ice. Mix Licor 43 and Absolut vodka, fill up with milk. In the summer you can mix the drink with icecream and make a very nice milkshake.
Jamaican Sunrise: A quite fruitful and colorful drink, hince the name sunrise. Be sure to add the cranberry last, and always watch it run down and mix with the rest of the ingrediants.
Italian Stinger: Fill Old-fashioned glass with ice. Add Brandy and Galliano. Stir and garnish with wedge of lime.
Ladies Sidecar: Shake well with ice. Strain into a chilled cocktail glass.
Mike's Chocolate Pudding: This drink came to be when Mike was drunk and he tried to make himself a Colorado Minty Dog, but mistakenly added irish cream instead of peppermint schnapps. It turned out pretty good. I'm sure this drink has been made before under a different name.
Georgia Tea: Fill glass with large ice cubes. Mix alcoholic ingredients in the glass. Fill the rest of the glass with Dole pineapple-orange juice and stir.
Butterball: Add Amaretto first and then layer Butterscotch schnapps on top, don't mix. Add whipped cream if desired.
Dizzy Damage: This drink is known also as the "Dead Hitler": however it has become popular on the west coast as the Dizzy Damage. This drink is in legend to have been Dizzy damage's (Erik Boyles) drink of choice. (From the Glamour Punks).
Picasso \"1\": Combine ingredients in the order listed into a shaker. Fill half full with ice and shake well. Strain into collins glass with ice. Top with Schweppes Russain. Garnish with a slice of lime, a minth leave and a straw.
White Tornado: This comes from the shooter city Calgary, Canada. Tastes great and the girls love it.
Jack-Off: Pour in one shot of Jack Daniel's on ice, more if you like your drinks strong. Then pour about a half of a can of Coca-Cola on top, leaving room for the iced tea. Finally, fill to the top with very strong iced tea (try three times the amount of powder).
Sweet Burning Eruption: The sweet is the first thing you taste, the burning is on the way down and the eruption is how it looks before you down it.
Surfer on Acid: Combine and shake well with ice and strain into a shot glass.
Russian Quallude: You can substitute cream for the Baileys and you can substitute hazelnut liquor for the frangelica.
Salty Dog: Pour all ingredients over ice cubes in a highball glass. Stir well and serve. (Vodka may be substituted for gin, if preferred.)
Noah: Pour amaretto into glass filled with ice, then add equal parts orange juice and lemon-lime soda to fill glass.
Perfect Flaming Dr. Pepper: Make sure you have a bar rag handy for fast clean-ups!
I go to Purdue: If mixed right it will go from red on the bottom to an orange color on top.
Curtain Call: This drink is suprisingly smooth tasting. The sweet Midori taste balances out the slight harshness of the Jack Daniels and Jägermeister. Very good and easy to drink.
Chocolate Shock: Add 1 shot of After Shock to 8 oz cup of hot chocolate and enjoy.
Serial Killer: This drink got it's name because it looks normal, tastes normal, but you'd never guess it would sneak up and kill you.
Flaming Blue Jesus: Layer with 151 rum on top. Light on fire - Burn for 5 seconds - Blow it out and drink.
Lassi - Sweet #2: I learned this recipe in my 6-year internship at a Bengali Bistro in Paris.
Milky Way Martini: Combine all ingredients, mix, serve without ice.
Jay In Your Tummy: Warning: Too much Sambuca will overpower the other ingredients and ruin the shot.
Black Fruit Tree: Add all ingredients to glass with ice and stir.
Iceberg: That's how we warm up here in Ottawa!!!
Gloom Raiser: Do not confuse with Gloom Chaser
Landed Gentry: In a shaker half-filled with ice cubes, combine all of the ingredients. Shake well. Strain into a cocktail glass.
5-Ball: Make Kool-Aid as normal, except add double the amount of sugar. After Kool-Aid is made add Triple sec. Serve Chilled.
Coronation Cocktail: Stir all ingredients with ice, strain into a cocktail glass, and serve.
Devil's Piss: Using a large glass of water, add lemonade concentrate to taste (Best if you make it a little stronger than usual). Add the 1.5 shots of Everclear and be sure to mix well!
Grenadine Cocktail: The proportions are approximate, vary according to taste. Mix together, serve with lots of ice.
Jack Sprite: Pour the 1 shot of Jack Daniels into glass followed by Sprite to taste and then 1 slice of lemon. Then stir the beverage and enjoy. Note this is a light drink, a good one to start the evening off.
Dying Bastard: Place all ingredients into a glass, stir, and drink.
Imperial Cocktail: Shake with ice and strain into cocktail glass.
Sweet Maria: Shake all ingredients with cracked ice, strain into a cocktail glass, and serve.
Michelada: Mix ingredients in a tall high glass with lots of ice. Add beer at the end. Mix and enjoy.
Lassi - A South Indian Drink: Blend in a blender for 3 seconds. Lassi is one of the easiest things to make, and there are many ways of making it. Basically, it is buttermilk (yoghurt whisked with water), and you can choose almost any consistency that you like, from the thinnest to the thickest. Serve cold.
Rocket Fuel #2: Ingredients may be varied to taste. Coloured food dyes may be added for visual effect.
R-Float: After stirring ingredients,Drink should look just like a rootbeer float and taste even better. Discovered by a bar owners daughter and another bartender.
Amaretto Paradise: Mix over ice. Shake and serve.
Brandy Milk Punch: Shake brandy, milk, and powdered sugar with ice and strain into a collins glass. Sprinkle nutmeg on top and serve.
White Witch: Sweet and smooth, but watch out (Tuaca is 80 proof)
BMW #2: Back in the day, two bartenders at Philthy McNasty's in Waterloo, Ontario, Canada were sitting around the bar trying different alcohols, trying to find the best tasting shot with a real smooth taste and a great aftertaste that you can still taste after a few more drinks. After trying about 15 shots each they started getting sloppy and careless. One of them grabbed the three bottles and mixed them up. He shot it back and the look of pure joy appeared on his face. The other one tried it and this was the beginning of the tastiest shot I've ever had. They came up with this shot and I wanted to share this great shot with all of you.
Canecutter: Ice first, then add Bundaberg Rum, Kalua and fill with Coca Cola.
Hawaiian Punch #2: This is a big hit in nightclubs in Honolulu.
Red Vodkatini: Mix vodka, vermouth, and creme de cassis. Pour over crushed ice, and garnish with a slice of orange.
Paralyzer #3: Taste like Bailey's with more of a kick.
Butterballs: Use a double shot glass. Pour the Butterscotch Schnapps first, then the coffee liqueur.
Rattlesnake Cocktail: Shake all ingredients with ice, strain into a cocktail glass, and serve.
Brian's Belief: In a shaker half-filled with ice cubes, combine the rum, creme de cacao, lemon juice, and sugar. Shake well. Strain into a highball glass almost filled with ice cubes. Top with the tea and stir well.
Frisky Witch: I found this on the internet somewhere, and had it last New Years...VERY nice, and smotth to boot =)
K.G.B. #2: Pour each ingredient in shot glass floating each time. Make sure Galliano is on top.
Lady-Killer: Shake all ingredients with ice in shaker, strain into a Champagne flute or Longdrink glas over some cubes of ice. Decorate with mint and cherry
Andalusia: Stir all ingredients well with cracked ice, strain contents into a cocktail glass, and serve.
Murray's Cocktail: Put ice cubes in glass. Pour rum, vodka, and citron vodka into glass. Fill with 7-up. Mix.
Bull Rider: Created at "Country Connectin" in Fort Wayne, Indiana
Toblerone #1: Posted in The Webtender Forum by Damian J. White.
Jack & Coke: Pour jack daniels into large glass filled with ice. Pour Coca-Cola into glass. Stir lightly.
Screaming Banana Banshee: Shake all ingredients (except cherry) with ice and strain into a chilled cocktail glass. Add the cherry on top and serve.
Sip and go naked: Mix all ingrediants together in a pitcher. Tastes and smells non-alcoholic, but packs a wallop.
Scotch Flip: In a shaker half-filled with ice cubes, combine the Scotch, egg, sugar, and cream. Shake well. Strain into a sour glass and garnish with the nutmeg.
Choad: Please email me if you find this drink to your liking, please see my other entries for similar interesting concoctions. Check your dictionary for the meaning of choad.
Jersey Devil: The Jersey Devil is a Colonial mythical creature that alledgly lived in the woods of South (New) Jersey. In Colonial times people would tell misbehaving children that if they didn't behave the Jersey Devil would come out of the woods and take them away. New Jersey,
Yo mama cocktail: Pour Vodka in highball over ice, add soda, top of with splash of OJ (just a splash)
Dutch Treat: Place all ingredients in the blender jar - cover and whiz on medium speed until well blended. Pour in one tall, 2 medium or 3 small glasses and drink up.
Baseball Pleasure: Begin by making a standard Screwdriver (OJ and Vodka) and then add the Whiskey and the Amaretto. Mix and serve.
Chumbawumba: Originated from the song by the band, from which the name of this drink originated.
The Other Half: Drinking and fire can be a bad mix, be careful. This drink was invented by Jason Halfman
Russian Bloody Mary: It is important to use chilled Vodka and Tomato juice. You need to add the juice carefully by the wall of the glass - it will inject via the Vodka layer. This drink must be two coloured - red at the bottom and transparent at the top.-- Enjoy the Russian drinks!
Dakota: Combine in a double shot glass and enjoy.
Brain Damage: I created this drink while receiving some guests on a Saturday night.
Watermelon Shooter #2: Stir in an ice-filled mixing glass and strain into rocks glass.
Slow Painful Movement: This is definitely a party drink. The flavor is good, but the feel of it sliding down your throat takes some gettting used to.
Screwdriver \u00e1 la Carla: Mix the orange juice with sugar and the yolk of an egg. Then pour in the vodka with some icecubes and stir. Serve well chilled.
Brandy Alexander #3: In a shaker half-filled with ice cubes, combine the brandy, creme de cacao, and cream. Shake well. Strain into a cocktail glass and garnish with the nutmeg.
Martini #3: In a mixing glass half-filled with ice cubes, combine the gin and vermouth. Stir well. Strain into a cocktail glass. Garnish with the lemon twist or an olive.
Neon-Geek: Mix all three ingredients in a mixing glass, along with 1 cup crushed ice. Strain into margirita glass and serve immediately!
Low Lattitude Lust: The drink is supposed to have a light orangeish-pink color to it. When mixed properly, you will only be able to taste a smoothly sweet pineapple taste.
Dempsey Cocktail: Stir all ingredients with ice, strain into a cocktail glass, and serve.
Kermit: This cocktail won 1st. price in the 1994 Bartender Club of Iceland, cocktail drink competition.
Black Dragon: You first get the fire of the scotch then the taste of the liquer and finally the cooling taste of the mint schnapps. This drink came about one day when I was experimenting with different combinations of liquers with mint schnapps and scotch.
Fishbone: Fill glass with ice add liquor, orange juice, and sour mix. shake well add 1 oz of 7 up to the top.
Johnnie Cocktail: Shake all ingredients with ice, strain into a cocktail glass, and serve.
The Admiral's Passion: I was bored serving Passoa always the same way & started experimenting on new ways to serve it. Dedicated to Koen.
Dreamsicle #2: Shake and Strain contents into a highball glass filled with ice. Tastes just like the popsicle
Michelada Regular: Very popular drink for the beach in the Puerto Vallarta area. Is refreshing and delicious. An alternative ingredient is called "sal de gusano" (worm salt), made in Oaxaca, Mexico, and is made from toasted agave worms, chili and salt, using it istead of regular salt. Be careful, though, to use only 1/4 of a teaspoon on this one, because it is VERY strong (but tastes really great).
Fjellfinn: This drink is one created in the Royal Norwegian Cavalry and drunk mostly by officers at Setermoen in Troms. It's taste is quite good and the leaf adds a nice touch.
Mandarin Crush: Fill highball glass with ice, add Absolut Mandarin, then fill with Orange Crush or some other orange soda.
Nerds: Very tasty sugary drink... Very enjoyable on a hot day!!
Safe Sex on the Beach: Pour over ice in a chilled glass and stir. Garnish with a cherry.
Japanese Fizz: Shake all ingredients (except carbonated water) with ice and strain into a highball glass over two ice cubes. Fill with carbonated water, stir, and serve.
Juicy Lucy #2: This is the south GA version of Juicy Lucy.
Joe Blow: Amazing refreshing blend of soda and alcohol. A perfect marriage.
Root Beer: Tastes like a Root Beer soda doesn't it?
Jamaican Me Crazy: Tastes like strawberry & banana. I'm a bartender at Characters Sports Bar and Grill, on a slow day I started mixing different ingredients together and I came up with this, enjoy.
Cafe Seattle: Measure Irish cream and Vodka into coffee mug. Add Hershey's chocolate syrup. Fill will coffee and top with Whipping cream.
Dirty Bloody Martini: This drink is best serve with a spicy vodka such as Inferno or Pepper Pot which are available in Canada.
Grapefruit Cocktail: Shake all ingredients (except cherry) with ice and strain into a cocktail glass. Add the cherry on top and serve.
The Pernod Demon: This shooter is actualy rumored as being the official shooter of Hell. Enjoy...
Jungle Juice: The Best Drink in the world ?? Use Tropicana Orange Juice For Best taste
Woodpecker: Add 4 ice cubes to old-fashioned glass. Pour 2 ounces of vodka over the ice. Add 15 dashes of peychaud bitters. Stir.
Chocolate Buzz: Start with the chocolate milk, next stir in 2 shots of Kahula and 2 shots of Irish Cream. Serve cold.
Ginny's Slammin' Goddess #2: Be Really Carefull with this one!
Electric Lemonade #1: Combine all ingredients in Collins glass filled with ice.
Fruity Vodka Beverage: Pour ingredients over ice in a large glass.
Ice Cappuccino: You can add a dash of nutmeg or cinnamon on top.
Galapagos: Enjoy and do not get drunk!
Double Chocolate: Godet is very sweet, so if you want it sweeter, use more Godet and less Creme de Cacao. If want it less sweet, use less Godet and more Creme de Cacao.
The Dragon: Just Dump 'EM All In A Glass & Mix 'Em All Up.
Gates Of Hell: In a shaker half-filled with ice cubes, combine the tequila, lemon juice, and lime juice. Shake well. Strain into an old-fashioned glass almost filled with crushed ice. Drizzle the cherry brandy over the top.
Green Hell: Pour both into glass and keep away from open flames!!
Grovspol: A drink from the Royal Swedish Mechanized Forces.
No Pressure: Anyone who has ever been to Sandals Resort, La Toc, St. Lucia has experienced this drink. A couple of these and you will truly be feeling "No pressure"!
Booda's Black Brew: Well it was Halloween Night I was working (being the Rookie). I shaved my head and all my facial hair and I dressed up as Buhhda.Anyway some really hot chick asked me to make a Witches Brew. Me being a Rookie I didnt know how to make it. So to impress this girl I flew around the Bar I work at picking up every dark looking liquior trying to make something that looked and tasted cool. Then Pow she dark it and asked me "what the Hell was that??" and it just came out "Booda's Black Brew" I said. She licked her lips and says "Damn give me another!!" Then all her Fine little friends came and asked me for some Booda's Black Brew!!! And So a Drink was Born. I work at the Ale House and Raw Bar in FL and I have been called Booda for Years now so everything fit into place.
Poire Fantastic: Take a Highball glass, pour in the Poire au Cognac. Add Sprite. Put in some ice if you want.
Bitch-On-Wheels: In a mixing glass half-filled with ice cubes, combine all of the ingredients. Stir well. Strain into a cocktail glass.
The N8er T8er: Combine cream soda and gin. Stir well
Kryptonite kooler: For an out of this world green drink, you have to try this.
Berlin martini: Take a shaker filled with ice. Add 2 oz smirnoff vodka, 3 dashes of schnapps, a wee splash of black zambuca and shake well, keeping your feet firmly planted, posture perfect. Strain into a chilled martini glass. Garnish with a blackberry.
Tachyon: As long as the proportions of Pernod and Tequila are 1:1, any amount can be made. As much as I would like to take credit for it, I did not invent this drink - Gregory Benford mentions it in his novel "Timescape" where it is referred to only as a "Macho".
Buttery Nipple #3: Pour schnapps into shot glass. Carefully add Baily's to surface. Don not mix.
Rose de Mai Cocktail: Shake very well pineapple juice, raspberry fruit-syrup and cream with ice cubes. Strain into a large cocktail glass.
Concord: Drink may be consumed with a straw while on fire (use EXTREME caution), or may be extinguished before consumption.
Caipiroska: Crush sugar into the lime wedges with a spoon. Place the lime wedges in the bottom of an 8 oz. glass. Cover with crushed ice. Pour vodka to fill the glass. It's a great summer drink.
Absinthe Curacao Frappe: Stir ingredients and pour over crushed ice in a deep-saucer champagne glass. Add orange slice.
Cat's Eye: Shake gin, chartreuse, and vermouth in cocktail shaker filled with ice. Strain into chilled cocktail glass. Twist orange peel and drop into cocktail.
Three Wise Men (on a farm): A drink that is well worth-while. Can top off a good night of getting plastered.
Dungeon Punch: The official drink of Zelda's Kinky Dungeon of Kinkiness
Absolutely Fruity: mix banana and watermelon liqueur in shot glass top with vodka.
South Bank: Shake the spirits with ice and strain into a Highball. Fill with Grape Tonic and stir gently. Serve with a Lemon Slice on the Rim and a Straw. If you find the Grape Tonic too sweet, add a splash or two of Lemon Juice or Sour Mix. A Sour Bank is made in an Old Fashioned with two ice cubes and Grape Fruit Juice instead. A Southern Bank is a South Bank which has been added 1 part Southern Comfort.
Dirk Diggler: This drink was created in the little town of Chelan, Washington. It is derived from a porn star because you will be ready for some action! Have fun!
Monkey C*m: Fill shot glass about 3/4 full with Bailey's Irish Cream. Perfection is not necessary with this drink. Fill rest of way with Butterscotch Schnapps.
Kentucky Colonel Cocktail: Stir bourbon and Benedictine with ice and strain into a cocktail glass. Add the twist of lemon peel and serve.
Rain Man: Shake all ingredients together, then pour into a hurricane glass filled with ice.
Chocolate Covered Cherries: Layer carefully using the back of a spoon. Grenadine first, then Kahlua and then Bailey's.
Lui Lui: Mix with ice. Strain into shot glass.
Orangeade: Place some ice cubes in a large tumbler or highball glass, add lemon juice, orange juice, sugar syrup, and stir well. Top up with cold soda water, serve with a drinking straw.
Greek Lightning: When chilled, the Ouzo will turn milky white allowing the Chambord to turn the shooter purple. Very similar to Purple Haze, but with a Greek touch...
The Shearer Special: Mix fifth of a gallon of bacardi to a splash of cranberry juice Enjoy!
Smith And Kearns: Pour Kahlua and light cream into a highball glass filled with ice and stir well. Fill with carbonated water, stir lightly, and serve.
Rum Runner: For many drinks, mix in a punch bowl. -- Women enjoy the fruity flavor of this drink..(Malibu Rum has a coconut flavor). It does not have a strong alcohol taste and is a great pool side drink.
Mansion Mind Eraser: A drink for two people. Tastes like a chocolate milkshake. This particular Mind Eraser originated (as far as I can tell) in The Mansion, a nightclub in West Texas, and was served almost exclusively behind the bar. It was too good to share with the patrons.
Red Witch: Put Pernod in a pint glass. Fill almost to the top with cider and add the blackcurrant. After that, it's up to you.
Berry Buster: A mighty tasty drink that goes down smooth. If it's too sweet, try more vodka. If you really want to wow someone, double the recipe, add one egg white and shake for 15 sec instead of 20 sec.
Minttini: Shake all ingredients with cubed ice, then pour into a martini glass. Garnish with a mint leaf.
Caribbean Cruise: A tasty and refreshing drink for those who tell you, " I want something strong, but fruity! I don't like to taste the liquor!" This one will satisfy their urge and your register!!
Nappy Dugout: Build over 2 cubes of ice. Stir.
Fifty-fifty Cocktail: Stir ingredients with ice, strain into a cocktail glass, and serve.
Lemon Highlander: Pour into scotch glass over ice. Stir. Garnish with a twist of lemon peel.
Shady Lady: Pour melon liqueur, tequila, and grapefruit juice over ice in a highball glass and stir. Add the slice of lime, top with the cherry, and serve.
Matty's Magic Mixture: combine ingredients in mug and stir until fizzy
Lone Tree Cocktail: Stir ingredients with ice, strain into a cocktail glass, and serve.
Chocolate Covered Banana: Pour all ingredients over ice. Garnish with slice of banana.
Bourbon Sour: In a shaker half-filled with ice cubes, combine the bourbon, lemon juice, and sugar. Shake well. Strain into a whiskey sour glass, garnish with the orange slice and cherry.
Los Cabos Clout: Excellent drink for lounging in the sun under a palm tree or by the pool.
Slushy: Mix drink with crushed ice or blend with 2 1/2 scoops of ice. For added enjoyment stick a straw in the middle and drink for a slushy rush.
Apple Judy: Shake well with cracked ice. Serve without garnish in a cocktail glass.
Cherry Bomber: From Nicks Bar & Grill in Greenville, PA
Margarita: Rub rim of cocktail glass with lime juice, dip rim in salt. Shake all ingredients with ice, strain into the salt-rimmed glass, and serve.
The Drunken Elf: How do you think all those elves make it through the Christmas season?
TGV: Mix in shotglass(es). Add Curacao last, to a nice blue-green color.
Irish Cream BTB: To much mixing after the whipping cream has been added will make the cream froth, leaving a head on the mixture. Keep the Irish Cream in a good sealed container, give it a little shake after it has been sitting. "Better Than Baileys."
Fire in Heaven: Fill up shot glass with 151 proof Rum. Then add a dash of Tabasco into the glass. Allow a few seconds to settle. Drink fast and stand back.
The Postman: I got this drink from the manager where I work. His last name is Post, hence, the Postman. Definately an enjoyable shot, so, Enjoy!
Bon Voyage: Add the shot of tequila and shot of gin over ice in a cocktail glass. Then mix a dash of lemon juice and dash of blue curacao over gin and tequila. Stir lightly. Best when drank with a straw.
Dracona: Without the Lemonade the cocktail is extemely strong on the tongue and has a harsh after-taste. Adding the lemonade gives a refreshing feel.
Canteloupe Dizzy: Pour club soda into a parfait glass with ice. Pour vodka, melon liquer, and peach schnapps into a shaker and shake well. Strain into the club soda and stir. Garnish with cherry/orange/pineapple.
Crapachino: I was messing around in the kitchen when i came up with this recipe. It's a drink rich in flavour if very bitter cocoa powder is used. If you can't get your hands on Sweetened Condensed Milk, use regular milk, sugar and sweetener instead. -- P.S: make sure ice-cream is plain, if it's got like chips and stuff inside, it won't be as nice. Enjoy!
Amaretto Rose: Pour amaretto and lime juice over ice in a collins glass. Fill with club soda and serve.
Girl Scout Cookie: Pour all ingredients into mixing cup with ice. Shake and strain into double shot glass. Drink soon after pouring before liquors separate.
Jamaican Beer: first of all pour in a glass vermouth,gin,whisky. next add the beer and last curacao and vodka's drops
Sex on the Grass: Similar to Sex on the beach, but should be a nice grassy green color, hence the name. You can adjust the curacao to get the right color. Nice summertime drink!
DC: Put Tequila in a double shot glass, then add the baileys Slam then repeat
Kyoto: Created by Roar Hildonen for the Norwegian newspaper Dagbladet's summer drink column the summer of 2000.
Screaming Chocolate Monkey: Credit to us bartenders at "Goocci's" in SC!
Sweet Bananas: Place all ingredients in the blender jar - cover and whiz on medium speed until well blended. Pour in one tall, 2 medium or 3 small glasses and drink up.
Smooth Operator: Blend with a scoop of ice
Tequila Surprise: Fill shot glass with Tequila. Add drops of Tobasco sauce.
Buzz Lightyear: This drink originated in a large house in Las vegas on the center island of the kitchen by basically mixing a screwdriver and a midori melonball into a drink that glows like the green on the buzz light year doll.
Green K: Drink created by Kerstin Nedele in September 1997
Blue Ice Mountain: A very light drink that could be drink as apperif. A very nice baby blue colour.
Chocolate Orgasm: This is a very popular drink and people always want more.
San Francisco: Take a tall glass and put in a few ice cubes, fill the vodka over it and fill with juice then the "creme", to end fill in the grenadine but very carefully at the side of the glass so it will lay down in the bottom. garnish with orange and strawberry.
Malibu Pink Panther: In a blender, crush a hand full or two of ice. Then add the frozen pink lemonade and Malibu Rum. Blend until it becomes somewhat smooth (usually less than 30 seconds). Then add the whipped cream while leaving the blender running. This will add the consistency to your drink and therefore the amount of whipped cream is to your discression. Blend until smooth and serve.
Pegu: Stir with cracked ice and strain into a chilled cocktail glass. Garnish with a lime twist.
Presticles Spectacles Wallet and Watch: Origin, University of Wisconsin-Stout, Courtesy of Jon Prest
Patsy mix: Pour in Brandy and Babycham on ice
Naked Yellow Bird: If the customer asks why it's called a naked yellow bird since the color is actually a dusty sort of purple, mention that a naked yellow bird has no feathers, therefore it is not yellow but instead the ugly purple color of this shooter...
Pascal: Pour licor 43 and Midori in a glass and fill with milk and ice
Burnso Tropical: I came up with this drink while bartending in college. It became a favorite of the local crowd and was often also served as a jigger of shots.
Voodoo: Pour ingredients over ice and stir.
Zombie #1: Shake all ingredients (except 151 proof rum) with ice and strain into a collins glass over ice cubes. Float the 151 proof rum on top, add a cherry (if desired), and serve.
Poontang: Delicious and orange. The drink of the astronaut!
Will Willy Wander: This drink originated in a bar on Route 61 North of Reading, PA called Nutsy's.
Smoothie: Recipe courtesy of Teresa at H.L. Franklin's in Birmingham, Alabama.
Tropical Titty Twister: The flavor comes from the banana liquer, coconut rum, and pinapple juice. Cranberry juice is used to break the acidity of the pinapple juice, while the soda water breaks up the sweetness. The flavored vodka adds a twist and some kick. Knowing this you can vary the recipe to your liking. Can be made stronger by adding more flavored vodka. Also great if mixed in a blender. -- Created in a night club in Courtenay, BC in May 2000.
Angry Chameleon: Disolve kool-Aid in rum. Add Mountain Dew.
The Boiling Panther: This drink has been enjoyed at Hanover College and Purdue University.
Blue Motorcycle #2: Fill glass with ice, add the ingrediants, shake and serve.
Purple Rain #2: This has a sneaker quality like a college party Wop. Possibly named after the artist formally known as Prince as it is popular in some of the underground bars in downtown Minneapolis.
Bulldozer: Be careful. Don't go blind. Don't go anywhere. Since 1972, the limit and the record on drinking these monsters is still two.
Purple Heart: Turns purple in color, hence the name Purple Heart.
Climax: Shake all ingredients well with cracked ice, strain into a chilled cocktail glass, and serve.
Cindy's Cycle: Mix Tequila, Melon Liqueur, Sweet and Sour, and Grenadine. Blend with Ice. Serve in glass.
Atlantic Sun: Shake all the ingredients, top the drink with soda. Garnish with a slice of orange.
The Bomb: an original drink by Dale Rockhill, Club Oxygen, Huntsville, Alabama
Wet Pussy: Vayr amount of milk to taste.
Sloppy Joe's Cocktail No. 1: Shake all ingredients with ice, strain into a cocktail glass, and serve.
Blue Cowboy: In a mixing glass half-filled with crushed ice, combine both of the ingredients. Stir well. Strain into a cocktail glass.
Irish Coffee: Whipped cream can also be used, but won't give the great sensation of drinking hot coffee through the cold layer of cream.
Dillinger: This is some high class sh*t!
French Afternoon: Served on ice in "rocks-glass" May be served with a little whipped creem on top!
Drinking Chocolate: Heat the cream and milk with the cinnamon and vanilla bean very slowly for 15-20 minutes. (If you don't have any beans add 1-2 tsp of vanilla after heating). Remove the bean and cinnamon. Add the chocolate. Mix until fully melted. Serve topped with some very dense fresh whipped cream. Serves 1-2 depending upon how much of a glutton you are. For a richer chocolate, use 4 oz of milk, 4 oz of cream, 4 oz of chocolate. Serve in coffee mug.
Wild Berry Pop-Tart: Add all ingredients into shot glass, slam it on the table and shoot it, followed promptly with a beer.
Chewybubu: If done correctly, you will have a shot that has three distinct layers: blue, clear, and brown.
Popped cherry: Served over ice in a tall glass with a popped cherry (can add more popped cherries if in the mood)!
Karlsson: If you don't have Pisang ambon you can use Bananaliquer instead
Grand Orange-Cognac Liqueur: Place zest and sugar in a small bowl. Mash and mix together with the back of a wooden spoon or a pestle. Continue mashing until sugar is absorbed into the orange zest and is no longer distinct. Place into aging container. Add cognac. Stir, cap and let age in a cool dark place 2 to 3 months, shaking monthly. After initial aging, pour through fine mesh strainer placed over medium bowl. Rinse out aging container. Pour glycerine into aging container and place cloth bag inside strainer. Pour liqueur through cloth bag. Stir with a wooden spoon to combine. Cap and age 3 more months before serving.
Bananaball: Instead of the Orange juice you can use Pineapple juice.
Deidru: Add Brandy to glass and fill with Lemonade. Add ice if desired. Stir.
Purple Rain Shot: Shake with ice and strain into chilled shot glass.
Horse's Ass: So named because anyone who would order one is clearly a horse's ass.
Mock Pink Champagne #1: Boil sugar and water until sugar dissolves, cool. Stir cranberry, pineapple, orange juices. Chill. Just before serving, add carbonated beverage.
Rye & Pepper: Compliments of Saugeen Hall / The Zoo @ Western University.
Banana Split: This can be served as a frozen drink, but you have to add substansial amounts of the acohol to override the ice.
Hyper-Active Apple: I made this drink in Bars throughout Europe and used it to get free drinks. Free is always good.
Tainted Heart: This drink is a classic to the old mint chocolate flavor usually found in ice cream.
Flip Juice: Mix all ingredients together in a gallon pitcher and refrigerate. Serve chilled.
Black Margarita: I invented this one myself, as a "spooky" or Halloween drink. The color should be a gray-black, but don't be fooled: it tastes great. -- Also known as Santeria Margarita or Margarita With A Curse.
Jay's Rootbeer Dream: Good for that hang over morning Cocktail. Use it every weekend!
Plum Liqueur: Wash plums and pat dry. Cut plums in half or smaller, pit. Place plums in aging container. Pour sugar over plums, stir. Add vodka and brandy stirring to partly disolve sugar. Cap container and place in a cool, dark place for 2 months, stir occasionally. Place a strainer over large bowl and strain liqueur. Press liquid from plums with the back of a wooden spoon. Discard plum pulp. Re-strain liqueur through cloth until clear. Bottle as desired. Ready for drinking or cooking but best if aged another month.
Apricot Lady: In a shaker half-filled with ice cubes, combine the rum, apricot brandy, triple sec, lemon juice, and egg white. Shake well. Strain into an old-fashioned glass almost filled with ice cubes. Garnish with the orange slice.
Mary's Dream: Pour the rum, triple sec, orange juice, and orange bitters into a highball glass almost filled with ice cubes. Stir well and garnish with the orange slice.
Red Raider: Shake all ingredients with ice, strain into a cocktail glass, and serve.
Robicheaux: Great on a summer day. Inspired (with apologies) by James Lee Burke's Dave Robicheaux novels. Try also with Dr. Pepper.
Cranberry Apple Martini: Shake and strain into a chilled cocktail glass
Bull Shot #2: Disolve bullion cube in water. Mix in vodka and Tabasco. Garnish with celery.
Vodka Kick: Just mix it! Also add some lime.
Mountain Dang: Major sugar and caffeine high. I do not suggest more than 4 tablespoons of tang to 8 ounces of mountain dew. And cheaper brands of tang don't seem to have the same flavor or effect.
SD Special: This is the best drink I have ever had.
Charger: In a shaker half-filled with ice cubes, combine all of the ingredients. Shake well. Strain into a cocktail glass.
Hurlyburly: This is a house specialty drink from the Bellagio Hotel and Casino in Las Vegas.
Malibu Punch: Fill collins glass with ice. Add malibu and fill with pineapple juice. Add grenadine and splash of 7-up.
Green Cow #2: This Green cow drink taste a lot better than the original. You may have to try it out some times before you get your own favorite taste, that is one of the great things about this recipe, you can make your own favorite taste. I have not met one person yet that doesn't like this drink. I have tried to use several other ingredients but this is (so far) the best. We have once tried with aquavit instead of vodka, that was the nearest we came to the taste we have today.
Yale Cocktail: Stir all ingredients with ice, strain into a cocktail glass, and serve.
Kiwi Papaya Smoothie: Throw everything into a blender and liquify.
The Kruzewski: Named after my english teacher, who is responsible fo all of my contributions.
Bitches Tit: Pour the chamborde into a shaker, add cream or milk and shake well. Pour into an Irish Cream mug filled with ice. Enjoy!
Pirate's Float: Mix all ingredients in glass with ice. Add cola to taste. Serve on the rocks.
Zool: Pour 1 oz. of Peach Schnapps in the shot glass first. Then pour 1 oz. of Absolut Vodka on top. Last pour Amaretto on top of Vodka until the Vodka changes in to a light brown.
Dressed Up Like A Dogs Dinner: In a mixing glass half-filled with ice cubes, combine all of the ingredients. Stir well. Strain into a cocktail glass.
Tequila Old-Fashioned: Mix sugar, bitters, and 1 tsp. water in an old-fashioned glass. Add tequila, ice cubes, and carbonated water. Add the stick of pineapple and serve.
Wine Punch: Combine all of the ingredients and pour over a block of ice.
Aztec Punch: Mix all ingredients in a pitcher. Mix thoroughly and pour into whatever is available, the bigger the better! This drink packs a big punch, so don't over do it.
Sitarski: In a shaker half-filled with ice cubes, combine all of the ingredients. Shake well. Strain into an old-fashioned glass almost filled with ice cubes.
Top Banana: Shake all ingredients with ice, strain into an old-fashioned glass over ice cubes, and serve.
Tangerine Dream: Finalist in the 1992 Mandarine Napolean Cocktail Competition.
The Black Death: Mix ingredients in shaker and pour over ice. Serve cold. Great on a hot day!
Bluuzberry Shake: Blend ingredients in blender until thoroughly mixed. Add more ice cream if too thin. Garnish with blueberries and strawberry.
Sweet Tits: Add all the ingredients into a shaker over ice. Shake gently and strain into shot glass.
Mostly Mal: In a shaker half-filled with ice cubes, combine the rum, vermouth, tiple sec and grenadine. Shake well. Strain into a cocktail glass and garnish with the cherry.
Golden Coke: This drink was created late at night, by some college students.
Paris Paradise: Some like it with the Bailey's, some like it without.
Apple Grande: For a party, 1 bottle tequila to 1 gallon apple juice
Blister: Color should be a nice turquoise or very light green, taste should be smooth, a bit fruity, yet not harsh. Enjoy!
Thunder king: Just mix it and shake it..
Mcclelland Cocktail: Shake all ingredients with ice, strain into a cocktail glass, and serve.
Black Cactus: Pour Tequila and blackberry brandy together. Add club soda. Drink like a shooter.
Captain with a Skirt: Because of the addition of white wine to the traditional Morgan and Coke, my friends refer to this as a "girly" drink.
Favorite Cocktail: Shake all ingredients with ice, strain into a cocktail glass, and serve.
Golden Sunrise: Mix all ingredients together and shake!!!!
Tequila (Straight): Put salt between thumb and index finger on back of left hand. Hold shot glass of tequila in salted hand and lemon wedge in the other. Lick salt, slam the tequila, then suck lemon.
Sister Starseeker: Pour the rum, lemon juice, grenadine, and tonic water into a highball glass almost filled with ice cubes. Stir well and garnish with the lemon wedge.
Carnegie Sunrise: Be ready to smile. Tastes like Orange Julius, but with a twist of tomato, and some extra kick. My first party drink.
Johnny K8: Pour first 3 ingredients in shaker and shake. Pour over ice and top up with tonic. Then layer with blue curacao.
Beelzebub: I was served this drink at my favourite bar, in my hometown, Sortland in North-Norway. They serve it on a tray with a mirror attached to it. On the mirror they have painted a pentagram, and it is served to a special song. The reason for this is, as they say: this drink is made out of pure evil. And if you watch closely in the mirror you're supposed to see the horns grow.
Ooo: Best with a no-pulp juice. Yet another Carnegie Mellon fave.
Rocky Mountain Bumpsucker: Oh yes. The best among the never-ending "Rocky Mountain" series.
Banana Colada #2: Combine All Ingredents in a blender except for the ice and blend. Then add Ice until the drink begins to thicken then serve.
Blue Motorcycle: Basicly a Long Island Ice Tea but instead of Triple Sec you add Blue Caracao, and instead of coke you add a splash of 7-Up.
Crystal Slipper Cocktail: Stir all ingredients with ice, strain into a cocktail glass, and serve.
Cherry Martinsen: Pour in the brandy and then the coke, biatch. Hold up the glass and say dude. Enjoy dude.
Orange Surprise: This is a drink that both the gyus and the girls will like. A real refresher in the heat of the summer or in the heat of the moment! This is a drink I invented working at Da Carlo Bar in Bodø, Norway.
Salisbury Special: Can substitute tequila for vodka, or Strawberry Liqueur for cordial if unavailable (but it's not as good....)
Voodoo Lady: Pour triple sec, cognac, and lemon juice over ice. Shake and strain. Pour into cocktail glass. Enjoy.
Banana Milk Shake: Blend very well, preferably in a household mixer. Serve in a wine glass, garnish with whipped cream and a piece of banana.
Dead Hitler: Fill a shot glass equally in parts with Rumple Minze, Jägermeister, and Goldschlager.
Moonlight Serenade: Mix in highball glass. Stirr. Garnish with slice of orange.
Mundo Fine: Shake or mix all ingredients, and pour over ice cubes into a collins glass, (or any glass large enough,) Garnish with an orange slice, a lemon slice, and a cherry if so desired.
Robyn: Pour the vodka into a highballglass, add russian 'til the glass is a little more than half-full, fill up with fruitsoda and top it with a drop of lime juice.
Melon Margarita: Serve on the rocks or blend with ice to make a Frozen Melon Margarita.
The World's Best Pina Colada: This is absolutely the best Pina Colada recipe in the world! Use it wisely.
Peppermint Patty (Northern Style): Dr. McGullicuddys Menthomint Schnapps is only sold in some states. Its very smooth but you can substitute with Rumple Minze but it has a little bit of a bite. With Dr.'s the flavor should be smooth and almost taste like a York Peppermint Patty.
Trailer Wench: Randomly made up at 4th Street Cafe in Chattanooga, TN
Zizi Coin-coin: Very similar to Caipirinha, this drink is, however, less high on sugar, and therefore, slightly bitter. The old-fashioned French orange liquor made sexy by Argentinian party girls. Supposedly the official Argentinian party girl drink.
Orange Safari: Build over ice in highball glass. Stir.
Deauville Cocktail: Shake all ingredients with ice, strain into a cocktail glass, and serve.
Artic Red: First smash the limes and sugar to bottom of the glass. Then add vodka and soda. Mix the drink with a spoon. Add ice cubes and lemon.
Riley: Shake first six ingredients with cracked ice and strain into a chilled cocktail glass. Ass a dash of raspberry syrup. Garnish with a lime squeeze.
Norwegian Hunting Mixture Bowl: Norwegian hunting speciality invented by Academic Hunting Club 1984. A very popular drink in Norwegian Hunting Festivals.
Smoothe Operator: This makes 2 perfect drinks. Multiply recipe for larger groups. Believe me, everybody comes back for more!
Russian Monster Tom Collins: I like to mix them to where you can barely taste the vodka, about half and half. These will make you more bulletproof than Superman.
Klondike Cooler: Mix powdered sugar and 2 oz. carbonated water in a collins glass. Fill glass with ice and add blended whiskey. Fill with carbonated water and stir. Add twist of lemon peel and orange spiral so that the end dangles over rim of glass.
Mandarin Delight: I am always looking for a new drink. I tried a vodka tonic for the first time last week and wondered what it would be like with a little more flavor. I experimented with different types of flavored vodka and liked this one the best!
Charro Negro: If don't have a Mariachi Soul, After 3 of These, you'll be singin' "El son de la negra" or "Cielito Lindo"
Sabra: I named this shooter "Sabra" after the Israeli chocolate and orange flavored liqueur Sabra.
A Smile: As you drink rock the glass in your hand between sips to get the full flavour. Enjoy.
Deep-7: Can be made more powerful by adding more alcohol and/or less 7-up.
351 Special: It is very important that the ingredients are mixed quite right (after feel, not the measurements in the ingredients), because if this is not done, the drink will lose it's "touch". You'll have to try your way to get the perfect taste.
Electric Marcucci: Another hit from Carnegie Mellon. Invented in honor of the new master electrician of the drama department. Whiskey is his drink of choice, the melon helps smooth the edges, and anything with "electric" in the title HAS to be blue of course!
Cold Duck Punch: Mix all liquids in a large punch bowl. Float the sherbet on top.
Caipirinha: Muddle the sugar into the lime wedges in an old-fashioned glass. Fill the glass with ice cubes. Pour the cachaca into the glass. Stir well.
Purple Yummy: Mix in cocktail shaker with ice cubes to chill. Strain into glass, adorn with cherries.
Amaretto Stinger: Shake ingredients well with cracked ice, strain into a cocktail glass, and serve.
Period in a Pitcher: Also goes very well with Absolut Vodka or Black Velvet in place of the rum.
Snow Cap Columbian Monk: Pour 2 1/2 oz. frangelico into a tall glass and fill with strong coffee. Top with a scoop of ice-cream.
Horny Bull #2: Easier than the original. Found this at a different bar.
Jaq'ed Up Screwdriver: I am so obsessed with mixing things up I actually came up with a good drink! My friends at school gave this drink its name... after yours truly!
Cucaracha: In a low glass put Tequila first, than Kahlua. Flame the coktail. Two people had to drink in the same glass with two plastic-pipe. The goal is to drink before the plastic-pipe melt down.
Southern Ireland: A friend of mine from Ireland told me this was what he drank at his local pub. It really is a tasty drink.
Neutron Bomb: If layered right, the shot should look like a nuclear mushroom cloud.
Texas Sweat: Mix all together and filter back and forth through ice to chill and mix. Not a sipping drink, shoot it.
Catalina Margarita: Shake with cracked ice and strain into chilled cocktail or margarita glass.
Watermelon Crawl: Fill a 16 oz pint glass with ice, pour the above in. Garnish with cherries.
Mother: Learned about this is college (where else) back in the day (70's). The drink, according to legend, originated at a Margate, NJ bar of the same name.
Baked Apple: Pour the liqueur into the glass first, then add the Cider. Serve cold.
N\u00e4germeister: This one is very tasty, but one or two seems to be enough for most of the people who have tried it. It originated from some guys in Pirum at Studentersamfundet in Trondheim.
Four Horsemen: Obviously this is a large shooter with a lot of the liqours that make people crazy so limit your customers to 2 or 3 of these.
Tinyee's Orange Smoothie: When adding soda at the end, the bubbles should rise through the blended juices creating the smoothie effect.
Santa Monica Pier: Great sweet drink for relaxing. Not a party drink, don't drink this expecting to get wasted, you wont, expect to drink, and be relaxed.
Frozen Mint Daiquiri: Combine all ingredients with 1 cup of crushed ice in an electric blender. Blend at a low speed for a short length of time. Pour into an old-fashioned glass and serve.
Everybody's Irish Cocktail: Stir all ingredients (except green olive) with ice and strain into a cocktail glass. Add the green olive and serve.
Long Island Iced Tea #2: Fill 12 oz. glass with ice. Add all the alcohol and sour mix. Top off glass with Coca-Cola to taste then watch out.
Kahlua #1: Bring to boil. Reduce heat and simmer 1 hour. let cool and add vanilla and either a pint or fifth of Vodka. Drink and Enjoy!!
Kosmo: A bartender from Plymouth Country Club came into my bar one night and showed me how to make it.... after one taste I was hooked!
Klondike: Originally found in Seattle, WA., the Klondike has a sweet, creamy texture. Carefull, they go down fast and easy!
Absolut limousine: Taken from a pamplet by Vin & Sprit AB. The Makers of Absolut
David Caradine: As you have noticed, the drink is basically a grasshopper. It is named after David Caradine's role in Kung Fu--Kane, whose nickname was grasshopper. It's a grasshopper that will kick your .
Banana Russian: I've been spending a lot of time over the last month learning how and practicing at the art of Bartending. Last night while at a local bar I was looking over what they had on the back shelf and asked the Bartender to whip this up for me. It tastes a lot like a banana milkshake. I suggest heavy cream to help give it that milkshake feel, but half & half will work. Enjoy!
Fraise de Champagne: Pour into a coupette glass/champagne saucer.
Cherry Lifesaver Shooter: Shake with ice and strain into shot glass.
Egg Nog - Williamsburg: Separate the eggs (yolk and white) Set the white aside. Mix yolks well, gradually adding the cream, milk, and sugar. Get back to the egg white - WHIP IT (whip it good!) until "soft peaks" form. Fold the white into the rest. Gradually add the alcohol. Either add nutmeg right away, or sprinkle on top later. AGE for at least 2 hours in refridgerator, uncovered.
French Russchian: Put the ice cubes in the glass, pour the Anisette in, fill with Schweppes Russchian
Mimosa: Pour orange juice into a collins glass over two ice cubes. Fill with chilled champagne, stir very gently, and serve.
Flaming Cocaine: Chill the shot glass until a frost has developed on it. All ingredients should be chilled. Add the Aftershock and several small crystals, then add the Vodka, and finally the Cranberry juice.
Grand Marnier: Posted to rec.food.recipes by Dan Aleksandrowicz.
Wile E Coyote: Very refreshing drink after a hard day of chasing Road Runners!
Lamb Brothers: In a shaker half-filled with ice cubes, combine all of the ingredients. Shake well. Strain into a cocktail glass.
Glacier Mint: Stir the ingredients together and strain into a sugar-rimmed cocktail glass. Garnish with mintleaves.
Embolism: Add Rum and Grenadine to a glass. Fill with Coke. Ice optional.
Whisky Martini: Mix ingredients in cocktail glass with chipped ice.
Purple Crayon: Pour Chambord and Vodka over ice. Fill to top with pineapple juice. Garnish with purple grape and pineapple slice.
Maryville Sweet: pour soouthern comfort and lime juice over ice, stir, enjoy
Pimp Cocktail: This drink is a combination of the peach and orange flavors but is a bright green color. A very festive drink indeed! -- Also known as "The Knightrider".
The Mummy: I invented this while watching the movie "The Mummy"
Royal Peaches and Cream: I created this drink to be a replica of the taste of fresh homemade peach ice-cream.
Terror From the Deep: Smells bad, tastes worse. If someone pukes after drinking this, you'll know where the name comes from.
Tequila Cocktail: Shake all ingredients (except lemon slice) with ice and strain into a cocktail glass. Add the slice of lemon and serve.
Royal Peach: Can also be enjoyed over ice in a rocks glass.
Sizz Snot: Whilst sipping this cocktail through the lips there should be a sensation of a thicker, slimey liquid going into your your mouth and down your throat.
Champs Elysees Cocktail: Shake all ingredients with ice, strain into a cocktail glass, and serve.
Star Burst: This cocktail was designed by LoneStar steakhouse and saloon in Brighton, Victoria, Australia!
Ejhazz: Add Vidka and peach juice. Fill glass with ice and add vanilla to taste. If the drink is too sweet, dilute it with water.
Stirrup Cup: Shake all ingredients with ice, strain into an old-fashioned glass over ice cubes, and serve.
Funky Monkey: This is a house specialty drink from the Bellagio Hotel and Casino in Las Vegas.
Detroit Diesel: Ultimately you determine your own tastes, but allow enough Chartreuse to level off the taste of the ginger. The Jager will hold it's own, keep total liquor the same and adjust ratio of Jager and Chartreuse per taste.
Velvet Tongue: Add Southern Comfort, Canadian Club and fill with ginger ale over ice to a highball glass.
Whitecap Margarita: I found this recipe in a magazine and tried it on several friends and they all agree, it's a keeper.
Dirty Martini #2: Great drink for those pesky costumers that keep pecking at your olives. Very Popular drink in NY.
Four Roses Cocktail: Cocktail created and distributed nationally for a 1935 Four Roses Whiskey ad campaign. Any straight whiskey may be used.
A Sunny Delight: Should taste like Carbonated Sunny Delight, with a hint tang. Regular Vodka can be used but is a poor substitute.
Legspreader #2: Drink originated in Memphis Tennessee. Now the number one selling fufu drink in Little Rock area even more than marg X.
Continental: Shake all ingredients (except lemon peel) with ice and strain into a cocktail glass. Add the twist of lemon peel and serve.
Wicked Tasty Treat: Dip the rim of cocktail glass in Amaretto and then into powdered sugar. Shake all alcohol and cream with ice and strain into rimmed cocktail glass. Garnish with Cinnamon stick and whipped cream (optional)
The Roni: after a couple of these, you'll know what's it's like... havin' a RONI!!!!!
Buccaneer: This gem lets you feel the gentle tradewinds and hear soft island rhythms. A parrotthead's dream. No additional lime needed.
Rum Daisy: In a shaker half-filled with ice cubes, combine the rum, lemon juice, sugar, and grenadine. Shake well. Pour into an old-fashioned glass and garnish with the cherry and the orange slice.
Sazerac: Pour Ricard into a glass and swirl around to coat glass, discard any excess. Place the sugar, Peychaud bitters, and water int othe glass and muddle with the back of a teaspoon. Almost fill the glass with ice cubes. Pour the bourbon over the ice cubes.
Liquid Sword: Mix liquors in tall glass with ice, fill with Orange Juice
John Collins: In a shaker half-filled with ice cubes, combine the bourbon, lemon juice, and sugar. Shake well. Strain into a collins glass almost filled with ice cubes. Add the club soda. Stir and garnish with the cherry and the orange slice.
Laser Beam: combine all liquor in full glass of ice. shake well. garnish with orange and cherry
Conga Line: Created by Jose Ruiseco. First place in the 1998 United States Bartender's Guild Cocktail Competition.
Saucy Sue Cocktail: Stir all ingredients with ice, strain into a cocktail glass, and serve.
Green delight: Just mix all the ingredients. It is also best served cold.
Sloughdriver: This drink looks like sewage(especially with the peel floating on top) but tastes like a normal screwdriver. We discovered it on new years.
Big Pine Puss: Very smooth and refreshing shot. It originated in Big Pine key in the Florida Keys duing Spring Break 1994. The Puss is not a sexual reference but rather a description of the taste and relatively low potency of the shot.
Hudson: Revved up peach schnappes. The gin taste is not distinguishable.
Apple and Cinnamon Joy: This drink is a taste sensation to be reckoned with. Created on a late night by some college students.
Extra Fuzzy Navel: A Fuzzy Navel's older brother. This sure tastes like a fuzzy navel but will knock you on your ass a lot quicker. It's also a good party drink if mixed in a large punch bowl.
Harlee's Planters Punch: measure light and dark rum into glass, add juices, grenadine...shake well, top with 151 rum... garnish with cherry and orange slice.
Surfer On Acid #2: Cannot substitute Chambord for anything. A phrase some of my fellow bartenders say "You can pour Chambord over a terd and it would taste good".
Limon and Ginger: The perfect summer drink. This will even win over people who say they can't stand rum.
Acapulco Twister: This drink was created by my friends after the movie Twister, it has great and fresh taste speacially for the summer at the beach were we actually created. This drink was made proudly at Acapulco and has got more that a drunk out of it.
Strawberry Shortcake: Tastes Just Like Strawberry Shortcake. Recipe Came From A Bar in Cleveland. Great Drink for Ladies Who Do Not Like Harsh Tasting Drinks.
Brown Bomber: Shake all ingredients with ice, strain into a cocktail glass, and serve.
