Aloha Fruit punch: Add 1/4 cup water to ginger root. Boil 3 minutes. Strain. Add the liquid to the guava, lemon and pineapple juices. Make a syrup of sugar and remaining water. Cool. Combine with juices and pineapple. Chill throroughly.
Stinger Shot: Tabasco in the bottom of the shot. Pour Vodka and Crème de Mènthe gently on top. Shoot!
Slow Screw: Pour sloe gin into a highball glass filled with ice. Fill with orange juice, stir well, and serve.
BFD (Bad F****** Drink): Good at parties. Strong drink that tastes mysteriously like straight grapefruit juice. We have discovered that it tastes good for a long time (maybe even gets better) if kept cold.
Chapala: Shake all ingredients (except orange slice) with ice and strain into an old-fashioned glass over ice cubes. Add the slice of orange and serve.
Gorilla's Fart: Mix all ingredients in a separate glass with Ice, then pour it into the shot glass. Drink straight up.
Brandy Fizz: In a shaker half-filled with ice cubes, combine the brandy, lemon juice, and sugar. Shake well. Strain into a highball glass almost filled with ice cubes. Add the club soda. Stir well.
Mountain Dew #1: Fill half beer glass with beer. Fill other half with 7-UP soda (If you have the patience, pour a little of one, then a little of the other, until the glass is full). Fill a shot glass with Melon liqueur. Drop entire shot glass into glass of beer. Immediately drink entire pint of beer with shot glass still inside (do not swallow the shot glass).
Kiss-In-The-Dark: Stir all ingredients with ice, strain into a cocktail glass, and serve.
Hoo Doo: This is really meant to be a slow-sipping drink.
Creme de Spooge: Mix half a beer with half of a cream soda.
Morning Glory Fizz: Shake all ingredients (except carbonated water) with ice and strain into a highball glass over two ice cubes. Fill with carbonated water, stir, and serve.
Adam's Apple: Another way to drink Galliano! Very easy to make and it tastes great.
Bananas and Cream: stir until ingredients are mixed well.
Bart Simpson: Chill and serve in large shot glass
Bacardi Gold & Cola: Fill a tall glass completely with ice cubes. Mix the ingredients into the glass and serve with a slice of lemon put on the glass. It is a very simple drink, but never the less it is very deliscious - especially in the summertime.
Hat Trick #1: In a mixing glass half-filled with ice cubes, combine the dark rum, light rum, and vermouth. Stir well. Strain into a cocktail glass.
Waborita: This is the special drink of Sammy Hagar, whose backup band is called the Waborita's. This receipe (which is similar to a Special Tequini) can be found on his new CD, "Red Voodoo". Mas Tequila!
Waldorf-Astoria Eggnog: Shake well over ice cubes in a shaker and strain into a large highball glass over ice cubes. Sprinkle with nutmeg.
Melon Jones: It is similar to a Melon Sour but with more kick. Don't let the Everclear scare you away - this drink as mixed is around 20% alcohol. It is very smooth and many people have liked it.
Carolina Dream: This drink was inspired by the intense heat of the Fourth of July in the south east.
Monarchy Luau Punch: Remove rind and core form pineapple, coarsely chop fruit. Combine pineapple, brandy and sugar, marinate 6 hours or overnight. Pour pineapple juice into a ring mold and freeze. Add wine to pineapple-brandy mixture, refrigerate 30 minutes. Add pineapple juice ring and champagne just before serving.
Flaming Lamborghini: I know it seems a tad theatrical but bar customers do love the whole ritual of cocktails like this and it may sound strange but it is actually a very pleasant tasting drink.
Deep Valley: Starting by the gin and the blue curacao and finishing by the soda, mix directly into a collins glass filled with ice. Garnish with a long lemon twist, a cherry and mint leaves.
An Irish Kiss: Quite good. Originally found at Kierans Irish Pub in Minneapolis (http ://www.kierans.com/). Ingredient amounts are estimates.
Love-me Tender: This cocktail will partecipate to italian cocktail competition on 11/11/97 in Taormina (Italy)
Texas Sling: Blend with Ice until smooth. Serve in a tulip glass, top with whip cream.
Robson Cocktail: Shake all ingredients with ice, strain into a cocktail glass, and serve.
Mom's Apple Pie: Pour apple schnapps over ice and float Hot Damn on top.
Mint Collins: Shake gin and juice of lemon with ice and strain into a collins glass over ice cubes. Fill with carbonated water and stir. Add slices of orange and lemon, top with the cherry, and serve with a straw.
Blue Shark: Combine all ingredients in a cocktail shaker with cracked ice. Shake well. Strain into chilled old-fashioned glass.
French Connection #2: Combine ingredients into a snifter and serve neat, or add a small amount of ice if desired.
Occhi Blu: "Occhi Blu" won a cocktail competition (A.i.b.e.s. associazione italiana barmen e sostenitori-regionale triveneto) on 30/03/98.
Red Eye a la Cocktail: From the movie Cocktail. Some friends at a party asked me "Bahtenda, d'you know how to make a redeye?" ala Doug Coglin. This seems to be a morning-after drink... or a dare.
Portland Coffee: The winters get cold in Oregon. This drink will definitely take the chill off those cold winter nights.
Grand Master: Pour the Scotch, schnapps, and soda into a highball glass almost filled with ice cubes. Stir well. Garnish with the lemon twist.
Jamaica Glow: Shake all ingredients with ice, strain into a cocktail glass, and serve.
Daydream: If the right amount of grenadine is used, it should be the color of orange sherbert. -- Just one of the creations invented at The RoadHouse NightClub in International Falls, Minnesota. -- Lemon Tattoo is a lemon flavored schnapps that temporarily dyes your mouth yellow.
Original Terminator: Drink was invented 10 years ago in Wayne, NJ. Still popular at clubs along Jersey shore.
Wine Cooler: Mix wine and soft drink. Pour into glass. Add ice.
Smurf on the Rag: I got drunk one night with Smurfette but she wouldn't put out because she was on the rag.
ZaZa: Pour a dash of angostura bitters into the bottom of the glass. Add gin and Dubonnet. Stir.
El Bastardo: One time, I drank 18 El Bastardos at a party in less than 2 hours. I woke up three days later in Pakistan with amnesia and a killer hangover, but it was worth the trouble! I had quadruple tunnel-vision for 4 days afterward, plus I couldn't put together a coherent sentence.
Hershey Squirts: Discovered by Hernan Barangan and Chris Newnan in Jan 1989
Toasted Fisherman: My wife and I discovered this in an old hotel bar in Ohio called The Antlers. Excellent.
Foreplay: Mix both ingredients together in a tumbler with ice. Strain into a shot glass! Enjoy!
Susan Littler: Pour all of the ingredients into a highball glass almost filled with ice cubes. Stir well.
Purple VW: This is not a drink to be shot, it is far too sweet for that, this drink is quite sweet but it packs a bit of a punch. Good for drinking games.
The Kuoyamuli: Mix ingredients swiftly with a spork in either a irish coffee mug, or cappuchino mug. Serve hot/warm.
Bermuda Highball: Pour brandy, gin, and dry vermouth into a highball glass over ice cubes. Fill with carbonated water and stir. Add the twist of lemon and serve. (Ginger ale may be substituted for carbonated water, if preferred.)
Chocolate Cow: Pour all ingredients over ice in cocktail glass.
Polo Cocktail: Shake all ingredients with ice, strain into a cocktail glass, and serve.
Party Punch: Combine all ingredients in a punch bowl.
Gorilla Fart #2: Just add the 2 ingredients, and shoot it.
Lake George Iced Tea: Best drink of the upcoming millenium. Will be featured at Clint n' Josh's at Grand Opening. Originated with the GLP of Lake George!
Caribbean Martini: Newly-created in New York and appearing in Los Angeles hotspots
Summer Sucker: It's worth the effort. It's rumored Mark Twain enjoyed this special treat, albeit with bourbon rather than vodka. Kids like it too. Note: this is not to be performed during any season other than summer. Cheers.
Kish Wacker: Mix the ingredients in the blender with ice. Tastes like a chocolate shake. *Can add Bailey's to taste.
Andrea's Colada Collision: Fill blender about 1/4 full with ice. Add all ingredients to blender. Blend to a smooth consistency. Serve in either a hurricane glass or a tall glass or goblet. Garnish with a pineapple spear is optional.
Skip And Go Naked: Pour gin and sweet and sour into a collins glass over ice cubes and stir well. Fill with chilled beer, stir lightly, and serve.
Vodka Grasshopper: Shake all ingredients with ice, strain into a cocktail glass, and serve.
Flaming Cornholio: A friend of mine stumbled upon this one night at a party in Clinton County, IL!!
South African Smoothie: Blend all ingredients on high until smooth. Pour into a tall glass and garnish with chocolate shavings and a cherry.
Pisang cold: Put the milk into a glass and put the Pisang ambong into it also. Shake and serve it cold with ice cubes.
Brandy Cooler: Pour the brandy and the soda into a highball glass almost filled with ice cubes. Stir well. Garnish with the lemon wedge.
Pink Squirrel: Shake all ingredients with ice, strain into a cocktail glass, and serve.
Hot Butterscotch Cocoa: Mix ingredients in coffee mug, top with whipped cream.
Memachau: Mmm... way to shake off those college finals blues...
Bee Stinger: Shake ingredients with ice, strain into a cocktail glass, and serve.
Frozen Blue Daiquiri: This is a new generation of Daiquiri. A very nice colour drink.It is about the same as other Daiquiri except for its colour only.
Hot Buttered Cranberry Punch: Crush cranberry sauce with a fork. Mix with sugar, spices and salt. Add water and pineapple juice. Cover and simmer 2 hours. Ladle into mugs and float a pat of butter in each serving.
Brandon and Will's Coke Float: Scoop two large scoops of vanilla ice-cream into frosted beer mug. Next, add 2 ounces Maker's Mark. Then, pour in coke. Gently stir and enjoy.
Darkwood Sling: This drink vas invented in Molde during the jazz festival, and has its name from the inventor.
Silver Fizz: Makes a great breakfast drink during the holidays. Don't be scared off by the egg, it is really a great drink!
Hard Green Bricaki: It's a super-tropical drink with a kick. Also makes a delicious shot!
San Patricio: This drink originated in Berkeley as I was speaking to the new barkeep who had Irish heritage. I myself am of Mexican heritage so together we created the San Patricio (said in Spanish). It is named after the Irish-American troop that sided with the Mexican's during the Mexican-American War. Optional variations include a 1 oz. shot of Bushmills or a 1 oz. shot of Añejo Tequila.
Glogg - Christmas: Stir half a bottle of the wine with the spicesand sugar under heating, close to boiling. Remove casserolee from heat. Set aside for 24 hours. Strain off spices, and add remaining wine, vodka, and sherry. Add appx. 10 dashed aromatic tincture (this is a spice concentrate). Bottle your glogg, seal well, and let mature for a week. Mix with red wine or water, heat and serve in irish coffee cup.
Greenback: Shake all ingredients with ice, strain into an old-fashioned glass over ice cubes, and serve.
Key West Lemonade: People will suck this drink down, there is no hint of alcohol when mixed properly. Just watch out when the drinkers try to walk after having a few, that's 2 shots of Vodka per serving. A big glass will have many ounces of vodka and you can't taste it at all. Drink responsibly, this one can get you and you won't know it till you try to stand up!! Thanks to April in Key West for this one, it's been a long time favorite for me. Wish I could remember the bar name, some place by Mallory Square across from the Pirates Den. Figures I remember that place.
Pearl Necklace #2: Tastes best when mixed/shot with ZZ Top's Pearl Necklace played at full volume. Swallow, don't spit.
Enchantress: Invented on a whim, one of my many concotions. It was so good I had to name it after myself -- one little vanity.
Dark Indulgence: Blend all ingredients. Pour into Poco grande glass.
Florida Pina Colada: A typical pina colada with the addition of orange juice for a fresh taste variation.
Black and Blue Shark: To bring out the Jack Daniels flavor, chase with ginger ale.
Arizona Stingers: This drink was stumbled upon (and I mean stumbled) accidentally on Halloween night by people dressed as bees ! As the rest of the story goes, it's safe to say we got stung that night! Bzzzzzzzzzzzzz.................
Depressed Goalie: I prefer to not mix it as I get to progress into a stronger drink as the jar get nearer to the end. -- Made by a Colorado College Goalie when he is depressed and needs a drink.
Thunder Peel: It's Damn Good!!! It's nammed after a Beck song, so it's got to be good!
Parisette: Pour grenadine syrup over some ice cubes in a large tumbler. Stir. Fill up with cold milk. Stir again, serve with a drinking straw.
Cable Car: Credit to Tony Abou-Ganim for this wonderful cocktail.
Dutch turbo: It already won a price in Holland!
Bushwacker #2: Fill blender 3/4 with ice (small cubes best). Add a small splash of vodka, a small splash of Grand Marnier. Add a healthy serving of kahlua and a little less healthy splash of amarreto. Fill the blender with Bailey's until liquid is 1/2 inch from top of icecubes. Mix until smooth. Pour in hurricane glass and sprinkle some nutmeg on top! (Sorry about the vagueness. I learned this recipe while bartending in the Virgin Islands -- St. Thomas before it was demolished by Marylin. The drink is kick ass! The consistency should be like a milk shake, except without the milk. Also, this drink may be a bit expensive here (liquor is EXTREMELY cheap in the Caribbean)).
Jamaican Coffee: Stir the rum, coffee and water together. Top with the whipped cream. Sprinkle with a pinch of well ground coffee and drink with a straw.
Lemon Drop #2: Mix equal parts Absolut Citron and sweet & sour over ice then strain into a shot glass. Sprinkle sugar on lemon slice. Drink shot, then suck the lemon!
Black Gold: pour both ingredients in shot glass and enjoy!
Fruit Cooler: Toss strawberries with sugar, and let sit overnight in refrigerator. Cut lemon, reserve two slices. Juice the rest. Mix together the lemon juice, strawberries, apple juice, and soda water. Add slices of lemon (decor, really). In glasses, put ice cubes, and a slice of apple. Pour drink in, and serve.
Ladder: This drink was founded by D.J. van der Beek. I put it on the internet. The drink is called 'Ladder'. Its a dutch word from the expression 'ladder zat'. It means: getting really drunk. Enjoy this cocktail!
Lime Chu-Hai: Probably the most popular mixed drink in Japan. The name "Chu-hai" comes from "sho-CHU" and "HIGH-ball glass"
Chocolate Raspberry Brownie: When we first tried this beverage at the tavern, my glass disappeared and came back empty. It can be made with milk instead of cream, but it is best with cream.
Cajun Comforter: A nice drink, really. A drink for grampa while he sits on the porch on a midsummer evening, listening to zydeco.
Pink Lemonade #2: Add ice, vodka, sour mix, cranberry and lime juice. Shake and serve with a garnish of lemon
The Irresistible Manhattan: You may also put the pitcher in the freezer for a few hours and serve it "up" in a martini glass. Be careful, these have been known to be addictive.
Black and Brown: I prefer Henrys for the rootbeer (cold) and the Guinness warm and flat. I have used other beers and for me stouter is better. Porter works. You may vary the 50/50 proportions to taste. One of the most charming traits of this drink is the disgusted looks you get when you order it.
Peltikatto: Squeeze juice from a fresh lemon. Mix with Koskenkorva.
Washington Apple Martini: Posted by Natrone in the forums on 20. Nov. 2004.
C3PO: From a galaxy far, far away.
J. R.'s Revenge: In a mixing glass half-filled with ice cubes, combine all of the ingredients. Stir well. Strain into a cocktail glass.
Grapeschlager: This one was created on a boring night. Suprisingly, we all liked it!
Tropical Lust: Fill glass with ice, add gin and vodka. Almost fill with pineapple juice, then add SoCo and melon liqueur. The drink can also be made frozen by adding 1 1/2 scoops of ice and blending.
Baywatch: The drink is perfect for a day at the beach and it is from Denmark
Harlem Mugger: it got it's name as it does your head in and takes all your money
Thorny Mexican: I love to take tequila shots, but i also like sweet drinks. Thorny Mexican is the best of both worlds!
La Jolla: In a shaker half-filled with ice cubes, combine all of the ingredients. Shake well. Strain into a cocktail glass.
The Finnely: Mix all ingredients, shake and pore over ice in a collins glass. Garnish with a lemon, lime, and orange wedge.
Creamy Screwdriver: Combine all ingredients with 1/2 cup crushed ice in an electric blender. Blend at a low speed for a short length of time. Pour into a collins glass and serve.
Wembly Cocktail: Stir all ingredients with ice, strain into a cocktail glass, and serve.
Moilanen: If you want a real Moilanen you should get a 1 1/2 litres plastic bottle, cut it of in the middle and use it as a glass. I've tried with a beer glass and it's not the same feeling but it will do. -- Invented it all by my self on a trip to Corfu in Greece. I prefer this drink in the summer, it's a real cooler. Enjoy!
Three Stages of Friendship: Mix all three in a shot glass and shoot the damn thing.
Apple Jack: Very simple and very tasty. Hope you enjoy your drink.
Flaming Kevin: This drink was created by Kevin Klein. The nutrasweet in Diet Pepsi takes the bite out of Everclear. A couple of them will mess you up.
Martini (Traditional 2-to-1): Stir gin and vermouth over ice cubes in a mixing glass. Strain into a cocktail glass, add the olive, and serve.
Emerald Forest: In a mixing glass half-filled with crushed ice, combine all of the ingredients. Stir well. Strain into a cocktail glass.
Superjuice: Shake or mix the vodka, gin, and orange juice. Pour over ice. Add tonic water and lime juice, stir slightly.
Tuve Nightmare: Mix the Vodka with the cider or the wine. Drop the fruit from a height of at least 3 feet. Pour the sprite and the Ginger Ale with the rest Carefully pour the Pisang Ambon into the punch. Enjoy!
Guinness Shandy: From Guinness.com: "The practice of drinking Guinness with lemonade is rumoured to have started with the New Zealand rugby team, during a British tour. After a game, they ordered Guinness and lemonade (instead of bitter shandy), and found it extremely refreshing.
Caribbean Bliss: Use chilled orange juice, but no ice.
Mocha Martini: mix ingredients in a shaker with ice and strain into a chilled martini glass
Olympia-Flip: Put ingredients in shaker with ice, shake very well, pour out in a cocktail glass and put some fine cracked almonds over it as a decoration.
Whistling Gypsy: Goes down smooth with a great aftertaste.
Grand Mimosa: Pour Grand Marnier into a Champagne Flute. Fill almost to the top with Champagne and top off with fresh Orange Juice.
Russian Apple: This is a popular drink with the student population of Chico State in Chico California.
Nuclear Ice Tea: It is like a Long Island Ice Tea, but becomes very contaigous at bars because everyone wants "one of those green drinks"
Liquid Cocaine #6: I'm sure this is about the 100th version of this drink, but this one is not as potent and usually goes down a little smoother. Try it and see.
Avocado Daiquiri: Although this drink has been around for a while, you may not have tried it. It's not your everyday Daiquiri, but it has a refreshing summer flavor. Depending on your avocado and your personal taste, you may want to add a pinch of salt or a pinch of sugar.
Scotch Mist: Pack a collins glass with crushed ice. Pour in scotch. Add the twist of lemon peel and serve with a straw.
Cowboy's Comet: If you mix this properly, you will hardly taste any alcohol.
Mekong: I heard a song about Mekong (titled just that), could not find the drink anywhere... I made this after work for some friends... they loved it. Based on the lyrics (and some personal interpretation), this drink became the Mekong.
Martinet: Less sweet and more complex than a straightforward gimlet, it still has the deep green color and sweet acidity that Rose's lime juice lends it. And it tastes better than martinis. I like it with Boodles or Tanqueray gin.
Irish Monk: Great for cold, wintery, lonely nights. But, better for cold, wintery, nights to share with someone.
Brian Sinnott Family Punch - Unleaded: I was first introduced to this drink in its "unleaded" form while attending some 1997 holiday festivities. Brian Sinnott is an ex-fiance of Kristine Hunter, middle sister of Beth Hunter, who is my ex-wife. Anyway, his family created this tremendously wonderful "kool-aid" punch, and used it for all of their family occasions. Through careful scientific experimentation, I have created a wonderful and magnificent champagne-kool-aid punch to use for parties, New Year, Christmas, birthday celebrations, etc. Printed above are instructions for the original "unleaded" version of the drink. I posted a "leaded" version of this drink on the Webtender that uses sparkling wine, vodka, and rum to make a champagne-cool-aid punch. This is a wonderful tasting punch, despite its Kool-Aid roots. I prefer its nice sweet, tangy, and bubbly taste to the more popular sherbet punches you find at parties. One batch is probably good for a party of 5-10 people. Make two batches for medium parties of 10-20 people. (This also maximizes the fact that frozen juice usually comes in 12oz sizes anyway.)
Glogg - Grandmother's: Mix everything in a casserole. Keep overnight. Heat the mixture - do NOT boil. Strain and serve hot woth raisins and almonds. (You have to throw the almonds in boiling water for maybe a minute, and peel of the brown 'coating'. They should be white for use with glogg.) Serve in irish coffee cup.
Deer Killer: Mix all drinks in a blender, You can add 8 cubes of ice to chill the drink and give it more of a body. Add the Hot melting butter(or the schapps right before you drink). Makes enough for at least 10 people.
Black Tooth: The "black tooth" is the offcial drink of heavy metal group Pantera.
Skydiver: Fill glass with ice, add SKYY vodka, add orange juice, prefeable fresh orange juice. Garnish with orange slice.
Gin Fix: In a shaker half-filled with ice cubes, combine the sugar, lemon juice, and water. Shake well. Strain into a highball glass almost filled with crushed ice. Add the gin. Stir well and garnish with the cherry and the lemon slice.
Jose Flame-O: First put Tequila in shot glass, then add Firewater
Navel Caribbean Love: Pour 3 oz of Malibu into the Hurricane glass. Slowly pour in the Orange juice, and VOILA!
Frothy Redhead: Add in said order. Do not shake, soda will mix. Garnish with 2-3 grapes and sprinkle with sugar. Named after a friend who demanded a new drink.
Jamaican Sunset: This is a house specialty drink from the Bellagio Hotel and Casino in Las Vegas.
Sex Appeal: A refreshing alchoholic beverage. A "Girlie Drink" , created by Steve and Simon at the British Embassy Rock Bar, Redhill-England.
Patti's Irish Bloody Mary: Rim coffee mug with celery salt, Pour Baileys over ice and fill with bloody mary mix. Garnish with pickle spear and filberts.
Mazerati: Pour 3/4 oz Absolut Citron in a highball glass, balance with cranberry juice, top with 7-up, and garnish with lime.
Fuzzless Navel: The non-alcoholic variation of the Fuzzy Navel.
Penthouse: Smoother than a regular tequila. Great start on a Penthouse party. Invented in Lund, Sweden.
Amoco Shot: It's called Amoco, because it looks and tastes like gasoline.
Blow Job #5: First put in the Creme De Banane Then float the baileys irish cream on top Then add a small shot of cream. Give the glass a quick swirl before drinking.
Southern Harmony: I came up with this because i dont like Triple Sec in Lynchburg Lemonaid
Unabomber: Before ingestion, grab large, stable objects to support you. This drink came from a failed attempt at kamikaze's... in retrospect, mission accomplished.
Harlem Cocktail: Shake gin, pineapple juice, and maraschino with ice and strain into a cocktail glass. Decorate with pineapple chunks and serve.
Sand In Your Crack: I am a bartender and was asked to make a "sex on the beach" for a customer. My bar was out of the raspberry ingrediant so i improvised a bit. I told the man that if you had sex on the beach, you would have "sand in your crack!"
Mumsicle: In a mixing glass half-filled with ice cubes, combine the rum, bourbon, and bitter. Stir well. Strain into a cocktail glass and garnish with the cherry
Jen's Hot Chocolate Butterscotch: Add one shot of butterscotch Schnapps to the hot chocolate. Top off with Bailey's.
Simple Charm: Smooth, charming taste! Especially for the ladies.
Rum a'la Olof: Poure the rum and the lemon-juice in the bowl, and mix it. Then you take the cocoa-powder and the hot coffee and mix it with the other stuff in the bowl. After that you poure your mixture in a shot-glass. The whipped cream you put on the top of the glass. Ready to be served!
Panty Dropper: This is a fairly common drink here in Seattle!!!
MVP's Strawberry Bomb: * If Tequila Rose can't be found (it's an awesome creamy strawberry flavored tequila) you can improvise by using 1/2 shot Tequila and 1/2 shot Bailey's Irish Cream. -- This is one of my Original Drinks, it began at a small little tavern in Delaware where I worked. It was a local favorite and the bar still uses it.
Winter Tropic: We invented this on our last day of finals.
The Real Windex: Shake vodka and liqueur with ice, strain into chilled glass, garnish with orange peel
Mean Green Machine: Shake well with ice and strain into glass.
Summer Tea: Make the tea and add all the stuff. Mix and enjoy.
Irish Curdling Cow: If you can get past the curdled look its not that bad!!
Patagonian Black Bush: Bitter taste drink used in old Patagonian country bars. Origin: Argentina.
Golden Cola: Coke may be replaced with Pepsi, and more may be added for taste. More ice may also be added to keep it cold. Excellent for drinking games.
Crockpot Mulled Cider: Posted to rec.food.recipes by Janie McKinney.
Another Hot Day in Fresno: Measures are approximate. I made this on a 110 degree day. Didn't matter how hot it was after that...
Shlagerfloat: My friends and I thought of this after almost polishing off our bottle of Goldschlager. Luckily, we had enough to each make a drink and I must say, it was definately worth it.
Polar Bear, Swedish: Mix Absolut Vodka and Blue Curaco, fill it up with Sprite. Use lots of icecubes.
Charlie's Angel: If desired, customer can mix the soda in to create a mildly diluted and carbonated drink. If left in a float style, the soda acts as a refreshing cleanse of the palate at the end of the drink.
Dan's Dewberry Martini: I just recently invented this drink at the nightclub i work at and it was a big hit! It's a very dry cocktail when made properly and is addictive.
Glogg #1: Pour the wine & vodka into a large pot. Add spices, fruit and nuts. Turn on the heat and bring the ingredients to a temperature just below the boil. Now for the fun part. Invite all of your guests into the kitchen. Place the sugar cubes in a sieve (one that you don't mind sacrificing to the greater good). Don oven mitts and set the glogg on fire. Ladle the burning glogg over the sugar cubes until it has all melted. I usually do this with the overhead lights off for greater theatrics. When the sugar is melted, cover the pot to extinguish the flame. Ladle glogg, fruit and nuts into irish coffe cups and serve.
Chocolate Orange: This drink is reminiscent of a Chocolate Orange, with a nice smooth flavor to it. White Creme de Cacao makes for the best looking version of this drink.
Airhead: The origin of the Airhead.... We do not know whether this drink already exists, but one night we decided to experiment. Erika and Heather were at Erika's empty house (litterally) preparing for a party. After many shots we came up with something that we both enjoyed. Combining our names Er-Hea-d : Airhead. Enjoy!
Snowball #2: Take the glass and rub the edge on a lemon, then dip the rim in sugar. Drop the ice cubes into the glass, pour a 1/3 liqueur and fill it up with Sprite. Stir.
Agent Orange: Hurricane glass filled with ice add ingredients shake cherry and orange garnish
Cappucino Cocktail: Shake all ingredients well with cracked ice, strain into a cocktail glass, and serve.
Chill Out Shock (C.O.S): This drink was introduced in Israel about a year and a 1/2 ago by the importer of the "Buttershots" caramel schnapps as a promotion measure. To me personal opinion the drink is excellent and all the people I made it for agreed.
Purple Plague: Mix Zinfandel with Chambord and add 7-Up. Serve on ice.
Wassail #1: Heat the water to boiling. Cut the lemons and oranges (and lime if using) in half and squeeze the juice into a separate bowl to save, throw the skins and pulp into the boiling water. Add spices and simmer for one hour. Remove the cinnamon sticks and a few cloves and allspice and save to one side. Using a slotted spoon or strainer remove the citrus peels and pulp and the remaining spices. Return the cinnamon sticks and saved spices to the water. Add the apple juice or cider and return to heat. When boiling remove from heat and add the citrus juice and sugar. Simmer very lightly for another 10 minutes and serve. Delicious!
Forest Funk: Moisten the rim of the Collins glass with a lime wedge and coat the rim with granulated sugar. Ice the glass and build the vodka and peach schnapps. Top with grapefruit juice.
Dallas Stars: Some of my friends and I made up shots for different teams during the 1999 NHL Stanley Cup Playoffs. This shot signifies Dallas' colours - Green and Gold.
Massacre: Killer drink at parties. Very tasty and the aftertaste is slim to none, yet the buzz factor comes pretty quickly for a mixed drink. Enjoy!
Harvard Cooler: Pour 2 oz. carbonated water in a collins glass. Add powdered sugar and stir. Add ice cubes and apple brandy. Fill with carbonated water and stir again. Add the twist of lemon peel and the spiral of orange so that the end dangles over rim of glass.
Typhoon: Shake all ingredients (except champagne) with ice and strain into a collins glass over ice cubes. Fill glass with chilled champagne, stir lightly, and serve.
Salty Chihuahua: Pour tequila over ice in a cocktail glass. Fill with grapefruit juice and add a dash of salt.
The Bionic Drink: This drink works best in the Bionic drinking game, so keep playing.
Irish Whip: The Irish whip comes from the small Island of Guernsey. It is drank on St Patricks day and any time Ireland is playing in a world cup soccer game.
Killer Kool-Aid (Rhode Island): WARNING: This drink is VERY POTENT!!! You may not realize by tasting it how strong it is, but two or three will put you out for the count! Due to the particular mix of these liquors, it will taste like a non-alcoholic drink. BE CAREFUL!!!
Barracuda: Put the liquor in the shot glass equally
California Rattle Snake: This drink, if made correctly, has little to no strong alcohol taste. -- To make it a Florida Rattle Snake, substitute Orange Juice for the Sour mix.
Blue Tahoe: Drink at Tahoe during a sunset or anywhere to get a reminder of the color of Tahoe's waters.
Purple stealth: Pour vodka in large soft drink tumbler first. Tastes more like carbonated Ribena than grape soda. Very powerful!
Bailey's Comet #1: Shake and Strain the Butterscotch, Bailey's, and Goldschlager into a cocktail glass. Float the Sambuca, then sprinkle Cinnamon or Nutmeg into drink (Before you flame the drink). Just before presentation, flame the drink. As the Sambuca burns, the cinnamon will sparkle. A dazzling effect if the bartender or server is walking with the drink while it's burning (give the comet a tail).
Pink Elephant Ears: Mix pink lemonade per instructions on can. Add vodka, slices of lime, and ice. Mix well. Enjoy on a hot summer day on the boat!
Duchess: Shake all ingredients with ice, strain into a cocktail glass, and serve.
The Extinguisher: Combine all alchohol in 12 Oz. glass with ice. Add Sour Mix. Splash Cranberry Juice. Enough to form a layer of red at the top of the glass. Top with foam from draft beer tap.
Autumnal Equinox: Developed at the end of summer to be enjoyed as the days grow shorter.
Flaming Russian: Pour vodka in shot glass, carefully layer rum on top. Ignite rum and serve.
Porch Climber: Pour all over ice in large cooler. Then climmb the pporchs.
Suburban Warhead: This is a drink for those who like it strong.
Charlie's Angel #2: Has a cool body with a fierry head. Originated in a military boarding school in Kent.
Backdraft: Customer places hand over top of glass to form airtight seal that extinguishes flame. Straw is slid in between fingers keeping seal as tight as possible. Drink beverage through straw. Remove straw after drink is finished. Put glass to nose and remove hand to allow burnt fumes to be inhaled through nose. Definitely a one-a-nighter.
Long Island Iced Tea #5: Usually served in a 1 liter mug. A lot smoother flavor without Tequila and a lot more enjoyable. If being served in bars women tend to like it better. The only reason I said to use these brands for alcohol is because it is my rail at my bar but use the premiums there will be a smoother flavor
Iron Hindu: This drink was created for CMU spring Carnival '96, and was served at Kappa Delta Rho. I wanted a name that combind apricots with cardomom. Green cardomom is used in indian deserts, hence the
Campari Milkshake: I found this one in a german 1970's recipe-book. You can change the amount of campari if you want to. (I prefer 4 cl).
Platina Blonde: Poor Tequila in a glass, fill in with cream, stir.
Brown Cow #2: Also known as: Brown Cow When You Run Out Of Kahlua
Green Lantern: Mix all together in order, shake once and pour into glass.
Don's Bloody Mary: Put 4 or 5 ice cubes in a large old-fashioned glass and fill 3/4 full with Clamato juice. (Clamato may be mixed 1/2 and 1/2 with any other favorite tomato or veggie juice). Add the vodka, Worcestershire, Tabasco, and Horseradish and stir thoroughly with a spoon or swizzle. Twist the lime slice over the glass edge and stick a scallion in as a casual stirrer and delicious finish to the drink.
Stone Sour: Shake all ingredients with ice, strain into a chilled whiskey sour glass, and serve.
Jager Vacation: It looks like shit in a glass, but you won't care once you drink it!
Cielo: Created by Tony Abou-Ganim of the Bellagio Hotel in Las Vegas.
Fernet con Coca: Put some ice in a cocktail glass. Pour the Fernet and then fill with coke. No mixing required.
Tahitian Treat: Fill highball glass with ice. Add liquor, juice, and then Sprite.
Crazy Cow: Place all ingredients in the blender jar - cover and whiz on medium speed until well blended. Pour in one tall, 2 medium or 3 small glasses and drink up.
Purple Penis: Girls like this shot because the other ingredients mask the alcohol. When they ask for a shot, pretend you can't hear them so they yell out the name.
Amer Picon Cocktail: Shake all ingredients with ice, strain into a cocktail glass, and serve.
Chocolate Martini #3: Between the vanilla vodka, chocolate and added cherry, this drink is extremely sweet and not for the faint of heart.
Letitia's Penisbutter Cup: Combine all ingredients, pour over ice, and enjoy.
Brush Fire: WARNING: Extremely hot! This drink must be shot like it is a shot.
The Emily Weir: Let it slip down and wait for the world to go fuzzy. Best served on a balmy night with lots of ice.
Danny Q's Aruba Rum Punch: Combine all ingredients in a hurricane glass with ice. Shake Vigrously Serve with a cherry and orange slice for garinsh.
Martina Mandarina: My own creation inspired by the Cosmopolitan Martini. Other orange/mandrin lovers will enjoy this variation.
Georgia Peach #2: In a 10 oz highball filled with ice, add Southern Comfort, peach schnapps and fill with orange juice. Mix. Top with a dash of grenadine. Garnish with cherry and serve.
Blow Job #4: Layer each ingredient into a Sherry Glass in order as listed. Indulge in this creamy minty flavour!
Stinky Weasel: Less filling, tastes great, with a sweet twist.
Almond Casa Noble: Shake ingredients in mixing glass with ice, except almond, then strain into a cocktail glass. Drop lime in glass.
Ramos Fizz #2: Fill glass with cracked ice and add gin, cream, lemon juice, egg white, sugar and orange juice. Shake and strain into a chilled Collins glass, then add Club soda.
Saratoga Cocktail: Shake all ingredients with ice, strain into a cocktail glass, and serve.
Jumper Cable: Pour rum over ice, fill with Jolt, and stir.
Carolina: pour strega into chilled wine glass, add champagne. Stir slightly.
Mellow Hiker: Combine alcohol over ice and add Mountain Dew. Stir and Garnish with Melon ball if desired.
Seabreeze: Pour vodka over ice into highball glass. Add mixers. May be garnished with a wedge of lime.
A Goodnight Kiss: Great way to end the evening!
Nutty Irishman (without milk): Pour the Frangelico first over a glass with ice. Then, pour the Bailey's over the top, but do not stir the drink.
The Marv Alberts: Fill glass with 3 oz of Bailey's Irish Creme, then add 1 oz of Southern Comfort, followed by mixing in 1 oz of Buterscotch Schnapps.
Mikey Mike: Mix ingredients in a tumbler and shake thoroughly. Pour over ice into a 10 oz. glass and enjoy.
Tia-Maria: Boil water, sugar and coffe for 10 mins and let cool. Add rum and vanilla. Put in clean bottle(s) and leave for 1 week before using.
Virgin Manhattan: Shake with ice, strain and serve in a chilled cocktail glass, on on the rocks in an Old-fashioned glass. Granish with maraschino cherry.
Irish Dawg: Put vodka in first. then add the Baley's and cream. lightly stir and serve.
Pedro Collins: Full collins glass with ice, pour in Limon, add sweet and sour, fill with equal parts club soda and 7-up
SherryBear's Lemonade: I created this drink, when in the middle of a party, we ran out of OJ for Fuzzy Navels. It became the drink of the Athens State College campus, and my friend's declared it "SherryBear's Lemonade".
Seven and Seven: Put a few cubes of ice inside glass. Pour shot of Seagram 7 into the glass, then Pour 7-UP into glass. Shake or stir briskly.
Ma Wee Hen: In a shaker half-filled with ice cubes, combine all of the ingredients. Shake well. Strain into a cocktail glass.
The Big Johnson: Mix Lime Juice, then Vodka, then JD and 7-UP. Optional Grenadine dash last--pour around side of glass for effect. Serve on ice.
Cubano: Nice combination of sour and sweet.
Polar Bear #2: Just blend with ice in a highball glass.
Alexander #2: Shake all ingredients (except nutmeg) with ice and strain into a cocktail glass. Sprinkle nutmeg on top and serve.
Mexican's Revenge: I discovered this cocktail in Belfast. The cranberry juice really sets off the tequila.
The Dash: Well it all started in a wine bar in London. Myself Josh "The Baptist" Murray and Andy "Hatchett" Hockey (Baptising the stomach in beer, and put it down the hatch). We were after our favourite tipple, A Flaming Arsehole (advocaat and cherry brandy), and disaster struck... no cherry brandy. After much consultation with Pete the barman, it was decided that the only honourable substitute was creme de fraise, and low the dash was born. Enjoy it, its a pleasure.
Camel Hump: These were invented at Clancy's Sports bar in Azusa, CA.
Victory Collins: Shake all ingredients (except orange slice) with ice and strain into a collins glass over ice cubes. Add the slice of orange and serve.
Alice Cocktail: Shake well, strain into a large cocktail glass.
Sinlet: Mix the ingredients with a great deal of ice and garnish with a cherry.
Great Green Monster: Mix together and serve in a pitcher with ice.
Stinger #2: Shake with ice, strain, serve in cocktail glass
Eye of Swamp: Build in highball with lots of ice. Fill with Sprite.
Strawberry Punch #1: Allow strawberries to thaw for a couple of hours in fridge. Prepare lemonade and chill. Combine all just before serving and mix until sherbet is dissolved. Place ice ring in to keep punch cold.
Yellow Parrot: Stir with ice in a mixing glass. Strain into chilled cocktail glass.
Colibri: Shake well with ice in a shaker. Strain oover crushed ice in a highball glass.
Slider: Add Rye, khalua and milk to a high ball glass, glass should be full off ice.Stir and enjoy.
Greven: Pour vodka, passoa and orange juice over ice in the glass. Add the blue curacao and the lime. Do not stir.
Mexican Martini: Shake tequila and vermouth with ice. Strain into a cocktail glass, add pepper slice.
Flying Masturbator: This drink was invented in the Bahamas by John Ackerman
Orchard Downs: This is great drink for when you don't want to drink something citrus-based, or on warm nights. If you make it right it should taste like an apple tree (or cherryapple tree if you add grenadine). Named after an infamous University of Illinois Bus Line.
Helluva Hurricane: Best served with two straws and slammed between very close friends/lovers. Substitute Malibu or spiced rums for any of the three listed for a personalized ultimate hurricane.
Drunk Watermelon: Cut a hole in the top of the watermelon and pour all of the vodka in the watermelon. Put the watermelon (hole upwards) in the fridge for one day before eating.
Tomato Tang: Place all ingredients in the blender jar - cover and whiz on medium speed until well blended. Pour in one tall, 2 medium or 3 small glasses and drink up.
Black Hole: Fill glass 2/3 with ice, add Sambuca and fill with soda.
Gin Swizzle: In a shaker half-filled with ice cubes, combine the lime juice, sugar, gin, and bitters. Shake well. Almost fill a colling glass with ice cubes. Stir until the glass is frosted. Strain the mixture in the shaker into the glass and add the club soda.
Gin Sangaree: Dissolve powdered sugar in water and add gin. Pour into a highball glass over 2 ice cubes. Fill with carbonated water and stir. Float port on top, sprinkle lightly with nutmeg, and serve.
M&M;: Pour straight up into shot glass.
Retribution: Burns like fire and tastes like Christmas.
Jedi Mind Trick: Combine all contents in blender except cherries, blend until smooth. Pour in mug, garnish with cherries.
Chambrite: Very mild drink for those who don't like the taste of strong alcohol.
Jennifer's Orgasm: 1 ounce of each ingredient will make about three shots. My friends gave this concoction its name because of the reaction I had when I first drank it!
Flying Scotchman: Shake all ingredients with ice, strain into a cocktail glass, and serve.
Miami Hurricane: So named because I invented it in Miami, and after several, I felt like I had been hit by a hurricane!
Metropolitan: In a shaker half-filled with crushed ice, combine all of the ingredients. Shake well. Strain into a cocktail glass.
Nasty Bitch: Chill the tequila and the Cointreau and serve in a shot glass straight up.
Gareth Glowworm: In a shaker half-filled with ice cubes, combine the rum, creme de cacao, and heavy cream. Shake well. Strain into a cocktail glass. Drop the cherry brandy into the center of the drink.
Caribbean Blues: Mix all ingrediants gradually. Best results if poured over the crushed ice and then stirred.
Watermelon Shooter #3: In a large juice or water pitcher filled with ice cubes, pour equal parts pineapple juice and Jack Daniels. Stir, then add a splash of grenadine to give the mixture a pink, almost watermelon, tint. Stir until well chilled. Pour into shot glass, straining ice, and enjoy.
Jen's Creamy Sighs: A great warmer-upper - Even on mild days! Warning: This is a very rich drink. Not for the weak of heart (nor ones with clogged arteries)!
Raspberry kamikaze: Mix all ingredients in a glass and add ice ! Enjoy!!
Foreplay on the Neutral Ground: Created during Mardi Gras in New Orleans
Blonde Moment: Mix over Ice and garnish with a cherry
Mai Tai, Michael's Ultimate: Squeeze lime wedge in tall glass with ice. Add other ingredients. Sugar is optional.
Red Hot Lover: Found it on holiday in Zakynthos, Greece.
Leaving Las Vegas: This drink was invented by my crazy brother Eddie, who begged me to put it on the internet for the whole world to enjoy. Eddie calls it " The feel good drink of the year!" As for the taste, you can not taste the alcohol!! It tastes just like Lemonade, with a surprise at the end of the night.
Shamrock: Stir all ingredients (except olive) with ice and strain into a cocktail glass. Add the olive and serve.
Erin's Sweater: Is good as a cocktail drink as well as for shots. Try it stirred instead of shaken.
The Reservoir Dog: Derived after Kahlua ran out while making B-52's. Jägermeister was used as a substitute. Was named after the the movie Reservoir Dogs. Tastes like cold chocolate milk.
Sour Kiss: Very interesting taste once you get past the color. Fans of fruity drinks will probably enjoy this one.
Imperial Fizz: Shake all ingredients (except carbonated water) with ice and strain into a highball glass over two ice cubes. Fill with carbonated water, stir, and serve.
Ruby Tuesday: Pour gin and cranberry into a highball filled with ice cubes. Add grenadine and stir.
California Gold Rush: This drink looks very pretty because the bubbles of carbon dioxide in the 7-up continuously move the gold flakes around.
Almond Joy: Shake all ingredients with ice, strain into a cocktail glass, and serve.
Jamestown Kool-Aid: Don't drink to much or you will die! Enjoy!
Black Cow: Can also be made with other carbonated soft drinks.
Montana: Stir all ingredients in an old-fashioned glass over ice cubes and serve.
Melon Tonic: Add vodka, melon liqueur, and lemon juice over ice in cocktail shaker. Shake 3-4 times, then add tonic water or club soda and shake once. Strain into cocktail glass or pour over ice into highball glass.
Ziemes Martini Apfelsaft: Serve without ice. At least the juice shold have room temperature.
Royal Flush #2: This can also be made as a cocktail. A very smooth, fruit-punch tasting drink. Be careful, though...these don't hit until about fifteen minutes later!
Pink Beaner: Not for the weak or politically correct. Physician approved. Interesting taste. Not horrible. May cause numb lips and dead hands.
Rum Swizzle: Dissolve powdered sugar in mixture of 2 oz. carbonated water and juice of lime in a collins glass. Fill glass with ice and stir. Add bitters and rum. Fill with carbonated water, stir, and serve with a swizzle stick.
Hop, Skip, and Go Naked: You will posetively get drunk if this is drank through a straw.
Tropical Nat: This is a favorite drink for summer parties, BBQs,and jimmy buffet concert tailgate parties!
Jetstream: This drink was improvised on New Year's Eve 1997 to celebrate my friend Roger's first exam at a private aviation academy. Unfortunately, he does not touch alcohol, so he will probably never taste it. Still, it was an instant success for everyone else attending the party. If you have any comments, suggestions or anything else-do mail me.
Piggelin #1: Mix it in a glass 1/4 full of ice...
Ishav: Shake vodka, Pisang and sour mix well with ice. Pour into a highball glass. Fill with soda water.
Toronto Maple Leafs: Some of my friends and I made up shots for different teams during the 1999 NHL Stanley Cup Playoffs. This shot signifies Toronto's colours - Blue and White.
Drool: Drew Hull in Lawrence, Kansas thought of this great tasting drink.
Lanette: Invented by Lanette Dunkeson in Cabo San Lucas. Served at all NHRA drag races in the Phoenix area (DiCarlo Racing Team).
Soda Cracker: Fill old fashioned glass with ice,add alcohol and enjoy!
Rob Love: Original recipe by Robert Skagseth, Trondheim, Norway.
Silk Stockings: Shake all ingredients (except cinnamon) with ice and strain into a cocktail glass. Sprinkle cinnamon on top and serve.
Lion Tamer: Mix Southern Comfort and Lime Juice in the Martini Glass. Top off with a pinch of Powdered Sugar. Add One Large Ice Cube. Serve.
Cinco de Mayo: This is a classic Mexican recipe for drinking Tequila. I don't remember where I learned it. I think it was a precursor to the modern Margarita. I didn't think Tequila & Grenadine would be a good combination, but the ingredients blend beautifully & this drink is outstanding!
Snake Piss: Fill glass with ice (crushed or cubes). Add ingredients and stir ocassionally.
Danger: This drink will get you VERY drunk in no time!!!
The Nick: Be carefull when you first get a wiff of this drink. It may seem as though the tequila is too overpowering, but give it a try.
Fat Cat: I work at a restuarant as a bartender and there is a waitress who is from Turkey. She can not speak English very well so she often orders drinks mispronouning them. One day she ordered a fat cat on the rocks meaning vodka on the rocks. So the manager and I decided to invent a drink called a Fat Cat.
Sweet Casa Noble: Use Casa Noble Gold for best taste results.
Flaming Giraffe: Inspired by my favorite painting, Girafe En Feu by Salvadore Dali
Butternut Rum Lifesaver: Mix ingredients Chill over ice Strain into shot glass
Blow Job #2: Layer the butterscotch schnapps and Irish Cream by pouring the Irish Cream over the back of a spoon. Spray the Whipped cream on top, pile it about 1-2 inches high. This shot must be taken without using your hands. Pick up the shot glass between your lips and tilt back.
Pink Cello: Pour into a tall glass over ice. Fill with cranberry juice. Garnish with wedge of lemon.
Dr. Shocker: Feel free to vary the amount of Aftershock to your taste.
Serena: I invented this long drink. It's a thirst-quencing drink.
The Shoot: Shake all ingredients with ice, strain into a cocktail glass, and serve.
Homemade Kahlua: Dissolve sugar in 2 cups of boiling water and add corn syrup. Dissolve the instant coffee in the remaining water. Pour syrup and coffee in a gallon jug. Let it cool. Add vodka and vanilla when cold. For the best result, let the mixture "mature" for 4-5 weeks.
Jesus is Here: A very good pre-party drink since russian kills the liquer taste completely as long as there are more russian than vodka in the drink. Two of these and you have fun!
Piss in the Snow: For a stronger and minty taste, add more Avalanche
Lady Love Fizz: Shake all ingredients (except carbonated water) with ice and strain into a cocktail glass over two ice cubes. Fill with carbonated water, stir, and serve.
French Cosmopolitan: I experimented with traditional Cosmopolitans and Kamakazes and came up with this combo by accident, since then it's caught on like fire at the Westin Seattle Lobby Bar ! :)
Tiki Torch: Fill glass halfway with Tang. Add Vodka until you can begin to taste the Vodka. Mix drink to taste.
Chocolate Valentine: Shake with ice and strain into a shot glass.
KiBa: Pour all ingredients into a highball glass over ice cubes and serve.
Chocolate Martini #4: Enjoyed by the bar staff at Storrowton Tavern.
Suddenly Daylight: I got this name from a friend. It's derived from when we found out that a few of these knocked out another friend, so when she woke up, it was Suddenly Daylight
Brandy Cocktail: Stir all ingredients (except lemon peel) with ice and strain into a cocktail glass. Add the twist of lemon peel and serve.
Russian Cream: Pour vodka and kahlua into old-fashioned glass over ice. Stir. Add irish cream and light cream.
Mexican stand-off: Swish around in mouth several times before swallowing.
White Mess: Can also be made tall (add a little soda water to cut down on the cream). Tastes like an Almond Joy (candy bar) that has been dunked into a can of root beer!
Bailey's Shake #2: Put it all in a blender. Blend until smooth. Serve.
The Bartman: Drink originated when a few of my friends through the alcoholic ingredients into my Dew, it was one of the first alcoholic drinks I had.
Elmo: Shake and Strain or Roll. No Garnish.
Gold Driver: Fill a short glass with ice. Pour the Cuervo into glass until about half full (more if you like it like I do). Top off with the Orange Juice. Squeeze a slice of lime into the drink. Enjoy!
Pic-Walsh: Swirl all ingredients in a blender.
Felix's feast: Mix the milk and the Bailys, add some ice, and drink it in a whiskeyglass.
Drunk-N-ade: Makes for a good punch. No girl has turned it away. Booze hits fast and hard. Stop DUIs, drink at home.
Stained Blue Dress: The Professional Bartenders School in Chicago (529 S. Wabash) held a Monica Lewinsky drink contest in its afternoon and evening classes with instructor Kim G. This was voted #2.
Shark's Bite: Mix together the Southern Comfort and the Cranberry Juice and stir. then add the Lime Juice (be careful not to get too much lime). Serve cold! You can substitute lemon juice for the lime juice if needed.
Is That a Banana in Your Pocket: Fill Collins glass with ice. Mix ingredients and top off glass with 7-up. Stir and enjoy!
Kamikaze #2: Pour all 3 into a shot glass and away you go.
Sexy Blue Eyed Boy: Put all ingredients into blender, blend until smooth.
Cafe' Joy: A wonderful drink after skiing or after a cold day at work.
Kurant: Put some icecubes into a highball glass. Pour Absolut Kurant in the glass and fill up with Russian. Add a straw. Drink.
Red Melon: Ppour vodka, melon and peach schnapps over ice. Top with the sprite, stir well, add 1 dash of the grenadine and serve. Garnish with a slice of lemon (or lime), or a piece of melon.
Cosmoquila: Shake all ingrediants with ice and strain.
Tropiflipano: The drink was discovered by a group of malcontents at Colorado College wasting away a snowy eve (by being wasted). It was named after the primary ingredient and a filipino contributor who christened the drink that night, and a toilet the next day. We take no responsibility for individual results. P.S. We do not recommend inhalation of fumes.
Iced Velvet: This drink was originated by my boss Jake. The owner of a small town bar who wanted something refreshing to drink but still wanted the booze. This drink has become one of our biggest sellers at Uncle Levi's Bar in Grill.
Baby Guinness: Pour Kahlua, almost filling shot glass. Then, carefully pour Baileys, using wall of shot glass. This will give the "Guinness" its "head".
Purple People Eater: Pour ingredients over ice and shake vigorously.
Virulent Death: Combine in shot glass and stir.
Eggnog - \"Kentucky-style\": Separate eggs. Beat yolks, add sugar. Add bourbon slowly while beating. Beat egg whites until stiff. Fold whites into egg yolk mixture, then fold whipped cream into mixture. Refrigerate for more than 4 days. Stir frequently to avoid separation. Color will change to a pale Serve with nutmeg or cinnamon.
Mogul Masher: Mix hot chocolate according to instructions in a 12 oz. glass or larger and add liquors...top with whipped cream...beware!!!!! These sneak up on you!!!!
Red Eyed Hell: Spicy and great treat for the grown ups.
Applejack: Add all ingredients into mixing glass, chill and strain into cocktail glass
Norwegian Iceberg: This is a great fresh and strong drink from the real country of ice, Norway.
Sevilla Cocktail: Shake all ingredients with ice, strain into a whiskey sour glass, and serve.
Medd: Spread the yeast on a piece of bread. Boil the water, honey and sugar. Stand in an earthenware pot. Skim off anyscum. Add lemon juice, cloves and ginger. Leave to cool. When just warm, float the bread and yeast on the top. Cover with a clean cloth. Leave for about 6-8 days. Strain and bottle. Corks should be loose to start with. Leave for at least 5-6 months.
Free Silver: Shake all ingredients (except carbonated water) with ice and strain into a collins glass over ice cubes. Fill with carbonated water, stir, and serve.
Galliano Island Iced Tea: Stir vigorously until it has the consistency and appearance of iced tea.
Peggy Cocktail: Stir all ingredients with ice, strain into a cocktail glass, and serve.
Dickel & Dew: Take a large glass and fill with ice. Add 1 part George Dickel Tennessee Whiskey to 2 parts of Mountain Dew.
The Kristy #2: Second version of drink, modified for "around the world" shot party at university of Kansas.
Avalon: Fill a tall glass with ice. Layer the Finlandia Vodka, lemon and apple juices, Pisang Ambon, and top up with lemonade. Stir slightly and garnish with a spiralled cucumber skin and a red cherry. The cucumber provides zest and looks attractive. This drink, created by Timo Haimi, took first prize in the 1991 Finlandia Vodka Long Drink Competition.
Sweet Summer: Strawberry vodka can also be used.
The Quan: The name, "The Quan", comes from the movie "Jerry Maguire". Cuba Gooding, Jr. tries to explain the quan to Tom Cruise, but Tom just doesn't get it. Drink this and you will!
Spicy Martini: Make sure you take your time with this drink
Bob's Special Punch: Tastes great and is good for large party's.
Citronade: Mix Lemonade and Citron into a Collins glass....shake or stir, add ice, and drink.
Absinthe #1: Note that this drink may be bad for your health. It is also illegal to make Absinthe in several countries.
Melon Cocktail: Shake all ingredients (except cherry) with ice and strain into a cocktail glass. Add the cherry on top and serve.
Blavod Martini: Very good drink to add a Gothic flavor to your Martini party.
Guapo: Taste great. Made at the Chief Pettyofficers Club at Lemoore, Ca. and named after my friend Carlos Ortiz (GUAPO).
Red Death: This is a actually a combination of a Kamakazi and an Alabama Slammer. It also makes a good shooter.
Orange Crush: Add all ingredients to tumbler-Pour as shot
Johnny Cat: Place gin or vodka, triple sec, vermouth, grenadine and ice in shaker. Shake well and pour into glass. Fill with tonic water or club soda.
Golden Delicious: This is a great drink. We created it when we had the ingredients left over. One can alter the amount of cider to taste. The best glass to use is a solo cup. It's a very pretty drink and look great in a clear glass.
Cranberry Bomber: Pour over ice and fill with cola. Stir and add honey. Garnish with a slice of lemon.
Pineapple Tea: Variation of Long Island Iced Tea. Substitute pineapple juice for Coca-cola.
Honey Liquor: Exchange spirit of wine with spirits like whisky, brandy or a similar strong liquor, then you'll get a lighter liquor. The strong variant is also called "Baerenfang" (bear catch), because it is said that two or so hundred years ago bears were caught in the forests of Northern Europe by putting out pans of that brew, and when they (the bears, not their hunters) got drunkily asleep they could be caught without danger.
White Carnation: Official drink of the Belmount Stakes, the third jewel of the Triple Crown. Technically served in a 12oz. souvenier "Belmount Glass". The official drink of the Belmount used to be the Manhattan, but for some reason, it was changed to the White Carnation.
Malibu Seven: Mix the 7-up and rum together in a cup of ice.
Malibu Tequichi: Add some ice. Twist and shake that thing. Serve at once.
Grandma's Swingin' Eggnog: This stuff is *potent*, even if you reduce the rum by half. Brandy, dark rum or bourbon may be substituted for the light rum. If you prefer a nonalcoholic eggnog, leave out the booze altogether. With or without booze, this eggnog is very rich and very good.
Apple Pie Shooter: A bit of a spectator sport.
Thai Coffee: Place the coffee and spices in the filter cone of your coffee maker. Brew coffee as usual, let it cool. In a tall glass, dissolve 1 or 2 teaspoons of sugar in an ounce of the coffee (it's easier to dissolve than if you put it right over ice). Add 5-6 ice cubes and pour coffee to within about 1 inch of the top of the glass. Rest a spoon on top of the coffee and slowly pour whipping cream into the spoon. This will make the cream float on top of the coffee rather than dispersing into it right away.
Buried Under An Avalanche: Note: When you pour in the Ouzo on top of the ice cube it will turn white.
Sensei on the Rocks: Vary the amount of Jack Daniels depending on how the strength of the drink desired.
Astoria: Founded in 1897 at the Waldorf Astoria hotel in New York. Acknowledgement given to Paul Harrington and Laura Moorehead's book, Cocktail:The Drinks Bible for the 21st Century.
Shimmers: Served on the rocks. Pour the St. Hallvard first, then the aquavit. Add a lemon twist.
True Alabama Slammer: Drink up and be very merry!
Bourbon Black Hawk #2: In a shaker half-filled with ice cubes, combine the bourbon, sloe gin, lemon juice, and sugar. Shake well. Strain into a cocktail glass. Garnish with the cherry.
Sherry Eggnog: Shake sherry, powdered sugar, and egg with ice and strain into a collins glass. Fill with milk and stir. Sprinkle nutmeg on top and serve.
Aperol '86: Shake ingredients with ice. Strain into a chilled cocktail glass. Garnish with strawberry.
Blue Meanie: It tastes sweet, kinda like Kool-Aid. I was at a party one night, and was messing around, figuring out what I could put together that would taste good. I tried this, and boy, did it taste good.
The Ricky Martini: This drink is the new sensation here, like Ricky Martin, it's spicy and a little fruity.
Monte-Sano: This is how I learned to make the famous drink of Larchmont Yacht Club on Long Island Sound. It is named for the great drinking/racing family of Commodore, Bizzy, and Jimmy Montesano. You can look for their name on sailing trophies everywhere. When at Larchmont a Monte-Sano is standard operating gear for all activites. Best when made by the pitcher for all the crew, paid for by the skipper.
Cerebellum: Found at a riverside bar in Seville, Spain.
Carbomb: Combine the Bailey's and Whiskey in a shot glass. Drop shot glass into beer. Should be finished immediately.
Lava Flow: My parents discovered this drink while on vacation in Hawaii. They enjoyed it there and brought the recipe home for us to try! So enjoy this delightful drink in the sun and feel as though you were in Hawaii too :) Aloha!
Scotch Fix: In a shaker half-filled with ice cubes, combine the sugar, lemon juice, and water. Shake well. Strain into a highball glass almost filled with crushed ice. Add the Scotch. Stir well and garnish with the cherry and the lemon slice.
Protein Smoothie: Shoot ingredients into a shot glass. Shake it up good and swallow.
Yellow Cake: Learned it at work one night, and it really does taste like yellow cake. Very good for those "Fun Shots".
Chocolate Toasted Almond: Mix all together, serve in a Collins glass over ice.
After Five: 1. Pour Kahlua into shot glass to about 1/2 full. 2. Using a spoon(inverted), slowly pour in the Peppermint Schnapps until glass is about 3/4 full. Done correctly, the Schnapps will flow under the Kahlua for a clear layer. 3. Again using a spoon, but this time right side up, slowly top off the glass with a layer of Bailey's. Be careful to place the spoon right at the top of the Kahlua layer and to raise it as the glass fills up. Done correctly, this will provide a layer of Bailey's floating over the Kahlua. 4. Toss it down all at once for something like a Peppermint Pattie, WITH A BANG!!! NOTE: Best if all ingredients are chilled
Warm Woolly Sheep: Speaks for itself. Feels just like a cuddling with a warm woolly sheep by the fire. Thanks to Chris and Jared for helping with this one.
Dea Lea: Shake all on Ice and strain into a Cocktail Glass. Serve on the rocks
Southern Bell: Using Southern Comfort is really the key, it adds an extra sweetness to the drink. I personally use Abita brand root beer, but just about any bottled root beer will do.
Georgia Peach Iced Tea: Sweet as sugar with a kick like gasoline. Many thanks to the employees of R.P. Tracks, Memphis for letting me get drunk enough to think this up. Heath
Peppermint Beach: Mix with ice. Serve cold. [Our studies show this drink to taste quite foul at the beginning of the evening but rather refreshing after several other drinks have been consumed.]
Sweet Surrender: Start by rubbing an orange slice over the top of your champagne flute and dip it in sugar. Then, shake the peach brandy and orange juice with ice and strain. Pour into the sugar rimmed flute and fill with chilled champagne.
Pine-Sol Shooter: Combine ingredients in a mixing glass nearly filled with ice. Stir, and strain into a shot glass
Wet Crotch: Obviously using 1 oz. of each ingredient will make three 1 oz. shots. Add or lessen the amounts according to the desired number of shots. (Just remember to always use equal amounts of each.)
Texas Tea: I received this recipe from a bartender friend of mine in Uvalde, TX. Take warning, this drink is potent and you should have at least three people present. Two to drink and one to drive!
The Shiwala: Remember that I warned you...Don't drink more than 4-5 of these or you are in BIG trouble the next morning! A.K.A. Jen's Rum Punch (Ft. Lauderdale/Palm Bch., Florida)
Headcrush: Fill the glass with Tequila then add Tabasco sauce carfully, put on a top with whipped cream and add some salt on it.
Door County Cherry Cheesecake: If you like cherry cheesecake, this Award-winning shot is as close as you can get to the real thing without all of the grams of fat.
Highland Sling: In a shaker half-filled with ice cubes, combine the sugar, water, lemon juice, and Scotch. Shake well. Strain into a highball glass. Garnish with the lemon twist.
Talos Coffee: This is a drink for the person who does not want to get to fancy with the ingredients but still wants a tasty drink.
Tequonic: Pour tequila over ice cubes into old-fashioned glass. Add fruit juice, fill with tonic water, and stir.
Arizona Antifreeze: Just the shot to warm up your insides !!!!
Brandy Alexandra: Blend all the ingredients in blender, garnished with cinnamon powder.
Bingo: Build in highball glass with lots of ice Garnish with slice of orange and cocktail cherry.
Scottish Jersey: It tastes like chocolate milk with a bite. Discovered on 7/1-00.
Christer Petterson: Mix and serv with crushed ice
Queen Bee: Shake all ingredients with ice, strain into a cocktail glass, and serve.
Mind Meld: Fill the hurricane glass with ice, then add the blue curacao, triple sec and peach schnapps. Fill with 7-up and garnish with an orange wheel.
Flaming Blow Job: This drink is a favorite at family get togethers in Arkansas. Warning have a hose ready in case flames get out of hand. This drink sounds disgusting but it is delicious.
Egg-Nog - Classic Cooked: In large saucepan, beat together eggs, sugar and salt, if desired. Stir in 2 cups of the milk. Cook over low heat, stirring constantly, until mixture is thick enough to coat a metal spoon and reaches 160 degrees F. Remove from heat. Stir in remaining 2 cups milk and vanilla. Cover and regfigerate until thoroughly chilled, several hours or overnight. Just before serving, pour into bowl or pitcher. Garnish or add stir-ins, if desired. Choose 1 or several of: Chocolate curls, cinnamon sticks, extracts of flavorings, flavored brandy or liqueur, fruit juice or nectar, ground nutmeg, maraschino cherries, orange slices, peppermint sticks or candy canes, plain brandy, run or whiskey, sherbet or ice-cream, whipping cream, whipped. Serve immediately.
Autodaf\u00e9: Mix and fill up with soda water. Drunk by finns on a sunny day any time of the year and day.
Auger: I prefer to use Skyy vodka and Florida's Natural Orange Juice.
Perroquet: Pour over ice cubes in a highball glass. Fill with cold water and stir well.
Lani: Lani is our customer. She was the first girl I served this drink.
Screaming Viking: Stir liquids with ice then strain into a cocktail glass. Garnish with celery and cucumber. Serve immediately.
Ecto Cooler: This drink can be made with greater amounts of alcohol. Use more or less to suit your taste
All Jacked up: Chill in a mixing tin and pour.
Spooky Juice: This is a great one for Halloween!
Fireman's Sour: In a shaker half-filled with ice cubes, combine the rum, lime juice, and grenadine. Shake well. Strain into a highball glass almost filled with ice cubes. Top with the club soda. Stir well. Garnish with the orange slice and the cherry.
Sangria Classic: Combine orange juice, wine, sugar, brandy and Cointreau. Add lemon and orange slices. Chill. To serve, add ice and club soda, stir gently.
What The Hell: Stir all ingredients with ice cubes in an old-fashioned glass and serve.
Blue Eye: This is an Norwegian recipe, so you are free to increase the amount of vodka. The name came from a girl that ment my blue eyes matched the drink. Hehe.. - Typical female drink -
Black Hawk: Stir blended whiskey and sloe gin with ice and strain into a cocktail glass. Top with the cherry and serve.
Carjacker: Fill shot glass of Hennessey and then drop it into a pint of malt liquor.
Senorita Margarita: This can also be made as a frozen drink.
Beer Breezer: Add freezer chilled vodka to frosted glass, add tabasco and celery salt, top up with very cold very strong lager.
Vampire: Recipe given to me by Tim at TGI Friday's (Langhorne, PA)
Brandy Sour: Shake brandy, juice of lemon, and powdered sugar with ice and strain into a whiskey sour glass. Decorate with the lemon slice, top with the cherry, and serve.
Almond Delight: Tasty. Another variation is using about three ounces Amaretto rather than 1/2 in an old fashioned glass on the rocks, which is nice if you like almonds. cheers.
George & Ginger: Pour George Dickel over ice into a tall glass. Add Ginger Ale, and stir.
Tequilini: Shake ingredients with ice strain into cocktail glass.
A Furlong Too Late: Pour the rum and ginger beer into a highball glass almost filled with ice cubes. Stir well. Garnish with the lemon twist.
Raspberry Sex: Similar to an Absolut Sex, though a friend of mine heavily into martial arts is only allwed clear liquors. This is different because of the raspberry flavor and not too sweet, not too sour, very palitable mix.
Vodka & Schweppes: For best result use Smirnoff vodka.
Pink Lady: Shake all ingredients with ice, strain into a cocktail glass, and serve.
Blue Bohemian: Shake. Garnish with an orange twist and a cherry.
Friar Tuck: Shake and pour into a v-shape, and garnish with cinammon.
Suffragette City: In a shaker half-filled with ice cubes, combine all of the ingredients. Shake well. Strain into a cocktail glass.
Brandy Swizzle: In a shaker half-filled with ice cubes, combine the lime juice, sugar, brandy, and bitters. Shake well. Almost fill a collins glass with crushed ice and stir until glass is frosted. Strain the mixture in the shaker into the glass and add the club soda.
Green Hell #2: Mix all ingredients in shaker. Fill with ice and add orange juice. Pour into hurricane glass and serve.
Sweet Candy Apple: It tastes exactly like a candy apple, don't ask me how...but you have to try this.
BLT: Fill glass with ice. Add Limon. Fill with Iced tea. Add lemon wedge.
Liquid Cocaine #3: There are other versions that go by this name, but as far as I know this is the most popular, and certainly the best. It is also the "unofficial" drink of Dragoncon convention goers in Atlanta Ga.
Blue Moon: Another specialty drink from the Bellagio hotel in Las Vegas. Courtesy of Drink Specialist Tony Abou-Ganim.
Exploding Cherry: pour it all into an ice-cream pail and add more vodka if you wish.
Cran-Razz: Cranberry-raspberry juice may substitute for cranberry juice.
Butt Naked Kiwi: This drink was invented one night while bored and thirsty in a college dorm. After all, you can't always ressurect a Purple Jesus.
Captain's and Creme: Cream soda doesn't have much carbonation in the first place, so try not to stir too much.
Tropical Martini: Tastes great! I came upon this drink in the wilds of northern South Afica. Not really, I made it when I was drinking with some friends. I liked it, and so will you (barring any objection to either ingridient).
Mallis 97: Shake all! in glass with 3 ice cubes
Melonball: Fill tall glass with ice. Pour in Melon Liqueur and Vodka. Fill glass with juice. Orange juice may also be used.
Aqualung: Brew espresso, mix in shots of kaluha and syrup
Netherland: Pour ingredients into an old-fashioned glass over ice cubes. Stir well and serve.
Magic Dew: Mix 1/2 part Blue Maui with 1/2 part Mountain Dew to taste.
Forest Fire: Mix in shot glass, it's that simple. Use more Tabasco for more fire, less for more alcohol.
Cornell Cocktail: Shake all ingredients with ice, strain into a cocktail glass, and serve.
Aggie Banana: If ice flecks are desired, add ice and use fresh, not frozen, bananas. -- For best handling and taste, first peel and slice the bananas. Put them in an uncovered plastic bowl to freeze. Allow frost to form on them. -- I use vanilla ice cream for this drink. But I think it would also be good with almond ice cream. -- This is a great drink for banana lovers. The butterscotch gives it a nice sweet flavoring without overpowering the bananas. As far as I know, this is an original drink. I got the idea one day because I was making a banana shake and trying to get rid of some left over butterscotch instant pudding. So, I added the pudding to the shake, and it was wonderful. Then, I started experimenting and came up with this. I was not sure what to name the drink. I decided on Aggie Banana because I'm a student at Texas A&M; University, and if it weren't for me being an Aggie, I would have never thought of this. WHOOP!
Patel's Special: I you want it stronger, add more Absolut citron. The colder the drink is the smoother it will go down.
Funky Cold Medina: Pour over ice and top off with cranberry juice.
Flaming Ale: This is a variant on the Flaming Soda, since we had no soda. It is probably sweeter than the Flaming Soda, but is still very good.
Fruit Tingles: The best shaker at "Shooters Bar" Surfers Paradise, Australia
Egg Nog Ice-Cream: This is somewhat recursive. You should buy the first qt. of Egg Nog Ice-Cream.
Jello-shot Supreme: Bring water to a boil. Mix with a large package of Black Cherry Jello. Then add Peachtree Schnapps, mix well. Pour into small plastic shot or 2 oz. containers. Chill and enjoy.
Mudslinger: Appearance will be similar to that of muddy water, but it tastes great!!
Reptile (Orginal): This is the drink the Reptile is based on, created by Joe Schaftall. Shake indredents with cruched ice untill outside of shaker is cold enough to have water droplets on the outside. Strain into highball glass.
Captains Pie: Pour the ginger ale and the cranapple juice togther and then add the rum.
Queen Charlotte: Pour red wine and grenadine into a collins glass over ice cubes. Fill with lemon-lime soda, stir, and serve.
Slow Comfortable Screw: Pour sloe gin and Southern Comfort into a collins glass filled with ice. Fill with orange juice, stir well, and serve.
Power Sangria: Fill a wine glass with 1/3 chilled vermouth and 2/3 red wine.
B-54: Also great mixed in with hot coffe of hot chocolate
Sud-Ouest: Shake and strain. Add a few drops of grenadine. Garnish with a slice of lime, a maraschino cherry and fresh mint.
Brittle Fracture: YUM! Tastes just like real root beer, kids. It's good for what ails ya. Created during Colorado School of Mines Engineers' Days 1993.
New Orleans Buck: Shake all ingredients (except ginger ale) with ice and strain into a collins glass over ice cubes. Fill with ginger ale, stir, and serve.
Sherry Milk Punch: Shake all ingredients (except nutmeg) with ice and strain into a collins glass. Sprinkle nutmeg on top and serve.
Salty Balls: A combination of a Salty Dog and a Melon Ball.
Fruit A la la: Put all together in blender, and blend until smooth.
Flori's Hot Tub Heaven: Please add in order from light to heavy finishing with coffee. No mixing required.
Rafu Eighteen: Fill vodka and Pisang in the glas. If you tihnk it's to strong you may fill in with more pisang. Fill then with orange juice and sprite, about half of each till the glas is filled. Take then a twist or two of lemon.
Red Devil: First add ice, then mix in the alcohols, then the juice and grenadine. Shake when all ingredients are mixed. Serve in a 10-12 oz. glass.
Zambeer: Mix sambuca with rootbeer and stir. Add ice
Golden Dream: I must have made 500 Golden Dreams' in my 28 yrs. of tending bar. Most people say it taste like a cream sicle. It was very popular back in the late 60's and early 70's. I can't tell you the origin but it was popular on the east coast of US.
Gorilla Smile: Invented in a coffee shop in Salisbury, Md.
Oklahoma Tropical Twister: Great with Spiced Rum. Great as a NAB drink. Great served over crushed Ice. Great as a Frozen Drink. The drink for every member at the party, including the kids.
Harvest Moon: Pour first 4 ingredients over ice, slowly add grenadine as you stir.
Nuclear Waste #2: Tastes like a chocolate milk and a root beer float combined.
The Real Jungle-Juice: This is a great party drink, but heed my warning this stuff is very strong!! If desired make any amount you wish, just double the ingredients.
Prarie Fire: Pour one shot of tequila into the glass. Add Tabasco to taste
Orange Margarita: Great summer drink, very refreshing. It may be helpful to note that it tastes terrible with salt on the rim.
The Incredible Hulk: Add 2 oz of Captain Morgan to glass. Add sugar. Add Mountain Dew till mix turns green.
Ru's Snap Shot: Put Pop Rocks Candy in bottom of shot glass. Add Cinnamon Schnapps. Stir, and shoot immediately.
Greasy Swede: This drink was invented by two good friends: One a Greek and the other a Swede trading shots at a the Bali Hai in Potsdam, NY.
915 Special: Conceived at Lake Manyara, Kenya. Named after a dorm room at the University of Washington, USA.
Klingon Disrupter: Mix all three ingredients together. (Real Klingons drink it warm!) Shoot it!
B-52 #6: B-52 must be lighted!!! These ingredients are used in Switzerland.
Damn Good!: Just one of the creations invented at The RoadHouse NightClub in International Falls, Minnesota
Negroni: Stir over ice and pour into a rocks glass. Garnish with a lemon zest.
Jamaican Juice: Also, if you would like a sweeter taste, feel free to add a pinch or two of sugar.
Fireball #3: DO NOT use plastic shot glasses for this drink and if you are very easily affected by alcohol, do not eat the beans if that is what you used instead of tabasco because the beans absorbe all the alcohol.
Corpse Reviver: In a mixing glass half-filled with ice cubes, combine all of the ingredients. Stir well. Strain into a cocktail glass.
Sweaty Belly: This is a "built" drink, meaning it gets made directly into the glass, no mixing glass or shaker is needed. Put the cubes in first, then the amaretto, then half fill with OJ and half fill with Cran. juice.
Watermelon Shot: This is the best watermelon recipe I found after about 9 years of bartending. Try it you will like it the best.
Dreamy Winter Night: Add Amarretto to Hot Chocolate to your taste.
Formula 3: Add the 2 rums and vodka together in a beer mug. Then add the other 2 ingredients to it. Then top off the beer mug with lemonade.
VooDoo Tea: Stir until it turns black or dark and enjoy!
Golden Daze: Shake all ingredients with ice, strain into a cocktail glass, and serve.
Orange Buck: Shake gin, orange juice, and lime juice with ice and strain into a highball glass over ice cubes. Fill with ginger ale, stir, and serve.
Lime Vodka Collins: Do not blend!! Do not serve in a hurricane glass!
Blackthorn: Stir sloe gin and vermouth with ice and strain into a cocktail glass. Add the twist of lemon peel and serve.
Golden Comfort: Mix, then pour into shot glass
Miami Beach Cocktail: Stir all ingredients with ice, strain into a cocktail glass, and serve.
Sex on the Beach #9: If you want to, you can spice it up a bit ( in terms of alcohol, that is ) by putting in 1 msr. of Jamica Rum... Enjoy
Get Laid: Mix Raspberry liqueur, vodka, and pineapple juice in the mixer, shake, strain, pour into glass, then add splash of cranberry juice.
