Scottish Highland Liqueur: Combine all ingreds in aging container. Cover tightly and shake gently several times during the first 24 hrs. After 24 hrs, remove the lemon zest. Cover again and let stand in a cool, dark place for 2 weeks, shaking gently every other day. Strain through a wire sieve to remove the angelica root and fennel. Return to aging container, cover and let stand undisturbed in a cool dark place for 6 months. Siphon or pour clear liqueur into a sterile bottle. The cloudy dregs may be saved for cooking.
Golden Star: put two scoops ice-cream in blender add liquor and blend until like a milk shake.
Lucky Lemon: Founded by some lucky college students of SUNY Albany some time ago, and passed on, and on, and on....
Blue Cosmopolitan: Frost the rim of a chilled cocktail glass with sugar. Stir absolut citron, blue curacao, grapefruit juice, and sugar syrup in a mixing glass with ice to prevent cloudiness. Strain into cocktail glass. Garnish with a maraschino cherry.
Mark n' Club: Maker's Mark is a bourbon whiskey from Loretta Ky with limited distribution.
Flaming Blue: Mix into a shot glass, and splash the Bacardi on the very top. Be careful not to mix it into the rest of the drink. Then carefully light the rum on fire with a match. Blow out the flame and drink it fast before the rim gets too hot.
Rose Cocktail (English): Rub rim of cocktail glass with lemon juice and dip into powdered sugar. Shake vermouth, gin, brandy, lemon juice, and grenadine with ice, strain into the sugar-rimmed glass, and serve.
In a shaker half-filled with ice cubes, combine the gin, kirschwasser, apricot brandy, and lemon juice. Shake well. Strain into a highball glass almost filled with ice cubes. Garnish with the lemon twist.
Luftwaffe: Put 1/3 chocolate syrup, then 1/3 Jägermeister, and then 1/3 Butterscotch of the glass.
TLA: This bizarre shot originated in a club in Toronto when a friend of mine (after quite a few drinks) said he would drink any shot: namely tequila, wine and amaretto. I didn't think wine would go too well, so I substituted lime, and bought him the shot. He said it tasted good, and the TLA was born. Of course, bartenders still look at us funny whenever we order it...
Baltimore Bracer: Shake all ingredients with ice, strain into a cocktail glass, and serve.
Wedding Anniversary: Created at our fourth wedding anniversary.
Liquid Cocaine #5: Pour all ingredients into a shaker, shake and strain.
Captains Saddle: Mix rootbeer schnaps with spiced rum and chill with ice cubes. Strain into a highball glass and enjoy
Cape Cod Crush: Blend the Southern Comfort, cranberry juice, and ice in a blender. Pour and serve.
Joyful Bull: Tastes a little like hot chocolate, but with a kick!
Kahlua and Cream: I've had this drink in many different sized glasses. Whatever you decide to use, remember it is about an ounce cream, the rest Kahlua.
Kinda Tasty: Put in highball glass with ice and stir.
Ramcooler: Created by Fred Falkenberg, Canada. Winner of the 1976 I.B.A. international cocktail competition.
Dolphin's Foam: You must shake well or else the coconut parts in the pina colada will sift and drop down in the glass, leaving the drink undesireable to drink.
Woo Woo #2: Another Variation of the Woo Woo. We started drinking these at Muddys Too in Watervliet, NY. Our favorite bartender, Margie, got us going. They definitly make you wanna go WooWoo, after you've had a few. :)
Southern Bound Meteor: Use a large shot glass. Remove stem from cherry and drop in glass. Pour in Southern Comfort and Goldschlager. Carefully float in a splash of 151 Rum. With a cigarette lighter ignite 151 Rum on fire and serve. Put out fire before drinking.
Smile Cocktail: Shake all ingredients with ice, strain into a cocktail glass, and serve.
May Blossum Fizz: Shake all ingredients (except carbonated water) with ice and strain into a highball glass over two ice cubes. Fill with carbonated water, stir, and serve.
Firecracker: Made at Joni's East, San Diego
Southern Raspberry Tart: Taste differs with amount of sour mix. It tastes better with a little less than an ounce.
Kamakazie #1: shake well with ice, pour strained mixture into shooter. Salute'
Polar Bear #3: Mix drinks over ice before serving in a shot glass. Tastes like a peppermint patty!
Caribbean Boilermaker: Pour the Corona into an 18oz beer glass pour the rum into the beer.
Damned if you do: Pour into shot glass. Put in mouth. Repeat as deemed necessary.
Salt and Pepper Martini: Combine vermouth and Absolut in mixing glass over ice and stir. Strain into a cocktail glass with a salted rim.
Sperm Whale: Created by Cheryl Loo @ Red Lion, Waikiki, Hawaii. Easy to remember by SPM WHL...S-outhern Comfort, P-each Schnapps, M-alibu Rum WHL-What Hawaii Likes (Pineapple). Named after a member of the Aloha Hash House Harriers drinking club with a running problem (Sperm Whale)
Purple Jesus: Combine all ingredients in a punch bowl.
Irish Cream, Home Made #2: Mix all ingredients in a blender until well stirred. Great in your favorite drink recipes or straight as a dessert. Drink contents within two weeks. Some ingredients are perishable. Store in an airtight container so you can shake it before each use. The chocolate settles at the bottom.
Bakkus: Pour the ingredients into a cocktail shaker and shake well, pour into a tall cocktail glass and add a slice of lemon.
Pepe's Flame of Love Martini: The great Dean Martin was responsible for the creation of this drink. He regularly visited the bar at Chasen's in Beverly Hills and told the bartender - Pepe Ruiz - that he was bored with the same old Martini's. Pepe than spent three weeks experimenting until he came up with this drink. Dean was reportedly floored by this drink and it soon became his favorite Martini. Frank Sinatra immortalized the drink in a 1962 recording entitled "Nothing But the Best (Is Good Enough for Me)". The lines "I like my martini, with burn on the glass" is a veiled tribute to the drink. Hollywood legend has it that Frank ordered 65 of the drinks in one night - for his guests.
Leap Frog Highball: Pour gin and juice of lemon over ice cubes in a highball glass. Fill with ginger ale, stir, and serve.
Banderas: Shouldn't take more than 8 seconds between first to last shot. Shake neighbors head. Enjoy!
Mexican Virgin: Pour into an 8 oz. glass and stir. Then pour into another 8 oz. glass over ice.
Screaming Banana: Make sure the glass is full of ice. Orange and pineapple juice amounts may be varied according to individual preferences.
Immaculata: In a shaker half-filled with ice cubes, combine all of the ingredients. Shake well. Strain into a cocktail glass.
Italian Surfer: I found this recipe in a magazine - Cosmo, I think. I've ordered it at bars a few times and noone had ever heard of it. If mixed properly, (sometimes you have to play with the mix depending on the amaretto you use) you get a smooth textured coco/pinapple thing happening that's very tropoical, and not overly sweet.
The Rising Skirt: This is absolutely delicious! The color is almost like Mountain Dew. It is very pretty and very strong! It is not too sweet as it may seem just by reading the ingredients. -- It is called the Rising Skirt because it was deemed a girl drink by a golfer at Lafayette Golf and Country Club (where it was created). After each drink, the girl's skirt may get shorter and shorter.
B-52 #5: Fill 1/3th of the glass with Tia Maria. Then pour smootly on a spoon the baileys so it flows on the Tai Maria. Then fill the glass up with Grand Marnier also with a spoon. Afterwards you see 3 layers, the middle layer looks like a after boming scene.
Creole Scream: Mix the rum, grenadine, vermouth and angostura. Shake with ice. Add the olive.
Screaming Multiple Orgasm: Build over ice. Granish with strawberries or cherries.
Emerald Isle #2: I made this up while hangin' out with friends. It was the hit of the party.
Gin And Bitter Lemon: In a shaker half-filled with ice cubes, combine the gin, lemon juice, and sugar. Shake well. Strain into a highball glass almost filled with ice cubes. Top with the tonic water.
Ario Bomb: Build over ice in glass. Garnish with 3 cherries.
Banana Tropical: You can find this recipe in our menue : http://www.abseits.de/ld_alkfrei.htm
Batida Mango: Place all of the ingredients into a blender. Blend well. Pour into a wine glass.
Jamaican Green Sunrise: Start with the ice cubes. Pour rum and orange juice. Carefully add blue curacao, making sure it falls to the bottom. Layer pineapple vodka on top.
Reptile: Make sure all ingredients are chilled. Add in order: ET, OJ, Dew. Stir lightly. Like most OJ drinks, the alcohol is hard to taste. A padded bar is recomended.
Ping-Pong Cocktail: Shake all ingredients with ice, strain into a cocktail glass, and serve.
Flaming Anus: Combine all ingredients in mug. Let stand until room temperature. Enjoy!
Gilroy Cocktail: Shake all ingredients with ice, strain into a cocktail glass, and serve.
Indian Summer: Mix all together and take all at once as a shot.
Choclate Banana Martini: Fill mixing glass with ingredients, stir and pour into chilled martini glass. Add Hershey's kiss or Godiva choclate for a garnish.
Jamaican Dust: Mix all three ingredients in a strainer with ice, serve chilled
Cough Syrup: Mix all ingredients together in a shot glass.
Shut the hell up: Pour Jager at bottom of glass. Mix Crown, Everclear, & 151 separately to layer on top of the Jager. Splash the Grenadine. Attempt to shoot & SHUT THE HELL UP.
X: Mix all ingredients in mixing glass and shake with ice. Strain into glass and shoot.
Nuts 'n Holly: "THE" holiday shot at the Jungle in Tampa, FL
Opal Cocktail: In a shaker half-filled with ice cubes, combine all of the ingredients. Shake well. Strain into a cocktail glass.
Snake Bite (UK): Pour ingredients into a pint glass. Drink. Fall over.
Goats Milk: I used to have a baby pet goat (her name was Daisy), and when I had to let her go I held a going away party and put a punch together. Goats milk was born.
Southern Bondage: This is a semi-sweet drink. Majority of women love this!
Peach me Tender: Shake all the ingredients. Serve in a chilled cocktail glass. Add a twist of orange.
Kurant Collins: Like a Tom Collins with Absolut Kurant instead of Gin. Very nice.
The Real June Bug: Pour the Fresca over the SoCo.
Summit County Suicide: As strange as it sounds, it's good. Invented by a group of us partiers in the mountians in colorado. Summit County suicide was invented to get you really drunk, without making you sick, or making you gag.
Eagle Eye: Great tasting drink, perfect to serve cold in the summer.
Lemon Sherbert Punch: Mix Lemonade in very large punch bowl. Add soda and frozen fruit. Open sherbet and dump the entire package of it into punch (it will float on the top). Due to the frozen fruit and Sherbet, there is really no need for ice until later, or unless it it very hot.
Dirty Dog: About Six Dirty Dogs will make you act pretty damn dirty.
Pjolter Bay: Have it all in a shaker, add 50/50 Fanta orange/Lemon mix. Sahake. Serv in highball glass. garnish with lemon an cherry.
Brazil Cocktail: Stir all ingredients with ice, strain into a cocktail glass, and serve.
Winegum: This drink comes from Denmark, and is very popular in Djursland, the nose of Denmark.
The Whammie: From Louie's Backyard South Padre Island, TX
Die ruhige Sturm: When served, the drink will taste like coke, but it'll sneak up on you so watch how much you drink. Serve in a standard plastic party cup with ice.
Ice Bear: Mix vodka and Curacao. Pour in a high glass. Fill it up with soda.
Bourbon Milk Punch #2: In a highball glass, dissolve the sugar in the bourbon by stirring with a teaspoon. Add 6 ice cubes and the milk. Stir well. Garnish with the cinnamon.
Bellini: In the original recipe, created around 1940 in Harry's Bar in Venice, white peaches and Italian sparkling wine, Prosecco, should be used. If you can find them use them, if not, regular peaches and champagne will do.
Two Turtles: A cutesy named and tasty drink I came across while whipping up mixed drinks at a party...the girls love it. Enjoy!
Mage's Fire: This drink is a favorite of The Royal Chessmen's and most of the performers we know from the renaissance faires.
Glogg - Swedish: Put cardamon seeds, cinnamon, cloves and orange parts in nylon bag and tie top. In large saucepan put bag, half bottle of the wine, and the raisins. Cover and simmer for 15 minutes. Add remaining wine and the almond, heat through. In another saucepan warm about 1/3 of the brandy (or aquavit), pour in sugar and light with match to flame. When sugar has melted, pour in the remainder of brandy. If necessary extinguish flame with cover lid. Add sugar mixture to wine mixture. Pour in cups with raisins and almonds in each serving. Serve in irish coffee cup. A hot cup of glogg is the Scandinavian way of offering a warm welcome to a friend on a wintery evening.
Ultra-Marine: Add Blue curacao then top up with Champagne and garnish with a grape or strawberry.
Royal Fizz: Shake all ingredients (except cola) with ice and strain into a chilled collins glass. Fill with cola and serve.
Fahrenheit 5000: Cover bottom of shot glass with Tabasco Sauce and then fill with half Firewater and half Absolut Peppar.
Headless Horseman: Put vodka and bitters into a collins glass. Add several ice cubes, fill with ginger ale, and stir. Add the orange slice and serve.
Frozen Girl Scout: Tastes like a Girl Scout's Thin Mint.
Sunshine Cocktail: Stir all ingredients (except orange peel) with ice and strain into a cocktail glass. Add the twist of orange peel and serve.
Sugar High: Sweet tasting drink that will literally give you a sugar high
Homemade Advocaat: Variation: Substitute 1/4 to 1/2 cup brandy for same volume of vodka.
Bushwacker #5: This is the recipe from the annual Jubilee's Bushwacker Festival in Pensacola Beach, FL.
1-900-FUK-MEUP: Created by the bar staff at TGI Fridays, Tallahassee, FL.
Upper Cut: Just like an irish coffey. Wait till it has cooled a bit. Drink all in one move.
Satan's Spawn: Add the Tabasco first, then the Firewater
Cherry Bomb #2: This is a very popular drink in Door Co. Wisconsin (The Cape Cod of the Midwest), where cherries are one of the largest crops in the area.
Thumb Press: Add the vodka, 151, and Midori forming a nice green shooter. Then tilt in some grenadine to give it some red flare at the bottom -- burn it down!
Red Headed Slut: This drink has a bit of a kick to it, and the ole' familiar Jägermeister after taste. However, it is a fun drink and after two or three of these you will be good to go. So kick back, enjoy, and remember -- Please don't drink and drive.
Kordulas Special: Pour in the ingredients - Then put a dash of Angostura on the cube - put it in the champagne by using a tong.
Monaco: This drink comes from France. A lot of teens drink it over there, and it's actually quite refreshing. Try one out!
Savannah: Shake all ingredients with ice, strain into a cocktail glass, and serve.
Nuts and Berries #1: In a ice filled mixing cup add all ingredients and shake well, pour into cocktail glass, garnish with berries in season
Brown Cow from Hell: Mix all ingredients until no chocolate residue is left on bottom of glass. Serve chilled. Enjoy!!
Bloody Coochie: Any kind of punch can be substituted for fruit punch.
Dambuster: In a Highball glass with ice, pour three shots of Rum (preferably Bacardi) one shot of Kahlua, a shot of ginger ale and fill the rest of the glass with milk, (Homo or 2%, never SKIM!) Stir. That's It! Enjoy
Mojito: Lightly muddle the mint and sugar with a splash of soda water in a mixing glass until the sugar dissolve and you smell the mint. Squeeze the lime into the glass, add rum and shake with ice. Strain over cracked ice in a highball glass. Top with soda water, garnish with mint sprig and serve.
Hot Afternoon: Throw the shit in the shot glass and drink it down!
The Saint Lawrence: Stir, pour into plastic cup and chug!!!!
Witch's Brew #2: Pour Grenadine into glass. Mix orange, Bols Blue, Cointreau and Midori melon seperately in shaker. Pour slowly into glass disturbing grenadine as little as possible. Garnish with spray cream, cherries etc.
Black River: First you mix the alcohol into the glass with ice in it. Next you pour Sprite and Farris at the same time into the glas. At last you the drops from lime comes and you serve it with a slice of lime on the side.
The 5th Element: Chill mug, add ice, pour Sprite and juice into mug. Then add rum and Southern Comfort. Finally add the 5th element: Everclear!
Anti Freeze: Pour the hot chocolate mix into a 9 ounce glass mug. Add the schnapps and boiling water. Stir Well. Top with a swirl of whipped cream. Garnish with a Maraschino cherry and a peppermint stick.
Ragnar #2: Pour the Kurant into a highball glass full of ice. Add some Rose's lime (how much depends on individual taste). Fill up with Sprite.
Cherry Bomb: Serve as a shot or on the rocks.
South Beach Martini: Recipe borrowed from "Ocean Boulevard" restaurant in Kitty Hawk, NC.
Irish Comfort: combine Southern Comfort and Blue Curacao in a high ballglass over ice. Add enough orange juice to fill the glass. The orange juice and blue Curcao will combine to form a lovely green shade!
Screwdriver: Put 3 ice cubes into a highball glass. Pour in vodka. Fill balance of glass with orange juice, stir, and serve.
Derby Daiquiri: Blend all ingredients with 1/2 cup shaved ice in an electric blender at a low speed. Pour into a champagne flute and serve.
Double Brit: Don't be afriad to let it linger in your mouth before you swallow, especially if you have used quality ingredients. It sounds like a brutally simple shot, but can really have an eloquent flavor if done properly. Also, as you might have guessed, this drink is *very* strong, so be careful!
Chuck Wagon: A house speciality at the Old West Steakhouse in Salisbury, Maryland.
Picon Limon: Stir Amer Picon, creme de cassis and lime juice with cracked ice and strain into a large chilled wine glass (should hold 16 ounces). Fill with soda water and garnish with a twist of lemon.
Hurricane, New Orleans Style: The first sip/drink bites a bit, but the rest goes down 'way' too fast and easy! - Potent!
Lime Lizard: Pour in Vodka first, then mix in the rest. Count to three and drink!
Glaciermeister: Mix in blender by adding the ice cream first, followed by the milk, then the Jägermeister. Blend until smooth.
Cloud 9: The combination of the the caffine, the alcohol, and the sugar will have you buzzing like your on cloud 9! Enjoy!
Mellon Collie and The Infinite Gladness: Combine all ingredients and shake with ice. Serve in 140ml martini glass. Garnish with strawberries marinated in Cointreau and Monin Passionfruit syrup and a pineapple leaf.
Chi Phi: This is the official shot of the Chi Phi Fraternity. Try it, you might like it!
The Jersey Cherry: Build over ice in a rocks glass. Granish with a cherry.
Rum Fix: Stir juice of lemon, powdered sugar, and water in a highball glass. Fill glass with ice, add rum, and stir. Add the slice of lemon and serve with a straw.
Cosmopolitan #3: Stir ingredients on ice and strain into martini glass.
Zorbatini: Prepare like a Martini. Garnish with a green olive.
Yukon Cornelius: In a shot glass pour the Yukon Jack to just below the rim. Add Goldschlager, filling the glass to full. Enjoy.
Chambord Royale: Credit to Jimmer. You won't even know what hit you.
Tovarich Cocktail: Shake all ingredients with ice, strain into a cocktail glass, and serve.
The Betty Ford: This drink tastes jut like a Shirley Temple and is named by my fiancee' after our favorite alcoholic/first lady, Betty Ford. Happy drinking.
Firehammer: combine with ice in shaker strain into cocktail glass
The Player: This drink is very alcoholic, most ladies enjoy the taste of it, however, the amount of tequila can be lowered to three shots if too much tequila taste is present.
Absinthe #2: Note that this drink may be bad for your health. It is also illegal to make Absinthe in several countries.
Pina Colada Punch: Chill pineapple juice and soda. Blend first four ingredients in a blender until creamy. (I've found a hand blender works very well since my blender won't hold all of this liquid or you could split it into two batches.) This can be done ahead of time and put back into the fridge until serving time. When your ready to serve, place coconut mixture in punch bowl, add ice-cream and allow it to dissolve somewhat. When ice-cream has dissolved almost completely, add pineapple soda. Add ice ring and decorate the frothy top of the punch with thin orange slices. If you wanted to make this alcoholic, cut back a little on the amount of soda and add a bit of rum - I like it with Captain Morgan's Spiced Rum.
Bartender's Margarita: Shake tequila, triple sec, sweet & sour, cranberry juice, and lime juice in a pint glass. Rim another pint glass with salt and transfer contents. Float the Gran Marnier, garnish with a lime and straw, and serve.
Jack Voigt: The name comes from a once great Milwaukee Brewer baseball player (Jack Voigt). This is in honor of his wonderful one year spent in Milwaukee.
Cement Kicker: Fill one shot glass with Bailey's. Fill second shot glass with Lime and 151. To Drink: Pour Bailey's into mouth, do not swallow. Pour Lime and 151 into mouth. Shake head back and fourth, the shot will turn solid.
Charlie Chaplin: Shake all ingredients with ice, strain into an old-fashioned glass over ice cubes, and serve.
Pineapple Cooler: Put white wine, pineapple juice, powdered sugar, and 2 oz. carbonated water in a collins glass and stir. Add ice cubes, fill with carbonated water, and stir again. Add the lemon peel and the orange spiral so the end dangles over rim of glass.
Superfly: A very sweet drink. Very popoular in Stockholm, Sweden.
Pablo's shot: If you like my shot please say so, and mail me some of your favorites to: epcv009@apolo.eafit.edu.co
Orange Scented Hot Chocolate: Combine all ingredients in heavy medium saucepan. Stir over low heat until chocolate melts. Increase heat and bring just to a boil, stirring often. Remove from heat and whisk untily frothy. Return to heat and bring to boil again. Remove from heat, whisk until frothy. Repeat heating and whisking once again. Discard orange peel. (Can be prepared 2 hours ahead. Let stand at room temperature. Before serving, bring just to boil, remove from heat and whisk until frothy.) Pour hot chocolate into coffee mugs. Makes 2 servings.
Irish Cream Liqueur #3: Blend (use blender) all ingredients until smooth. Store tightly covered in refrigerator. Shake before serving. Keeps up to one month.
Texas Cool-Aid: Pour over ice, shake until cooled, then pour into glass.
Afternoon: Build into a suiting glass, with no ice. Cream on top if wanted. Served directly.
April's Apple: Pour apple pucker into glass, add granadine, then fill glass with lemonade. Can be served on ice.
Hunch Punch: Put them all together and mix it with a lot of ice. For big parties use more of each and mix in a garbage can.
Pulp Vega: Crush the cherries in the glass and mix it with the other ingrediences
Starla's Waver: This drink is only for people who have experience with alcohol, do not drink it if you hate hangovers or get drunk easily, believe me this will make you very drunk!!!!
Thai Iced Coffee: Prepare a pot of coffee at a good European strength. In the ground coffee, add 2 or 3 freshly ground cardamom pods. Sweeten while hot, then cool quickly. Serve in highball glass over ice, with cream. To get the layered effect, place a spoon atop the coffee and pour the milk carefully into the spoon so that it floats on the top of the coffee.
Caribbean Screwdriver: Obviously this is not a drink for a small glass. Shake with ice. Strain the mixture into a tall glass. Garnish with a cherry if you feel so inclined.
Electric Jello: Made in large quantities usually. Mixing varies depending on personal preference. Mix Jell-O as you normally would. Replace 26oz of water with 26oz of vodka (strong). Pour mixed Jell-O and Vodka into glasses or small cups for serving. Let set in freezer (vodka requires colder temperature to set). Serve after it has set with a spoon.
Kentucky Hot Tub: A surprisingly good shooter. Sweet and smooth at first taste with a spicy finish. Give it a try.
Bitter lime: Pour 2 oz. Gin (seagrams lemon lime, best), over Ice cubes. Then pour 4 oz. of Lemon lime Gatorade. To finish pour 2 tbspn of lime juice and mix.
White Russian: Pour vodka and coffee liqueur over ice cubes in an old-fashioned glass. Fill with light cream and serve.
Viscous Robert: Serve to patrons who have temper tantrums.
Pamela: Simply make a standard vodka and tonic and garnish liberally with sliced cucumbers. sounds funny, but makes a great hot weather drink.
Cranberry Blast: Pour all ingredients over cubed or crushed ice stir well and serve!
Ice Pick #1: Put Vodka in glass fill with iced tea. Stir in lemon to taste.
PEZ: mix all three ingredients together over ice in tumbler. shake well. for shot, strain ice. for drink, retain ice. adjust sour mix ratio to taste.
Tanga: In blender add Orange Tang Mix, Absolut Vodka, and ice. Blend until smooth.
Black Irish: Sweet but very refreshing. Available at the worldfamous Unicorn Pub in Yellowknife, Northwest Territory, Canada.
Adios Mother: This drink started in Newport Beach, CA.
Lava Lamp: Pour over ice. Grenadine first, then Absolute Citron, fill to top with Apple Juice.
K.G.B. Cocktail: Shake all ingredients (except lemon peel) with ice and strain into a cocktail glass. Add the twist of lemon peel and serve.
Viva Villa: Rub rim of old-fashioned glass with lemon juice and dip in salt. Shake all ingredients with ice, strain into the salt-rimmed glass over ice cubes, and serve.
Banshee: Combine ingredients with crushed ice in a mixing glass, then shake & strain into a cocktail glass.
Greazy Deigo: Empty zima into glass. Then add the 2 shots of 151 rum. next add the Kool-Aid. Mix until a light froth is achieved...and enjoy
Jersey Lightning: Shake all ingredients with ice, strain into a cocktail glass, and serve.
Green Coconut: Combine in shaker with ice and pour over ice.
Romulan Ale #2: Add all ingredients to mug, Zima last. Pour once hard into shaker, gently back into mug. Use more tabasco if less sweetness is desired.
Dead Nazi: pour rumple minze(should be pre chilled) into shot glass add jager(should also be pre chilled), serve
Ulanda Cocktail: Stir all ingredients with ice, strain into a cocktail glass, and serve.
Elmer Fudpucker: Makes a nice fruity bevrage (despite the idea of beer and Sprite/Slice!). Best to sit down and enjoy an entire pitcher by yourself in one sitting, possibly watching the game, then stand up. This is not an original drink by me, I mearly passing it along.
Amer Picon Punch: A great summertime cooler with a unique flavor!
Combustible Edison: In a shaker full of cracked ice, combine Campari and lemon juice. Shake and strain into a chilled cocktail glass. Heat brandy in a chaffing dish. When warm, ignite the brandy and pour in a flaming stream into the cocktail glass.
Fuck Me Up: This drink is also known as a beam me up scotty, only layer ingredients in shooter glass and drink!
Fjellbekk (Mountain Stream): Mix everything in a glass with ice.
Egg Nog #4: In a small mixer bowl beat egg yolks till blended. Gradually add 1/4 cup sugar, beating at high speed till thick and lemon colored. Stir in milk, stir in rum, bourbon, vanilla, and salt. Chill thoroughly. Whip cream. Wash beaters well. In a large mixer bowl beat egg whites till soft peaks form. Gradually add remaining 1/4 cup sugar, beating to stiff peaks. Fold yolk mixture and whipped cream into egg whites. Serve immediately. Sprinkle nutmeg over each serving. Serve in a punch bowl or another big bowl. NOTE: For a nonalcoholic eggnog, prepare Eggnog as above, except omit the bourbon and rum and increase the milk to 3 cups.
Irish Cream #2: Great for X-mas cheer. Best when drunk in front of a fire.
Love Juice (LJ): First add rum, followed by other ingredients, mix well. Serve on the rocks with an orange slice in a Collins Glass (approx. 14 oz.).
Vanilla Coke: I suppose you could substitute vanilla liqueur or vodka for the southern comfort.
Grim Reaper: Mix Kahlua and 151 in glass. Quickly add ice and pour grenadine over ice to give ice red tint.
Afganistany Whore: Invented by a great drunk, James Hong.
Shark's tooth: Pour rum, lemon juice, lime juice, and grenadine in a short collins glass. Shake or stir, then add splash of soda.
Screaming Dead Nazi: Pour all in shot glass, one by one. Set aflame, blow it out, and enjoy.....
Be Sweet: Add a few ice cubes and fill the glass with ginger ale
Southern Death Cult: Put ice in a highball glass and the add the liquors. Top the glass off with Coke and 7-up and a lemon twist. Stir.
Dreamy Chocolate Winter: Add Kahlua and Irish Cream to Hot Chocolate. Then add Amaretto to your taste. Stir.
Boston Sidecar: Shake all ingredients with ice, strain into a cocktail glass, and serve.
Fancy Whiskey: Shake all ingredients (except lemon peel) with ice and strain into a cocktail glass. Add the twist of lemon peel and serve.
Apple Pie Shot #1: Pour one shot of Apple Juice and another of Vodka. Sprinkle cimmamon on the tougue and pour both shots into your mouth. Without drinking, shake your head until cimmamon is dissovled and drink. (Repeat if nessesary....or unconscious on the floor.)
Nuts and Berries #4: Mix ingredients with ice and shake. Serve with ice strained out.
Soviet: Shake all ingredients (except lemon peel) with ice and strain into an old-fashioned glass over ice cubes. Add the twist of lemon peel and serve.
Joe Collins: Pour scotch and sweet and sour into a collins glass over ice cubes and stir well. Fill with cola and stir lightly. Top with the cherry and serve.
French Whore: Shake vigorously over ice and strain into a rocks glass.
Pink Elephant: Pour grenadine into snifter and swirl around so it coats most of the glass surface. Dump out. Add gin.
Bootlegger Tea: Order of pour: Pint glass iced, 3/4 oz Vodka, 3/4 oz Rum, 3/4 oz Triple Sec. 1/2 fill sweet and sour, 1/2 fill seven-up, splash grenadine to get a slight pink color
Fuzzy F**ker: Mix all ingrediants in a highball glass. Serve overice. Enjoy!
Hot Pants: Shake with ice cubes and pour into old-fashioned glass rimmed with salt.
Green Voodoo: Sweet and best served chilled. Made at Quarters Club located in Huntsville, TX. By a Sam Houston State student.
The BV: Use small amounts lime wedge, pepper, and/or salt if desired. If you like a spicier taste subsitute bloody mary mix for tomato juice.
Hunka Hunka Burnin Luv: Pour all ingredients into a glass (larger than 12 oz.). Put a lid over the glass. Shake vigorously for 30 seconds.
African Lullaby: Mix all ingredients in blender with one cup crushed ice. Pour into glass and garnish with red Cherry.
Creole: Shake all ingredients with ice, strain into an old-fashioned glass over ice cubes, and serve.
Ski Slope: Tastes like hawaiian punch with a kick
On My Ass: Poor liqour equally into a shot glass. Give it a quick swirl and top with a cherry.
Girlie Martini: Coat the inside of a chilled cocktail glass with dry vermouth. In a mixing glass filled half way with crushed ice, combine vodka, champagne and maraschino liqueur. Stir and strain into the cocktail glass. Garnish with an olive and a maraschino cherry on a cocktail skewer.
Spiced Cherry Jello: Boil one cup water. Add the package of cherry jello. Stir for 2 minutes. Then pour in the cup of spiced rum. Stir until mixed. Pour into a pan and refrigerate.
Flamming Gorrilla Titties: This shot is a favorite at all my parties so try and enjoy it.
Bourbon Cobbler #1: In an old-fashioned glass, dissolve the sugar in the club soda. Add crushed ice until the glass is almost full. Add the bourbon and stir well. Garnish with the cherry, orange and lemon slices.
Black Magic: Mix ingredients with cracked ice in a shaker or blender. Pour into a chilled old-fashioned glass.
Tropical Orgasm: This is great at parties. Women especially like it because it is not too harsh and has a pleasing taste to it. But careful! Beause you cannot taste the vodka or rum very well, it goes down very easy. Its easy to get drunk on this stuff.
8 Seconds: Mix all ingrediants with ice and strain. Serve chilled.
Simpson Bronco: Add all ingrediants in mixing tin with ice and strain
A midsummernight dream: Mix the strawberrys in a blender Pour it together with the vodka,kirch and strawberry liquer over ice in a shaker. Shake well and pour in a highballglass. Fill up with the Russchian water
Ironman: It kinda tastes like a Brandy old fashioned, but yet has a distinctive taste to it. I made this drink up at my brother's batchleor's party and was a big hit. So i have to send out thanks to Daver. E-mail comments are happily accepted
Perfect Kiss: A nice girlish drink with a good looking appearance. The crushed ice and strawberry makes it look delicious.
Southern Blues: small shaker with ice add ingredients stir strain into shot glass
McTavish: My brother, Todd, invented this drink. It serves the family name well.
The Bootlegger: Mix three shots together in a glass. Pour over ice. Sit down and drink.
Rum Gimlet: Pour the rum and Rose's lime juice into a mixing glass half-filled with ice cubes. Stir well. Strain into a cocktail glass. Garnish with the lime wedge.
Rock-and-Rye Toddy: May also be served in Old-fashioned glass
Mojo: Failure to stir will cause pineapple to solidify and settle, turning brown in the process (YUCK!) Very potent. Keep moving while drinking. If you sit while drinking, you will fall over when you try to stand. I learned of this drink while stationed in Japan in 1978.
Purple Russian Gonzo: The drink should look like grape juice. I invented it for my girlfriend one night when she was relaxing in the tub.
Strawberry Blond: You could also make it into a cocktail-style drink by adding milk. -- Created at Mount Royal College, Calgary, Canada
L&C;: Put pineapple in the blender and blend (duh) till smooth. Add vodka, rum, and enough ice to raise the level to five cups. Blend until the ice gets all smashed up. Pour into tall glasses; garnish with the cherry. Drink until YOU get all smashed up.
78 Camaro: Fill a cocktail shaker with ice. Add liquor and pineapple juice. Shake and serve in glass. Top with champagne.
A 243: The name of the drink is my apartment :)
The Captains Silver Sunrise: A beautiful sight that has quite a bite
Blueberry Tea #2: Pour amaretto and grand marnier in the glass Add hot tea
Swiss Family Cocktail: Stir all ingredients with ice, strain into a cocktail glass, and serve.
Goombay Smash: Mix all ingredients in highball with ice and shake. Garnish with orange slice and cherry.
Shark's Nipple: For those that can't take really strong drinks but still like to get blitzed.
Frooty Biznitch: Mix in all ingredients in a shaker, strain into a cocktail glass, and garnish with pineapple wedge and cherry.
La Mamila: First empty the beers then mix the lemons, tabasco and the salt then empty the tequila and then the clamato, swirl everytihng. This drinking by four people is a baby boom "Try it if you are not a baby".
Peach May Cocktail: For a stronger drink, can replace the apple juice with 1 oz of apple liqueur and add 1 oz of white rhum.
Arctic Fish: Fill glass with ice and fish, add vodka, grape soda and orange juice. DO NOT STIR!!!!! Serve well chilled.
Banana Punch #1: Pour brandy, vodka, and juice of lime into a collins glass over crushed ice. Fill with carbonated water and stir. Decorate with banana slices and mint sprigs and serve.
Bermuda Rose: Shake all ingredients with ice, strain into a cocktail glass, and serve.
Entwistle's Error: Pour all of the ingredients into a highball glass almost filled with ice cubes. Stir well.
Reynolds Special: A simple but wonderful summer drink.
Thriller: In a shaker half-filled with ice cubes, combine all of the ingredients. Shake well. Strain into a cocktail glass.
Far West: Put in a Shaker with ice, shake well, pour out in cocktail glasses and add some cinnamon powder over it.
Ultimate Mudslide: Place all ingredients, except grated chocolate, in a blender and blend until smooth. Pour into glass and sprinkle with grated chocolate
Blonde Bombshell: If the proportions seem a little strong feel free to change the amounts of ingredients as needed, or a few shots of water instead of some of the shots of rum. This recipe should make enough for 2-4 people, depending upon the size of your margarita glasses.
The Hollywood: You can also do The Hollywood as a shot for a real Hollywood Expierence.
Mountain Sex: Pour Mountain Dew in glass then add Triple Sec and stir.
Strawberry Bomb: Pour ingredients into shot glass and slam. Enjoy!
Alexandra: Mix in a shaker, add some ice and shake very well
Corfu Lule: It was invented in Corfu, Greece by me Erik Larsson and my best friends, Fredde, Huvve, Johny and The crow.
Hot-Buttered Rum: In a mug put sugar, butter, rum and cloves. Fill with boiling water. Stir.
Si Kami Ki: mix vodka and cinnamon schnapps in cocktail glass, add corbonated water, serve with ice
Mind Eraser: In a rocks glass pour vodka, the Kahlua and then the tonic water. Serve with a straw.
Tropical: Shake or build directly in the glass.
Cocaine Shooter: Shake with ice and strain. Serve in chilled shot glass.
Angel's Kiss: Pour ingredients carefully, in order given, into a pousse-cafe glass so that they do not mix.
Bearded Boy: Add all ingredients and stir for 5 minutes, allowing alcohol to settle.
Slapshot: Add a cherry on top for added color. A favorite of hockey fans!
Killing Light: Highly dangerous mix-but taste it! You'll be surprised.
Fire Fly: Pour the vodka and grapefruit juice into a glass with ice. Add grenadine and stir.
Black Army: Pour gently, i'ts important to get 2 layers. Use a shot glass. You can use 2 cl of each, if 3 is to much for you.
Meister Mind Meld: Pour the Coca-Cola into a highball glass. Then add the Amaretto. Finish off with one ice cube so the carbination does not leave the beverage
Montreal Gin Sour: Shake all ingredients (except lemon slice) with ice and strain into a whiskey sour glass. Add the slice of lemon and serve.
Sperm: Fill the slammer glass with tequila and vodka and drop carefully some cream in it.
Nevins: Shake all ingredients with ice, strain into a cocktail glass, and serve.
Jello Shot: Mix hot water and jello. Add rum. Pour into 2 ounce cups. Serve after the jello has set.
Ladies Man: A favorite from Courvoisier. Presumably named after the "Ladies Man" sketch on "Saturday Night Live": Courvoisier being the title character's favorite beverage.
Absolute HB: Pour everything in a beer mug and shake it. Then you simply drink it.
Tanyahtoo: Created by Tanya of the Criterion Hotel, Rockhampton
Shark Bite: Fill a shaker with ice. Add the spiced rum, light rum, sour, and blue curacco. Shake the ingredients well. Strain into a rocks glass. Garnish with three drops of grenadine.
Spooge: Pour ingredients into a mixing tin, shake like a wild man, and strain into a martini glass.
London Buck: Stir all ingredients (except lemon peel) with ice and strain into a highball glass. Add the twist of lemon peel and serve.
Havana Cocktail: In a shaker half-filled with ice cubes, combine all of the ingredients. Shake well. Strain into a cocktail glass.
Santa Shot: Taste like a candycane layer these in the order listed to get a red green and white(clear) shot.
White Heart: Shake all ingredients with ice, strain into a cocktail glass, and serve.
Hemingway Daiquiri: Shake with ice and strain into a chilled cocktail glass.
Phillips Screwdriver: Just another little twist on the screwdriver to give it some kick.
Hot Gold: Gently heat the orange juice and pour it into a red wine glass. Add amaretto. Garnish with a stick of cinnamon.
Generic Kamikaze: Cheaper way to make a kamikaze.
September Morning: In a shaker half-filled with ice cubes, combine all of the ingredients. Shake well. Strain into a cocktail glass.
Buzzby: My finest drink. While it may seem overpowering, the taste is divine. Have two in half and hour and your in the zone.
The Original Singapore Sling: In a mixing glass half-filled with ice cubes, combine the gin, Benedictine, and chery brandy. Stir well. Strain into a colliins glass almost filled with ice cubes. Top with the club soda and stir well.
Gorilla Milk: Invented by T. Harper and his Frat Brothers on one of those crazy nights.
Jim Kroener: Mix all the ingredients in a big ol' jar and enjoy!
Polarbear #1: Take one part vodka into the glass, pour one part lime in the same glass. Then you take two parts of 7-up or sprite. Mix this together with a straw or something like that. Ice is recommended.
Mudslide #2: measure all ingredients into a shot glass and drink
Shiny Nail: Sweet with a sting - easy to drink. Inspired by the drink Rusty Nail. Shiny from the sun of the vermouth bottle. Invented by my wife Lena.
Smooth Pink Lemonade: Also makes great shot good partner to Kamakazie!!
Gin Rickey: Pour juice of lime and gin into a highball glass over ice cubes. Fill with carbonated water and stir. Add the wedge of lime and serve.
Magic Star: Created by Josè Abreu, Portugal. Winner of the 1987 I.B.A. international cocktail competition.
Dixie Julep: Combine bourbon and powdered sugar in a collins glass. Fill with ice and stir gently until glass is frosted. Add the three sprigs of mint and serve with a straw.
C*m in a Hot Tub: Pour the vodka and rum carefully but not too carefully into a glass. They have different consistencies and you want them to mix just a little. Now let several drops of Bailey's fall into the liquor.
Lil Naue: Shake all ingredients (except cinnamon) with ice and strain into a red wine glass. Sprinkle cinnamon on top and serve.
Royal Bitch: If the person doing the shot takes a sniff all they will smell is the Crown.(ooooh). Once it is slammed the Frangelico tends to overide the burn of the Crown, and adds a nice "buttery" taste.
Knickerbocker Cocktail: Stir all ingredients (except lemon peel) with ice and strain into a cocktail glass. Add the twist of lemon peel and serve.
Green Dinosaur #3: Stir ingredients in ice and strain into a shot glass.
Up all night: Pour Red Bull into a Collins Glass. Pour a shot of Jägermeister into a shot glass. When ready to drink, drop the shot into the collins glass and drink.
Frog in a blender: Blend OJ, Blue Maui, and Vodka, put in glass. Splash grenadine on top, but do not stir in . Drink
Homewrecker: Legend has it that on the morning after this drink was created, the two creators woke up with women who were not their wives, hence the name.
Red Death (MAC style): mix together in large container....stir in the alcohol from atart of list till the halls....for melted halls centers do the following...: use a needle and thread and put it through each halls..tie a knot after each one...place in 1 to 2 litres of boiling..and i mean boiling hot water until all are melted pour into bowl and mix in the water and raspberry juice. have fun should serve 10 to 20 people at 1 litre each we use this for our residence house drink ..it is safe and actually very tastey..try it and see.
Roselyn Cocktail: Stir all ingredients (except lemon peel) with ice and strain into a cocktail glass. Add the twist of lemon peel and serve.
Salty Dog #2: Combine the grapefruit juice, vidka sugar and 4 or 5 ice cubes in a mixing glass, and stir gently with a bar spoon to dissolve the sugar and combine the ingredients. Strain into a chilled wineglass. Add 1 ice cube to the wineglass if desired.
Alien Urine Sample: Hand shake or blend with ice the liquer with the sour. Strain the drink from the ice into a pounder glass. Float Blue Curacao before serving
Coffee Sour: Shake all ingredients with ice, strain into a whiskey sour glass, and serve.
Fiery Blue Mustang: Mix ingredients and light on fire. Blow out flame, saddle up, and enjoy the ride!
Crooked Monkey: I ordered this drink in a bar in the Village. The bartender asked me for a name, and my friend came up with the name Crooked Monkey.
Hot Vanilla: In a heavy saucepan, combine the ingredients and warm over low heat. When small bubbles appear around the sides of the pan, remove it from the heat and let the mixture sit at room temperature for 15 to 20 minutes. Place the pan back on the stove and rewarm the mixture, whisking it briefly to redistribute the skin that forms on the milk's surface. Remove the vanilla bean half, scrape out the seeds with a sharp knife, and return the seeds to the milk. Pour the vanilla milk into two 8-ounce mugs and top with sprinklings of cinnamon or canela. Drink hot.
Bocci Ball: Shake amaretto and orange juice first then top with soda.
Cocaine Lady #2: Shake. Strain over ice. Float coke on top.
Honey Lemonade: Place all ingredients in the blender jar - cover and whiz on medium speed until well blended. Pour in one tall, 2 medium or 3 small glasses and drink up.
Mint Julep #2: Lightly muddle 4 of the mint sprigs with the sugar and a few drops of water in the bottom of the glass. Almost fill the glass with crushed ice. Add the bourbon and some short straws. Garnish with the remaining 2 mint sprigs.
Dublin Doubler: Mix irish whiskey, irish cream, and ice cubes. Shake to chill. Serve with or without the ice, it is very good either way.
Dr. Pepper #2: Combine the shots in a 'collins' glass. Fill the rest of the glass 3/4 full with Coke. Add crushed ice.
Green Milkshake: Great look!! But the taste is only average
Bronx Cocktail (Dry): Shake all ingredients (except orange slice) with ice and strain into a cocktail glass. Add orange slice and serve.
Manhattan Dry #2: Stir vermouth and blended whiskey with ice and strain into a cocktail glass. Add the olive and serve.
Screwdriver (modified): if you want to vary the drink it goes basically 2 parts vodka, 3 parts apple, and 3 parts orange juice. virtually no alcohol taste but when mixed properly packs one helluva wallop.
Bloody Brit: "Bloody" from the red Campari. "Brit" from the gin. Not as strong-tasting as it sounds. You must be a Campari fan to enjoy this one. The gin taste is fairly well masked by the Campari. I invented this one.
Tea Toddy #2: This is the new, Improved Teatoddy Still good for cold wintersdays or nights. Be careful, though, as this drink tend to gently sweep you off your feet and comfortabely lay you down :-) Enjoy!
April Rain: Pour Vodka, Vermouth and lime cordial into shaker over ice. Shake with care not to bruise. Strain into chilled cocktail (martini) glass. Garnish with lime peel (zest).
Midori Sun: From Sweden, made it my self. It's very easy to vary the drink from sweet to more sour. Just change the amount of lime mix or more pj to get it sweeter for example.
Diva: Pour and build in a tall glass or collins glass. Fill with 7-up. Garnish with cherry and lime.
Working Man's Zinfandel: So named for it's appearance. Looks like White Zinfandel, but it's made of hard liquor.
Blueberry Kami: Shake in shaker with ice. Pour the shots.
Cherry Rum: Shake all ingredients with ice, strain into a cocktail glass, and serve.
Snake Bite Black (UK): I lived off this stuff in England. Most pub tenders would only serve 2-3 per customer, so watch-out......This drink has a funny way of sneaking up on you! Taste like Kool-Aid.
Laura's Surprise: Add banana, strawberry, pinapple, ice, and captain morgan, into blender, and mix into slush. Pour into glass, top with cherry and orange slice on side.
Pure Pleasure: Shake all the ingridiens whith lots of ice. Stir in a Hurricane glas.
Trogg's Nog: Pour liquor over ice, fill with eggnog, and stir.
Citronella Cooler: Smooth citrus taste without as much pucker as what you might think. Quite tasty, indeed. Enjoy!
Kamakazie #2: Pour Absolut and Cointreau over ice in glass. Squezze and drop in lime to taste.
God's Great Creation: Pour Whiskey and Peach Schnapps over ice cubes in a High Ball Glass. Add frozen canned orange banana punch (no water). Add lemon juice and fill the rest with pepsi. Stir well and serve.
Vesper #2: This James Bond's martini found in Ian Fleming's first 007 novel, "Casino Royale".
Ugly: fill beer glass 3/4 full of beer, slowly pour tomato juice down the side so it settles on the bottom. Shake salt in the palm of your hand. Throw salt into the glass and wait until the top foams up. Chug the drink and then scream UGLY!!
Smiler Cocktail: Shake all ingredients with ice, strain into a cocktail glass, and serve.
Dead Bastard: Pour ingredients into glass, stir, and drink.
Purple Elastic Thunder Fuck: Go ahead and call a cab before you shoot this one!
Wild Squirrel Sex: Created by Kam's bartender Jeff Piper in Champaign, IL
Blue-Woo: Pour 1/2 oz. vodka and a 1/2 oz. blueberry schnapps in a tall glass. Balance with cranberry juice.
Naked Navel: Gives a icy blast with a peach ending. Created by barstaff for that after work refresher.
Party Slush Punch #1: Mix ingredients together, freeze to slush consistency and serve "slushy".
Ha Ha Tonka: use 16 oz. cup, fill ice, pour in alcohol, then top with orange juice, for weaker, add more OJ.
ChoozyMothers Milk: In a large kettle (lobster pot), mix the Bacardi 151 Dark Rum, Bacardi White Rum, Kahlua, Milk and Vanilla Ice Cream (keep the ice cream in its form from the carton). Stir and mix in the cinnamon powder.
Cactus Bite: In a shaker half-filled with ice cubes, combine all of the ingredients. Shake well. Strain into a cocktail glass.
Tipsy Island: Crush ice in a blender. Add frozen strawberries and banana to blender. Put on low speed and add Malibu & Banana liqueur. Pour into tall glass.
Raspberry Truffle: Very rich flavor without the overpowering taste of alcohol.
Jenny's Concoction: Pour the vodka and anisette into the glass and top it off with orange juice.
Pan Galactic Gargle Blaster (Zaphod's): Drink comes out a lovely blue colour. It gets people drunk very quickly, and has never produced a hangover. This recipe is based on one which came from Zaphod Beeblebrox's, a bar in Ottawa. However, the drink has circulated around Nova Scotia fandom a lot and has probably changed a bit.
Amaretto Sunrise Crush: Blend orange juice, amaretto, grenadine and ice cubes in blender until smooth. Pour into glass and add lemon juice.
Hazelnut Martini: add ingredients into mixing glass, chill and strain
Leaning Tower: In a mixing glass half-filled with crushed ice, combine all of the ingredients. Stir well. Strain into a cocktail glass.
Brain Tumor #2: Add Schnapps, Dribble Bailey's to give the look of a brain and add a few drops of grenadine to make that hemmorage look.
Mutual Orgasm: Pour ingredients into a pint glass half-filled with ice cubes. Alternately pour to another glass 3 or 4 times until chilled.
After Party: I created this drink out of boredom so have fun with it. As the punch bowl gets lower add more vodka!
Hurts You Right Here!: My buddy and I invented His name is Joe and He is Evil! Name is derived from the shooting spike this shot nails into your forehead,just above the right eye! You will stumble home.
Dancing Dutchman: Optional: Keep adding alcohol throughout the evening.
Sex on the Beach: Half fill with cranberry juice and grapefruit juice, stir in highball glass.
California Dream: In a mixing glass half-filled with ice cubes, combine the tequila, sweet vermouth, and dry vermouth. Stir well. Strain into a cocktail glass and garnish with the cherry.
Monique: The strawberries shall be very sweet, if they aren't use som sweetened orange juice
Amaretto Stone Sour #2: Add Amaretto, OJ, and Sour in a tub over ice.
Green Eyed Blonde: This shot tastes like a dream. It's sweet and creamy, but not so sweet it makes you sick. In a word, smooth. Careful, they may seem tame, but after a few they sneak up on you.
Ultimate June Bug: Blend all ingredients and pour over ice.
Wife Beater: Combine in shaker. Shake untill cloudy. Pour.
Mad Scientist #2: Phosphorous green with blue flame makes for a great look! Also great in a shot glass or beaker for that classic B-movie look. My customers love that hot apple "Jolly Rancher" flavor. Experiment with the right mix of melon and sour for your customers.
Snakebite (Aus): Pour Chartreuse into shot glass, and dash the Tabasco in. More Tabasco for a more venomous bite!
The Dangerous Dave: This drink was invented at the Atlantis Resort on Paradise Island, Nassau, Bahamas during the Bad Boys I Cruise. It's your basic (but good) Pina Colada but made with Tequila instead of Rum. Why? Because it was Tequila day when it was invented. It's a favorite with the ladies. Enjoy!
Sexual Trance: Shake well with ice and strain over ice cherry garnish
Milk Punch: Shake liquor and milk with cracked ice and strain into a chilled highball glass. Sprinkle nutmeg on top
Whiskey Highball: Pour blended whiskey into a highball glass over ice cubes. Fill with carbonated water and stir. Add the twist of lemon peel and serve.
Blue Neptune: Fill a shaker with vodka, blue curacao, lemon juice, and ice. Shake well. Strain into sugar-rimmed martini glass. Garnish with lemon peel.
Plaza Cocktail: Shake all ingredients (except pineapple stick) with ice and strain into a cocktail glass. Add the stick of pineapple and serve.
Olle Goop: Just mix in a highball glass.
Livingston: You can live off of these things, use discretion as to amount of rum. The listed ingredients are for Mount Gay but you may wish to increase tonic water level if cheaper or spiced rum is used.
Clueless: The strawberry juice and orange juice can be in an already mixed juice drink. Ex. A tropicana strawberry orange burster. This drink is excellent, and it will get you loaded very quickily! Amounts of ingredient's may very to taste.
Texas T: Tasty camping drink. Good in da canteen with a thousage thandwith.
The Vibrator: This drink's home is at Jillians Entertainment Complex in Albany New York and was invented by Richard Gerard. It has been published in bartender magazine. We serve on the average 50-60 of these on a friday night.
Tartan Swizzle: In a shaker half-filled with ice cubes, combine lime juice, sugar, Scotch, and bitters. Shake well. Almost fill a collins glass with crushed ice. Stir until glass is frosted. Strain mixture in shaker into the glass and add the club soda.
Batida de Coco: Blend well and add crushed ice.
Maria's Delight: Mix all ingredients in a drinkmixer with ice cubes. Pour in a highball glass and fill up with ginger ale.
Kanaan: Prepare in a blender with a little ice, serve in a highball glass.
Brown Eye Opener: Mix all five together then chill.
Champagne Punch #1: Combine all of the ingredients and serve in punch cups.
Sweet Tart - Loyalist Rez: You may wish to change messurements slightly, which is why it is best to mix large amounts. It actually does taste like the sweet tart you had as a child
Ice-Cream Flip: Shake all ingredients (except nutmeg) with ice and strain into a coupette glass. Sprinkle nutmeg on top and serve.
Purple Haze Shooter: The recipe seems to work better when making more than one shot.
Undertow: Excellent balance of sour and sweet.
Green Eyes: Pour over crushed ice and stir or can be blended.
Frozen Rum Runner: Blend at high speed until smooth. Garnish with a lime wheel and cherry. Enjoy!
Milky Nooky: For a "Crunchy Nooky", add chocotale chip cookie crumbs (finely chopped) and chill over night in a sealed mason jar.
Casey Special: Mix and Drink. Slam and Jam.
Charlie Coke: Add 1.5 oz. Absolut Vodka to 10 oz. cocktail glass filled with ice, top off with Coka-Cola.
Holy Water: Combine alcohol in a rocks glass over ice. Fill with tonic water, then add only a dash of Grenadine. Be sure the drink is served with the tonic still bubbling.
Red Hope: Created by Jahn Nesset, Norway. Winner of the 1993 I.B.A. international cocktail competition.
Snapple and Schnapps: A friend of mine mixed this for herself at a party and I enjoyed it so much that I decided to try making it myself. It is a very refreshing summer drink especially if you like either peachy stuff or pink lemonade. Enjoy!
Pumpkin Eater: Add ice and ingredients into blender and blend well. Serve in a house glass and garnish with a orange wedge and cherry.
Bourbon Fix: In a shaker half-filled with ice cubes, combine the sugar, lemon juice, and water. Shake well. Strain into a highball glass almost filled with crushed ice. Add the bourbon. Stir well and garnish with the cherry and the lemon slice.
PB&J;: Combine all ingredients into shaker with ice. Shake and strain into shot glass. Serve.
Mai Tai: Shake all ingredients (except cherry) with ice and strain into a collins glass over several ice cubes. Top with the cherry and serve.
Mamie Gilroy: Pour all ingredients into a collins glass over ice cubes, stir, and serve.
Kahlua Bomb: Andrea and Pat at Swarthmore College enjoy this drink on lonely Saturday nights!
Chihuahua: Fresh squeezed juice is far superior. This is like a greyhound made with tequila.
Cosmos: In a shaker half-filled with crushed ice, combine all of the ingredients. Shake well. Strain into a cocktail glass.
Sweet Tart: Shake ingredients in a mixing cup with ice. Strain into 7 oz. old-fashioned glass and serve.
Orange Bitters: Orange Bitters is a common ingredient in older cocktails, but can be hard to find. This is a recipe to make your own.
Hop, Skip, and Go Naked #2: Mix in a big ass cooler. If limeade is not available can substitute with concentrated lime juice. The amount of beer varies with individual taste.
Sour Apple Martini: Shake with ice and strain into a chilled cocktail glass. Garnish with a slice of apple.
Sangria - The World's Best: You may use orange or lemon flavored soda instead of the soda water.
Abilene: Pour all of the ingredients into a highball glass almost filled with ice cubes. Stir well.
Brown Hen: Fill glass with ice, then vodka, then bitters. Stir.
Coffee Grasshopper: Shake all ingredients with ice, strain into an old-fashioned glass over ice cubes, and serve.
Dixie Whiskey Cocktail: Shake all ingredients with ice, strain into a cocktail glass, and serve.
After Dinner Cocktail: Shake all ingredients (except lime wedge) with ice and strain into a cocktail glass. Add the wedge of lime and serve.
High Voltage: Enjoy and drink it listening to AC/DC.
Kongepjolter: Pour the Cognac in the mug, then mix the Champagne in.
Sex on the Beach #11: This is a hell of a drink. I'm surprised that this recipe hasn't been added. It's the best kind. Had it in Europe.
Bumbo: In a shaker half-filled with ice cubes, combine all of the ingredients. Shake well. Strain into a cocktail glass.
Bloody Mary: Shake all ingredients (except lime wedge) with ice and strain into an old-fashioned glass over ice cubes. Add salt and pepper to taste. Add the wedge of lime and serve.
Nasty Pablo: Otherwise called a black and blue screw. It should look a nice sewage green, hence the 'nasty' part. Drink, drink another, drink another and streak your neighbors like I did.
Jilly: In a rocks glass, pour 1 oz. vodka over ice. Fill 3/4 with tonic. Add a splash of cranberry juice, then squeeze the lime wedge in.
Full Moon: This drink is meant to sipped and savored.
Whiskey Sour Old-Fashioned: This drink is commonly found at social gathering in Wisconsin and parts of the Midwest. You can also substitute brandy for the whiskey, but remember to change the name. Another variation is to substitute Seven-Up for the Sour and you will have an old fashioned sweet. If making the sweet, you can also substitute olive juice for the cherry juice and garnish with a cherry.
White Lily Cocktail: Shake all ingredients with ice, strain into a cocktail glass, and serve.
Big Time: Mix in a shot glass and enjoy.
Party Slush Punch #3: Mix the following ingredients together and freeze. When slushy, drink as is or mix with 7-UP.
The Eclipse: Designed by a clever guy especially for the 1999 Solar Eclipse, this drink becomes darker if given time to settle - but can you resist it that long?!
Red Eisentrout: If you like red cream soda, you'll love this drink. But warning to the lightweights - you can't taste much alcohol, and they are really sweet. This drink originates from a really bored bartender in Kentucky (who goes by the name of "Eisentrout", pronounced "Eyes n' Trout").
Toreador: Shake ingredients with ice and strain into cocktail glass. Top with a little whipped cream and sprinkle lightly with cocoa.
The Lowee: This is a very good drink that will make you very drunk without even knowing you are drinking alcohol!
Cartwheel: Pour shot of Tuaca. Thoroughly drench the lime in bitters, then coat in powdered sugar. Drink shot, bite into lime, experience a veritable explosion of flavor.
Black Lodge: Invented by Brian Padnes and Greg Yurkovic after many episodes of Twin Peaks.
Thug Passion #2: This drink was started and made popular by the legendary, immortal Tupac (2Pac) Shakur. Rest in peace....
Smooch: pour into a tall glass over ice, shake to mix all ingredients well, garnish with a cherry or an orange slice if you so desire
Grovschpol: Fill a glass (40-50 cl) with whiskey, midori, Bailey's and then C.C. untill you have enough foam (it looks horrible). Drink it with a straw and don't look at the color :-)
Webster Cocktail: Shake all ingredients with ice, strain into a cocktail glass, and serve.
Ogre Drink: Put all ingred. in a bleander and blend untill smooth. Pour into a beer mug and enjoy
Detroit Red Wing: The name is derived from the location of the Vernors company and the fact that this drink is hot!
Strawberry Shivers: Place all ingredients in the blender jar - cover and whiz on medium speed until well blended. Pour in one tall, 2 medium or 3 small glasses and drink up.
Harbor Lights: A drink that's both smooth and flaming, a rare combination. Cheers.
Absolut Summertime: A great summer refresher. Shaking and straining the drink makes it frothy. This drink is also good when you need to 'wet your whistle'. A good first drink of the afternoon or evening.
Sleigh Ride: Float the ingredients in order by pouring over the bottom of a spoon.
Margaret In The Marketplace: In a shaker half-filled with ice cubes, combine all of the ingredients. Shake well. Strain into a cocktail glass.
Mean Green Love Making Machine: Put ingredients in shaker, shake, pour over ice.
Goldfish: When imbibing, drink shot, then chew on the mandarin oranges to act as a chaser.
Bushwacker #3: This drink was originated here in Pensacola, FL. It is so popular that we have a Bushwacker festival for a whole weekend on the Beach during the Summer. Tastes kind of like a Frosty. You can make other versions by adding: bannanas or strawberries, also 151.
Flaming Dr. Pepper: Add Amaretto, Bacardi, and vodka. Mix in the Dr. Pepper and beer
Gin Buck: Pour gin and juice of lemon into an old-fashioned glass over ice cubes. Fill with ginger ale, stir, and serve.
Chilly Willy: Pour into shaker. Fill with orange and pineapple juice. shake well.
Orange Demon: Pour the OJ first, then mix in the Everclear and the Cointreau.
Milwaukee Stop Light: WARNING: I like the liquers, if you don't I wouldn't suggest it, but it'll knock you off your feet. I find it best to do at last call just before calling a taxi
Mad Hatter: A four ounce shot. Look out. I've seen Peach Schnapps substituted by peach juice. cheers.
Tight Snatch: This drink was created by the people who live at the Ski and Outdoor House at York College of Pennsylvania. The type of glass is not important-just as long as you can drink from it!!
Napoleon: Stir all ingredients with ice, strain into a cocktail glass, and serve.
Five Star General: Just put all of them in a shot glass, and put it down.
Taste of Winter: Build in in the glass. Plenty of ice cubes
Outrigger: Shake all ingredients with ice, strain into an old-fashioned glass over ice cubes, and serve.
Murder in the Forest: Also good with Rum instead of Vodka...
Rum Screwdriver: Pour rum into a highball glass over ice cubes. Add orange juice, stir, and serve.
Bloody Biker: This will cure the serious rider of whatever malady the night before has put upon them. Prepare to sweat.
Royal Smile Cocktail: Stir all ingredients with ice, strain into a cocktail glass, and serve.
Lady Godiva: Shake sugar, triple sec, lime and lemon juice with ice. Strain into a highball glass. Fill with brandy.
Sno-Cone: Dreamed up one slow evening at the DayBreak in Mountain View, CA.
Red Frog: Shake with ice and strain into glass with light ice, can also be served as a shooter
Woot's Butter Cream Shot: Fill glass with cream and pour the schnapps on top.
Captain Creamsicle: Add Captain Morgan's to blender. Add equal parts vanilla ice-cream and orange sherbert to taste (O.J. can be substitued for sherbert).
Olympia: In a shaker half-filled with ice cubes, combine all of the ingredients. Shake well. Strain into a cocktail glass.
Southern Pink Flamingo: Mix in a shaker half filled with ice. Strain into a pony glass
The Fucking Shit: The vodka is an estimate. The cranberry juice covers it up so you can really add as much as you want. the lemonade takes away some of the bitterness of the cranberry juice
Solaris: Don't overdo it, looks sweet but hits bullseye
Duck Fuck: Invented at my cabin the day after a huge party using the only stuff left over. I used Tanqueray gin, Stolichnaya vodka, and Busch Ice beer. Hope you don't try too many!
Mojito #2: In a tall thin glass, crush part of the mint with a fork to coat the inside. Add the sugar and lemon juice and stir thoroughly. Top with ice. Add rum and mix. Top off with the club soda (or seltzer). Add a lemon slice and the remaining mint. Serves one.
Mickey Mouse: Shake all ingredients (except lime wedge) with ice and strain into an old-fashioned glass over ice cubes. Add salt and pepper to taste. Add the wedge of lime and serve.
Forgive Me: Stir with ice and strain to cocktail glass.
Hot Buttered Rum Batter #2: Blend all ingredients in a food processer or mixer and store in the fridge or freezer. To make a drink add a shot of good dark rum along with 1 or 2 tbl spoons of batter to a mug of very hot water. Serve in irish coffee cup.
Sonoma: An infamous drink by TP from Penn State!
King Cole Cocktail: Muddle orange slice, pineapple slice, and powdered sugar in an old-fashioned glass. Add blended whiskey and 2 ice cubes, stir well, and serve.
Bloody Sun: Nice smooth taste. Close to tequila sunrise.
Submarine (Mexican): This is a real strong drink even if it doesn't look like it. It is prefered that you drink it on one big gulp.
Watermelon Shooter #5: Put all ingredients in any order into a sifting glass filled with ice. Shake for 5 seconds and pour the chilled contents into your cocktail glass.
Arkansas Buttermilk: A local favorite of Fort Smith's finest!
Stevie Ray Vaughn: Shake ingredients over ice. Strain into shot glasses.
Christmas Pudding: If Draught Guinness is not available chilled bottled or canned Guinness will do
Pure Ecstacy: Absolutely great. Haven't struck out yet with this drink. Guarenteed results after the second pitcher, for the averege crowd, as for you lush ones, seek help.
Bushwacker #1: From N.W. Florida Bushwacker festival. Good drink!
Daylon's Bedtime: Pour vanilla vodka into ice filled glass. Add Triple Sec. Add Soda to taste. Mix with straw.
Lawn Boy: If you have access to fresh mint, this will make for some memorable (or blissfully forgettable) summer nights. Although Minneapolis has its downsides, sipping these with friends on the porch was not one of them.
On the Deck: For best results mix all ingredients into a frosted Mug.
Chocolate Milk: Put the milk in the bottom, pour the Liquer on top and add the dash of amaretto. Do not mix. SLAM IT!
Maiden's Prayer: Shake all ingredients with ice, strain into a cocktail glass, and serve.
Sweet Passoa: Fill half of the glass with ice and stir.
Violent fuck: Fill highball glass with ice, add 1oz. curaco 1/2oz sloe gin fill 1/2 sour mix, 1/2 oj blend for 2 secs, garnish with cherry
Gin And Tonic: Pour the gin and the tonic water into a highball glass almost filled with ice cubes. Stir well. Garnish with the lime wedge.
Snow White: Place Sprite/7up into glass. Pour Heineken to top off. Mixture can be varied. Good summertime drink.
Blow Blue Bubbles: Pour blueberry schnapps into champagne flute. Fill with champagne.
El Presidente Cocktail #1: Shake all ingredients with ice, strain into a cocktail glass, and serve.
Graveyard (light): WARNING: Strong stuff! Do NOT try to drink this if you can't drink very well.
Matt's Tropical Punch: I messed up trying to make another drink for my girlfriend, but she liked this one even better.
Curious Comfort: Makes a crazy turquoise color and tastes wonderful. Vote for this drink if you like it!
The Canadian Gulp: This drink is more like a "big gulp" as you are to chug it all down until it's gone. Sounds bad, but if you like Dr. Pepper it's tastes great and gets you feeling good.
Grapefruit Lemonade: Place some ice cubes in a large tumbler, add grenadine syrup and grapefruit juice, top up with soda water. Stir a little and serve with a drinking straw.
Blue Kisok: Pour an half ounce of Blue Curacao into shot glass. Follow with quarter of an ounce of Vodka. (Try and use Smirnoff) One table spoon of lime juice. Then fill rest of glass with sprite.
Long Island Iced Tea #4: Mix all liquors and sweet and sour and top off with Pepsi Cola. Stir and Serve with a Lemon wheel.
Yellow Bellied Sap Sucker: This was made up at the Kokokan Club, Kuta, Bali, Indonesia. It is incredibly sour, and is taken in a small shot glass.
Cafe De Paris Cocktail: Shake all ingredients with ice, strain into a cocktail glass, and serve.
Knacky: You can also use ice tea with peach flavor instead of juice and tea.
Doralto: In a shaker half-filled with ice cubes, combine the tequila, lemon juice, sugar, and bitters. Shake well. Strain into a highball glass almost filled with ice cubes. Top with the tonic water and garnish with the lime wedge.
Almond Joy Dark: Pour liquors over ice. Fill with pineapple. Add grenadine to color. Shake. Garnish with pineapple flag.
Soul Taker: Has a very strong taste, we used it mainly for drinking games when we felt like getting plastered. Origin unknown, one day it just showed up at a party and became a favorite ever since
Bruised Heart: Pour all ingredients in a mixing tin over ice, stir, and strain into shot glass
Buzzer's red cream soda: Place crushed ice in blender (at least 5 cup size) Add other ingredients in order given (alcohol first) Blend until ice crystals are thoroughly mixed and drink turns red.
Chocolate Mint Rum: In a shaker half-filled with ice cubes, combine all of the ingredients. Shake well. Strain into a cocktail glass.
6am Sunrise: This was mixed at a party at college and might be a little strong.
French Toast: Mix ingredients, the shot should taste like a piece of French Toast.
Cognac Flip: Shake well all ingredients in a shaker. Strain into cocktail glass and grate some nutmeg on top.
Tidbit: Blend all ingredients in an electric blender at a low speed for a short length of time. Pour into a highball glass and serve.
Baltimore Eggnog: Shake all ingredients well with cracked ice and strain into a collins glass. Sprinkle nutmeg on top and serve.
Angel's Wing: Pour ingredients carefully, in order given, into a pousse-cafe glass so that they do not mix. Serve without mixing.
Ibsen: This cocktail is named in honour of Henrik Ibsen.
Midnight Oil: This is a drink I was introduced to while I was in Japan on the island of Okinawa, in a bar called the Kiya Hut.
Root Beer Float: Pour vodka, galliano, and light cream into a collins glass filled with ice cubes and stir well. Fill with cola, stir lightly, top with whipped cream, and serve.
Devil's Cocktail: Stir all ingredients with ice, strain into a cocktail glass, and serve.
Crazy Monkey: combine all ingredients in a blender or Island Oasis machine. Blend and serve in a hurricane. Top with whip cream and garnish with a strawberry and orange.
Salem Witch: In a collins glass with ice, pour vodka, midori, and raspberry schnapps. Add a splash of lime juice. Fill 2/3 with sour mix and the rest with soda water (or seltzer). Stir gently, and finally top with a splash of grenadine.
Poison Apple: Pour ingredients over ice in shaker. Shake and strain into shot glass.
Mullens Mai Tai: Combine ingredients in an empty shaker. Shake vigorously then pour contents into a tall cocktail glass filled with crushed ice. Garnish with a slice of orange, a wedge of pineapple or a cherry (or all three).
Yellow Birdie: Pour vodka into glass over ice followed by Creme de Banana, then top it up with Sprite & stir.
Classic Old-Fashioned: This is a classic version of the Old-Fashioned. In more modern recipes the orange slice is muddled with the sugar, bitters and water.
Olsen Driver: Named after the head of the Norwegian traffic police some years ago, only known as U.P. Olsen. -- Champagne soda is a fruit flavored soda and has little in common with champagne.
Scanex: Charles Nyberg, F.B.S.K., Finland 1. Wodka Wyborova-competition 1972
Blue Marlin: Redrum works the best in this drink, but for those who don't like it's tropical taste, regular light rum such as Bacardi may be used.
Pain, Pain, Go Away: Drink first, then take a swig of ginger ale and bite the lemon peel. Sure to take all your pain away. Really good after break-ups or bad sex!
Crantini: Add all the ingredients in a martini shaker with ice. Then shake,pour into martini glass and add a few cranberries to complete the drink.(Soak the cranberries in vodka first)
Mutiny: In a mixing glass half-filled with ice cubes, combine the rum, Dubonnet, and bitters. Stir well. Strain into a cocktail glass and garnish with the cherry.
Dickhead's Delight: Great original drink to impress your sensitive women thinking of children. Also great to get your kids sleeping fast, for a good night with the wife.
Beeraquirilla: Pour into a blender in this order: ice - beer - tequila - rum - daquari mix - magarita mix. Blend until frothy, then pour.
Molotov Cocktail: Just an ordinary shot of vodka, but spices it up somewhat.
Irish Griep: Tastes like a sea breeze on a mid summers afternoon. This drink is Irish because the drink originated in Ireland in the mid to late 1940's in a local pub known as O'Kilduff's.
Purple Passion: Shake and strain into shot glass.
Whiskey Sour: Shake blended whiskey, juice of lemon, and powdered sugar with ice and strain into a whiskey sour glass. Decorate with the half-slice of lemon, top with the cherry, and serve.
Bombay Bellini: Pour mango puree into glass and slowly add champagne. Stir gently. Garnish with a mango slice.
Tootsie Roll Float: Pour all over ice, mix and strain off ice..
Smooth Sailing: This is a feature drink from a restaurant I worked in.
Sloe Vermouth: Shake all ingredients with ice, strain into a cocktail glass, and serve.
Raspberry Long Island Ice Tea: This is a great alternative to the regular Long Island Ice Tea. The first time I tried the drink was in the Century Club in Los Angeles, Ca. I hope you find it as delightful as my friends and I do.
Liquid Desert: Pour Midori, water, Mello yello and vodka. Stir. Serve over the rocks.
Fu** me like a beast: This one is sure to do exactly as it's title brags! Be Careful!! I've driven many a FMLAB fan home after a few too many of these!! ENJOY!!
Butterfinger: fill glass with ice. pour butterscotch scnapps and bailey's into glass. fill with milk. shake. serve with sip straw.
Red Haus: Best served while listening to Jimi Hendrix (hence the name of the drink).
Bahama Todd: Add light rum, dark rum, spiced rum, and malibu rum to ice filled glass. Mix in pineapple juice and blue curacao. Float 151 rum on top.
Ragged Company: In a mixing glass half-filled with ice cubes, combine the bourbon, vermouth, Benedictine, and bitters. Stir well. Strain into a cocktail glass and garnish with the lemon twist.
Honeymoon Cocktail: Shake all ingredients with ice, strain into a cocktail glass, and serve.
Sweet Flower: You may drop Grenadine-Syrup into glass, later. Very sweet cocktail completed!
Joy-To-The-World: In a mixing glass half-filled with ice cubes, combine all of the ingredients. Stir well. Strain into a cocktail glass.
La Stephanique: In a shaker half-filled with ice cubes, combine all of the ingredients. Shake well. Strain into a cocktail glass.
Fuzzy Nipple: If you want to spice it up add 1/2 oz orange liquer
Grandmom's slipper: If you can't find salmiac Koskenkorva vodka in your local cellar, you can make it using Koskenkorva vodka and some very strong salmiac (irish pepper is good). mix them into a liquid.
Eyes Wide Shut: If mixed correctly there should be almost no alcohol taste. Females enjoy this drink because they can have the hard liquor without tasting it.
Tropicetto: Great summer drink. Name is pronounced "trop-a-ketto".
Light and Dark: Add sour mix and shake in whiskey sour rock glass or 10 oz. goblet. Garnish with lime wedge
Fruit Pastille: It gets the name fruit pastille as the resulting colour red, green, orange/yellow looks like a packet of fruit pastilles.
Hand-Shaken Margarita on the Rocks: use large metal container with plenty of ice and a strainer. Shake well, pour through strainer into margarita glass. Serve with salt and fresh lime.
Orange Blossom: In a shaker half-filled with ice cubes, combine the gin, orange juice, and sugar. Shake wel. Strain into a cocktail glass. Garnish with the orange slice.
French Monkey: Sounds revolting but it's actually exquisite
Titia's Tushie: Combine all ingredients in a hurricane glass, and shake
Emerald Isle Cocktail: Stir all ingredients with ice, strain into a cocktail glass, and serve.
Ambrosia: Combine and shake all ingredients (except champagne). Pour contents into a highball glass over ice cubes. Fill with chilled champagne, stir lightly, and serve.
Blue Lagoon: Pour vodka and curacao over ice in a highball glass. Fill with lemonade, top with the cherry, and serve.
Red Zalo: Original recipe by Robert Skagseth, Trondheim, Noway.
Sky Blue Fallout: Be very careful. This drink will make you see God.
Limona Corona: Forget adding lemon or lime to your Coronas. This drink is much better.
Rusty Nail: Pour the Scotch and Drambuie into an old-fashioned glass almost filled with ice cubes. Stir well. Garnish with the lemon twist.
Tyson Punch: An excellent drink with a good alcohol content that is hidden well in the taste. Cut up fruit (watermelon, oranges,etc.) can be added. It will absorb alcohol, but can be eaten when the cooler is empty.
Tornado: mix everything except cola, sugar and ice in glass. then stir in sugar. then add ice cubes. finally, pour in cola. stir three times. drink.
Raggae Sunsplash: I had this drink in Jamaica, where I guess it was originated. It forms the colors of the Jamaican Flag, red on the bottom, yellow in the middle, and green on the top.
Toxic Antifreeze: You can make this in a pitcher and enjoy with all of your friends, plus it saves having to mix a drink every 15 minutes.
Russian Roulette: Fill two or more shooter 1 oz. shooter glasses with the kahlua and vodka and place a slice of orange on the top of each glass. Put the Sambuca in a wine glass and light. Pour the lit Sambuca on the shooters below and let burn for a short time in front of your bedazzled guests. Blow out the fire and instruct the drinkers of the shooters to drink out of the glass first and chew the Sambuca-soaked orange slice last.
Afterbirth: Mix schnapps and grenadine. Add Bailey's last. Wait until the Bailey's curdles then shoot .
Peachy Comfort: Fill glass Half full of ice. Add Southern Comfort and peach schnapps. Fill glass with ginger ale. stir and serve.
Iced Coffee Fillip: Mix together in a coffee mug and chill before serving.
Absolutly Screwed Up: Shake it up it tasts better that way, but you can stir it if you want. 6 of those and you will be wasted for the rest of the night.
