Jamaica Me Crazy: Fill a tall glass with ice. Pour in rum and tia maria. Add pineapple juice.
Green Frog: Fill a highball glass with 1 part Pisang Ambon. Pour 2 parts sprite in glas. then add some lime. Remember some ice-cubes. Drink with straw.
Ginelico: This libation is best made with Bombay Sapphire.
Williams Explosion: Blend pear half, vodka and pear juice well (until the pear is drinkable) Pour in a high glass, over ice and fill with soft drink
Soviet Sunset: Like a Kamikazee with club soda and a lemon flavor.
Evil Princess: Pour over ice. Stir and garnish with a lime slice.
Morning Dew: Can add cherries or grenadine for flavor.
Fiery Balls of Death: Pour the shit in the shot glass. Light on fire, pray for your life and down it.
Barbary Coast: Shake all ingredients with ice, strain into a cocktail glass, and serve.
Dirty Diaper: This drink was invented by a friend of mine, (bulldog) it sounds disgusting, looks disgusting, but tastes great!
Kamel Drivare: Pour the Sambuca into a shotglass, then layer the Bailey's over by pouring it over the back of a spoon.
Psycho: Very well recieved cocktail for "ladies night out".
Frozen Berkeley: Blend all ingredients with 1/2 cup crushed ice in an electric blender at a low speed for a short length of time. Pour into a champagne flute and serve.
Sit On My Face Mary Jane: A bartender by the name of Mary Jane in the city of Chicago made this drink up one night. She couldn't think of a name, but her favourite expression that evening was "puleeeze, like i'd sit on your face" (she was rather inebriated). And so the name was born, "sit on my face mary jane".
Cherry Blossum: Moisten rim of cocktail glass with cherry brandy and rub rim in powdered sugar. Shake all ingredients (except cherry) with ice and strain into the sugar-rimmed glass. Top with the cherry and serve.
Mansion Margarita: Mix above ingredients in a shaker. Shake and serve on the rocks.
Beauty Spot Cocktail: Pour a dash of grenadine in a cocktail glass. Shake remaining ingredients with ice, strain into glass over grenadine, and serve.
White Lady 1910: Shake vigourously with plenty of ice
Silver Cloud: Mix Amaretto, Kahlua, and Milk together. Fill with ice cubes and top with whipped cream.
Oil Spill: Layer Jägermeister on top of the Goldschlager.
Derailer: This punch really is not as bad as it sounds... it is quite palatable! Want to share your derailer experience? Write to me at bake@castle.net! Get derailed, and have fun!
Raspberry Punch: Pour pink grapefruit juice and ginger ale into punch bowl. Pour raspberry juice or 12 oz frozen raspberries into punch bowl (if using frozen raspberries, be sure to stir to un-thaw after adding to punch bowl). Add sherbet into punch and stir until majority of it is melted.
Dr. Dye's Revenge: A unique tasting drink, that traditionally men have enjoyed more then the women.
China Village Mai Tai: This version of Mai Tai was the most popular drink in the now closed resturant China Village. Though ingredients are there, the actual measurements of ingrediants are estimates due to the fact I was 10 at the time (no i did not tend the bar). Use chrodial grenadine thats alcoholic (12%).
Feel This: Fill glass with ice. Next add Absolut, Sloe gin, Pineapple juice, Southern Comfort, and last Midori. Last add pineapple and cherry garnish.
Rum Snapp: Drink must be served cold. May add ice.
Jon Lee Hooker: Made with limited ingredients at a fraternity. Strawberry syrup can be replaced with cranberry juice, (just add a little bit more cranberry juice).
Jack & Ginger: I prefer the double shot of jack, but the single will do.
Sir Walter Cocktail: Shake all ingredients with ice, strain into a cocktail glass, and serve.
The Cherry Magician: Caution: This is a strong drink, believe your first sips. After the first few sips the cherry flavor will dominate and the taste of alcohol will essentially dissappear, hence the name.
Canadian Pineapple: Shake all ingredients (except pineapple stick) with ice and strain into an old-fashioned glass over ice cubes. Add the pineapple stick and serve.
The Kristy: Invented for my girlfriend who dislikes most alcohol and beer but enjoys sweet drinks such as amaretto. She loved it!!
Latana: I mix this drink in a "Bennigans" True Pint glass, but any pint glass will do.
Irish Cream - Bailey's #2: Blend all ingredients in a blender for no longer than 2 mins. Pour over ice and enjoy straight away.
Lumberjack: Can be done with or without hot sauce.
3rd Wheel: A tasty all-French concoction that I invented at my brother-in-law's house. It will make your sphincter tighten.
Jungle Juice #3: Origin: The Green Parrot, Casselberry, FL
Fuquay Friday Night: Absolute can be varied to taste and alcohol tollerance. Discretion is advised. Also a dash of lime can be added for a slightly different taste.
Hop Toad: Stir all ingredients with ice, strain into a cocktail glass, and serve.
Caruso: In a mixing glass half-filled with ice cubes, combine all of the ingredients. Stir well. Strain into a cocktail glass.
Brandy Toddy: Dissolve powdered sugar in 1 tsp. water in an old-fashioned glass. Add brandy and one ice cube and stir. Add twist of lemon peel on top and serve.
Jamaican Ass-Kicker: High-octane variant on Rum and Coke. "Discovered" around 1985 in Mount Vernon, Iowa. Can be served over ice, but after one or two, this matters less....
Tubboocki: Origin: Yannis Villa, Sidari, Corfu, Greece. Taste: Very Warming. History: Just when we thought we couldnt think of any more shooters up poppped this one into our twisted brains. Thanks to Tellis (Holiday From Hell Fame) for lending me his bar. Tubbooki is Greek for blow job.
Hillbilly Bob's Mountaindrink: Shake all ingredients except coke.Poor over ice and top with coke for an extra creamy head. Serve with a straw on a sunny day.
Green Jolly Rancher: shake with ice, strain into rocks glass
Blue Heaven: Can use non alcoholic blue curacao syrup instead of Blue Curacao.
Mulled Wine: Simmer 3 cups water with, sugar, cloves, cinnamon sticks, and lemon peel in a stainless steel pot for 10 minutes. Add wine heat to a "coffee temperature" (DO NOT BOIL) then add the brandy.
A.T.B. (Ask The Barman): Have fun when your pissed up punter asks what A.T.B. stands for.
Virgin Whore: Mix vodka, lime juice, kool-aid, food colorings, and cranberry juice in shot glass. Slowly add apple juice down the side of the glass to mix. Then, add tequila and enjoy!
Love Potion #159: Pour ingredients into shaker with ice, shake and serve on the rocks.
Raspberry Cream: Blend all ingredients in an electric blender at a low speed. Pour into a champagne flute and serve.
La Bomba: Shake all ingredients except grenadine with ice 3 times ONLY. Pour into sugar rimmed cocktail glass. Add grenadine and garnish with a lime wheel.
Strawberry Storm: Shake all ingredience together except cream. Float cream on top. Garnish with pineapple spear and cherry.
Hornpipe: In a shaker half-filled with ice cubes, combine all of the ingredients. Shake well. Strain into a cocktail glass.
Sex on the Beach #4: This is a great drink for the person who wants to ENJOY what s/he is drinking. It tastes FABULOUS, especially when prepared correctly. It has to be 1 shot combined or else the drink become overpowering!
Hot Chocolate to Die for: Makes ONE serving. :-) Serve in the smallest coffee mugs you can find to all your friends. Top with freshly whipped cream, made from left over cream, and a mini-marshmellow. WARNING: This stuff can kill you if you drink it too often. The Surgeon General recommends at most once a month for safe for consumtion. :D
Snake Venom: It's barred from many a pub in Scotland
Mango Bellini: Fill champagne flute one-third full with mango juice. Top with champagne. Stir gently and garnish with a slice of mango.
Mir: Pour both shots over rocks into a highball glass. Fill with coke, or soda of your choice.
Hot Apple Pie #2: It will taste exactly like a hot apple pie. Mmmmm!
Bram Stoker's Dracula: Not for the weak -- Only dedicated fire-eaters with iron stomachs.
Red Rooster: Build drink in a collins glass.
Kahlodster: Pour each shot in cup filled with ice. Shake three times and serve.
Bishop: Shake juice of lemon, juice of orange, and powdered sugar with ice and strain into a highball glass. Add two ice cubes, fill with burgundy, and stir well. Decorate with various fruits and serve.
Sun Shake: Mix in blender until smooth. Garnish with slice of orange.
Egg Cream: Mix syrup and milk in a fountain glass. Add soda water, serve with a straw.
Heilig: Can also add whip cream and do with hands behind the back. This is called the Heilig Maneuver.
Orgasm #3: Build over ice. Garnish with strawberry or cherry.
Harry Boy: Just mix and use ice. Served cool.
Sloe comfortable screw against the wall: Shot of Sloe Gin, add half ounce Southern Comfort, fill with orange juice, float Galliano.
Razberi Kicker: This is a very refreshing drink, especially for the summer. I'm not sure if it's an actual drink or if it has a name already but my friends and I call it a Razberi Kicker because you can't taste the alcohol and it kind of sneaks up and kicks you in the behind! Enjoy!
Bijou Cocktail: Shake all ingredients (except the cherry) with ice and strain into a cocktail glass. Add the cherry on top and serve.
Southern Blast: Just pour it all in a glass. Stir it if you really feel the need to. I usually just pour in the alcohol and let the fruit juice do the mixing for me. For the best results, try and use that Minute Maid Fruit Punch. That stuff works very well. I advise against using any sort of "all-citrus" fruit juice, even OJ.
Lee's Drink: Fill glass 1/4 with coffee, pour Tia Maria, Frangelico, & Amaretto slowly, add whipped cream on top, cherry if you want to. When drinking, stir gently if you like your coffee light. Drink from the bottom with a straw if you like it strong. Still looking for a better name, e-mail me if you think of one, or if you've heard of it with another name. imrey@aol.com
Scooby Snack #2: Shake ingredients in a mixing cup with ice. Strain into 7 oz. rocks glass and serve.
Schnapp Pop: Has a very smooth, cooler-like taste and is sure to please the ladies. From Pittsburgh, Pennsylvania. Compliments of Lisa.
Splender Blenders: Enjoy on a hot summer afternoon!!!
Bolero: Stir all ingredients well with cracked ice. Strain into a cocktail glass and serve.
Washington Cocktail: Stir all ingredients with ice, strain into a cocktail glass, and serve.
Zombie #3: A Zombie should be made with rums of various strengths, i.e. 90 and 86 proof. You may use a little apricot brandy in addition to the fruit juice. Other garnish, like mint sprigs can also be used.
Geneva Convention: For the amount of alcohol in this drink it is amazingly smooth.
Prarie Dog: build contents into a shot glass guaranteed night-ender for 21st birthday outings! (invented @ 901 Club, Los Angeles)
Brandy Fix: Combine juice of lemon, powdered sugar, and water in a highball glass. Stir, fill with shaved ice, and add brandy. Stir again, add the lemon slice, and serve with a straw.
Reggae Ambassador: Fill a blender 1/2 full (or 1/2 empty) with ice. Fill 1/4 of the blender with vodka. Fill 1/2 with pine-orange-banana fruit juice. Fill the rest with fresh strawberries, and about 4 tsp. sugar. Blend, serve with an orange slice.
Margarita #2: Rub rim of margarita glass with lemon juice, dip rim in salt. Shake all ingredients with ice, strain into the salt-rimmed glass, and serve. (See also Frozen Margarita.)
Bourbon Cobbler #2: In a large wine glass, dissolve the sugar in the club soda. Almost will the glass with crushed ice. Add the bourbon. Garnish with starwberry, lime and pineapple wedges.
Triplesex: Fill a glass with ice. Pour first 3 three ingredients then adjust pineapple juice to taste. Suck it down:)
Passion Mimosa: Pour passion fruit juice into a champagne flute. Fill with chilled champagne, decorate with strawberry, and serve.
Raw Sewage #2: You may think it looks great without the grenadine, but that gives it the great color. If you can't handle the color leave out the grenadine. Tastes great and is less filling :-) Foo Foo drink to the hilt. Enjoy!!
Spanish chocolate: Stir the milk with the chocolate and the cinnamon over low heat until the chocolate dissolves. Add the eggs and beat the mixture until it becomes thick, taking care not to boil. Serve in coffee mug.
A Gilligan's Island: A fruity, tropical experience for everybody to enjoy!
Soviet Cocktail: Mix all ingredients, except lemon peel, with cracked ice in a shaker or blender and strain into a chilled cocktail glass. Twist lemon peel over drink and drop into glass.
Apricot Smoothie: For a little different taste use apple juice instead of orange juice.
STP (the motor oil of course): Add whiskyand vodka to glass of ice. Stir in maple syrup. Wait 2 minutes and enjoy.
Wiggle Worm: Mix Well. Put Vodka in first. Put cherry in last. Add ice if needed.
Shamrocks: Mix equal parts Curacao and Vodka and and O.J for a Light Green color. Erin Go Bragh!!
Loopy Lemonade: This drink tastes great on a hot summer day. Keep your eye open for this drink on the TGIFriday's menu!
Cossack Charge: Mix all ingredients with cracked ice in a shaker or blender and pour into a chilled cocktail glass.
Stanley Senior: In a shaker half-filled with ice cubes, combine all of the ingredients. Shake well. Strain into a cocktail glass.
Pure White Evil: Mix toghter, light, drink, wake up in bed.
Pine Cone: In a tall glass, on the rocks, add Southern Comfort and Amaretto. Fill glass with Pineapple juice. Stir.
Tidal Wave: Pour gin, vodka, rum and peach schnapps over ice in a collins glass. Add orange and pineapple juices, a dash of grenadine, and float 151 rum on top. Garnish with a piece of fresh cut pineapple. The wave will sweep you away!!!!!
Brain Eraser #1: In a sizable shot glass pour the Schlager, then Kahlua, then Vodka. Keep liquer levels seperate. Carefully slide a straw to bottom along side of the glass. Shoot from bottom thru straw. Bombs away!
Other Original Singapore Sling: In a shaker half-filled with ice cubes, combine the gin, cherry brandy, and lime juice. Shake well. Strain into a collins glass almost filled with ice cubes. Drop the Benedictine and brandy into the center of the drink.
Egg Nog #5: In an electric mixer, beat the egg yolks with the sugar until thick and lemon colored. Slowly add the bourbon and cognac, while beating at a slow speed. Chill several hours. Add the salt to the egg whites and beat until almost stiff, or until the beaten whites form a peak that bends slightly. Whip the cream until stiff. Fold the whipped cream intothe yolk mixture, then fold in the beaten egg whites. Chill one hour. When ready to serve, sprinkle the top with freshly grated nutmeg. Serve in punch bowl. If desired, add one or two cups of milk to the yolk mixture for a thinner eggnog.
Spanish Coffee #2: This is generally a dessert drink. I hope you enjoy!
ODWITS: For the proper version you should use Mezcal Tequila. If you can't get that use a golden Tequila rather than the ordinary silver. -- Smooth taste that belies its strength. Invented years ago at a party held by Lou Reed's roadies on the completion of a tour of Europe.
The Cherry Bomb: This is something I made up one night it is really cinnamony. Enjoy!
Ramos Fizz #1: Blend all ingredients except soda and orange slice in a blender until smooth. Pour into a chilled glass and garnish with a slice of orange.
Passout: Stir lightly, with or without ice
American Beauty: In a shaker half-filled with ice cubes, combine the brandy, vermouth, creme de menthe, orange juice, and grenadine. Shake well. Strain into a cocktail glass. Pouring slowly and carefully, float the port on top.
Sevilla Cocktail #2: In a shaker half-filled with ice cubes, combine all of the ingredients. Shake well. Strain into a sour glass.
The Dark Side: Chocolate shake with hint of orange. Easy to drink, hard to forget. Born on 12/23/1999 at HOPS Restaurant of Chattanooga, Tennessee. Created by Richard C., Joshua D., and Timothy J.
Simpson Solution: This will definately get about 15-20 light weights ripped, or 5 alcoholics. Name commemorates our beloved O.J. Simpson, and Orange Juice. Also known as the nectar of the gods.
Nitro Cocktail: In a shaker half-filled with ice, combine vodka, whiskey, and juices. The amount of orange and cranberry juice should be about equal. Strain into a collins glass nearly filled with ice. Add a dash of grenadine.
Go Girl!: Mix it all together on ice, what else?
Rum Sour: In a shaker half-filled with ice cubes, combine the rum, lemon juice, and sugar. Shake well. Strain into a sour glass and garnish with the orange slice and the cherry.
Verboten: Shake all ingredients (except cherry) with ice and strain into a cocktail glass. Top with the cherry and serve.
Strawberry Dream: Add all ingredients to a blender. Blend for 1 minute or until drink is smooth. Pour into glass and serve immediately.
Fuzzy Screw Shot: Pour a double shot glass half full of vodka. Pour the peach schnapps into the next quarter. Pour the triple sec in the reamaining quarter. Stir and shoot.
Hot Damn: shake all ingredients adding less or more orange juice for you preferance of taste. serve in shot glass.
Pumpkin Pie (Trafford Style): You might want to wait till the fire is extinguished, either by you or natural causes.
The Double Team: This drink was concocted in an American University dorm room. Drink with caution, and always drink responsibly.
Bird of Paradise: Named after the flower, "Bird of Paradise", because of its color.
Ice Pick #2: In large ice filled glass, pour vodka, then tea. Add a lemon wedge for garnish. Surprisingly refreshing.
Sex under the bleachers with a KU cheerl: Engineered by the captains of the drinking team at the University of Missouri at Columbia.
Green Opal: Shake all ingredients with ice, strain into a cocktail glass, and serve.
Think Pink: Put incrediments in cold glass. Stir well.
Old-Fashioned: In the classic Old-Fashioned the orange slice was only used as garnish and not muddled. However, today many bartenders muddle the orange slice to extract additional flavors from it.
Vodka Orange: serve with ice. fresh pressed juice tastes best.
The Green Monster: Can be done without the melon midori if you don't like the taste, the effect is the same!
Rocky Mountain Motherfucker #2: Mix with ice, strain into a shot glass.
Irish Cream - Bailey's #1: Combine all the ingredients in a blender. Blend on lowest setting until frothy or well blended.
Ludwig And The Gang: In a mixing glass half-filled with ice cubes, combine all of the ingredients. Stir well. Strain into an old-fashioned glass almost filled with crushed ice.
Buffalo Sweat: Stir in a shotglass. Drink quickly.
Irish Cream Liqueur #1: Combine all ingredients in a blender until smooth. Store in the refrigerator for up to one month.
Slime: Combine ingredients with cracked ice in a cocktail shaker. Shake well, and pour into a chilled old-fashioned glass.
Tiffany's Wet and Ready: Fill Mason jar with crushed ice. Add pineapple juice and Malibu rum. Mix well. Add splash of greanadine and 151 proof rum. Garnish with cherry, pineapple, or other fruit slice.
Strawberry Fields: It takes a little work, but it is worth it. Cool all engredients before making the drink so you don't have to use ice. Use hurricane or highball glasses. -- This drink was created on a hot night when a cool drink was needed. It really worked great. ThanX to An! (she bought the fruit).
Black Christmas: It takes a lot of Black Sambuca to taste real strong. So, the more you add the more punch it packs!!!
Gorilla's Puke: Layer in normal shot glass. Can be lit and shot through straw.
Bearsicle: The colder the better. It makes a good first drink of the night.
Green Tea: Mix Chartreuse and Sour Mix on top of ice in Collins glass. Fill with coca-cola and, if you like, garnish with lemon or lime slice.
The Incredible Hulk #2: Pour vodka and midori over ice in a highball glass. Add pineapple juice. Top off with a splash of 7-up.
Arthur Tompkins: In a shaker half-filled with ice cubes, combine the gin, Grand Marnier, and lemon juice. Shake well. Strain into a sour glass and garnish with the lemon twist.
Midori Splice: Currently one of the top-selling cocktails in Australia. Cheers from Down Under!
Cubins Cracker: This drink was created by Ian Sharpe at Cubins Nightclub, in Cork, Ireland and has become a cult cocktail in the area.
Inverted Traffic Light: The purpose on mixing the Blue Curacao with the Vodka is to enable the Blue to "float". Since it is a syrup in itself, if poured alone, the Blue Curacao would sink to the bottom, mix with the Grenadine and cause a hideous purple mess. When poured successfully, this drink makes an excellent conversation piece and can result in a rewarding night.
Cadalac Margarita: Combine first 3 ingredient into a shaker with ice. Shake well. Pour into a salt-rimmed margarita glass and garnish with a lime wedge.
Slam Dunk: Mix in a rock glass,filled with ice. Add 1.5oz of Southern Comfort. For the mix, add 1 can of cranberry juice with half a can of orange concentrate into a pitcher. Use this mix to top off the drink.
Horse Jizz: Get a big mug. Pour in one ingredient then the other.
Sex On The Beach #5: Pour Vodka over crushed ice, add cranberry juice, midori, chambord, and top off with pinapple, stir gently and serve.
50/50: If vanilla stoli isn't availible use vanilla flavor or vanilla liqueur.
Chris Crush: Mix all ingredients except soda with lots of ice in a shaker. Fill a highball glass with crushed ice and add the mixed ingredients. Fill up with soda.
Strawberry Dawn: Blend all ingredients (except mint sprig) with 1 cup of crushed ice in an electric blender at a high speed. Pour into a cocktail glass, add the sprig of mint, and serve.
Godmother: Pour vodka and amaretto into an old-fashioned glass over ice and serve.
410 Gone:

Lady Be Good: Shake all ingredients with ice, strain into a cocktail glass, and serve.
Thorazine: It is wise to advise those being served the Thorazine that fire does burn and does not taste good. The Thorazine should be served with discretion (it got its name for a reason!)
Passoa Recovery: Invented on a bus the way home from a student festival. A limited bar and persistent hangover led us to do a refreshing, not too sweet drink.
Blue Blazer: if done right it will look like liquid fire and will taste really good (Jack Daniels is perferred)
Gimlet: Pour the gin and lime cordial into a mixing glass half-filled with ice cubes. Stir well. Strain into a cocktail glass and garnish with the lime wedge.
R.B. Winter: Fill highball glass with ice. Add 1 oz. of Southern Comfort, 1 oz. of Amaretto, fill with Apple juice, do a short shake. While pouring the drink back in the glass add a splash of lime juice.
Narragansett: In an old-fashioned glass almost filled with ice cubes, combine the bourbon, vermouth, and anisette. Stir well and garnish with the lemon twist.
StumbleFuck: Mix all three in a shooter! Slight burn on the way down is normal, just enjoy it.
Butter Nut Scotch: Pour ingredients into an old-fashioned glass over ice and serve.
Jim Morrison: "Oh show me, the way, to the next whiskey bar, oh don't ask why, oh don't ask why, for if we don't find, the next whiskey bar, I tell you we must die, I tell you we must die, I tell you, I tell you, I tell you we must die!" -- This one's harsh ladies, and gentleman. Any whiskey lover will love it.
Bavorak: Fill glass with tonic, pour Fernet over spoon at the and add a straw.
Horsley's Honor: In an old-fashioned glass almost filled with ice cubes, combine the gin, vermouth, applejack, and triple sec. Stir well and garnish with the orange slice
Gin Blossam: Fill the glass about two thirds full of Sprite. Pour in the Schnapps, then gin. Put ice in glass to cool.
Cherry coke from hell: Pour alcohol into glass then add Coke. Stir if necessary.
Canadian Cocktail: Shake all ingredients with ice, strain into a cocktail glass, and serve.
Pat Quinn Freeze: Pour all ingredients into a blender. Blend until smooth. Pour into glass. You can either serve it like that or you can also put the drink into a freezer and serve when half-frozen.
Hybris: The drink was originally mixed at Club Dacke (Uppsala, Sweden) in the summer of -99, for a guest named Sara Karlhed. She asked for something refreshing, not too sweet, and this is what I came up with. She and her friends came back several times that night, always asking for the same drink.
Nightmare: Shake all ingredients with ice, strain into a cocktail glass, and serve.
Multiple Orgasm Cajun Style: Add all ingredients in the blender and blend until smooth.
Lighthouse: Pour Kahlua in shot glass then with a spoon slowly pour Irish Cream into the shot glass on top of the Kahlua then pour the 151 Rum with the Spoon slowly on top of the Irish Cream then light on fire.. Blow out Flame Before Drinking!
Super Qell: Just fill a big glass with all the ingridients
CoonDogg: Made at the Dallas Bull, Tampa, FL. Can be a shot or a shooter.
Apple Brandy Highball: Pour apple brandy over ice cubes in a highball glass. Fill with carbonated water and stir. Add a twist of lemon peel on top and serve. (Ginger ale may be substituted for carbonated water, if preferred.)
Hawaiian Cocktail: Shake all ingredients with ice, strain into a cocktail glass, and serve.
Generation X: This drink is sooo tasty that Generations Y & Z won't be able to pass it up either!
Frozen Brandy And Rum: Combine all ingredients with 1 cup of crushed ice in an electric blender and blend at a low speed for a short length of time. Pour into an old-fashioned glass and serve.
Blue Wave: From the September 2002 edition of Cheers magazine.
Mexican Flag: Layer Drink: Using spoon, pour shot over spoon over glass. Fill with Grenadine first, then Creme de Menthe, and last but not least Tequila. The layers form the mexican flag enjoy.
Hummer: Blend all ingredients in an electric blender at a low speed for a short length of time. Pour into a highball glass and serve.
Third Rail: This is a house specialty drink from the Bellagio Hotel and Casino in Las Vegas.
F-69: This great shot was invented when we felt there were too many shots with uncommon ingredients. This has common ingredients and goes down smooth and quiet but when it hits your stomach a warm sensation may be felt.
Scarlett O'Hara: Combine all three ingredients in a glass with ice. Stir and enjoy!
Red Death #2: Pour all the ingedients in mixing glass with ice. Shake and strain into shot glass(es).
Grog #2: Serves 3-4 (not 1! ...you have been warned). This stuff is fairly volitile so be prepared for the consequences.
Grasshopper: Shake all ingredients with ice, strain into a cocktail glass, and serve.
Tequila Press: Dissolve the sugar in the boiling water and chill in the fridge. This step is best done before the party/drinking session. Put the tequila and lemon juice in the pitcher and fill with soda water and ice. Then mix sugar syrup to taste.
After sex: Pour the vodka and creme over some ice cubes in a tall glass and fill up with juice. to make it beuty full make the top of the glass with a grenadine and sugar
Moose Fart: Best to make in a pitcher, and I'm not talking about Kerry Woods! Use large amounts, as this drink is sure to be a hit!
Banana Splat: Make this for people you LIKE: cleaning the used glasses is a major pain in the butt. For people you DON'T like, hey, your blender is broken...
Chocolate Covered Cherry: Can also be made with light cream.
Highlander: Tell your moms not to drink this shit!!!!
Summer Dreams: Perfect for a summer day- or night Or in winter when whishing it was summer!
Bend Me Over: Mix all ingredients, and pour over ice if desired.
Pineapple Monyca: Invented for Monyca at Ursinus College, PA.
Born on the 4th of July: Fill Collins Glass with ice Pour in Blue Curacao first Next pour in Sloe Gin but be careful, the appearance of the drink is very important. Pour gently onto the ice so as to layer it. Next fill it with cream also layering it. The result should be a blue and red drink with tendrils of white shooting through the colors.
Egg Nog - Healthy: Whip egg substitute and sugar together, combine with the two kinds of milk, vanilla, and rum. Mix well. Chill over night. Sprinkle with nutmeg. Makes 6 servings.
Vampire's Kiss: Shake with ice. Strain over ice in an old fashined glass.
Aggravation: Fill a rocks glass with ice, then add Scotch and kahlua. Float cream on top and stir.
Sloppy Joe: Pour cranberry and orange juice in cup, then add the sprite. Last, add the rum.
Brandy Alexander #2: In a shaker half-filled with ice cubes, combine the brandy, creme de cacao, and half-and-half. Shake well. Strain into a cocktail glass and garnish with the nutmeg.
Rosebud: Named for the red/green color combination when poured correcly (and after my dog Rosebud) Nice for presentation - vodka/lime juice/triple sec: green floats on pink grapefruit juice like a black&tan.; still looking for the proper garnish
Raspberry Swirl: Quite tasty, and fairly potent - the ice cream takes the edge off the vodka. First introduced to us by a bartender at the Grand Floridian in Walt Disney World during our honeymoon - it's been a favorite of my wife's ever since then.
Moonlight Drive: You can serve this in a glass, or as a shot. It is great for big parties. It has alot of alcohol to it, but it taste very fruity. I have had nothing but good responces, from a large sample of people ranging from 18 to 55.
Cointreauceptive: This was invented my me and my cousin one during a night of debauchery. Very tasty (if you like bailey's and cointreau) sweetness and yumminess of Bailey's with a soft bite of cointreau hiden in there.
Guillotine: Invented this drink to celebrate Bastille Day week at the bar I work at.
Sex with the Captain: Build drink in glass over ice. Garnish with a cherry.
Chocolate Soldier: Shake all ingredients with ice, strain into a cocktail glass, and serve.
Celtic Mix Cocktail: In a shaker half-filled with ice cubes, combine all of the ingredients. Shake well. Strain into a cocktail glass.
Golden Cadillac: Combine all ingredients with 1/2 cup crushed ice in an electric blender. Blend at low speed for ten seconds. Strain into a champagne flute and serve.
Apple Rum Rickey: Pour applejack and rum into a highball glass over ice cubes. Fill with carbonated water. Squeeze lime and drop in glass. Stir and serve.
End Wrench: Add ice. Tastes remarkably like a screwdriver.
Robert says: MASS: Mix the Vodka with Rose's Lime then stir. Fill up with Tonic Water.
Black Fog: This always reminds me of some sort of chocolate raspberry desert. If you enjoy a good stout, you'll probably love this!
501 Blue: Mix equal amounts into a glass with ice.
Chocolate Covered Cherry Shot: add in the order written and mix then add the grenadine
Simon Sez Seazar: This drink hot and spicy and is a great eye-opener for those terrible hang-overs.
Monkey Wrench: Pour all of the ingredients into an old-fashioned glass almost filled with ice cubes. Stir well.
Mudskipper: Pour gin and ginger ale over ice in a collins glass. Add chocolate syrup and let settle in the bottom. Stir very lightly. Drink should appear dark brown on the bottom and gradate to clear on top.
Carolina Kamikaze: The most popular drink on Franklin Street! (Go Heels!)
Multiple Orgasm #2: Pour ingredients into a blender and mix until smooth. Serve in a hurricane glass and top with a cherry. It tastes like a chocolate shake, but with a kick!
Fuzzy Ethan: Mix all ingredients except lime in a cocktail shaker, then shake, and pour into glass. Add lime.
Pink Panther #1: Mix the Crystal Light then add your favorite brand of Vodka. Pour over ice. Serve.--A nice strong party punch with almost no taste of alcohol!
The Big Robowski: If mixed properly, this drink is extremely smooth, with a hint of Cinnamon flavoring. I invented this drink about a year ago, in my second year of University, and have been making it for worthy recipients ever since.
Mind Game: Abusing of this substance will rot your brain while leaving a pleasant taste in your mouth
Berry Deadly: Add all ingredients to large bowl. Stir gently. Serve chilled.
Blinder: Pour the scotch and grapefruit juice into a highball glass alomst filled with ice cubes. Drop the grenadine into the center of the drink.
Spanish Coffee: Variant: Do not whip the cream and just layer the cold cream (or half-and-half) on top.
Crowbar: Watch Out! This one can hurt. It is best used for friend's birthdays or other special events.
Negroni - Zimbabwe Style: This refreshing drink has an initial kick but grows on you after the first few sips.
French \"75\": In a shaker half-filled with ice cubes, combine the gin, sugar, and lemon juice. Shake well. Pour into a collins glass. Top with the Champagne. Stir well and garnish with the orange slice and the cherry.
Amaretto Mist: Pour amaretto in an old-fashioned glass over crushed ice. Add the wedge of lime and serve. (A wedge of lemon may be substituted for lime, if preferred.)
Frisky Steve: Very nice at a brunch if you do not want a Bloody Mary or a Mimosa. Pretty damn strong for the early afternoon.
RumRunner's Easy Margarita: Whisk all ingredients in pitcher. Serve over ice. If frozen Margarita required, substitute ice for water and blend.
Sjarsk: Add the coffe first , then add alchohol and finally you should add the sugar. Shake well :c)
Drink this just like a shot of tequila. Mix the cognac and cointreau together in the shot glass. Lick between your thumb and forefinger and sprinkle sugar on it. Then lick the sugar, drink the shot, and suck on the lemon wedge when you're done.
Antifreeze #2: Add vodka to glass over ice. Then add water and lemon lime mix. Stir until all is dissolved.
Adios Motherfucker #3: Shake alcohol, then add sprite on top. Served on the rocks.
Rose Cocktail (French): Stir all ingredients with ice, strain into a cocktail glass, and serve.
Psycho Citrus: Mix together in a Tom Collins glass the vodka, tequila, schnapps, Grand Marnier and lime juice over ice. Fill with orange juice.
Rudy: Designed and served often at Club Liquid in St. Louis Mo. Come Check it out!
Strawberry Banana Colada: Very fruity, tropical taste. Great for hot summer nights.
Southern Salutation: Strong enough for a man, but made for a southerner
Captain's Table: In a shaker half-filled with ice cubes, combine the gin, Campari, grenadine, and orange juice. Shake well. Pour into a collins glass almost filled with ice cubes. Top with the ginger ale. Garnish with the cherry.
Cucaracha #2: Use a shot-glass and fill to the above proportions. Light the drink on fire. (It helps if you move the lighter in a circular pattern around the top of the drink.) Shoot it through a straw. Be careful!
Brandy Blazer: In an old-fashioned glass, dissolve the sugar in brandy. Add the orange slice. Tilt the glass and carefully ignite the drink with a match. Stir with a long spoon until the flame is extinguished. Strain into a punch cup and garnish with the lemon twist.
Ganggreen: This drink should be enjoyed after a hearty steak and potatoe meal,just before you start playing cards and smoking stogies with your friends. So eat, drink, and be merry.
Alaska: In a mixing glass half-filled with crushed ice, combine all of the ingredients. Stir well. Srtrain into a cocktail glass.
Banana Strawberry Shake: Blend all together in a blender until smooth.
Reform Cocktail: Stir all ingredients (except cherry) with ice and strain into a cocktail glass. Top with the cherry and serve.
Psycho Joe: In this recipe i suggest a good strong peppermint scnapps like ICE 101. I also suggest that you do not add any cream or sugar, but if thats the way you must take your coffee, be my guest. Enjoy...
Sweet Sunset: Fill blender cup with 15 ounces of small ice cubes, add rum, passion fruit syrup and sweet and sour and blend until smooth, in a hurricane glass pour the blended strawberries, then add the blended mixture, the strawberries will ooze up the sides of the glass and it will look like a beautiful sunset. Garnish with a pineapple wedge and a cherry.
Jolly Green Giant: mix just like you would a screwdriver, except substitute lime vodka
Green Puma: Mix it all together in the glass.
Kryptonite: Will knock you on your ass! And can also be set on fire and sucked through a straw.
Che Guevara: Pour in Jose Cuervo Gold, then Jägermeister. Top off with Goldschlager.
Big Dumb Russian: I came up with this while I was at a Jimmy Buffett concert.
Frozen Margarita #1: Place salt in a saucer. Rub rim of a cocktail glass with lime wedge and dip glass into salt to coat rim thoroughly, reserve lime. Pour tequila, triple sec, lime juice, and crushed ice into a blender. Blend well at high speed. Pour into a cocktail glass.
Key Lime Shooter: This is a favorite in Key West.
Coffee Flip: Shake all ingredients (except nutmeg) with ice and strain into a whiskey sour glass. Sprinkle nutmeg on top and serve.
Pineapple Lemonade: Mix juice and sugar syrup in a large tumbler with several ice cubes. Stir well and top up with cold Soda Water. Serve with a drinking straw.
Bourbon Sling: In a shaker half-filled with ice cubes, combine the sugar, water, lemon juice, and bourbon. Shake well. Strain well. Strain into a highball glass. Garnish with the lemon twist.
Suffering Bastard: Pour ingredients into a glass. Stir. Drink.
Tootsie: Tastes just like a tootsie roll.
Flaming D-: Pour in Amaretto and Whiskey in a shot glass. Top shot with Everclear. Light shot on fire Drop in glass of beer Chug!!!
Triple Asp: Poor the ingredients in a glass. Ice if preffered. Drink it on a hot summer-night.
Stranger-In-Town: In a mixing glass half-filled with ice cubes, combine the rum, vermouth, Calvados, and cherry brandy. Stir well. Strain into a cocktail glass and garnish with the cherry.
Hokkaido Cocktail: Shake all ingredients with ice, strain into a cocktail glass, and serve.
Chocolatier: Combine all ingredients (except chocolate shavings) in an electric blender and blend at a low speed for a short length of time. Pour into a chilled champagne flute, garnish with chocolate shavings, and serve.
GG: Watch out. These can get fairly strong.
Pink Ranger: Mix all ingredients in shaker, chill, then serve in shot glass
Is Paris Burning: Stirred, not shaken. Rocks acceptable. Fresh raspberry optional.
Kamikaze Version: Invented at Kappy's Tavern in Hudson, NY. Remember Blue Curacao and Triple Sec are both made of Curacao oranges so they basically taste the same. The only difference is the color. Also served as a shot.
Rebel Yell: In a shaker half-filled with ice cubes, combine the bourbon, Cointreau, lemon juice, and egg white. Shake well. Pour into an old-fashioned glass and garnish with the orange slice.
Snapple sensation: I developped this drink for females because many do not like the hard alcohol and the mango madness Snapple hides it. The lime also helps disguise the booze in this nice drink. Please E-mail me and tell me what you think! tonycv@hotmail.com
Bitter Pill: Mix JD & vodka together, add dash of lemon juice and top up glass with coke!
Flaming Fruit Trees: light on fire for five seconds blow out and suck through a straw.
What She's Having: measurements are approximate. Invented when I was having dinner with a friend and we decided to experiment.
Emerald City: Pour into an ice filled hurricane glass.
Pisco Sour: Shake well and serve in a cocktail glass.
Boston Sour: Shake juice of lemon, powdered sugar, blended whiskey, and egg white with cracked ice and strain into a whiskey sour glass. Add the slice of lemon, top with the cherry, and serve.
Pisang Garuda: Mix with ice cubes. Garnish: Slice of orange. Two straws.
Witch's Clit: Get's you there quick, doesn't make you sick.
Mojito #3: A famous writers favourite drink while he spent time in Cuba. VERY refreshing!
Talbot's Dream: Add Godiva and the Bailey's in a blender. Add ice to desired thickness. Blend well.
Pink Flamingo: Also, can be served as shooters in shot glasses. Sloe gin is to give it a pinkish color.
Orange Warthog: Real sweet and intoxicating. Sugar in Kool-Aid + caffeine gives initial euphoria, then you crash hard.
McDuff: In a mixing glass half-filled with ice cubes, combine the Scotch, triple sec, and bitters. Stir well. Strain into a cocktail glass. Garnish with the orange slice.
Keoke Coffee: Mix alcohols, add coffee, top with whipped cream, Enjoy. Good on a cold winters night!
Trinity Cocktail: Stir all ingredients with ice, strain into a cocktail glass, and serve.
Sand-Grown-Un: In a shaker half-filled with ice cubes, combine all of the ingredients. Shake well. Strain into a cocktial glass.
Grapefruit and Orange Cocktail: Mix and stir with ice in a mixing glass, strain off into a large cocktail glass.
Lesbian Lover: Tastes like a carbonated Pina Colada. Named after the person who discovered it..."The Lesbian Lover" Ralph Herrmann, LA.
Rocket Fuel #3: This shot really hurts. Me and some friends discovered it in a bar in Abbotsford, BC. We usually get it for someone on their birthday.
Baileyfloat: Tastes like a root beer float
Red Cloud: Shake all ingredients with ice, strain into a cocktail glass, and serve.
Hairy Jerry: Only place I've had this is South Shore Yacht Club in Milwaukee, Wisconsin.
Midori Sour: Shake with ice and strain. Garnish with a slice of orange. Ice is optional.
Sweaty Mexican: Fill mug half way with beer. Splash Rum on Tequila in shot glass, then light with match. Drop flaming shot glass in mug. Drop in a lime slice. Chug it.
The Original Margarita: Mix in a shaker with ice. Strain into a salt rimmed cocktail glass. Garnish: lime or lemon slice
Rod on the Rocks: Pour peach schnapps over ice. Fill with apple cider. Stir lightly.
Belle Melon: Shake and pour into cocktail glass.
Hangover: Pour the ingredients in a big glass and your done. Shake it don't stir.
Rum Punch #3: Stir or Shake. Grenadine can be adjusted for your own taste.
Brain Candy: Shake alcohols and juices. Add to glass with ice. Pour grenadine and ginger ale on top. Garnish with cherry and orange wheel.
Sex in the Red Zone: Put vodka and sloe gin into glass. Add lemonade.
Toby's Special: Created by the bar staff at Storrowton Tavern, West Springfield, Ma
Red Mosquito: Combine vodka and hot damn in shot glass, stir and shoot.
Nutty Irishman #2: Prepare a cafe-latte as normal. Add liquors acording to taste. Serve hot or over ice as a chilled coffee beverage.
Tequila BoomBoom: 8 of these and you're so drunk that you can't remember anything the next day.
Orange Oasis: Shake brandy, gin, and orange juice with ice and strain into a highball glass over ice cubes. Fill with ginger ale, stir, and serve.
Three Sheets to The Wind: Be prepared to suffer from the namesake after two or three of these.
Green Cookie Monster: For a smoother, sweeter taste, use rum as the top of the shooter. For a stronger shooter that burns your nose, use vodka.
Creme de Menthe: Bring sugar and water to a boil and simmer for 10 minutes. Cool. Add the remaining ingredients and stir. Cover and let ripen for 1 month.
Arizona PowWow: Best if drunk with a lime, lemon, or an orange wedge
Ice-T: I came up with this on November 21, 1997 at a party. If made correctly this drink should taste almost exactly like iced tea.
Swedish Coffee: Pour the coffee in an ordinary coffee cup. Add the aquavit. Add sugar by taste. Stir and have a nice evening (morning)
Dogs Bollocks: It tastes like beer but with a very light taste of vodka in the background. For a decent taste, a good lager must be used.
Brain Fart: Mix all ingredients together. Slowly and gently. Works best if ice is added to punch bowl and soda's are very cold.
81 Camaro: Inspired by a rusty, black '81 camaro that frequents the Montgomery county fair grounds.
Sun Of A Beach: Combine all the ingredients in a tall glass over ice.
Green Demon: Shake vodka, rum, and liqueur and pour over ice in a highball glass. Fill with lemonade, add the cherry on top, and serve.
Gentle Ben: Mix together in a high glass, add some ice and a straw. Enjoy it !
White Russian #3: Pour pour vanilla vodka and kalhua over ice. Top off with light cream and enjoy.
The Abba: mix absolute citron together with the sprite, and add a twist of lime, and stir. That's it.
Gingersnap: Originally called Oriental Rug, but renamed because it tastes like gingerbread.
Frisco: Shake with cracked ice and strain into a chilled cocktail glass. Garnish with a lemon slice.
Bailey's Banana Colada (bbc): Put banana and liquer into blender until it is a thick paste then add bailey's to taste and pina colada mix and rum. Blend well then add ice blend untill smooth and enjoy!
Rum Runner Island Style: You can add a floater of dark rum or 151 rum.
Mary Pickford Cocktail: In a shaker half-filled with ice cubes, combine the rum, pineapple juice, maraschino liqueur, and grenadine. Shake well. Strain into a cocktail glass. Garnish with the cherry.
Whip Cocktail: Stir all ingredients with ice, strain into a cocktail glass, and serve.
Homemade Snapple: You probably won't be able to perfectly match your favorite flavors, but you'll save a lot of money and you may create a new favorite. Also, you can make it exactly as sweet or tart as you like and you have a use for those 16 oz bottles (recycling at its best).
Peach Tart: Made by Ryan O'Reilly at his bar "Foggy Notion's" in Sault Ste. Marie, Ontario, Canada
Saint Paul: Take a tall glass, put a few ice cubes on top of each other. Pour the Gin and the rum in the glass, Fill the glass with bitter lemon. Leave some of the ice over the surface, so that you can pour the angostura on top of it. It should leave a rather nice track of red down the ice cubes.
Novebuche: I'm used to drink it at some golf club, and "Novebuche" (nineholes) was its name.
Fig: shake well, pour into shot glass.
The Sweating Monk: So tasty, even a monk will drink it.
Pimm's Rangoon: Pour Pimm's over ice in a large highball glass. Fill with ginger ale and garnish with lemon and cucumber peel.
Bengal: In a shaker half-filled with ice cubes, combine all of the ingredients. Shake well. Strain into a cocktail glass.
Tropical Lullaby: My best friend Sarah and I were bored one night and made this drink up, now we want everyone to enjoy it!
Fria Cafe Italiano: Thanks to Tony Abou-Ganim for yet another fantastic cocktail!
Ragnar #3: Take first the vodka then fill up with ice finally add the sprite (not to much).
Fuzzy Navel (original): Pour peach schnapps into ice filled collins glass. Fill with orange juice and stir to combine.
Artillery Punch: Combine all the ingredients in a large punch bowl with a block of ice. If found too dry, sugar syrup may be added. Decorate with twists of lemon peel.
Gentleman's Club: In an old-fashioned glass almost filled with ice cubes, combine all of the ingredients. Stir well.
Yoghurt Cooler: Place all ingredients in the blender jar - cover and whiz on medium speed until well blended. Pour in one tall, 2 medium or 3 small glasses and drink up. Note: Use lots of ice in this one - great on hot days! To add ice: Remove the center of the cover while the blender is on - drop 3 or 4 ice cubs and blend until they're completely crushed.
Bold Gold Monkey: Tastes like a Brass Monkey (or screwdriver to some) only a little sweeter.
Paul Raspberry: Pour vodka in medium-sized shot glass Add a mouthful of 2% milk Add a drop or two of grenadine Ice optional.
Tootsie Roll: Because of the darkness of this particular shooter, layering is not necessary.
Green Tree Frog: Mix together first three ingredients and then slice fresh limes and place in drink, then allow to sit for at least one hour. This drink is to be made in a large quantity, so the limes may "take effect."
Evil Tongue: Pour all ingredients into shaker over ice. Shake ans strain.
Batida Morango: Place all of the ingredients into a blender. Blend well. Pour into a wine glass.
Akis Special: Origin: Akis Hotel in Kamari on the Greek island Santorini, one of the Webtender's favourite holiday spots.
Stubbly Beaver: To lighten just add more milk or cream. Smooth and very enjoyable.
Rolf's Scandinavian Glogg: take seeds out of cardamom pods, put the seeds and the rest of the spices (1-4) in cheesecloth bag. combine 1qt port, 1qt red wine, raisins and spice bag, simmer for 15-20 minutes. add remaining port, red wine and almonds, heat through (but not hot enough to evaporate remaining alcohol). In another pan, mix sugar with 1/3 of the brandy, light brandy on fire and melt sugar. When sugar is melted add remaining brandy. Then combine with the wine/port mixture. Drink!!!
Fat Box: This is a favorite shooter of ours at Sports Fans in DC. It should be a green color.
Malibu Jello: Boil 1 cup water and add to peach passion fruit jello until dissolved about 2 minutes. Add 1 cup Malibu rum and pour into shot glasses or 1 ounce cup found in party stores. Chill for four hours. Enjoy!!!
Mandarin Metropolitan: You may need more or less of the Rose's lime juice. I find it kind of bitter, and use less when I am making this drink.
Twinkle My Lights: mix in shaker over ice...strain into glass(es)
Flaming Jesse or Tropical SunShine: Put all ingredients in a shaker with ice. Shake, strain into a collin's glass. Garnish with an orange slice.
Off your ass in a glass: No organized mixing require. Put all ingredients in a glass, stir, and drink straight. Then you had better lie down.
Dr. Pepper #4: Pour beer into beer stein, add coke. In a shot glass mix the three other ingredients. Pour contents of shot glass into beer stein and chug it all down. Tastes just like a Dr. Pepper.
Mallelieu: Pour the rum, Grand Marnier, and orange juice into an old-fashioned glass almost filled with ice cubes. Stir well.
Bronx Terrace Cocktail: Shake all ingredients (except cherry) with ice and strain into a cocktail glass. Top with the cherry and serve.
Fuzzy Asshole: Add as much coffe or Peach Schnapps as preferred.
Cockroach: I named this because that was what it felt like as it tried to crawl it's way out of my stomach.
Broken Spur Cocktail: Stir all ingredients with ice, strain into a cocktail glass, and serve.
San Diego Silver Bullet: Made in the Daily Planet, San Diego.
Goldschlager Lemondrop: Recipe calls for Lemonade Mix, but I find plain lemonade works just fine. Cheers.
Pio's Beating Stick: Great fruity drink with a kick, people at my bar asked for them one after the other. May also work well with blended with ice, but haven't tried it yet...
Red Ox: Fill a pint glass a quarter of the way with ice, then add the rums and juice. Fill the rest of the glass with the Sweet and Sour, almost to the top, then finish it off with the grenadine. Mix and serve.
Alaska Cocktail: Stir all ingredients with ice, strain contents into a cocktail glass. Drop in a twist of lemon and serve.
Piper At The Gates Of Dawn: In a mixing glass half-filled with ice cubes, combine the Scotch, Kahlua, and maraschino liqueur. Stir well. Strain into old-fashioned glass almost filled with ice cubes. Pour the cream over the back of a teaspoon so that it floats on top of the drink.
Martian Martini: This is a nice alternative to traditional Martini. The strong tast of the Midori cuts the bitterness of the Gin a bit (and makes the drink bright green). Just imagine how intrigued everyone will be when you walk around the party with a martini glass with what looks like antifreeze in it.
Cool Cow: Place all ingredients in the blender jar - cover and whiz on medium speed until well blended. Pour in one tall, 2 medium or 3 small glasses and drink up.
Gin Cooler: Stir powdered sugar and 2 oz. carbonated water in a collins glass. Fill glass with ice and add gin. Fill with carbonated water and stir. Add the lemon peel and the orange spiral so that the end of the orange spiral dangles over rim of glass.
Dragonfly: In a highball glass almost filled with ice cubes, combine the gin and ginger ale. Stir well. Garnish with the lime wedge.
Short Island Iced Tea: Pour all ingredients, except Coke, over ice. Fill with Coca-cola and stir.
Angel's Tit: Pour ingredients into glass in order given, carefully so each layer floats on top of the previous one with mixing. Chill for 1/2 hour before serving.
Black Jack WV: Only tastes best with Yukon Jack but can substitute for Crown or Seagrams.
Real Romulan Ale: CAUTION: This drink is extremely alcoholic and quite flammable! Do NOT expose to open flame and drink responsibly! NOTE: If you're not one of the few that enjoys the sensation of white-hot liquid crawling down the back of your throat then you might want to consider "Romulan Ale Light". Simply follow the directions listed above and, when you're ready to imbibe, pour the shot in to a 12-ounce glass and fill with Sprite. Variations include strawberry soda, pineapple soda, orange sode, Cherry 7-Up, and grape soda. Remember, you haven't had REAL Romulan Ale until you've sucked down a shot!
The Fat Albert: In a blender mix the Chocolate Milk, Ice, and Maple Syrup for about 5 seconds. Then add the Chocolate liquior and Kahlua and blend for another 2 seconds. Pour and top with whipped cream.
Campari Beer: Use a 15 oz glass. Add Campari first. Fill with beer.
Slammin' Sammy: A sweet taste, but a hint of tart that sets it apart.
Mortini: Chill cocktail glass. Add grenadine and amaretto to the chilled glass. Finally, add chilled vodka.
Angelica Liqueur: Combine all herbs, nuts and spices with vodka in a 1 quart or larger aging container. Cap tightly and shake daily for 2 weeks. Strain through a fine muslin cloth or coffee filter, discarding solids. Clean out aging container. Place liquid back in container. Place sugar and water in saucepan and stir to combine over medium heat. When sugar is completely dissolved, set aside and let cool. When cool combine with food coloring and add to liqueur liquid. Cap and allow to age and mellow in a cool, dark place for one month.
Irish Pirate: Variation: "Irish Seaman" - substitute Bailey's Irish Cream for Irish Mist. -- Origin: Plymouth State College, Plymouth, NH
Beetlejuice: In a tall mixing glass with ice pour the vodka on the bottom. Then fill the glass 3/4 full with sour mix. Pour in the rest of the ingredients one at a time. Garnish with pineapple spear and cherry
Southern Sunrise: Pour all ingredients into a shaker with ice. Shake well and pour into Cocktail glasses.
Afterburner #2: pour 1 shot a vodka pour 1/2 shot of Tobasco sauce in seperate shot glass (take vodka shot immediately followed by the Tobasco shot) ***amount can be changed to liking
Alabama Slammer #2: Also good as a mixed drink, served in a cocktail glass.
French Connection: Pour ingredients into a old-fashioned glass over ice, stir, and serve.
Cough Medicine: Does not prevent or cure the common cold.
Walker's Revenge: Add rums over ice and fill glass with ice tea. Best in a tall frosty glass.
Grendel: Shaken with ice and put in a pint glass and topped with lemonade.
Triad: Pour the rum, vermouth, amaretto, and ginger ale into a highball glass almost filled with ice cubes. Stir well and garnish with the lemon twist.
Romona Banana: Shake all ingredients and serve in shot glass.
International Jack: Mix ingredients in a mixing glass with ice. Strain into a cocktail glass. Garnish with an orange peel.
Coffee Coolata: I was feeling cheap and wanted to make my own Coffee Coolata so I tried things and this is what I came up with and someone sugested the Kahlua.
Fat Hooker: Pour first three ingredients in a highball glass filled with ice. Fill with orange or pinapple juice, stir well, and serve.
Raspberry Cordial: Combine all ingredients and stir until sugar is disolved. Store in large bottles for 22 days, then put in gift bottles and seal.
Godiva Chocolate Martini: Tastes like dreamy chocolate milk. Enjoy, pure heaven.
Virgin Sex On The Beach: Mix equal parts orange juice and cranberry juice. Mix in the nectar, and pour over ice. Pour in the grenadine last so it will sink. Garnish with pineapple.
Sex on the Beach #12: It's the best way to make it, absolutely the best!
Swamp Water #2: Great conversational cocktail! As disgusting as it looks, it tastes pretty good. Regular Curacao or Triple Sec can be used in place of Blue Curacao, but you'll lose the colorful effect.
Catfish: Artie Jones Theo's Bar & Grill, Camp Hill, PA
Red Snapper: One shot each, shake n shoot
Orange Velvet: Shake cream, pineapple juice and orange juice with some ice. Strain into a large cocktail glass.
Wave Runner (a.k.a. Rave Gunner): Pour rum and cranberry juice into a tall glass. Slowly add Sprite, stopping immediately when the color changes from red to pink.
Manhattan Sweet: Stir well in a mixing glass filled with ice. Strain into a chilled cocktail glass and granish with a cherry.
Bigger better Blue Lagoon: This is one of those drinks to sip on a long summer night, enjoying the sunset and having a few laughs. Enjoy!
Iced Coffee: Mix together until coffee and sugar is dissolved. Add milk. Shake well. Using a blender or milk shake maker produces a very foamy drink. Serve in coffee mug.
Boilermaker: Fill shot glass with whiskey. Drop full shot glass into mug o' beer. Drink immediately, enjoy.
Cream Soda: Pour 1oz of Spiced Rum into a highball glass with ice. Fill with Ginger Ale.
Horse And Jockey: In a mixing glass half-filled with ice cubes, combine all of the ingredients. Stir well. Strain into a cocktail glass.
Mind over Marny: Summer drink. Garnish with anything other than onions or olives. Fruitopia's "Mind over Mango", while a tasty beverage, is not as good a mixer as it may seem. Stick with the real.
China White #2: Layer creme de cacao on bottom, followed by the Irish Cream. Lastly, sprinkle cinnamon over top.
Love Potion: chill all ingredients over ice, strain into chilled shot glass, serve, enjoy
Tequila Mockingbird: Shake ingredients with ice and strain into cocktail glass.
Menage A Trois: In a shaker half-filled with ice cubes, combine all of the ingredients. Shake well. Strain into a cocktail glass.
Trilby Cocktail: Stir all ingredients with ice, strain into a cocktail glass, and serve.
Zooom!: Ideally this should be served in highball glasses that taper to a point on the inside, so it looks a bit like zoom ice lollys shoot it
Jamaican Dust-Buster: mix ingredients in a glass and knock off those dust-bunnies
Hakkespett: Origin: Musikerlåfte' på Studentersamfundet i Trondheim
Mandy Sea: Mix liquor and juices in mixing cup and blend. Pour over ice in collins glass top with grenadine and splash of 7-up. Garnish with a flag or two cherries.
Absinthe Martini: Stir well with ice. Strain into a prechilled cocktail glass. Very pleasant with an onion stuffed olive. Some bartenders pour a soucon of Absinthe into the glass, swirl it around and then add the martini.
Punch #1: Recipe above makes about 35 punch cup sized servings (about 4 oz each)
Elk's Own Cocktail: Shake all ingredients (except pineapple) with ice and strain into a cocktail glass. Add the pineapple slice and serve.
Ma\u00e8ek: Mix this and add orange peel.
Topaz: Cobine ingredients in a shaker 2/3 filled with ice. Shake well, and then strain into a cocktail glass.
Absolut 600: Created especially for the Consul General of Sweden who lives on 600 Park Avenue in New York.
Rolling Green Elixer: Combine ingredients in a shaker, strain ice cubes.
Stabilizer: Chill the Rumple Minze until VERY cold. Then pour over the 151 in a shot glass. They will not layer, so don't try it. Then drink the shot quickly...don't waste time smelling the shot or sipping it...just drink it. The sit back and enjoy!
Nuked Hot Chocolate: Mix with a bit of milk (1 oz or so) in coffee mug. Nuke mug for about 30-50 seconds. Stir until the heated cocoa dissolves. Fill mug with milk. Nuke for 1-2 minutes, depending on wattage and preferences as to burnt mouth parts.
Black & Blue Berries: Place all ingredients in the blender jar - cover and whiz on medium speed until well blended. Pour in one tall, 2 medium or 3 small glasses and drink up.
Poppy Cocktail: Shake ingredients with ice, strain into a cocktail glass, and serve.
Hairy Sunrise: Mix all ingredients in blender except grenadine. Pour into collins glass and float grenadine on top. Garnish with a lime slice.
Ash Blonde: Shake lillet and cointreau with ice. Strain into cocktail glass. Add splash of vermouth for color.
Ghetto Hell: This drink is an excellent choice for the "financially challenged." As unemployed college graduates, we enjoy this fine cocktail on a regular basis.
Grinch: A Panama City Beach, Fl., Sweet Dreams Original created by Dave Tyring and Jo Meints.
Greek Sex On The Beach: Put all ingredients in together, and shake. Serve in a glass filled up to 2/3 with ice.
Trojan Horse: A summer drink, popular in the UK. Cheers.
The Skunk Pussy: Place lime in snifter then inhale contents aroma deeply, and then you will know how we came up with the name Skunk Pussy.
Crickets: Combine all ingredients in a blender. Add enough ice-cream to make the drink thick like a malt. Serves two.
Fill shaker with ice, add ingreidients to taste. Don't want rum to overpower. Shake well, pour into shot glasses.
Chambord sour: Blend with ice. Serve up or on the rocks.
Pedra (stone): First put the tequila, then the vodka, then the black rum, then the Bailey's Irish Cream, then the Granadine syrup and then mix this five elements for that the drink become pink, to finish put the Absinthe with the help of a spoon. Put the shot on fire and drink it with a straw, or you have another choice: When the shot is on fire you slap it to extinguish the fire and then you drink it.
Liberty Blue Champagne: Shake first 4 ingredients over ice and strain in sugar rimed champagne flute. Fill with champagne.
Small Sand: Mix the 4 first ingredients with ice. Fill with lemonade. Garnish with carambole and strawberry on the edge of glass.
Red Alert: Shake all ingredients together and serve
Pixy Stick: Can add a slight bit of soda (tonic water) on top of the Blackberry Brandy.
B-52 #1: Layer the Kahlua, Amaretto, and Irish Cream into a shot glass in that order. After drinking, notice the Vapor Trails.
Delilah: A light, sweet citrus taste combined with the dryness of gin
Midnight Lemonade: Just one of the creations invented at The RoadHouse NightClub in International Falls, Minnesota. -- Berry Tattoo is a berry flavored schnapps that temorarily dyes your mouth blue.
Blue Edisonian: Put all ingredients into a shaker filled with cracked ice. Shake well. Strain into a cocktail glass.
Russian Qualude #2: Pour over ice, shake vigorously, Strain into martini style cocktail glass. Garnish with one filbert.
Tropical Storm Jack: Put all in hi-ball glass and shake garnish with lime
Etyk: Fhis drink comes from Finland and it means: "I don't come home tonight!"
Toolkit: Mix all ingredients and pour into shot glasses. Slam it!!
Tequila Gimlet: Shake well with ice in a shaker and strain into a chilled cocktail glass.
Dreamsicle #3: This smooth drink will take you back to the carefree days of kiddoom (or childhood, if you will). One sip is like a lick of the original Dreamsicle.
Donkey Punch: Favorite punch of Trinity College in Hartford, Connecticut. The name originates from the fact that when drunken everybody becomes stupider than a jackass!
Big Red Hooter: Pour tequila and amaretto over ice into collins glass. Fill with pineapple juice and top with grenadine. Garnish with a cherry and serve with a straw.
Gluehwein: Boil sugar and spices in water, leave in the water for 30 minutes. Strain the spiced water and mix with the wine. Heat slowly until short of boiling temperature. (To remove alcohol, let it boil for a while.) You may add lemon or orange juice to taste. Serve in irish coffee cup.
Loch Lomond: In a mixing glass half-filled with ice cubes, combine the Scotch, Drambuie, and vermouth. Stir well. Strain into a cocktail glass. Garnish with the lemon twist.
Manhasset: Shake all ingredients with ice, strain into a cocktail glass, and serve.
Jamaican Bum: Pour shots into glass over ice, fill with 7-up, add cream and stir. Garnish with any fruit or cherry.
Spring: Mix gentle, and add ice cubes. Serve whith Straw.
Bleeding Orgasm: Cut the pineapple into small chunks and soak them in the vodka and rum for 20-30 minutes. Add the rest of the ingredients and you're all good.
Strawberries And Cream: Place schnapps, half-and-half, sugar, and 2 cups of crushed ice in an electric blender and blend at a high speed. Add 2 of the strawberries and blend for 10 seconds. Pour into a parfait glass, top with the other strawberry, and serve with a straw.
Fuck You: Mix each ingredient in a glass. Tilt glass 180 degrees and slam it!
Lady Finger: Shake all ingredients with ice, strain into a cocktail glass, and serve.
Sandbar Sleeper: Makes aprox. four to five shots.
Cruz Azul (Blue Cross): Name originates from a Mexican soccer team: Cruz Azul. -- This shot has an extremely strong mint taste, and when consumed through a short straw, is on the potent side. Not meant for the weak at heart. Enjoy. -- Credit for the drink belongs to a good friend of mine, and a fine bartender. Thanks Fabian.
Orange 43: Pour over ice and stir to mix.
Lemon Celebration: This drink came about through a lack of ingredients and the alcoholic urges of Heath & Scott.
Bulldog Cocktail: Shake all ingredients with ice, strain into a cocktail glass, and serve.
Just Peachy: Mix together the Peach schnapps and the Iced Tea and serve over ice.
Stanley Steamer: Made at the Country House in Clarendon Hills, ILL. for the last 20 years by yours truly.
Raw Sewage: This drink tastes better than it looks (and sounds). An excellent conversation starter! My best friends and I were playing around mixing drinks one night, and this one kinda "pooped" up. It tastes great! Try it...
All American: Serve with two ice-cubes. You can vary the amount of Coca-Cola, all after how soft you want the drink to be.
Satin Sheet: I prefer not to use a sipping straw for the reason that you have more time to enjoy this tasty treat. Brandy is a very tasty liquor. So I added some peach schnapps, grenadine, and orange juice to spruce it up. What I came up with is something that I will drink for the rest of my life!
Fuzzy Monkey: Shooter. Shake ingredients with ice (in a mixing tin). Strain into a shooter glass.
Gin-Dew-It: This a great drink after a hard day at the office, or a grueling game of volleyball enjoy!
Bittersweet Jack: Very nice, very classy. You probably wouldn't want to use a whiskey other than Gentleman Jack. Cheers.
Howell Says So: In a shaker half-filled with ice cubes, combine all of the ingredients. Shake well. Strain into an old-fashioned glass almost filled with ice cubes.
Storm Trooper: Inspired by the Star Wars series.
Moscow Mule: Mix all ingredients in a highball glass with ice and enjoy.
Cherry Bon Bon: Perfect for a Valentine's Day shot.
Frangeilico Float: Blend all ingredients until smooth. Serve in a highball glass and garnish with whipped cream.
Blue Whale: Pour ingredients over ice and mix in a shaker
Johnny on the beach: Mix over ice. garnish with a slice of orange.
Pisco-rita: Add limeade concentrate, Pisco, and triple sec in blender. Add ice until blender is full. Blend on high speed adding water until blender is full while blending. Serve in margarita glass rimmed with salt if desired.
Freddy Kruger: make it an ample size shot!!
Ultimate Blue Frozen Margarita: For those who don't like salted glasses, substitute red party sugar, for a sweeter, prettier drink, excellent for the novice margarita drinker.
Flaming Lemon Drop: If you have ever had a lemon drop candy as a child this drink will surely bring back memories! This drink proves what one can invent when totally bored and full access to a stocked bar!
Bloody Caesar: Rim tall glass with celery salt, fill with ice and ingredients. Garnish with a celery stick, straw, and lime.
Hurricane #2: This was from a book I read somewhere. This drink hides the alcohol taste well. Dangerous! -- Substituting cranberry juice for grapefruit juice also creates an awesome drink.
Golden Glow Punch: Pour the concentrate and the apple juice into the punch bowl. Stir the ginger ale into the bowl. Spoon in sherbet or add an Ice Ring. Serve immediately.
Pine Needle: Amounts of Triple Sec and Sweet and Sour can be varied to taste. Great drink for sippin' on.
Burning Worm: Put into seperate shot glasses. Shoot the mezcal first then chase with goldschlager.
Irish Float: Best when drunk through a straw to avoid the foam!
Flaming Rasta: I learded this drink in the Virgin Islands. Everyone that has done it so far loves it..
Bosom Caresser: In a mixing glass half-filled with crushed ice, combine all of the ingredients. Stir well. Strain into a cocktail glass.
Alabama Slammer: May also be served without ice in a shot glass.
Dirty Bong Water #2: Good for the college crowd. definately a group shot. Was created in a mini-bottle state so recepie was slightly modified.
Banshe: Pour over chrusted ice. Lightly stir.
Irish Russian: Add the ingredients in the order listed in the recipe. Care must be taken when adding the Guinness to prevent an excess of foam. Do Not add ice.
Listerine: Discovered by myself and SoCo Folchi at our house, El Rancho, mere moments before Lee's first excursion into the world of topless entertainment.
Barbarian: Pour root beer into mug. Add a shot of Blackberry Brandy.
Holy Blue: A variation of the Holy Water. Using gin instead of Vodka out of preference, and Blue Curacao instead of Grenadine because the tastes mixes better with the Triple Sec.
Captain Pepper: Mix. Then drink. Repeat as necessary.
Cool Kid: put the shit in a hurricane glass, mix it up, and suck it down
Patriotic Blow: The Professional Bartenders School in Chicago (529 S. Wabash) held a Monica Lewinsky drink contest during afternoon and evening classes with instructor Kim G. This was the winner.
Tennessee Tea: This recipe comes directly from Jack Daniel's Distillery in Tennessee, which offers wonderful tours if you're ever in that area. It makes a great punch.
Irish Mint: Originally called a Pan Galactic Gargle Blaster, I developed it in the latter days of my high school in Bangkok. My friend and I experimented with many drinks. Another good one is an "Apple Pie with a Crust"
The Crying Game: Mix JD and Vodka together with Kahlua. Heat over medium flame Bailey's, Tequila, and Rum. Mix all together with tomato juice and top with grenadine. Garnish with a stalk of celery and green onion. Enjoy!!!
Green angel: The blue syrup is not neceserry, but it gives the drink it's Characteristic green colour.
SigTau Scorpion: This is a good summer drink that was mixed at the Sigma Tau Gamma Fraternity at Michigan Technological University in the Upper Peninsula of Michigan.
Blue Margarita: Rub rim of cocktail glass with lime juice. Dip rim in coarse salt. Shake tequila, blue curacao, and lime juice with ice, strain into the salt-rimmed glass, and serve.
Hot Lunch: Remember to eat the pickle - that's the lunch!!! -- Another Name: The Steaming Chest
Lord And Lady: Pour the rum and Tia Maria into an old-fashioned glass almost filled with ice cubes. Stir well.
Jackbull: An easy drink,that give you the power to go on and face the night. Enjoy "Menphis" the Lowlanders MC Italy bartender.
Brainstorm: In a mixing glass half-filled with ice cubes, combine all of the ingredients. Stir well. Strain into a cocktail glass.
Gin Smash: Muddle sugar with carbonated water and mint sprigs in an old-fashioned glass. Add gin and 1 ice cube. Stir, add the orange slice and the cherry, and serve.
Sunset Sour: This is my original recipe never before published. It is a three-color drink (yellow, then orange and finally red at the bottom of the glass) and looks like a sunset.
Boxcar: In a shaker half-filled with ice cubes, combine all of the ingredients. Shake well. Strain into a sour glass.
Golden Bronx: In a shaker half-filled with ice cubes, combine all of the ingredients. Shake well. Strain into a sour glass.
Raspberry Russian: Tired of the same old white Russian? Give his wife a try. This is definitely a "girly" drink.
Pi\u00f1a Rita: Refreshing and deliciosa! For people who might not like sweet and sour mix but like tequila.
The Hurtado: Dont be fooled by the taste. This one will knock you on the ass! Before you drink yell "El Tanque"!
Truck Punch: Give yourself a break, use ice.
Pillow Mint: Add the whiskey fist, then Kahlua. Finally, add a splash of the mint for flavor. Stir and enjoy.
Apertif d'Absinthe: Add wormwood to shot of pernod add sugar and water serve over ice.
Papaya Sling: Shake all ingredients (except carbonated water and pineapple stick) with ice and strain into a collins glass over ice cubes. Fill with carbonated water and stir. Add the pineapple stick and serve.
Cheapo student bevvy: Mix in a pint glass. Down very quickly.
Vodka Russian: Mix it as a ordinary drink .
Honolulu Cocktail No. 2: Stir all ingredients with ice, strain into a cocktail glass, and serve.
Ward Eight: Shake blended whiskey, juice of lemon, grenadine, and powdered sugar with ice and strain into a red wine glass filled with cracked ice. Add the orange slice, top with the cherry, and serve with a straw.
Martini #2: In a mixing glass half-filled with ice cubes, combine the gin and vermouth. Stir well. Strain into a cocktail glass. Garnish with the lemon twist or an olive.
Royal Laundry: It comes out purple like a kings robe.
Grumpy Old Man: It's a little on the tart side. One must have a taste for both Old Grand Dad (high-proof bourbon, similar to Wild Turkey) and Lime Juice to really enjoy.
Buzz Inducer: Put the two shots into frosty beer mug. Add IBC Root Beer into glass. Ice cubes are optional.
Thames Water: In the UK we use a straight Pint glass, in the US I guess you need a large Pilsner beer glass. Its important to add the orange juice first. *Don't* tilt the glass when you add the cola. A perfect mix is obtained when a noticable head forms on top. It is best mixed *without* ice, but use cold ingredients. -- Also known as a "Muddy Puddle", this drink is dark brown in colour and looks revolting. It is guaranteed to turn heads if not stomachs. Nevertheless, the two ingredients compliment each other as the cola ends up not too gassy and the orange loses it sharpness.
Malibu Milk Shake: Put all ingredients in a blender, blend till smooth, should create a small frothy head. Pour into to any glass handy, and enjoy your milkshake!
44D: The nice and eazy way to help that nagging little cough(only if you need a reason). Nice and smooth all the way down.
Max The Silent: In a mixing glass half-filled with ice cubes, combine all of the ingredients. Stir well. Strain into a cocktail glass.
Secret Blue: Shake ingredient vodka, lime and sugar with shaker. Add soda. Pour into Beer-pilsner with Ice. Drop curacao and creme de menthe. Decorate with cut-lime and cherry.
Brantini: Stir all ingredients (except lemon peel) with cracked ice and strain into an old-fashioned glass over ice cubes. Add the twist of lemon peel and serve.
Sicilian Cocktail: Fairly strong drink but tastes great.
Greyhound: Pour ingredients into a highball glass over ice cubes. Stir well and serve. (Vodka may be substituted for gin, if preferred.)
Pooh Bear: I made this drink up in college. It is named for my childhood hero and my favorite Disney character. Its sweet flavor and golden color remind me of that silly, nilly, willy old bear. I tend to like this drink best on hot, humid nights. The cream soda really takes the edge off of the whiskey. You can adjust the ingredients to taste, but too much cream soda tends to make this drink almost sickly-sweet. It's definitely a whiskey lover's drink.
Amaretto Alexander: Combine liquers in shaker along with cream and ice. Shake and strain into a brandy snifter. Garnish with a sprinkle of nutmeg.
Voodoo Juice: Pour over ice in a hurricane class. Float dark rum on top and serve.
Mellow Tennessee: Pour Jack Daniels into highball glass. Add ice cubes. Fill with ginger ale and finish off by topping it with orange juice.
Antoine Special: Float vermouth on top of chilled Dubonnet in a red wine glass and serve.
Purple Haze: Stir with ice in a mixing glass and strain into shotglass.
Flying Tiger: Fill glass with ice: add Galliano, Creme De Menthe and Vodka. Top glass off with orange juice. Enjoy!
Schwimmer: Mix all ingredients together in mixer, chill, then serve in shot glass
Shirley Temple: Build in a highball glass. Add ginger ale over ice and sprinkle grenadine syrup over it. Garnish with a lemon slice and a cherry.
Frisky's Surprise: Put all ingredients in blender, mix well, and enjoy.
Bleeding Surgeon: I invented this because I don't like the flavor of the new product. All my freinds like the taste because it's smooth.
Bermuda Triangle: The best Bermuda Triangles are served up by Cheeks and Idamae at the Harmony Club in Paget, Bermuda.
Oil Slick #2: A great night starter. Dont forget that this is a shot so it must go down in one gulp. Feel it oooze.
Mafia's Kiss: Good to drink while eating Combos snacks.
Perfect Rob Roy: In a mixing glass half-filled with ice cubes, combine the Scotch, sweet vermouth, and dry vermouth. Stir well. Strain into a cocktail glass. Garnish with the cherry or a lemon twist.
Ethiopian Camel Basher: Invented in the mid 80's by myself and a farmer. The young & daft will use a pint glass, in my more "mature" years, I use a 1/2 pint glass. The name ? I have no idea where that came from !
Gumball Hummer: I recommend 99 Bananas, but that's just me! Tastes like a gumball, hence the name.
Well Greased Dwarf: This drink was created in honor of my girlfriend Kathy King. The name "Well Greased Dwarf" came about from a clue that appeared in a NTN game at my bar. She thought that the phrase was funny enough to warrent a shot and I created this for her. It has since become something of my signiture drink at my bar & one that Kathy will frequently offer to new patrons.
Tequila Bay Breeze: The drink is a house signature cocktail for my bar. The name of the bar is Tequila Bay. It was tested on the band we had playing that weekend and after 4 attempts I came up with this one.
Fourth of July: may also subtitute vodka for cream Stronger version
Blue Lady: Half fill martini glass with crushed ice, pour in alcohol and stir.
Scotch Highball: Pour scotch in a highball glass over ice cubes. Fill with carbonated water, stir, and serve.
Risk: Tastes good. Great for anyone who doesn't want the usual shot.
Estonian Forest-fire: you should never drink one of these.
Fallen Angel: Shake all ingredients (except cherry) with ice and strain into a cocktail glass. Top with the cherry and serve.
Juniata Juice: Add 1 shot rum to 12 oz beer, stir in 2 tbls lime juice concentrate.
Gin Cobbler: In an old-fashioned glass, dissolve the sugar in the club soda. Add crushed ice until the glass is almost full. Add the gin. Stir well. Garnish with the cherry and the orange and lemon slices.
Delmonico #2: Stir all ingredients (except lemon peel) with ice and strain into a cocktail glass. Add the twist of lemon peel and serve.
Liquid Crack: Pour one-third of Rumple Minze, Jägermeister, and Goldschlager into a shot glass
Buddy's Favorite: Pour ingredients into a highball glass, stir, and serve without ice.
Scotch Cooler: Pour scotch and creme de menthe over ice cubes in a highball glass. Fill with carbonated water, stir, and serve.
K-V-S Kaboom: This has known to knock a party on it's ass! Be careful!
Pink n' Tart: Either light or medium rum works well.
Dirty Monkey: Mix in order listed. Do not stir. Serve in Brandy Snifter.
Jasmine: Stir with cracked ice and strain into a chilled cocktail glass. Garnish with a twist of lemon peel.
Limon Skyy: This drink is a very refreshing summer alternative to a standard Martini.
