Banana Cantaloupe Smoothie: Juice cantaloupe, pour juice into blender, add banana, and liquify.
Lick-Her-Itch: This is a "shooter" drink that I came up with myself. It is a favorite with younger "college" customers. The name is a "take-off" of the licorice flavor of the drink. -- So far, I have come up with 2 varriants: #1. Same as original but cut the vodka to 1/2 oz. then add 1/2 oz. sloe gin. The name of the drink than becomes "lick-her-itch sloely" -- #2. Same as the original, just add 1/2 oz. cream and serve as a cream style (I.E. Pink squirrel) drink. The name of the drink then becomes "lick-her-creamy-itch". -- A third possible varriant that a few customers have requested (which actually tastes rather nasty) is the same as #2 with the 1/2 oz. cream addition. (Sloely lick her creamy itch)
Orange Smile: Shake egg, grenadine syrup, orange juice, and several ice cubes well. Strain into a small tumbler, serve with a drinking straw.
Bourbon Cooler: Pour the bourbon and the soda into a highball glass almost filled with ice cubes. Stir well. Garnish with the lemon wedge.
P.S. I Love you: Mix the Baileys, Grand Marnier, and single cream together with some ice in a shaker. Shake thoroughly, and pour into a cocktail glass. Pour a splash (about 1/3 shot) through the mixture to the bottmo of the glass. Shake nutmeg over the top of the cocktail, and Bob's your Uncle.
Southern Pride: A shot I came up with after finding myself at a party with an original "Southern Belle" that was crazy over So-Co and Peach Schnapps. Little bit of a kick with taste-bud smacking flavor. Enjoy!
Malibu Twister: Add rum & trister then, add cranberry jucie,stir
Sweedish Blow Job: Add ingredients in order. Pour the cream soda to make the whipped cream spurt.
Biffy Cocktail: Shake all ingredients with ice, strain into a cocktail glass, and serve.
Abbey Cocktail: Shake all ingredients (except for the cherry) with ice and strain into a cocktail glass. Top with the cherry and serve.
Lady Scarlett: Jaroslav Krátký, C.B.A., Czech-Republic 1. in International Bartenders Associantions Intenational Cocktail Competition, Tokyo 1996. -- Category: Pre Dinner
The Milky Way: A nice and smooth shot with a little cinnomon twist.
Fox Poison: The color is almost the most important feature, it should be a clear sparkly purple. The Original included banana liqueur, but that tasted too sweet.
Alexander's Sister: In a shaker half-filled with ice cubes, combine the gin, creme de menthe, and heavy cream. Shake well. Strain into a cocktail glass and garnish with the nutmeg.
Brandied Egg Sour: In a shaker half-filled with ice cubes, crack the egg and add the rest of the ingredients. Shake well. Strain into a cocktail glass.
Rootbeer Floatie: In a shot glass, float .5oz. lt. cream on top of .5oz. rootbeer schnapps.
Attitude Adjustment #2: Tastes kind of like a Sex on the beach shooter, but a little stronger. Very tasty! Came from City Grille and Sports Bar in Charlotte, North Carolina
The Berserker: Pour shot of Amaretto into glass and fill with pineapple juice. Mixing is optional.
A True Amaretto Sour: Use whiskey instead to make a "Whiskey Sour". Once you have tried this drink made with real lemon, you'll never be able to drink those "mixers" again.
Red Rock: Mix vodka and schnapps in the bottom of a glass. Add ice and Dr. Pepper.
Carman's Dance: Pour Vodka and gin simultaneously. Add strawberry and cranberry together. Fill the rest with orange juice.
Pink Russian: Tastes great. White Russian used to be my favorite, but this one is so much better.
Sandra Buys A Dog: Pour all of the ingredients into a highball glass almost filled with ice cubes. Stir well.
Sombrero: Pour brandy into an old-fashioned glass over ice cubes. Float cream on top and serve.
King Willy: Made in Karlssons Salonger in Jön-köping, Sweden 1996 and very popular.
Chicks Dig It: Created in a basement bar in Rockville, MD. The chicks will dig it. Can also be served up in a martini glass.
Moo Moo: Pour both liquors into glass with ice. Add cream and shake well. Serve with large straw.
Peach Smoothie: Sweet and Smooth, goes down easy.
Manchurian Candidate: First pour vodka, then soy sauce, into the shot glass.
Rosita: Stir in old-fashioned glass with cracked ice. Add a twist of lemon peel and serve with short straws.
Dead Grasshopper: I liked Grasshoppers and I also enjoy Aftershock so I mixed them to make a "Dead Grasshopper"
Bleacher Creature: Pour butterscotch over rum. Do not stir.
Absinthe Minded Martini: You can also use your favorite vodka or other clear dry spirit to substitute for gin.
Deep, Dark Secret: In a shaker half-filled with ice cubes, combine all of the ingredients. Shake well. Strain into a cocktail glass.
Dutchie: This drink is very sweet, but the flavour is wonderful. I invented this drink while working as a bartender in northern Alberta. I named it "Dutchie" because Bols is a Dutch Liquer company.
No Regrets: The sweet of the Irish Cream mellows out the bite of the tequila. Or if you prefer, the bite of the tequila tones down the sweetness of the Irish cream. Either way, this definitely will wake up your mouth and make you feel warm inside. -- An alternate way of mixing this drink comes from its origin. One person has 1 oz of tequila in her/his mouth. The other person holds 1 oz of Irish Cream in her/his mouth mouth. Kiss and let the alcohols mix. Warning: this alternate way will produce more warm feelings than the method outlined above (and possibly a few regrets, lol).
Rusty Mist: A Rusty Nail but with Irish Mist instead of Scotch. Does it have any other names?
Frisky: Drink these until they taste good, then you'll know your lit.
Piggelin #2: Mix it all in a glass 1/4 full of ice...
Blue Diamond: Named for the Blue Diamond squadron at NAS Lemoore
No ice in the glass, no decoration. it's a very light, smooth and well balanced cocktail - just the perfect after-dinner-drink, not only for sisters. - dedicatet to s.
Babbie's Special Cocktail: Shake all ingredients with ice, strain into a cocktail glass, and serve.
Pam's Root Beer Float: Fill the glass with ice, add 2 shots Irish Cream and fill with cola. Mix gently, it will be very foamy!
Fatkid on the Rocks: Put the ice cubes in first then add the shots in the order that they're listed.
Spiced Cherry: Put the Spiced Rum in the glass. Fill with cherry coke. Stir.
By The Pool: Shake briskley for 10 seconds and serve in a tall glass over ice.
The District III: This drink is the chapter-drink of the Phi Alpha Delta, Law Fraternity International. It was created by members of the Ford Chapter of Loyola Law School in Los Angeles, California. It is particularly enjoyable with a strong, sweet tasting cigar!
Pink Banana: Fill glass half way with ice. Pour in 1 oz. of creme de banane and then 5 oz. of pink lemonade.
Deep Blue: Vodka and Blue Curacao are stirred on ice and then topped with champagne. Place a blue cocktail cherry in the bottom of the glass.
New York Sour: Shake blended whiskey, juice of lemon, and powdered sugar with ice and strain into a whiskey sour glass. Float claret on top. Decorate with the half-slice of lemon and the cherry and serve.
Irish Highball: Very nice and easy to drink. My personal favorite.
Golddigger: Drink with another drinking budy,and do not forget to slam the glass on the bar when done,upsidedown
Port Wine Cocktail: Stir ingredients with ice, strain into a cocktail glass, and serve.
Zippy's Revenge: Mix Kool-Aid to taste then add Rum and ammaretto. shake well to disolve the sugar in the Kool-Aid... serve cold
Delta Sunset: This is called a Delta Sunset at Bubba Gump's
Snakebite #1: Pour two ounces of Yukon Jack over ice; add a dash of lime juice; enjoy
Fuzzy Screw: For those who like a Fuzzy Navel but with more of a kick.
Tequila Body Slammer: An alternative known as a "Shiver Shot" involves the shot glass being held between the breasts rather than in the drinker's hand. The salt is placed on the breast. The drinker licks the salt, tips the glass over into his/her mouth, then sucks on the lemon.
Vanilla Creamsicle: WARNING: This drink goes down really easy and leaves you wanting for more - just remember that it is potent (because you can't tell by the taste!) ENJOY!
Gin And It: Stir gin and vermouth in a cocktail glass. (No ice is used in this drink.)
Bartender's Wet Dream: Just put the ingredients in a shot glass and put a little bit of whipped cream on the top.
Afterburner #1: pour both ingredients and let them mix some(you can stir it some to help it out)
Double Jack: This drink HURTS. Will get you drunk really fast. If I don't feel like dancing, this drink always gets me out on the dance floor.
Green Cow: Blend the two ingredients together. Use about half of each.
Candy Apple #2: Pour Amaretto and Butterscotch in a glass with ice. Fill with apple juice.
Hoots Mon: In a mixing glass half-filled with ice cubes, combine all of the ingredients. Stir well. Strain into a cocktail glass.
Cardinal: In a mixing glass half-filled with ice cubes, combine all of the ingredients. Stir well. Strain into a cocktail glass.
Poor Man's Mommosa: Pour Beer into a highball glass, add orange juice til desired color
Black Orchid: You should not use Meyers Dark Rum for this one.
Lemon Drop #1: to consume: place sugar on lemon, place in mouth and take shot, then bite down on lemon -enjoy sweet/tart flavor as vodka goes down! YummY!
Mint Julep #3: In electric blender, blend on high for a few seconds, until leaves are reduced. Strain into silver tumbler packed with shaved ice, add more Bourbon to saturate the ice, garnish with a sprig of mint.
Nutty Ginger: The amount of ginger ale can be adjusted to taste. You can garnish with lemon peel.
Passoa Sweet Dreams: Created by Mauricio. A very tropical drink for the ladies.
Donkey Semmen: Put 4 ice cubes in shaker. Add ingredients. shake well and serve in a margarita glass. Garnish with lime.
Seventh Heaven Cocktail: Shake all ingredients (except mint sprig) with ice and strain into a cocktail glass. Add the sprig of mint and serve.
Adios Motherfucker #2: This is the best shot in "Cocktail and Dreams" in Japan
Sloe Comfortable Screw #2: The name is derived from the ingredients: Vodka and O.J. being a 'screw'driver. The amount of juice you add will affect the strength of the drink. A little juice and it's a shot, a lot of juice and it's a foo-foo drink.
Linfield's Spare Part Punch: Solicite as many ingredients as possible from the guests. Feel free to add, subtract, or change any ingredients you like. You might consider using Hawaiian Punch in place of the Fruit Punch to make it sweeter.
Jeannie's Dream: Origin: An off-campus dorm room at Slippery Rock University, one January weekend. Was named after one of the girl's because she was known as Jeannie on the internet and she was the one just mixing things that tasted good.
Shrewsbury Slammer: Something for all those who live in the small town of Shrewsbury, Pa.
Japaneese slipper: Shake well with lot's of ice. Pour into cocktailglass.
Pat Quinn: The ratio of whiskey to orange pop can be changed if you want.
Boston Cocktail: Shake all ingredients with ice, strain into a cocktail glass, and serve.
John Daly: This is a fantastic summer drink at the golf course. An Arnold Palmer with a little kick!
Lewinsky: Pour together in shot glass and serve. Very easy to do.
Buttery Nipple #1: The Butterscotch Schnapps makes up the bottom layer. The top layer of Baileys should be added using a spoon. This is a layered shot. Delicious!!
Golden Slipper: Stir brandy and chartreuse with ice and strain into a cocktail glass. Float unbroken egg yolk on top and serve.
Lewd Lewinsky: The Professional Bartenders School in Chicago (529 S. Wabash) held a Monica Lewinsky drink contest in its afternoon and evening classes with instructor Kim G. This was #3.
Widow Woods' Nightcap: In a shaker half-filled with ice cubes, combine all of the ingredients. Shake well. Strain into a cocktail glass.
Smeraldo: Put all in a Shacker with Ice, shake it for a while and serve in a cold Cocktail glass
Remsen Cooler: Put powdered sugar and 2 oz. carbonated water into a collins glass and stir. Add ice cubes and gin, fill with carbonated water, and stir again. Add the twist of lemon peel and the spiral of orange so that the end dangles over rim of glass.
FireBall Shooter: Drink the shooter and chase it with a beer. Tastes like a fireball candy.
Rainbow Brite Blowing Sunshine Up Your B: This drink is most attractive when made with a clear brand of strawberry schnapps - it's similar to a rainbow (ergo "Rainbow Brite"). After absorbing the aesthetic effect, the drink is best enjoyed well-stirred.
Wa-Hoo-Wa: This is the drink of a University of Virginia Cavalier.
Cold Shower: Use about 1:4 of creme de menthe to club soda, and stir.
Caesar: Add optional amount of Tabasco to fire it up.
Fruit of the Loom: Fruity shooter, tastes like bubblegum. Customers enjoy it quite well, girls in particular.
Lemonade #2: Pour lemon and lime juice into a pitcher and add sugar. Stir until the sugar is dissolved. Add water and ice cubes. Stir.
Italian Delight: Shake all ingredients (except cherry) with ice and strain into a chilled cocktail glass. Add the cherry on top and serve.
Cheshire Cat: This is also excellent mixed in blender with ice and served frozen. Very smooth and very potent. Enjoy!
Bull's Eye: Pour brandy and hard cider into a highball glass over ice cubes. Fill with ginger ale, stir, and serve.
Toocan Sam: in a shaker half filled with ice, add first 5 ingredients. shake well. strain into hurricane glass filled with ice. lace with grenadine.
Lemon Drop #4: There are a lot of ways to make this particular drink, but this has been the best method I've come across so far. Add more sugar if you prefer a sweeter taste. You can also substitute Equal or Sweet & Low in place of sugar.
Splurge: The lemon juice cancels out the taste of the vodka creating a citrusy taste sensation!
Malibu Express: Mix all ingredients together. Serve on ice.
Hot Scotch: Pour Buttershots Schnapps into an 8 oz. mug and fill with hot chocolate. Garnish with whipped cream.
Sunset Island: Combine in a shaker over a few ice cubes. Shake thoroughly. Pour into a collins glass and serve.
Imagination: This is a very tasty drink.
Field of Green: Pour the Sloe Gin and Amaretto into a glass. Fill the Glass 1/2 way with 7-up (Optional), and the other 1/2 with Orange Juice
The Perfect Margarita #2: Incredible. Best mararita I've ever made. Sweet N Sour mix gives it a nice frothy look and taste.
Beer Top: From the Island of Guernsey Channel Islands.
Glogg in the Microwave: Mix all ingredients, except for the lemonslices, in a coffee mug. Heat it (using a lid) on full power for 5-6 minutes or, if you are using a temperature meter, 75'C. Stir, until the sugar is dissolved. Serve in a small cup, with a slice of lemon for decoration.
Woo Woo: Pour all ingredients into a highball glass over ice cubes, stir, and serve.
Snakebite #2: Very carefully layer the vodka on top of the green Chartreuse. Drop in the Tabasco, which should sink to the bottom. Slam it.
Gin Milk Punch: Shake all ingredients (except nutmeg) with ice and strain into a collins glass. Sprinkle nutmeg on top and serve.
Falling star: This is a strong shot that leaves little or no after taste.
Absolut Stress #1: Pour all ingredients into a mixing tin and shake with ice. Pour into a collins glass. No garnish.
Lennart: Pour pear brandy and lime juice over ice in glass. Fill with sprite.
Null & Void Punch: Mix with ice in a Tupperware dish pan. Serve in 16 oz glasses (with caution). Tastes great, but can lead to wastedness if comsumed too quickly, hence the name NULL & VOID punch.
Will Rogers: Shake all ingredients with ice, strain into a cocktail glass, and serve.
Venus on the Rocks: Perfect end to a romantic dinner or for sipping on the beach.
Frozen Mudslide #2: This is a shot from the hip on the ingredient amounts in this drink. It can be mixed together without the chocolate syrup and added later as a topping (lining the inside of the glass) and not mixed and served in a margarita size glass and served with whiped cream on top. This is very good!
Tree Frog: I learned of this drink while visiting a quaint little resturaunt on Mackinac Island, Michigan.
Colorado Pitbull: In a shaker mix Spiced Rum, Kahlua, and Cream. Pur into a Mason Jar filled with ice and add a splach of Coca-Cola. Garnish with a couple of Filberts.
Chocolate Cake Shooter: It tastes just like chocolate cake -- soon you'll be telling all your friends about this amazing drink.
Barney on Acid: Shake and strain into shot glass.
Nutty Russian: Serve well mixed over ice. Yo can add 1 part milk if desired.
Pink Cotton Candy: Pour all ingredients over ice and stir.
Dinah Cocktail: Shake all ingredients (except mint) with ice and strain into a cocktail glass. Add the sprig of mint and serve.
The Spiff: Stir the Amaretto with the Dr. Pepper. Pour over Ice cubes and add two Cherries. Enjoy.
Simple but Sweet: Pour vodka in rocks glass. Half fill with apricot nectar.
Nipple on Fire: First put in ButterScotch, then Firewater, and float the Irish Cream
Batida Summerday: Use a half coconut instead of the glass.
Aviation: The strict recipe does not have any sugar, but I like to add a little.
Lunch Box #2: Mix the beer and OJ in a mug, drop the shot of Amaretto in, and down it.
Kilted Black Leprechaun: Layer ingredients in the glass, in the following order: Baileys first, Malibu next, Drambuie last Serve with a smile (to placate the Leprechauns), wearing no underwear (och!), and thinking of sex (mon). Glug. Whee!
Alien Urine: This drink is ideally made in a 16 ounce glass, but can also be made in a Collins glass. The drink is served on the rocks. Add the Midori, Malibo, and Schnaps. Add juices. Shake in a tin. Garnish with either two cherries or with a kiwi wheel.
Cranberry Punch: Combine first four ingredients. Stir until sugar is dissolved, chill. Then add ginger ale just before serving. Add ice ring to keep punch cold.
Baroness: Mix juices and cinnamon with ice. Strain to a cocktail glass. Serve cold.
Christmas Cheer: stir it up and shoot it down. HO! HO! HO! Tastes like christmas with a pine tree twist.
Bondages' No Problem: This is a version of a drink Johnny Bondage and I had in Jamaica. So get some reggae music on and have a few of Bondages' No Problem and get irie! It's no problem man!
Captain's Spiced Cider: Pour (over ice is best, but not necessary) spiced rum into glass, fill with apple cider, stir.
Vodka And Tonic: Pour vodka into a highball glass over ice cubes. Fill with tonic water, stir, and serve.
Coo Coo: In a blender, combine ingredients with ice and enjoy!
Shot-o-Happiness: The more Razmatazz used, the sweeter the drink is.
Horse's Neck: Place the lemon peel spiral in a highball glass and drape one end of it over the rim of the glass. Fill the glass with ice cubes. Pour the brandy, ginger ale, and bitters into the glass. Stir well.
Metromelt: First there was the Snowplow, then there was the Metromelt. Named after the massive snowbank melting machines used in Toronto, it easily packs the same "thawing" qualities! Note: For extra (highly effective) thawing power, use 1 oz. of 151 proof rum......Wooooooeeeee! Yes...we have intensively researched this particular variation.
Tiger Tail: This is a shot that, layered correctly, tends to resemble a striped tigers tail.
Caribbean Kiss: Dip the rim of a cocktail glass in Kahlùa, then in brown sugar. Shake the spirits and cream with ice, strain into the frosted glass and sprinkle cinnamon on top. This drink is created by Sami Taalas (Sheraton Malmö, Sweden) Caribbean Kiss won Trois Rivières After Dinner Cocktail Competition Swedish Championship 1994
Gin Daisy: In a shaker half-filled with ice cubes, combine the wine, lemon juice, sugar, and grenadine. Shake well. Pour into an old-fashioned glass and garnish with the cherry and the orange slice.
Valencia Cocktail: Shake all ingredients with ice, strain into a cocktail glass, and serve.
Midnight Manx: Fill a mixer with ice and add Baileys, Kahlua, Goldshlager, and cream. Shake for 5 seconds and Strain into a double rocks glass filled with ice. Add chilled coffee Stir and enjoy!
Tree Smacker: Learned this drink at a small bar in the mountains on a snow mobile trip. Excellent drink...
Manhattan Dry: Stir well in a mixing glass filled with ice. Strain into a chilled cocktail glass and granish with a lemon peel.
Leave-It-To-Me Cocktail: Stir all ingredients with ice, strain into a cocktail glass, and serve.
Tartantula: In a mixing glass half-filled with ice cubes, combine the Scotch, vermouth, and Benedictine. Stir well. Strain into a cocktail glass. Garnish with the lemon twist.
Third-Rail Cocktail: Shake all ingredients with ice, strain into a cocktail glass, and serve.
Tie Me To The Bedpost #2: Shake well with ice. Pour into a highball glass. Garnish with a cherry.
Vit Ryss: Mix everything in a highballglas and add some ice.
Strawberry Smoothie: Put all in blender and wizz away until thick.
Rambo Shot: keep both liquors cold and serve ina chilled shot glass if possible
Blood Clot #1: Drop shot glass of s.c. into lowball glass mixed with 7-UP and grenadine. Slam it!!!
Bastardized Screwdriver: Ice, then rum, then orange juice. Mix
Tailspin Cocktail: Stir all ingredients (except cherry) with ice and strain into a cocktail glass. Top with the cherry and serve. (An olive may be substituted for the cherry, if preferred.)
El Diablo: Stir tequila and creme de cassis over ice in a chilled collins glass. Fill with ginger ale, squeeze lime wedge over drink and drop it into the glass.
Rouge Martini: In a mixing glass half-filled with ice cubes, combine the gin and Chambord. Stir well. Strain into a cocktail glass.
Honolulu Action: Drink may be garnished with a cherry if 9 other ingridents are not enough!
Afterburner #3: Pour over ice in a cocktail glass.
Dirty Martini: This is salty... I mean SALTY! You will either love it or hate it immediately. I take my martinis this way all the time. If you like the flavor but the salt is a bit to much, just decrease olive juice to taste. The first dirty martini I had was not salty enough, so I added more juice..Enjoy!
Bob Marley: Layer in a 2 oz shot glass or pony glass
Summer Mind Eraser: I invented this drink at one of the hottest nightclubs in Sydney, Australia. The original Mind Eraser is a little much in our hot summers (especially when the air con. went out!). This one is quite refreshing, and packs even more of a punch than the original!
Stockholm \"75\": In a shaker half-filled with ice cubes, combine the vodka, sugar, and lemon juice. Shake well. Pour into a cocktail glass. Top with Champagne and garnish with an organce twist.
Depth Charge: Very easy on the taste buds, but 2 is usually enough to blow your head off.
Light Green Panties: The shot should look light green with a thick consistency. The Grenadine should appear as a thin red smear down the inside of the glass. Should taste like a mint girl scout cookie.
San Juan Cooler: Fill a highball glass with ice Add rum and dry vermouth Fill with pineapple juice and serve
Sinfonian: This is the official drink of Phi Mu Alpha Sinfonia, the Professional Fraternity for Men in Music.
Kahlua Twist: Chill all ingredients well before using them in this drink. It tastes much better when cold. If in a rush, put mixed drink in freezer for 5-10 minutes, stir again, and drink.
Manhattan: VARIATION: No bitters. Substitute a twist of lime for the cherry and orange. Hold the lime twist in a lighted match over the drink and then drop it in. The heat really zips up the lime flavor.
Strawberry Margarita: Rub rim of cocktail glass with lemon juice and dip rim in salt. Shake schnapps, tequila, triple sec, lemon juice, and strawberries with ice, strain into the salt-rimmed glass, and serve.
Chambord Kamikaze: This drink is an adaptation that I learned from a friend in Tacoma, WA. This drink is superior to anything like it because of the fact that using the Absolut Kurant, which is a berry flavored vodka, doesn't kill the flavor of the raspberry taste like a straight vodka does. Also, even though you use Roses lime juice, do not omit the fresh lime. You will definately notice a difference in the taste because the lime juice has sugar in it and it mellows out the sour taste. Enjoy!
Frozen Strawberry Margarita: To make a Frozen Strawberry Daiquiri, do the exact same as above, but replace the tequila with a light rum.
Gorilla Sweat: Suprisingly easy to drink and tasty. Try it without salt.
Vicious Kiss: In honor of a bartender who said vodka makes her vicious!
The Constable Shuffle: Put everything into a pint glass with one Ice Cube. Serve with Wheelchair.
Citrus Smack: Fill glass with ice. Add rum, triple sec, and sour mix. Fill remainder of glass with grapefruit juice. Stir and garnish with orange and lemon wedges.
Nightcap: Heat milk. Add sugar. Add Kahlua. Nutmeg on top. Sleep tight.
Heartbreaker's Special: Great drink from Helsinki City nightlife!
Skittle: Kool-Aid flavor determines what flavor Skittle you get.
Smart Christine: In a shaker half-filled with ice cubes, combine the gin, Benedictine, and orange juice. Shake well. Strain into an old-fashioned glass almost filled with ice cubes. Garnish with the cherry.
Monsoon: You'll positively love it...one of my all time favorites.
Liqiud Mintaero: Mix Creme de Cacoa, Creme de Menthe, Midori, Kahlua and Ice into a shaker. Give a small shake, then add milk and shake well to foam up milk.
Hennyville Slugger: This drink taste very good if you are a brandy or cognac groupie. Very high alcahol content posibilities, but suitable for sociable gatherings, or a night with the boys.
Classic Pimms: Stir, and add a slice of lemon and a few mint leaves.
Kamikaze: Shake all ingredients with ice, strain into an old-fashioned glass over ice cubes, and serve.
Stone Cocktail: Stir all ingredients with ice, strain into a cocktail glass, and serve.
Fat Face: In a shaker half-filled with ice cubes, combine all of the ingredients. Shake well. Strain into a sour glass.
Bot: The easy way to make this drink is to add all listed ingredients with ice into shaker and strain into glass. However, the really slick way is much more impressive: Add cranberry juice, lime juice, tripple sec and only one ounce vodka into shaker with ice. Strain into glass. Then, mix 1 once orange juice with one ounce vodka in a seperate glass. Fill a turkey baister with the vodka/OJ mix, and slowly inject it into the cranberry glass on the bottom. This produces a sort of reverse-layering effect, and also ensures both cranberry and OJ will have the same amount of vodka.
Trashcan Punch: BEWARE: This stuff is strong, and it hits you all at once. If you are trying to get plastered, this will do the trick.
Puffer: Pour the rum, orange juice, and grapefruit juice into a highball glass almost fillled with ice cubes. Stir well. Drop the grenadine into the center of the drink.
Apple Blow Fizz: Shake all ingredients (except carbonated water) with ice and strain into a highball glass over two ice cubes. Fill with carbonated water, stir, and serve.
Split Beaver: Discovered this while trying to come up with a punch for a staff party.
Mandarine Passion: Pour Mandarine Napoleon and gin. Fill with passion fruit juice. Add ice cubes and garnish with a slice of lemon.
Dr. Peppermint: Mix 1 oz. Peppermint Schnapps and 12 oz. of Dr. Pepper together.
The Green One: shake with ice. pour into glass.
Godchild: Shake all ingredients well with cracked ice, strain into a champagne flute, and serve.
Boot Blaster: Great for a hot summer's day. Originated at the "Calgary Stampede" Alberta Canada.
Masala Chai #2: Serves 2. May be served at tea time or at the end of a meal.
Long Beach Iced Tea: Either eat a big meal before having this drink or enjoy this drink with a meal...there's a lot of alcohol in this baby.
Brandy Smash: In an old-fashioned glass, muddle the mint sprigs lightly with the sugar and club soda. Fill the glass with ice cubes. Add the brandy. Stir well and garnish with the orange slice and the cherry.
Liquid Asphault: Just layer chilled Jägermeister on top of sambuca
Ball Of Fun: Drink the fuck up, get fucked up, and break the ball of Fun. (BSU)
Apricot Brandy Sour: Optional: Add 1/2 oz triple sec, or 1 teaspoon grenadine.
A Piece of Ass: Put ice in glass. Pour in shots. Fill with Sour Mix.
Chocolate Slam: First add the chocolate syrup smoothly on the bottom of the glass. Then mix Vodka in followed by Coca-cola
Irish Lady: Basically a St. Patricks Day Green Mimosa.
Monet Carribean Frost: Fill snifter with ice, add rums and vanilla. Then splash with cola and then fill rest of glass with orange juice. Pour mixture in blender and half blend so it isn't too thick. Pour back into brandy snifter and serve.
Royal Gin Fizz: Shake all ingredients (except carbonated water) with ice and strain into a highball glass over two ice cubes. Fill with carbonated water, stir, and serve.
Cactus Juice: Amaretto will sink to the bottom to make an attractive drink. Do not garnish with a cherry, it will ruin the flavor.
Cossak: Originated at a Rocky Horror convention!
Amaretto Sunset: It should taste orangey, almondy, appley, all together. An Autumn drink. You may alternately wish to serve it with an almond or two instead of the orange slice. Should be just a drop below room temp. For fireplace drink, eliminate ice, warm cider for 30 seconds in microwave.
Bourbon Daisy: In a shaker half-filled with ice cubes, combine the bourbon, lemon juice, grenadine, and sugar. Shake well. Pour into an old-fashioned glass. Garnish with the orange slice and the cherry.
Vik 'n' Rum: Pour in the Rum first followed by the 12 oz of Nestea. Make sure you have stirred well. Serve Chilled!!
Grape lemon pineapple Smoothie: Throw everything into a blender and liquify.
Caruso Blanco: In a mixing glass half-filled with ice cubes, combine all of the ingredients. Stir well. Strain into a cocktail glass.
Princeton Cocktail: In a shaker half-filled with ice cubes, combine all of the ingredients. Shake well. Strain into a cocktail glass.
Death of a Virgin: Pour first three ingredients. Then pour orange juice until cup is little more than half filled. Then fill the rest of the way with 7-up and stir until well mixed.
White Lady: In a shaker half-filler with ice cubes, combine all of the ingredients. Shake well. Strain into a cocktail glass.
Epidural: Chill all ingredients well. Mix equal parts and serve in a cordial glass. Or, if you have a test tube or beaker handy, go for it!
Eerie Witch's Brew: A SERIOUS CAUTION: never touch dry ice: use tongs to handle.
Key Largo Kooler: Mix juices and alcohol in mixing tin, flash blend, and pour over ice in a 23 oz. squall glass and float Bacardi 151 rum. Garnish with an orange flag and umbrella.
Spicey Scot: Add equal parts of liqeuer to hot chocolate or cocoa and top with whipped cream and shave chocolate, cinnamon or nutmeg.
Jonesey: In a mixing glass half-filled with ice cubes, combine the rum and creme de cacao. Stir well. Strain into a cocktail glass.
Kahlua #4: Mix first 4 ingredients and simmer them for 1.5-2 hours with occasional stirring. Cool. Add the rest of the stuff. Filter and pour into dark bottles. Keep the bottles in a cool, dark place for 3 months. Shake every day.
Tropical Waters: Pour the Melon liqueur and the Blue curacao into a highball glass. Then add Sprite, and finally the ice cubes
Hard Eight: Yet another of Tony Abou-Ganim's wonderful creations!
Adonis Cocktail: Stir all ingredients with ice, strain contents into a cocktail glass, and serve.
Shoot: Mix everything and shake with ice and strain into a highball glass. Serve.
English Highball: Pour brandy, gin, and sweet vermouth into a highball glass over ice cubes. Fill with carbonated water. Add the twist of lemon peel, stir, and serve. (Ginger ale may be substituted for carbonated water, if preferred.)
Caribbean Milk: I just bought the Malibu and I wanted to make something interesting with it so I did. I came out a KILLER drink, everyone that tried it said it's amazing, and one of the best drinks he every tasted. Just try it and you'll fall in love with it!
Wassail #2: Simmer the nonalcoholic ingredients together for 1-2 hours, then add the wine and rum about 10 minutes before serving (hot).
Blue Ed: Fill 16oz glass with Ice. Add liquor. Fill with sour.
Limoncillo: The #1 bestseller drink in the the Puertoricans beaches!
Cablegram: Stir blended whiskey, juice of lemon, and powdered sugar with ice cubes in a highball glass. Fill with ginger ale, stir, and serve.
Applecake: Shake well and use it as a shot
Klondyke: In a shot-glass pour Jägermeister then Bailey's, do not blend. Drink it all at once.
Doctor: Mixit together and shake it not to hard. Pour it up in a ordinar cocktail glass.
Strawberry Surprise: Add ice and shots in a hurricane or other tall glass. Add 1/2 of the sprite. Shake Well Add rest of sprite. Finished ingredient should look similar to pink lemonade. Enjoy!
Prairie Fire #2: Pour ingredients into shot glass and serve.
Pacific Sunshine: Mix with cracked ice and pour, with ice, into chilled parfait or hurricane glass with a salted rim. Garnish with a lemon wheel.
Southern Joe: Pour both ingredients into shot glass. Consume Repeatedly
Castillian Hot Chocolate: Shift the cocoa and sugar together into a medium-sized saucepan. Dissolve the cornstarch in the water, and stir into the cocoa and sugar until it is a smooth paste. Begin heating the mixture, stirring it with a whisk, and gradually pour in the milk. Continue stirring with the whisk as you bring the liquid to a simmer. Allow the chocolate to simmer for about 10 minutes, stirring often, until it is thick, glossy and completely smooth. Serve steaming hot in coffee mug. Serves six.
Shot of Respect: My local bartender, Rocky, invented this drink when somone spilled on the bar. After that, anytime someone did a party foul they had to take a shot of respect. The amount of tabasco is a direct relation to how bad the foul was.
Kamikaze Kool: Fill a glass with ice. Simultaneously pour in the Vodka and Grand Marnier. Add lime juice. Stir with a straw and serve.
Cokello: Pour into tall glass over ice, fill with Coca-Cola and add a wedge of lemon.
Fruit Loop #2: This one tastes like the milk on the bottom of the bowl.
Lime Bomber: This is our favorite party drink. It has been a hit at every party we have thrown.
Fuzzy Blue Gobbler: Drink it quick and good luck tomorrow! Trust me, you'll see flying turkeys in the morning and you'll say "M.R. Ducks"
Fire Engine: Pour it in a highball glass. Should be severed Cold. Also use Ice if preffered.
Easy does it: Bailey's first. Pour Kahlua. Float Everlear. Bottoms up!
Terminator: This drink was created at Stratton's, Los Angeles, CA. It's now gone but this drink was too good to forget.
Bourbon Black Hawk: In a mixing glass half-filled with ice cubes, combine the bourbon and sloe gin. Stir and strain into a cocktail glass. Garnish with the cherry.
Bourbon and sprite: Pour the bourbon into the highball or whiskey sour glass with some ice. cubes preferred then mix the rest of glass with Sprite or Seven up.
Soapy Tits: Pour Goldshlager, Rumple Minze and Aftershock into mug. Fill with sprite.
Alien Secretion #2: small shaker with ice add ingredients stir strain into shot glass
My Busted Cherry: Can be frozen for later use.
Bazooka Joe: It tastes just like Bubble Gum and my guests like it for an easy shot.
Bloody Mary Jolly style: Add together in a glass, and stir. Garnish with a lemon or lime wedge, chunk of cheese and an olive.
Purple Wind: Pour Chambord into shot glass. Warm sake on stove then pour into chambord. Drink immediately.
Campbell F. Craig: Pour the tequila, orange juice, and pineapple juice into a highball glass almost filled with ice cubes. Stir well. Drop the Chambord into the center of the drink.
Moon Pie: This Moon Pie shot is so good, you'll want a RC Cola on the side! Yee Haw !
Shazam Shooter: Add all ingredients to shaker. Shake to chill. Strain out ice and pour into glass.
Vaina: This cocktail was created for the chilean soldiers in The Pacific War in the 19th century. Obviously the recipe have changed with the time.
Merete: Stir all with ice in a mixing glass. Strain into a cocktail glass, add the cherry, and serve.
Kretchma Cocktail: Shake all ingredients with ice, strain into a cocktail glass, and serve.
Super Sprite: First drink 1/4 of the Sprite and fill up the 1/2l bottle with Hammer Lime vodka and drink!
Nystedt: A nice drink, invented by me on a vacation in Italy. Wonderful during damp, hot nights.
Iguana #2: Mix vodka and tequila over ice in shaker. Add Kahlua. Shake and pour into shot glass.
Sweet-tart Lollipop: Mix all ingredients in a collins glass over ice (if a 32 oz. glass is available double all the ingredients), mix in a shaker and serve with a cherry. Should taste like the old chalky lollipops that cam on a hard plastic stem!!!!
El Nino: In a shaker, mix ingredients with ice and shake vigorously. Strain over ice in a Hurricane glass. Garnish with pineapple wedge and cherry.
South Side: This drink was originated in Long Island, and is only found in the suberbs of New York. It is a summer drink and commonly found at country clubs. Some bar tenders like to make this drink with sour mix. Can be served frozen or on the rocks, but preferred frozen (in blender).
Hard Core: Combine all into a tall glass or wine goblet. Add the Cola last. Hang orange on rim of glass. Taste good but is super strong.
Mister Wu: Pour two ounces of whiskey and ounce of vodka on ice into a regular glass. Add three ounces of lemon-lime soda and a dash of orange juice. Serve and enjoy
Vulcan Mind Meld: Pour ingredients into glass (usually a double shot glass.) Drink quickly.
Fuzzy Bullet: This is prerequesite before hunting "The Elusive Fuzzy Blue Gobbler" Be quick or it will get you!
Lemonsquash a la vermouth: Mix add shake all the ingredience except the soda water in a shaker with ice. Pour it into a collins glas, add up with sodawater. Add ice and a lemon slide.
Winter Parker: A fruity, sweet drink that reminds me of summer walks along Park Avenue in Winter Park, FL. Cherry liqeuer can be used in place of maraschino cherry juice for a variation.
Creative Native: You will love this drink. It will bring out the creative native in you.
Belfast Bomber: Build over ice drink with a straw.
Rangers Rocker: Pour ingredients into mason jar; Stir; Sit down; Drink.
Grand Blue: Serve in an old fashioned glass.
Speedy Gonzales: Pour Bailey's and Amaretto into a shot glass, swish, and throw it back.
Mexican Iceberg: A good taste that will end with a good time!
Frozen Strawberry Banana Colada: Blender until smooth. Pour. Garnish with fresh strawberry.
Turbo: Shake. Strain into ice filled glass. Garnish with a slice of pineapple and a straw.
Nina's Special: This is the creation of the really nice owner of Nina's Restaurant in Ibiza, Spain. Thanks, Nina!!!
Commodore Cocktail: Shake all ingredients with ice, strain into a cocktail glass, and serve.
Stoli Fruit Cocktail: Pour all ingredients together in ice filled glass. Shake and pour back into glass.
The MacAttack: This may not sound very good, but it will surprise you. Prepare to be MacAttacked!
In and Out Martini: Pack Cocktail glass with ice, add a splash of dry vermouth. While glass chills, add gin in a mixer glass with ice. Throw away ice/vermouth in cocktail glass then strain in Gin.
Shitface: Enjoy while you can still see strait!
Death From Above: This drink is extremly harsh, so be careful with it!
Nurse: You can skipp the licor 43 if you like. Take some vanilla-licor insted. Drink invented by a nurse.
Danini: First two shots of Vodka, then the lime juice. Add ice. Top up the glass with Coke.
The Sheedy: As Tastie as friut beverage, and dangerous when consumed in excess. Founding father: David K. Sheedy. Owner of ESPI Productions.
Midori Sunrise: Mix one part of Midori (or equivalent melon liqueor) with one part of Orange Juice. Add a slash of Granadine Syrup.
Purple Hooter #2: I suggest making a large batch ( oz to gallons ) and serve it up at your next party.
Purple Haze #2: WOW!! Tried it in Belfast at the Chicagp Pizza Factory! It is really good, you have to try it!!
Fox And Hounds: In a shaker half-filled with ice cubes, combine all of the ingredients. Shake well. Strain into a cocktail glass.
Dr. Raspberry: Very good sipping drink. Very smooth and goes down easy. I came up with it one night when that was all that was in the house.
Riddler's Shot: Put 2 oz of tequila in a shot glass and then add 13 drops of Tabasco sauce. Then enjoy and be prepared to overheat !
Dream Cocktail: Shake all ingredients with ice, strain into a cocktail glass, and serve.
Crazy Janie: Drink was invented at "64" in the West Village, NYC.
Tie Me To The Bedpost #1: Shake with ice. Strain into sour glass.
Victor: Shake all ingredients with ice, strain into a cocktail glass, and serve.
Sid's Special: Very refreshing on a hot summers day...or night.
Tampico: Has a fairly bitter aftertaste (a la campari and tonic water), but very good. The kind of feeling you get when you have the bitter part of a citrus fruit .. I find it rather enjoyable.
Captain Louie: Mix in order: rum, drop, Kaula, drop
Vodka \"7\": Pour vodka and juice of lime into a collins glass over several ice cubes. Drop the lime wedge in glass and fill with lemon-lime soda. Stir well and serve.
Seizure: Put crushed ice in glass. Pour in ingredients. Mix through a couple times and serve.
Hot Whiskey: Learned in Co. Derry in N.I., autumn '93. The drink is belived to have the power to cure anything: from a solid cold to a broken heart....
Twenty Thousand Leagues: In a mixing glass half-filled with crushed ice, combine all of the ingredients. Stir well. Strain into a cocktail glass.
Nikki Coffee: Great on a cold day or when you can't decide what you want to drink. Great after dinner drink. I like buttery nipples so tried adding coffee. New drink was born!!!
Serpentine: In a shaker half-filled with ice cubes, combine the rum, brandy, vermouth, lemon juice, and sugar. Shake well. Strain into a cocktail glass and garnish with the lemon twist.
Razzberi Kazi: Mix ingredients in a shaker with ice. Pour into chilled cocktail glass.
Purple Helmeted Warrior: If done properly you can end up with a blue/green/pink/purple drink, but it is best to experiment.
Stoli Around the World: This is a very tasty drink invented by the crew at Maloney's Tavern in Tucson, AZ.
Cornholio's Revenge: Pour the malibu rum, banana liqueur, and cherry brandy. Add the ice and sprite. Add lime wedge and serve.
Viagra Shot: Blend, add ice and strain into glass.
Green Apple #2: A bartenders drink at Pat O' Brien's in New Orleans that spread around after work.
Richie Family: A very powerful weapon against hang-overs.
Placenta: Tastes Great! Was discovered at a party by accident.
Royal Caribbean Fuck: Pour all ingredients in shaker over ice. shake well and strain into glass.
Skinny Dip: In a Blender Throw in: 8 scoops of sherbet, 1 can of Fresca and 2 shots of Vodka :o) Yummie Blend till desired thickness
El Floridita: Shake with cracked ice and strain into a chilled cocktail glass. Garnish with a lime slice.
Pimp & Hoe: Pour the liquor first, then the OJ and then the lemon juice. Stir the drink a little bit and then drink.
Sloppy Joe's Cocktail No. 2: Shake all ingredients with ice, strain into a cocktail glass, and serve.
Sunny Mexico: Acknowledgments to Mr. D. Galipos for the idea
Schmooze: Add o.j. and 7-up. Stir. Add ice.
Liquid Cocaine #7: Mix it all together in a champagne flute and drink away!!
Triple Sec Sunrise: If too weak add more Triple Sec. It has a very sweet Tangerine flavor. It is ment for the more social drinkers then for Partiers. It is derived from the stronger drink Tequila Sunrise
Otter Pop #2: Shake and strain, or or build over ice in a pint glass.
Confirmed Bachelor: In a shaker half-filled with crushed ice, combine all of the ingredients. Shake well. Strain into a cocktail glass.
Quick Fox: Layer each ingredients onto one another
Emerson: Shake all ingredients with ice, strain into a cocktail glass, and serve.
Naked Girl Scout: By adding the shot to coffee, a "Steamy Girl Scout" will be made.
Bumble Bee #3: The crushed ice should be added first, followed by the honey. Stir the mixture ass you pur the gin on top, which should be realtively chilled. Add lemon juice to taste, and place a wedge over the rim.
Banana JABS: The Origin: This drink came about while a few friends were at the lake throwing a few back. It began as an experiment of trying to make new and interesting drinks. This was just a fluke that ended up tasting like coconuts, but making someone feel very good all through the night.
Army Green: Made popular by the US Army Military Police stationed on Johnston Atoll in the Pacific Ocean.
Cocomacoque: Combine rum, juice of lemon, pineapple juice, and orange juice. Pour into a collins glass over ice cubes. Fill with red wine, add the pineapple stick, and serve.
'57 Chevy #2: This shot also adapts into one hell of a cocktail. The "'57 Chevy" is currently going fast on Austin's 6th Street.
Mocha Mudslide Milkshake: For a chocolate-flavored shake, use reduced-fat chocolate milk instead of the plain fat-free milk, and reduce the sugar to 1 tablespoon.
Coconut Frappe: Shake or blend until frothy, then pour over ice and garnish with toasted coconut.
Straight Jacket: Created under stressful working conditions in a bar frequented by students.
Brandy Cobbler: In an old-fashioned glass, dissolve the sugar in the club soda. Add crushed ice until the glass is almost full. Add the brandy. Stir well. Garnish with the cherry and the orange and lemon slices.
Time of the month: Mix all the ingredients in a big old fashion. Stir and serve.
H.P.W. Cocktail: Stir all ingredients (except orange peel) with ice and strain into a cocktail glass. Add the twist of orange peel and serve.
Purple Haze #1: Just like a Long Island Iced Tea but sweeter!
Rococo: Shake all ingredients with ice, strain into a cocktail glass, and serve.
Blood of Satan: Very strong shot. Hits like an atomic blast.
Quaker's Cocktail: Shake all ingredients with ice, strain into a cocktail glass, and serve.
Nuthugger: Pour in hard liquors first and lime juice follows. Top with beer until full. Do not stir. Enjoy!!
Western Rose: Shake all ingredients with ice, strain into a cocktail glass, and serve.
Zipperhead: Drink all at once through the straw, like a Mind Eraser for those anti-Kahlua folks. A friend of mine came up with the idea and became fairly popular. Easy to drink, not terribly strong.
The Nog: The ingredients list 4 oz of pineapple juice, but you'll probably never use that much in 1 drink (more like 2 oz). The best drink for hot summer nights, and ladies love this drink!
Uncle Sam: Pour three liquors in a shot glass. Better if chilled, prettier if layered.
Black River Boogie: Combine all ingredients in a glass and mix well
Y2K Shot #2: The taste of this drink is sweet, very sweet, yet quite enjoyable. The color on the other hand is brown, somewhat the color of a rootbeer liquer. The history is all in the name, created by me and served on New Year's Eve 1999, also to toast in the New Year.
The Breakfast Drink: The amount of ingredients can vary depending upon the size of the punch bowl,
Crocodile Cooler: Winner of the "Cheers International Food & Beverage Recipe Competition" in USA, 1993.
East India Cocktail #2: Stir all ingredients with ice, strain into a cocktail glass, and serve.
Mamacita: You may convert this into a frozen drink by mixing it in a blender. You may also substitute cointreau for triple sec or your favorite color of curacao.
Half & Half: An English-free version of the Black & Tan. Good for any true Irish boy or girl!
Pan Galactic Gargle Blaster #2: It's easier to mix up a lot of these at once and pour them as needed that said however, people rarely drink more than two. -- Strange Fact: The ontion in this cocktail is psychic, concentrate upon the onion and order it to float or sink. The onion does as it's told...
Summer Sunset: You can add red maraschino cherries and a lime slice on the edge of the glass to had some colour, plus 2 straws or a swizle stick.
Lay Down and Shut Up!: Shake over ice, Strain and pour.
Brandy Manhattan: Fill rocks glass with ice. Add Cherry juice and cherry, then bitters. Add brandy, then sweet vermouth. Add water, stir.
Mike Samm's Purple Passionate Punch: Add all ingredients into a mixing tin with ice. Place mixing glass on top. Shake vigorously. Spin tin & glass on the palm of hand. Throw behind your back and catch with opposite hand. Repeat in various ways until your customers or guests are mystified. Serve in collins with out a garnish.
J's Tropical Orgasm (JTO): Created by Timothy J. at HOPS of Chattanooga, Tennessee.
Indiana Jones: Add the Whisky and Tequila together, one shot worth combined, then add the same amount of Champagne/Sparkling Wine. Put your hand or a beer mat over the glass, slam it down onto table and then down it in one.
Crack Pipe: Shake with ice, strain into glass
Gin Squirt: Stir gin, grenadine, and powdered sugar with ice and strain into a highball glass over ice cubes. Fill with carbonated water and stir. Decorate with the pineapple chunks and the strawberries and serve.
Spritsor: Add ice, then whisky, fill with soda. Stir and enjoy.
Absolut Anti-freeze: Summer time cooler! Looks like Anti-freeze tastes sweet big kick!
Breath Freshener: A nice shot to freshen your breath before you go talk to that special someone.
Pineappleless Pineapple Juice: It tastes a lot like pineapple juice (with a KICK!!), and it fizzes a bit.
Velvet Hammer #2: Put all ingredients in blender with ice. Puree until smooth.
Cape Breton Lemonade: Mix in the lemonade with the Bacardi Limon. If it is a good lemonade you're using you can mix as much as half & half and not be able to taste the rum.
Calimocho Torreon Special: Fill the highball glass with ice, then half fill it with red wine, and half fill it with coca-cola. Enjoy.
The Ringo: Play some Sargent Pepper's Lonely Heart's Band or other Beatle's favorites and enjoy.
Picon Whiskey: Shake with cracked ice and strain into a chilled cocktail glass. Garnish with a lemon or orange twist.
Fuzzy Banana: I use 2 oz shot glasses to mix this into a glass. You can modify it for a pitcher or punch bowl or whatever, I suppose. My Fiance & I came up with this last New Years, and it was a hit at our party.
Shark Attack Punch: This drink was huge at a bar in Peoria, IL called Gilligan's Tropical Hideaway. It was served in plastic fishbowls. We also poured Grenadine into plastic sharks and dumped them into the fishbowl. Looked just like a SHARK ATTACK! This drink is a guideline, we used blueberry Kool-aid but they don't make it anymore, so I substituted Schnapps. Mix to taste. Happy drinking.
Raspberry Southside: This is just a modification on the traditional Southside (think lemonade for grown-ups). I got the idea at Fazoli's (of all places) where you can have your lemon ice mixed with raspberries. It's a great summer cocktail that you can make with Peachtree instead of the Schnapps. Enjoy!
Blackjack #1: In a shaker half-filled with ice cubes, combine all of the ingredients. Shake well. Strain into an old-fashioned glass.
Flower of nippon: One of the ten best drinks on the world championchip in Tokyo 1972.
Tom Collins: In a shaker half-filled with ice cubes, combine the gin, lemon juice, and sugar. Shake well. Strain into a collins glass alomst filled with ice cubes. Add the club soda. Stir and garnish with the cherry and the orange slice.
Chocolate Bomb: This drink is a direct result of my experiments with the alcohol I drink and common beverages found around my house. It tastes fairly good.. but can taste funny if the milk does not have a strong Chocolate content.
Coffee Nudge: Great for a warm up in the snow or on a rainy afternoon. The best!
Gray Hound: Put a small measure of each ingredient into a shot glass, not completely filling it. Lick the palm of your hand and ignite the drink. Immediately put your hand over the glass. The flames will go out and there will be a vacuum holding the glass to your hand. Take the glass and hand up to your mouth. Take off your hand and deeply inhale the fumes and then knock the drink back.
Dead Lizard: It's a very yummy drink. I was turned onto this drink by my ex girlfriend's brother.
Sex on the Beach Bettsy Style: If I had it my way, this would be James Bond's drink and I would call it the 007.
Snowball: Place one ice cube in the glass and add 1 1/2 oz of Advocaat. Fill up the glass with lemonade and decorate with a slice of lemon. Serve at once.
Amaretto Sour: Shake and strain. Garnish with a cherry and an orange slice.
Lady Cello: To coat rim of glass, first dip in Limoncello, then in a bowl of sugar.
Axe Murderer: This one will knock you off your feet!
Ekatherina Andreevna: Always put ice in glass first to cool the mixers when they are poured.
X.Y.Z. Cocktail: Shake all ingredients with ice, strain into a cocktail glass, and serve.
Shogun: Mix in blender and garnish with orange slice
Wookie: Down the drink a follow with a hearty Chewbacca roar.
Diamond Fizz: Shake gin, juice of lemon, and powdered sugar with ice and strain into a highball glass over two ice cubes. Fill with chilled champagne, stir, and serve.
Limon Delight: Fill glass with ice. Add one shot Bacardi Limon, fill with Sunny Delight or orange juice
Grateful Dead #2: fill glass with ice. Add each liquor, then pour sour mix to top. stir. splash of 7up or sprite.
Joulouville: Shake all ingredients with ice, strain into a cocktail glass, and serve.
Irish Kiss: I invented this drink for people who don't care for the taste of wiskey. This is a very smooth drink. We serve this every year for our annual St. Patricks Day wild game feed!
Berrynice: shake with ice garnish with with strawberry on glass,with another summer berry held on with toothpick
Sunoco 251: Combine the vodka and rum in a shot glass. Add the chartreuse to make the drink a gasoline-type color.
Russchian Comfort: Put ice in the glass, pour the SoCo in, fill with Schweppes Russchian and add a splash of lime.
Papa Doble: I found this recipe in, of all places, Car and Driver magazine. Supposedly, this is was a favorite drink of Hemmingway's while he lived in Cuba. A very sweet drink.
The Crown Cherry: Mix all together in glass with ice.
Patti's Blow Job: Layer in order in shot glass. Drink without using your hands!!
The Usual: This does not work with any other combination brands of Vodka or Vermouth in my experience, but try your favorite brands if you like. Dreamed up by Jon E. C-Note., and kindly in served up as "the usual" by the friendly folks at Jillian's. A UofI Champaign staple.
Cosmo Katie: Chill cocktail glass. Pour ingrediants and ice into mixer and shake well. Serve straight up with a cherry.
Claridge Cocktail: Stir all ingredients with ice, strain into a cocktail glass, and serve.
Egg Nog - Kahlua: Mix kahlua with eggnog in a wine glass and then sprinkle some nutmeg on top.
Flaming Gorilla: Shoot it down and enjoy. Make sure flames have been extinguished first.
Dirty Mexican Lemonade: First add vodka to lemaonade, sprite goes in last. Stir.
Peach 200: Poor the Koskenkorva Peach in a glas, fill up with Coca-Cola and stir. To be served cold, but without ice.
Silver King Cocktail: Shake all ingredients with ice, strain into a cocktail glass, and serve.
Boo Punch: Combine Orange Kool-Aid and Vodka. Add some Jägermeister and it will look and taste scary.
Caroli: In a mixing glass half-filled with crushed ice, combine all of the ingredients. Stir well. Strain into a cocktail glass.
Tossed Salad: Dip rim of shot glass in chocolate syrup. Add Kahlua and Jägermeister. Place arms behind back. Drink shot using mouth only (a la "blowjob").
Soft Serbian: Mix alcohol, then juice and tonic water. Add crushed ice and drink.
Pentecostal: Add Bourbon, Vodka, then 7-Up in Wiskey Sour glass and stir.
Crocodile: Add a few cubes of ice to glass and then add Midori and Bacardi. Fill the rest of the way with the soda and give a little stir.
Tropical Clarkson: Pour out a mug and go park yourself in a snow bank in the north country. Developed by the cold souls of Clarkson University for those weeks where it never gets above -50. For the true effect add an umbrella.
Mandarin Dream: Delightful cocktail at Pier 14 in Myrtle Beach, SC
Freight Train: Pour ingredients into 1 ounce shot glass
Royal Clover Club Cocktail: Shake all ingredients with ice, strain into a whiskey sour glass, and serve.
Southampton Slam: Serve in rocks glass - no ice - Pour both liquors, fill with club soda, roll once Serve with straw
Dirty Grasshopper: Pour Creme de Menthe and Kahlua in a glass over ice. Add milk to fill. Garnish with whatever you'd like. Enjoy!
Jumanji: Origin: From Fuego Salsa Bar in Malta. Created by one of the owners, Mr. Mark Grima.
Broken Down Golf Cart #2: This shot is from Outta Bouns in Banff, Canada!!
English Rose Cocktail: Rub rim of cocktail glass with lemon juice and dip rim of glass in powdered sugar. Shake all ingredients (except cherry) with ice and strain into sugar-rimmed glass. Top with the cherry and serve.
Long Island Milkshake: In a large blender cup, add ice, sugar cubes, creme de cacao, vanilla extract (optional), and the cream or Half & Half. Mix for no more than 5-10 seconds. Then add the alcoholic beverages in no particular order, then hit the "frappe" or "whip" button on the blender for 15-20 seconds, or until you can see that all the ingredients are well-blended, but before you over-blend and start the ice melting too fast. Serve in a tall pre-chilled Tom Collins or similar tall iced-tea glass. No garnish required, serve with a large-diameter straw.
Booger: After the first 1/2 oz drop just a tiny bit of Bailey's on top.
Bag of Filth: The drink of choice by the New Zealand firefighters when off duty. 1 drink = wow. 2 drinks = jesus christ!! 3 drinks = I'll fight any one. 4 drinks = someone call the paramedics.
Madonna: Stir gently. Garnish with a maraschino cherry.
Boomerang: In a mixing glass half-filled with ice cubes, combine the gin, vermouth, bitters, and maraschino liqueur. Stir well. Strain into a cocktail glass and garnish with the cherry.
Dreamy Winter: Add Irish Cream to Hot Chocolate to your taste.
Anime Freak: Shake Tropico, Midori, Cranberry Juice, and 7-Up on the rocks. Serve in a glass with no ice.
Booty Juice: Fill mixing glass 1/2 full with ice. Add all ingerdients. Strain into a rocks glass.
Hot Lemonade: Squeeze the juice of the lemon into a 10-oz. glass. Add maple syrup and a dash of cayenne pepper. Fill with ice water. Stir. Drink.
Nuclear Waste: this drink looks extremely nasty -- but it tastes good. enjoy!
Dick Hard: You might also add 1/2 oz of grenadine for flavor
Lash: Fill tall glass with ice. add Vodka and Amaretto. Fill remainder of glass with Sprite or 7up
Arizona Sunset: Add ice to tall-stemed cocktail glass. slowly pour cream de noyaux over ice until some settels on the bottom. add tequila, triple sec, lime juice, & orange juice into shaker with ice, shake thourghly. pour over ice. Garnish with straw, and lime slice or orange & cherry
Angler's Cocktail: Shake all ingredients with cracked ice, pour contents into an old-fashioned glass over ice cubes, and serve.
Mint Martini: It feels like a toothpaste cocktail! :)
Chocolate Almond: Can also be made with light creme de cacao, but is much better with dark.
Shanghai Cocktail: Shake all ingredients with ice, strain into a cocktail glass, and serve.
Flyin' Hawaiian: Pour Midori, rum, and pineapple juice into shaker with ice. Shake well. Strain into glass over ice. Pour in Sprite and stir lightly.
Lennart #2: I've seen Lennarts done both this way, and with Sprite instead of Ginger ale. I personally like this one much more.
From Russia with Love: Tastes great, and it will mess you up.
Walk the Plank: Pour rum over ice. Fill with 7-Up. Stir. Garnish with cherries.
Saxon Cocktail: Shake all ingredients (except orange peel) with ice and strain into a cocktail glass. Add the twist of orange peel and serve.
Crazy Maker: Holy Jeez, This will make you go crazy!
After Supper Cocktail: Shake all ingredients with ice, strain into a cocktail glass, and serve.
Tequila Screwdriver: This is a very easy drink to make, just like the normal screwdriver, except with Tequila. Enjoy.
Island Tide: This is not too strong, and very fruity, women seem to love it for some reason. :) Good luck, and cheers!
Sugared Rose: Shake and strain cranberry vodka into a sugar rimmed cocktail glass. Add a splash of lemon juice and cranberry juice. For decoration, insert a stirrer through a slice of lemon to bridge over the glass.
Petticoat Lane: In a mixing glass half-filled with ice cubes, combine the gin, vermouth, and Campari. Stir well. Strain into a cocktail glass and garnish with the lemon twist.
Haacker Special: Put vodka in glass, put in sugar and the crushed ice with the lime cubes and stir all until all sugar is dissolved
Texas Tumbleweed: This is basically an alcoholic milksake. Very tasty!
Dr. Daniel: Put ice in glass. Pour in ingredients. Gently swirl to mix. Drink.
Mexicana: Shake with ice and strain into cocktail glass.
Urban Violence: Put some ice in your favorite glass. Add liquor. Fill up remainder with strawberry/orange/banana and stir. Enjoy.
Charles Cocktail: Stir all ingredients with ice, strain into a cocktail glass, and serve.
Red Apple: Shake all ingredients with ice, strain into a cocktail glass, and serve.
Pick Me Up Jose: Lay shot glass in a CLEAN ash tray right side up, and start to pour the drinks into te glass till they overflow into the ash tray. then light the liquer on fire, blow it out, take the shot from the shot glass, then drink out of the ash tray. ENJOY
Chocolate Rum: Shake all ingredients with ice, strain into an old-fashioned glass over ice cubes, and serve.
Raging Indian: Mix a lot and mix in shaker. Pour shot.
Spic: Invented in the back seat of a '95 Nissan Pathfinder on January 7, 2000. "Pick 'em up!"
Volga Boatman: Combine the orange juice, vodka and kirsch in a mixing glass and add the ice cubes. Place a shaker on top of the glass and, grasping them firmly together with both hands, shake vigorously. Remove the shaker and strain into a cocktail glass.
Arctic Mouthwash: This drink tastes almost like Blue flavored Kool-Aid, with a little kick. Enjoy!!!
Bionic Beaver: It tastes like fruit punch. I got this from a bar in Plattsburgh. It tastes great, and packs a hell of a punch.
Corkscrew: In a mixing glass half-filled with ice cubes, combine the rum, peach schnapps, and vermouth. Stir well. Strain into a cocktail glass and garnish with the lemon twist.
Damn-Your-Eyes: In a mixing glass half-filled with ice cubes, combine the rum, Dubonnet, and vermoth. Stir well. Strain into a cocktail glass and garnish with the lemon twist.
The Head: Invented by Heather Yurcak at Riverside Golf Course in Cambridge Springs, Pennsylvania. Tested and approved by Brad Wheeler as a fruity cocktail.
Green Widow: This drink was made by two American high school students on an exchange trip in Germany. The drink should be green at the time of consumption.
Backseat Boogie #2: This drink was made when Dan, Freddy and JP went to an open bar and there was five minutes left before it closed, they each order a vodka-cran and gin-ginger, to make it go down fast to have more, they mixed the tow together and were pleased with the mix. Hope you enjoy too.
Dick Deming Martini: Invented by Mr. Deming from Maine.
Turkey Trot: Mix with a stirrer in a pitcher then pour over ice into glasses. A Thanksgiving tradition for the truly disfunctional family!
Rummple: Tastes like pineaple juice with a splash of rum, but it's just well hidden.
Snowball #3: mix together into a double shotglass
BearCat Special: Put both in shot glass, mix, and down.
Cancun Coffee: Moisten rim of coffee mug with lime and dip rim in sugar. Pour liqueurs into mug and fill with coffee. Top with whipped cream.
Lemonade: For a fizzy lemonade you can substitute club soda for water.
Cookie Dough: Layer Amaretto above Bailey's Irish Cream, then add various pinches of Cinnamon. Serve once cinnamon clumps begin to settle into the liquor.
Harley Davidson #1: In a mixing tin add bailys and midori over ice stir and strain into 4oz bucket and top with Jägermeister
Rum Old-fashioned: Stir powdered sugar, water, and bitters in an old-fashioned glass. When sugar has dissolved add ice cubes and light rum. Add the twist of lime peel, float 151 proof rum on top, and serve.
The Piledriver: Add 1/3 rum,1/3 vodka , and combine coca-cola and orange juice to fill glass. Add ice if you have room!
Lasseman's Partysaver: A very yummy Drink - especially if you don't want to taste the Ouzo...
Dark and Stormy: You can substitute any dark or spiced rum . Pour rum over ice, add ginger ale, stir.
Russian Sunset: Mix vodka, triple sec, and sour mix in shaker with ice. Strain into chilled glass. Add a dash of grenadine to the top and swirl slightly. Optional garnish of cherry and orange slice.
Malibu Snapper: A really good friuty rum drink that was made by accident, by my best friend and I.
Flying Monkey: Makes a great drink at parties and is a big seller a shooter bars. BOTTOMS UP - SLAM IT BACK.
Green Dinosaur #2: Combine all ingredients and mix well. Add ice and drink up.
Igloo Sue: Fill glass with ice or snow. Pour in lemonade. Add Vodka. Splash in grenadine (it should seep to the bottom).
Smith and Wesson: Variation apparently uses carbonated water instead of Pepsi. This drink is essentially a Smith and Kearns with the added vodka.
Green Gulf: Shake with ice. Add creme de mente.
Ethel Duffy Cocktail: Shake all ingredients with ice, strain into a cocktail glass, and serve.
Pour the ingredients in a glass, stir.
Nalgaa: Get a glass with 4 ice cubes, pour cherry liqueur into the glass, followed by the Campari. Add 7-Up and serve.
Straight Law Cocktail: Stir ingredients with ice, strain into a cocktail glass, and serve.
Buddy: This drink tastes like a Strawberry Starburst with a twist.
Sammensurium (Mix up): Because of its weight, the grenadine will sink to the bottom.
Tripwire: This is what we drink at the bar crawls in D.C. and Philadelphia. If mixed well and kept on ice the vodka is not noticed. It is easy to drink several eight ounse party cups and not notice the affect coming on. We call it tripwire because of the fact tht you don't perceive your impending drunkeness until it hits you suddenly and you fall over!
Blue Moon Martini: Shake with ice and strain into a cocktail glass. Garnish with a twist of lemon.
Kameleon: Looks sorta like a traffic light. When served, stir in front of customer and it turns lime green.
Secret Place: Pour all of the ingredients into an Irish coffee glass filled with crushed ice. Stir well.
Irish Twist: Founded in a bar in San Francisco by 3 Irish emigrants: Peter Phelan - Kildare. Tony Collins - Clare. Mairead Forristal - Kilkenny.
Purple Lei: This drink was invented during a Maui vacation!
Caramel Nut: Combine creme de cacao, caramel liqueur, and vanilla ice-cream in an electric blender. Blend at a low speed for a short length of time. Pour into a champagne flute, garnish with whipped cream and chopped nuts, and serve.
Spiked Cherry: This was invented due to lack of ingredients at a friends' house.
Royal Scandal: Add liquors and mixers into shaker with a few cubes of ice. Shake vehemently and strain out ice. Serve as a shooter.
Pirate Float: Improvised this when certain places stopped serving frozen drinks (i.e. the original Pirate Float) over the winter. This one might even be better!
Peppermint Patty: Put a shot of peppermint schnapps in your mouth. Do not swallow. Squirt chocolate (not too much!) into your mouth. Shake head vigorously and then swallow.
Lassi - Mango: Put it all in a blender and pour over crushed ice. You can also use other fruits like strawberries and bananas.
Avalanche: Mix in highball glass over ice, shake well.
Green Spider: Shot of 151 first then Creme de Menthe.
Polish Professor: Invented by some guys in Tucson, Arizona in 1989 at a hotel party near the U of A campus.
Scarlet O'Hara: Pour 2 oz. Southern Comfort over ice in an 8 oz. glass. Fill with cranberry juice. Squeeze one wedge of lime into drink. Stir and serve.
Alex Chi-Chi: A beautiful cocktail to drink during the summer vacancions.
Evil Slider: Made best with Turkey Hill Iced Tea
Rocky Mountain Bear Fucker #3: The taste is original and goes does fairly smooth, but for the weeker stomach a chaser of some sort is usually required.
Southern Suicide: The grenadine syrup is what gives this drink a unique taste. Cheers.
Topher Special: After three Specials you need to take a manditory break to let the alcohol catch up with you. This drink is strong enough to be dangerous because you cannot taste the Vodka!
Tootsy Pop: You can also stir in the midori, to get a lava lamp effect.
Baltic Murder Mystery: A concoction made especially for a murder mystery party at my house with a Baltic/Scandinavian theme. Judging by the lack of left-overs, and no unmasked murderer, this drink was the "killer".
Dry Rob Roy: In a mixing glass half-filled with ice cubes, combine the Scotch and vermouth. Stir well. Strain into a cocktail glass. Garnish with the lemon twist.
Monkey Brain #1: Fill a shot glass with Apfelkorn almost to the rim. Then, very carefully pour a little Bailey's into the glass. The two liquors don't mix at if poured correctly, and the Bailey's will sink to the bottom as a nasty looking blob, not unlike a brain.
Separator: This drink is basically a white russian with brandy subsituted for vodka.
Kiwi Colada: Pour all ingredients into blender and blend until smooth.
A Southern Screw: Pour over ice, stir and serve.
Gayley Avenue Margarita: This is a strong margarita. But the great mix of the Strawberry mix and the Sweet and Sour Mix make an incredible impression.
Fragile Baby: This is popular with the yachting crowd early or late in the season when it can get chilly on the water in the evening.
Montana Tornado: The taste is very strong. It pretty much makes you shudder in your boots. My fellow drinkers and I thought of this drink one New Year's Eve, and have drank it ever since.
Flying Squadron: First, add some ice. Then, pour in your Jack Daniels. Finally add Pepsi and slosh around to mix. Enjoy your victory drink.
Green Fizz: Shake all ingredients (except carbonated water) with ice and strain into a highball glass over 2 ice cubes. Fill with carbonated water, stir, and serve.
Bombay Cocktail: Stir all ingredients with ice, strain into a cocktail glass, and serve.
Breath Stealer: Sip and breathe deeply. Created by Joe Baur for KYL.
Mosstrooper: I invented this mix to capture the spirit of the mosstroopers, undisciplined 17th century Scottish reivers. Lemonade or just plain lemon juice can be substituted for 7-up.
Cyber Smoke: Blend all ingredients and pour into champagne flute. Add a small piece of edible dry ice.
Cactus Berry: Shake with ice and pour into large salt-rimmed cocktail or margarita glass.
Long Kiss Goodnight Martini: Invented by Charlie the Clam Bartender at Lobster Bob's "Clam Zone", 1000 North Collier blvd, Marco Island, FL 34145. 941-642-0777.
Sour Apple: Drink is also known as a Jolly Rancher.
Frozen Margarita #2: In blender add the can of limeaide. Using the empty can measure the tequila and the triple sec and add to the blender. Blend, adding ice cubes until the drink becomes slushy and holds in peaks. Serves: 4
Carl Johan: Mix. Top with Schweppes. Garnish with lime slice.
Orange Cocktail: Stir lemon juice and orange juice in a mixing glass, strain into a large cocktail glass.
Cramit: Fill and stir, they love the name.
Tangaz\u00e9: Delisous also with a oz of coke.
XYZ: Shake with cracked ice and strain into a chilled cocktail glass. Garnish with a twist of lemon.
Colonial Cocktail: Shake all ingredients (except olive) with ice and strain into a cocktail glass. Add the olive and serve.
Get Jenny: Coors Light or other American light beers are preferrable for their non-imposing flavor. Lime-flavored gin will enhance the drink's alcoholic properties in a psycho-somatic manner. Add a garnish of maraschino cherry with tsp. of it's syrup if the drink is too tart.
Crimson Death: Pour vodka over ice, then add raspberry and fill with Jolt cola.
Burning Nazi: Keep bottles chilled or mix over ice and strain into shot glass.
Marianne: The history and origin of this drink is from a group of creative UC Berkeley students trying to celebrate Marianne's birthday. We have dedicated this drink to her! It is both a refreshing and juicy uplifter, definitely an elegant party drink. Add cake and good music! The amount of champagne and fruit mix can be varied accordingly to personal taste.
Down Home Punch #1: Mix in pitcher with ice, Pour into glass with ice, And enjoy.
Jen's Red: A great tasting shot invented by Jen in the Beacon Hill Pub in Boston.
Rearbuster: Pour tequila and Kahlua into glass. Add ice. Fill with cranberry juice and stir with straw. A lemon wedge and umbrella are a nice touch.
Gin Toddy: Mix powdered sugar and water in an old-fashioned glass. Add gin and one ice cube. Stir, add the twist of lemon peel, and serve.
Resaca Water: Place the vodka, rum and watermelon liqueur with ice in a shaker. Add the pineapple and orange juice and shake. Pour in a hurricane glass with ice in it. Garnish with an orange slice and cherry.
Absolut Sex: Shake Absolut Kurant, Midori, and Cranberry juice in shaker with ice: Strain into rocks glass: Splash of seven on top.Absolut Sex.
Sloe Comfortable Screw Against The Wall: Naming origin: Sloe = Sloe gin, Comfortable = Southern comfort, Screw = Orange juice (ie, screwdriver), Against the wall = Galliano (ie, Harvey wallbanger), With satin pillows = Frangelico, The hard way = whiskey.
Orange Push-up: Combine liquors in a blender. Add a half scoop of ice and blend. Garnish with an orange and cherry flag. So good it will melt in your mouth!!!
Strawberry Dream #2: Smooth strawberry and nutty flavors, made first in November 1999, Coco's in Covington Kentucky
The Red and Black: This shot was made after the '97 Georgia Florida football game. It was made in celebration of the big win over Florida 37-17!
White Lightening: Garnish with a neon lightening bolt. White lightening is the signature drink of OLD GLORY, located in the heart of Georgetown in Washington DC. Ask for Fred and get a free White lightening! We also carry DC's LARGEST BOURBON SELECTION!
Creamy Crispy Crunch: Relaxing smooth taste, can also be served hot with a dash of nutmeg for those cold evenings. Invented in 1998 by Mellissa Amadio.
St. Charles Punch: Shake all ingredients (except port) with ice and strain into a collins glass over ice cubes. Top with port, add the slice of lemon, and serve.
Quarter Deck Cocktail: Stir all ingredients with ice, strain into a cocktail glass, and serve.
Jungle Juice #2: Place all ingredients in the blender jar - cover and whiz on medium speed until well blended. Pour in one tall, 2 medium or 3 small glasses and drink up.
Class Act: This drink is intended as a sipping drink. i.e. mixing with a group of people and casually consuming your drink as the evening goes on. Not intended to be guzzled one after another like you would a beer.
Liquid Jello: You can use other kool-aid, although it is not recommended.
Cream Fizz: Shake all ingredients (except carbonated water) with ice and strain into a highball glass over two ice cubes. Fill with carbonated water, stir, and serve.
Breast Milk: Mix all ingredients in tin with crushed ice. Shake, strain, and serve.
H-Bomb: Dump out six ounces of beer, add vodka, fill up the rest of the beer can with water, mix and let settle
FU2: If done right it will be the best drink you ever made
Special Rough Cocktail: Stir all ingredients with ice, strain into a cocktail glass, and serve.
Cherie: Shake all ingredients (except cherry) with ice and strain into a cocktail glass. Top with the cherry and serve.
Mudslide #1: Mix with cracked ice in a shaker. Serve in a chilled highball glass
Banana Daiquiri: Combine all ingredients (except for the cherry) with 1 cup crushed ice in an electric blender. Blend at a low speed for five seconds, then blend at a high speed until firm. Pour contents into a champagne flute, top with the cherry, and serve.
Southern Peach: add all with ice shack and strain
Creamy Rum Liqueur: Dissolve coffee in water. Mix all ingredient's slowly in a blender. Serve chilled. Keeps, sealed in the fridge, for 2 weeks.
Vampire Juice: Greenish Ooze color should result. Inquire about Vampire club
Scope: Tastes like mouthwash! (For Americans, think of mint flavored Zima (For others, Zima is a malt beverage that tastes like alcoholic soda))
Navy Grog: Fill collins glass with ice. Pour alcohols. Pour juices. Shake Optional. Orange and Pineapple garnish Optional
Almond Joy #2: Fill mixing glass with ice, add Malibu, amaretto, creme de cacao, and cream. Shake, and strain into a highball glass filled with ice.
Blue Goose: Created by Francesco Lafranconi, a master mixologist, and beverage specialist for Southern Wine & Spirits of Nevada and director of the Academy of Spirits and Fine Service.
Nutty Irish Coffee: An amazing after dinner, cozy-by-the-fire drink! Tried it on our honeymoon and have been drinking it ever since!
Napotonic: Pour Mandarine Napoleon and fill with tonic. Add some ice cubes and garnish with orange peels.
The Wedge: Pour over ice in a highball glass. Stir.
Butt Fucks: We were goofing off at a party one night and we started mixing different things and came up with this.. It pack quite a punch. Very smooth and tasty.
CT: First time I tried this drink was actually in Cognac, the town that has given its name to the drink. CT is of course short for Cognac & Tonic, and is basically just replacing the gin in Gin&Tonic; with cognac. And please don't use your best cognac for this!
Jaguar: Mix in highball glass. Ice is optional.
Naughty Angel: White and creamy (angelic) with a little punch (naughtiness) to it.
Log Cabin: Shake all ingredients but the soda with ice. Strain into highball glass. Fill the glass to the top with the orange soda.
Glam Trash: Tastes like a liquid jolly rancher fire stick. Don't let the beer fool you. Everyone cringes at the ingredients, but have had no one complain after the first taste.
Schnappster: Mix together and have a good time.
Kahlua Madness: Put Kahlua in the glass. Put vodka in the (same) glass. Put tonic in the (same) glass. Suck from the bottom up with two straws.
The Party Girl: Amounts can be altered according to your taste/tolerance
Apfel Orange: Mix the ingredients, add a couple of ice cubes. Put a slice of orange or lemon (any fruit will do!) on the rim of the glass.
Jihad: It's packed with a religious punch! POW!
Canadian Hunter: Mix together in shot glass and "discharge" into mouth!
Stubborn Italian: Pour one shot Sambuca, add a splash of Galliano on top. Light on fire and drink it.
The King Of Denmark: The King of Denmark is actually the name of a traditional anise sweet which is very popular in Denmark.
Joan Mir\u00f3: Source: The Book "Els coctels del Boadas"
Hot Dick #1: Pour liquors into large irish coffee mug. Add enough strong hot coffee to fill mug. Top with whipped cream if desired, garnish with chocolate sprinkles or butterscotch sprinkles if desired.
Orangatang: Place all ingredients in the blender jar - cover and whiz on medium speed until well blended. Pour in one tall, 2 medium or 3 small glasses and drink up.
