Baby Eskimo: Leave ice-cream out for about 10 minutes. Add ingredients in order, stir with chopstick (butter knife or spoon works too). Consume immediately and often. Nice and light, great for following a heavy drink.
Cherry Sling: Pour brandy and lemon juice into an old-fashioned glass over ice cubes and stir. Add the twist of lemon peel and serve.
Jeyplak Cocktail: Stir all ingredients (except cherry) with ice and strain into a cocktail glass. Top with the cherry and serve.
Pink Clyt: This drink is really the brain-child of three people: Dean Roth, Stephanie C. Spatzer, and Jeff Rossini.
The Valentine: Mix in all ingredients and stir
Orange Whip: "Orange whip?...orange whip?...Three orange whips!" - John Candy from The Blues Brothers movie
Killer Bee: Pour both liquors in a shot glass.
San Diego Seabreeze: Build all ingrediants in a collins glass, cover, shake and serve
Drunk on Christmas: The color of 'Drunk on Christmas' makes the title. The drink itself is sweet, light, and powerful! A great holiday whiskey drink for those who can get plowed without embarassing themselves.
Hot Spot: Very spicey, Cool down with a beer. I got this drink from my halfbrother
Bourbon Flip: In a shaker half-filled with ice cubes, combine the bourbon, egg, sugar, and cream. Shake well. Strain into a sour glass and garnish with the nutmeg.
Winky: Add wink to gin, stir, add ice if desired.
Summer Martini: Make sure all ingredients are cold! Serve shaken, straight up with a twist.
Dew-Driver #2: A word of caution. This is pretty strong, but doesn't taste like it. If you see the 1/5 going down in less than an hour or so, stop for a while. Chances are you are already pretty drunk and it just hasn't hit you yet.
Fruit and Sherbet Punch: Just mix all the liquids together, and float the sherbert in the punch just before serving.
Jogeir: Mix lime vodka, absolut citron and juice together and put it in a shot glas, then add galliano right before serving. Shoot it.
Arkansas Razorback: The ice is just to get it cold and the shaking is to make it froth. Don't worry if it doesn't stay frothy.
Washington Apple: Shake with ice and strain into a chilled shot glass.
DeRosier: In a shaker half-filled with ice cubes, combine all of the ingredients. Shake well. Strain into a cocktail glass.
Pineapple Power: Place all ingredients in the blender jar - cover and whiz on medium speed until well blended. Pour in one tall, 2 medium or 3 small glasses and drink up.
Santa Maria: Especially appropriate for Columbus day celebrations.
Great Grapes: Place all ingredients in the blender jar - cover and whiz on medium speed until well blended. Pour in one tall, 2 medium or 3 small glasses and drink up.
Coconut Toastie: Combine all ingredients (except coconut) in an electric blender and blend at a low speed for a short length of time. Pour into a chilled champagne flute, garnish with shredded coconut, and serve.
Crimson Coma: Pour vodka over ice, then add raspberry and fill with Coca Cola.
Caribbean Queen: Fill glass with handful of ice and add ingredients. Then mix.
Golden Fizz: Shake all ingredients (except carbonated water) with ice and strain into a highball glass. Fill with carbonated water and serve.
Power Russian: After the drink is mixed, you can either add the ice, and blend again, or simply pour the drink over the ice. Then you can either add the ice, and blend again, or simply pour the drink over the ice. This drink should be put in a 8oz mug that has been chilled in the freezer for best enjoyment. The drink should taste sweet, almost like ice cream, if it's not, add more sugar, or milk to taste. *note* For an "added kick" use a bit of bourbon (Jim Beam).
The Mormon Surprise: People who don't like vodka love this drink because the white grape juice covers the unpleasantness of Vodka. -- Origin: As you may know, The Mormon religion forbids consumption of alcohol (along with many other things). So, in order to compensate for this fact, my Mormom friends serve the best punch anybody at their parties has ever tasted. I once asked for the ingredients to this nectar and they gladly gave them to me. A year and a half later lapsed in which time I completely forgot about the punch. However, I instantly recalled the mix at college when I saw the ingredients in my fridge. I made some of the punch right away and, remembering that alcohol makes anything better, added various liquors and spirits to the punch until I found the perfect compliment to surprise Mormons worldwide: vodka.
German Chocolate Cake: Drink can also be made frozen by adding two scoopes of ice cream and one scoop of ice and serve in a tulip glass. Same Garnish. Now it is called a German Chocolate Blizzard. (I used to work at DQ)
Cuba Libre: Pour lime juice into a highball glass over ice cubes. Add rum, fill with cola, stir, and serve.
Block and Fall: This drink is included in the international Bartenders Association's 50 World Cocktails.
Goombay Smash #2: fill tall glass with ice, add all ingredients and shake well.
Soylent Green: Shake well with ice, strain over ice in a medium sized hurricaneglass.
Skier's Toddy: Tia Maria or Creme de Cacao may be used in place of the Kahlua.
Wild Peppertini: This one is an old favorite at Attraction's Bar in Oxford, Ohio!!!
Ortensia: Shake all ingredients with ice. Strain into cocktail glass.
Hawaiian Shooter: Mix with ice and strain in tall shot glass.
Just a Moonmint: Place all ingredients in the blender jar - cover and whiz on medium speed until well blended. Pour in one tall, 2 medium or 3 small glasses and drink up.
Double Gold: Keep goldschlager in freezer. Mix in jigger shot glass. Shot it down and enjoy.
Cucacaracha: Using a jigger glass (3oz shot glass) mix 1/3 of each part then top with club soda. Cover and shake lightly.
Mountain Cider High: A great fall/winter seasonal drink, when Apple Cider is easily obtained.
Black Russian: Pour ingredients over ice cubes in an old-fashioned glass and serve.
Kick yer Ass Sas: Pour shots and soda over ice in mason jar or antique glass and experience a taste of the old west.
Loud-Mouth: This is a Winter drink which can only be consumed outdoors preferbly in an alpine environment. It is should be consumed in small swigs from a French Canteen type of devide and only after a epic day of skiing...Why yes it's strong but you'll be the better for it.
Blue Devil Cocktail: Shake all ingredients with ice, strain into a cocktail glass, and serve.
Apple Pie: In a shaker half-filled with ice cubes, combine all of the ingredients. Shake well. Strain into a cocktail glass.
Watermelon shooter #1: I don't know how, but it tastes similar to a watermelon.
Grass Skirt: In a shaker half-filled with ice cubes, combine the gin, triple sec, pineapple juice, and grenadine. Shake well. Pour into an old-fashioned glass and garnish with the pineapple slice.
Acid Cookie: A good shot for someone who wants a strong shot but doesn't like a strong taste.
Kentucky Colonel: In a shaker half-filled with ice cubes combine the courbon and Benedictine. Shake and strain into a cocktail glass. Garnish with the lemon twist.
Amaretto Sunrise: Mix together the amaretto and orange juice. Pour into glass and then add the grenadine untill you see the sunrise.
Swamp Juice: In a normal glass, add everclear and then vodka. Nearly fill with orange juice, and then add blue curacao until the entire drink turns a nice shade of green.
Deep South: In the never ending quest to find new ways to drink rum, this is one of my favorites to start hte night. Of course I always end up with the rum and coke in hand, this is too much work to make when you are drunk!
Shark Tank: Served at Norm's Beer and Brats, Superior, WI. Grenadine is poured into the mouth of a plastic shark, which is then placed tail-down in the drink. When patron is seated, they remove the shark and plunge it head-first into the vodka/lemonade mixture. Gives a nifty "blood" effect. Very sweet drink. Use caution with the straw, or the vodka will lay you out.
Green Dinosaur #1: If it is made correctly drink should be smooth, about like drinking mountain dew
Malibu juice: Put 3 shots of the rum in a glass, fill the rest of the cup with the juice.
Texas Apple Delight: This is a great drink to have at a party with friends. It will also keep you from getting a hangover the next day!
Leap Frog: A smooth drink that was invented by a patron taste great when stired becomes the color of a tree frog thus the name.Make shure patron stirs the drink. I would limit them to 4 a night.
Why Not?: Shake all ingredients with ice, strain into a cocktail glass, and serve.
Rum Rickey: 1. Fill mixing glass with ice 2. Add light rum and lime juice and sugar syrup 3. Shake 4. Strain into a collins glass filled with ice 5. Fill with club soda. 6. Garnish with a wedge of lime.
Peach Margarita: Pour tequila, peach schnapps, and sweet & sour over ice. Add grenadine and stir slightly. The drink should fade from yellow to red. You can also put ingredients in a blender with ice for a frozen version.
The Shanaynay: Mix the water and rum, add powdered lemonade mix to taste. Stir and enjoy!
Dixie Stinger: In a shaker half-filled with ice cubes, combine all of theingredients. Shake well. Strain into a cocktail glass.
Bourbon and Branch: Pour the bourbon and water into a highball glass almost filled with ice cubes.
Doctor Dawson: In a shaker half-filled with ice cubes, combine the tequila, lemon juice, sugar, bitters, and egg. Shake well. Strain into a highball glass almost filled with ice cubes. Top with the club soda.
Coco's Cocktail: Mix in a shaker and serve with a slice of lime
Sidecar Cocktail: Shake all ingredients with ice, strain into a cocktail glass, and serve.
The Green Mile: I did not invent this. A local restaurant created martinis named after the movie nominated for Academy Awards. It is very good.
Hawaiian Screw: pour over ice in regular glass. Add pineapple and orange juice to taste. Sort of like a regular screwdriver except with a tropical twist! Can also use orange-strawberry juice or any kind of funky fruit combination!
Eye of the Storm: Add lime juice, then THE CAPTAIN, then the Coca-Cola. Stir gently so you don't kill the carbonation. Enjoyed most after several weaker drinks.
Yellow Bird: Pour all the alcoholic ingredients in a highball glass, Stir Sour mix in a mixer and fill the glass.
Rum and Coke: For an extra kick, use Bacardi 151. If you want a lime taste, use Bacardi Limon.
Tweetie Bird: Triple Sec or Contreau may be substituted for the Grand Marnier
Quick Fuck: Tipped back slower then a normal shot.
Green Orange: Pour the Pisang Ambon into a glass, of the approx. size 1 dl. Slowly pour the OJ into the liquor. No stirring... Enjoy !
Sue Riding High: Let the hot chocolate cool to room temperature. In a shaker half-filled with ice cubes, combine the rum, creme de cacao, and hot chocolate. Shake well. Strain into a cocktail glass. Drop the cream into the center of the drink.
Zinger: Very good if you like surge and peaches. Try mixing a shot of Strawberry Schnapps too. Just add it to the other two.
Leatherneck: The amount of Tabasco decides the punch involved in the drink - the bigger men need more Tabasco. The drink is from the Dry Bean Saloon in College Station Texas (Next to the Dixie Chicken). Only in Aggieland!
Turlock Bulldog: This drink is submitted by Turlock high class of 1994 by Trevor Dewar.
Skinny Dipper: Mix ingredients and serve in a tall glass over ice.
Blackula: Blavod is the new Black Vodka. Longbranch mix is a spicy Bloody mix and it makes a smooth dark Bloody on a Sunday morning.
The Pineapple Drink: This drink was accidentally discovered by 5 drunken college students who had nothing better to do. Rum can also be replaced by vodka if desired.
Feel The Burn: Layer all ingredients and light on fire to warm. Blow out flame and drink in one gulp.
Compadre: In a mixing glass half-filled with ice cubes, combine all of the ingredients. Stir well. Strain into a cocktail glass.
This is a simple but a very smooth and refreshing drink. I came up with it while working as a banquet bartender at a hotel near the beach in Southern California. In the summer some functions were held outside where it was very beautiful overlooking the ocean but could be quite warm. On hosted bars some guests (especially women) who were not big drinkers but wanted to join in the festivities would ask for a drink which was not very strong in alcohol or liquor taste. So I came up with this recipe which I received many compliments on. If you want to add more of a jolt to it, just bump up the amounts of vodka and triple sec.
Inverted Pyramid Martini: This drink was created by Keith Orr for the professional premiere of Larry Dean Harris' play, "The Inverted Pyramid". A staple at the \aut\ BAR in Ann Arbor, Michigan.
Monk's Butt: Better with dark Creme de Cacao, but you can use the light stuff, too. Very sweet, good for after dinner.
Yolanda: Shake all ingredients (except orange peel) with ice and strain into a cocktail glass. Add the twist of orange peel and serve.
Golden Margarita: Using a blender will work. Just don't blend it too long so you end up with a slush.
Nuts and Berries #3: mix all the ingredients, and shake well.
Cherry Flip: Shake all ingredients (except nutmeg) with ice and strain into a whiskey sour glass. Sprinkle nutmeg on top and serve.
Tropical Lifesaver #1: Fill glass with ice. Then add the Malibu and Midori. Then fill the remainder of the glass up with Pineapple Juice. Shake and enjoy!!
Jens Special: A friend named Raine thought me how to make this, Once I tasted it I got stuck and now I allways drink it.
Long Island: Just mix the ingredients and enjoy it.
Under Current: I was bored at work one night behind the bar and some friends and I made it up, it tastes kinda fruity really sweet. We created it about four years ago and it is very popular in Richmond, VA.
Leap Year Cocktail: Shake all ingredients with ice, strain into a cocktail glass, and serve.
Frizzy Punch: This is a must at all parties.
Mandarin Sunrise: This drink is very smooth and easy to drink, the ladies love it. Plus it packs a pretty good kick. For a special occasions top with grain alcohol and light before serving.
Blue Balls: Mix all ingredients. Chill with ice and strain into a shooter glass!
Candy Corn: Although it doesn't taste like candy or corn, it looks like a candy corn. Origin unknown.
Sparkplug: Shoot this shot and watch the sparks fly!!
Cape Codder: Pour Vodka and Cranberry Juice into a High Ball glass over ice. Stir well, add the wedge of lime, and serve.
Irish Cream - Bailey's #3: Blend all ingredients in a blender until mixed well, serve cold. Stores up to two weeks in the fridge, but it's never lasted that long :-).
Lloyd Special: Pour into shot glass and shoot it back.
Three Wise Men: layer in a shot glass, Jimmy, Jack, then Johnnie
David Bareface: In a shaker half-filled with ice cubes, combine all of the ingredients. Shake well. Strain into a cocktail glass.
Crimson Sunset: In a shaker half-filled with ice cubes, combine the gin and lemon juice. Shake well. Strain into a cocktail glass. Drop the grenadine into the center of the drink and float the port on the top.
Chiquita: This drink tastes like milkshake, and should be drunk several in line.
Scorpion's Tail: Mix over ice, shake and serve.
Izayoi: In a shaker half-filled with ice cubes, combine all of the ingredients. Shake well. Strain into a cocktail glass, and serve. (Name mean: 16th moon in Japanese)
Campesina: I'm a bartender in a mexican restaurant in Lisbon, Portugal. I needed to use all the tequilas we've got so I created this mexican version of Caïpirinha. Enjoy it.
Purple Mask: Shake all ingredients with ice, strain into a cocktail glass, and serve.
Blue Monkey: Tried this drink at Mardi Gras and it is one of the best drinks I've ever had.
Strawberry Stripper: If you use the clear strawberry schnapps add a dash of Grenadine. Great Drink for the Ladies!
Dark'n Dirty: Mix like ordinary drink and serve with ice.
Shotgun Lou: Mix brandy, milk and brown sugar on ice. Top with ginger ale
Volcano: The raspberry liqueur and blue curacao may be heated, lit to flame, and extinguished with the champagne.
Forbidden Smoke: Blend all ingredients and pour into cocktail glass. Add a piece of edilbe dry ice.
Snowplow: Origin: A cold winter night. A fine festive or cold weather beverage.
Cable Guide: Refreshing summer drink. Sweetness can be varied depending on amount of mango used.
Banana Boat: In a 12 Oz glass, place banana and ice. Combine the other ingredients in another glass and pour over the ice. Add the pineapple slice and enjoy.
Highland Fling Cocktail: Stir all ingredients (except olive) with ice and strain into a cocktail glass. Add the olive and serve.
Purple Problem Solver: Dark rum can be used but the drink probably won't end up purple. This is also a good drink to ask for if you're trying to stump the bartender!
Italian Limoncello: Remember that the longer the zest and vodka mix rests, the better the taste will be.
Earth Shake: Place all ingredients in the blender jar - cover and whiz on medium speed until well blended. Pour in one tall, 2 medium or 3 small glasses and drink up.
Sunshine Smile: Shake Vodka and Orange Juice. Top glass with Champagne. Garnish with a slice of orange.
Milk Tooth: Made by me one boring Monday afternoon at work at Brannigans Croydon. Remember I've been famous for years just show me the money.
Monkey's Lunch: If you're a banana lover then this is the drink for you! Trust me. I'm one of them!!!
Black Maria: Combine and stir all ingredients in a brandy snifter. Add cracked ice and serve.
Pina Colada #1: Put all ingredients into an electric blender with 2 cups of crushed ice. Blend at a high speed for a short length of time. Strain into a collins glass and serve with a straw.
The Feckin Bolox: take the galliano and fill one third of the glass. then using a table spoon measure out the bayleys and pour onto the galliano, so that they are seperated. finally, clean the spoon, and measure out the coinraux pour onto the bayleys again so that they are seperated. take a match or lighter and light the cointraux, take a straw and place at bottom of glass and drink.
Latin Manhattan: If you like this, try the Cuban Manhattan!
Fart In the Ocean: Add tequila and chilled 7-UP to glass, drop in one sweet prune in each glass. Add ice if you wish.
Duke's Nightmare: Made by myself and the lead singer of the band Dukes Nightmare on Sept. 15 1999.
Silk Panties: Combine over ice, strain into shot glass.
Strawberry Bolle: Sprinkle strawbs with sugar, add one bottle cider. Chill for several hours. To serve, pour into large bowl with ice, add the rest of the wine. Serve in small wine glasses.
Bloody Brain: Looks horrid: tastes like chewing an entire pack of Juicy Fruit gum at one time.
Long Island Iced Tea (By a Long Islander: Mix ingredients together over ice in a glass. Pour into shaker and give ONE brisk shake. Pour back into glass and make sure there is a touch of fizz at the top. Garnish with lemon.
G4: Absolutely amazing taste, somewhat similar to a B52 but much cheaper to make. Invented by a creative university who got tired of beer.
Suicide #1: This drink has a bitter cruel taste, that only the most hard-core will enjoy. I've only seen it served in a few bars in Reykjavik, Iceland, where the most hard-core spend their days.
Scotty Boy: Pour a lot of kurant into ice filled glass. Fill with sour mix. Shake, always shake and add a splash of soda. Enjoy.
All Puckered Out: Add ice and a shot of pucker to the highball glass. Fill with ginger ale. Squeeze a wedge of lime and toss it in the glass. Stir.
Copper Cocktail: Shake rum, chartreuse, campari, and bitters in ice filled cocktail shaker. Strain into chilled cocktail glass. Sqeeze lime and drop into drink.
Blindside: Drink should taste like ruby red grapefruit juice.
Siberian Slider: mix equal parts into a tumber filled with cracked ice. Stir liberally and sip slowly.
Horny Bull #3: This drink should be drank with caution, as too many (ie. more than one)could be hazardous to the participant's health. These drinks tend to sneak up on a person. Even one who has only had one.
Bushranger #1: In a mixing glass half-filled with ice cubes, combine the rum, Dubonnet, and bitters. Stir well. Strain into a cocktail glass and garnish with the lemon twist.
Cumulus #1: Shake intensily with ice. Serve in frosted glass, and sprinkle with powdered coffee or nutmeg.
Purple Lobster: Can also be served as a mixed drink over ice in collins glass.
The Sabino Special: This drink originated at the Crystal Cocktail Lounge in Montreal courtesy of its star bartender Sabino and thanks to the help of an inside source... Thanks again Amy.
Wild Thing #2: This is a frozen/slush drink -- absolutely incredible! Fresh-squeezed juices MUST be used. Labor intensive, but worth it! Rosewater is usually available at East Indian groceries.
Galliano: Boil water, corn syrup and sugar for 5 minutes. Add the remaining ingredients and stir. Cover and let stand 1 month.
Packerita: To enjoy to the utmost extreme, donn a cheese wedge on your dome and enjoy another Green Bay Packer victory!
Haiku Martini: In a mixing glass half-filled with ice cubes, combine the sake and vermouth. Stir well. Strain into a chilled cocktail glass and garnish with a cocktail onion.
Hot Mulled Cider #1: Dump cider, cinnamon sticks and a couple of teaspoons of nutmeg into a pot over very low heat. Slice oranges (after washing them well!!), and stick whole cloves into the rind, then float in cider as it warms. That's it. Drink when it gets warm. You can dump more cider into it up to a point when the spices get old - then just start again with a new set of spices, and a new orange.
Flamingo Punch: This is a house specialty drink from the Bellagio Hotel and Casino in Las Vegas.
Green Thing: Shake well till it is a cream color and is frothing.
Mint Tea: This drink will cool you off nicely on a hot summer day.
Moonlight: Shake all ingredients with ice, strain into an old-fashioned glass over ice cubes, and serve.
Casino Cocktail: Shake all ingredients (except cherry) with ice and strain into a cocktail glass. Add the cherry on top and serve.
Melya: Brew espresso. In a coffee mug, place 1 teaspoon of unsweetened powdered cocoa, then cover a teaspoon with honey and drizzle it into the cup. Stir while the coffee brews, this is the fun part. The cocoa seems to coat the honey without mixing, so you get a dusty, sticky mass that looks as though it will never mix. Then all at once, presto! It looks like dark chocolate sauce. Pour hot espresso over the honey, stirring to dissolve. Serve with cream.
Frozen Apple: Blend all ingredients with 1 cup crushed ice in an electric blender at a low speed for a short length of time. Pour into an old-fashioned glass and serve.
Tropical Peach Martini: Shake with ice. Strain into cocktail glass.
Peach Daiquiri: Blend Ice until throughly crushed. Add Rum, Peach Nectar, and Schapps. Lightly blend until mixed well. Add Frozen Peaches. Blend until slushy. Enjoy
Red Death #3: Also works great in large batches.
Sugar Kick: Very strong drink (fruit wise). Found this one out working at a Gentlemen's Club. All the dancers love it!
Blimey: In a shaker half-filled with ice cubes, combine all of the ingredients. Shake wel. Strain into a cocktail glass.
Almeria: In a shaker half-filled with ice cubes, combine all of the ingredients. Shake well. Strain into a cocktail glass.
Dead Dog: Add in the order given and enjoy!
Turkeyball: The more amaretto used, the sweeter the drink is.
Bumble Bee #2: A German resturant I go to makes this. The Barenjaeger is a German honey liquor, which should be kept in the fridge. It is also good by itself, as a shot. It makes the Jägermeister easier to go down but is very potable!!
Oil Slick: WARNING!! These shots have been known to take a while to "hit" if you know what I mean. Drink more than one at your own damn risk.
Queen Elizabeth: Stir all ingredients with ice, strain into a cocktail glass, and serve.
Strawberry Sombrero: You may use your favorite flavored syrup instead of the strawberry syrup.
Rory O'more: Stir all ingredients with ice, strain into a cocktail glass, and serve.
Brain Hemorage: Pour schnapps into a large shot glass (the measurements may be off a bit, you can experiment). Slowly pour irish cream into schnapps so that it basically forms a "brain" in "formaldihide". Finally, dribble the grenadine (dribbling onto a spoon then into the schnapps helps) directly into the center of the irish cream mass . As the grenadine amount slowly increases it will eventually burst through the irish cream creating a "hemoraging" "brain".
Bora Bora: Prepare in a blender or shaker, serve in a highball glass on the rocks. Garnish with 1 slice of pineapple and one cherry.
Status Quo: Mix everything together and add some crunched ice and olives!
Sweets to the Sweet: Fill glass half way with vodka, fill rest of way with Zima. Then add the lime juice (Rose's Lime Juice works best). Now stir and add the slice of lime.
Pearl Necklace: Mix equal parts tequila rose and bailey's in shot glass, shoot! Also try chilled.
Blue Nut: Pour into a shaker with ice and shake and strain
Eben's Magic Juice (Orange): This mixture came about when my friend and I had way too much 100proof Vodka and only Orange mixers. Be carefull with this stuff tho: if mixed properly, the lack of alcohal taste can be misleading!
Canadian Cherry: Shake all ingredients and strain into an old-fashioned glass over ice cubes. Moisten rim of glass with cherry brandy and serve.
Orange Squash: Put one ice cube in a large tumbler, add lemon juice and orange juice. Stir well. Serve sugar and cold water on the side, so the guest can modify the taste, and a drinking straw and a spoon.
Lemon Lightning: This is a simple drink but yields an intense experience. First one feels a chill on their lips. Next, the sour of the juice makes your taste buds explode. Finally the alcohol imparts a warming sensation to the throat. Caution: These go down so pleasantly it is easy to quickly over do it. Enjoy!
Kahlua Butterball: Born at UCSD (University of California in San Diego).
Electric Lemonade: This drink is a house specialty from the Bellagio Hotel and Casino in Las Vegas.
Dragon's Breath: feel the heat of the dragon's breath, but please extinguish flame before downing this shot.......enjoy
Fifty-Fifty: In a mixing glass half-filled with ice cubes, combine the gin and vermouth. Stir well. Strain into a cocktail glass and garnish with the olive.
Jamaican Rum Punch: I found this recipe in Food & Wine and made it for a Caribbean style block party. This is a great Summertime drink and favorite of any rum lover.
Dirty Nipple: This is a layered shot - the Bailey's must be on top
Chocolate Snow Bear: Combine all ingredients in an electric blender and blend at a low speed for a short length of time. Pour into a chilled champagne flute and serve.
Southern Chase: You can try to layer the ingredients, I've only tried it once. It came to me in a dream, I was in Hazzard County and the Duke boys offered me a drink. They called it a southern chase and then I asked them what was in it. Pretty Wierd...
Hot Apple Pie: Mix Tuaca and Cider in a large microwavable mug. Heat on high for 2 1/2 minutes. stirr again, and enjoy!!!
Copenheering: Mix Cherry Heering and vodka and pour into a ice cold glass filled with crushed ice. Garnish with a twist of lemon peel.
Moninger's Madness: This drink came from a night where we wanted to see what went down the smoothest but got us drunk the quickest. We all decided this one was the best. Have fun with this one and let me know how you like it.
Blue Suede Shoes: Tastes likes one of "The King's" fried banana sandwiches. Looks like the young Elvis' blue suede shoes and has the kick of one of the old Elvis' karate moves.
Sex on the Beach #7: Add all together and stir heavily. You will then serve cold.
The Three Wise Men: The result should taste a little like Scope. History shows that the Three Wise Men drank this to recover from travelling all those miles to shower baby Jesus with Gold, Frankincense, and Myrrh.
The Better Fuzzy Navel: Mix ingredients together, then freeze drink until slushy (usually 2 hours) serve in highball glass, and enjoy!
Arise My Love: Put creme de menthe into a champagne flute. Fill with chilled champagne and serve.
Sever St. Special: One of many successful (or semi-successful) party-time mixing experiments.
Mexican Mountie: Pour each part into a Old-fashioned glass over ice. Top with a wedge of Lime.
Sour mix may be used in place of Lemon Juice. Cherry Coke may be used in place of Dr. Pepper, but not recommended.
Double Pucker: Tastes like a watermelon and apple jolly rancher sucked on together. I was on the drinking side of bar and was trying the sour apple pucker, then a the watermelon pucker and thought they might be good together (especially since there is only 15% alcohol in them) and low and behold it was GREAT now everyone where I bartend (the locals anyway) like them as well and the rest was history.
Created at the Rebar, when asked to make something nasty but nice
Midori Margarita: Moisten rim of cocktail glass with lime juice and dip in salt. Shake ingredients together, and pour into glass filled with crushed ice. Option: Mix above ingredients with one cup of ice in blender for a smooth, "granita" type drink.
NyQuil: Mix and serve to cure the common cold.
Satan's Piss: Pour rum into shot glass. Add tabasco to the top. Serve room temperature.
Muff Diver: Male equivalent of the Blow Job...shoot without hands! (Brought to you by the fine folks at Simrell's in Terre Haute, IN)
Green Monster #2: Created in the Dorms of Northeastern University in Boston, after a Red Sox game.
Creamy Grasshopper: Tastes like a mint chocolate chip shake.
Flirting With The Sandpiper: Pour all of the ingredients into a highball glass almost filled with ice cubes. Stir well.
Wolfsbane: Rub inside of glass with lemon juice, then sprinkle with sugar. Freeze glass to achieve a frosted affect. Shake together the other ingrediants. Pour into frosted glass and enjoy!
Berry-Berry: Place all ingredients in the blender jar - cover and whiz on medium speed until well blended. Pour in one tall, 2 medium or 3 small glasses and drink up.
FuzzB@ll: Drink it like a soft drink, preferrably through a straw. Tastes like a smooth, non-alcoholic peach soft drink.
Cosmopolitan #2: Combine all ingredients in a cocktail shaker with ice. Quickly shake and pour into a chilled cocktail glass. Garnish with a lime twist.
Body Shot: More style than substance...but ohhhh what style !
Tootsie Pop: Should taste exactly like a tootsie pop.
Jellyfish: 1. Pour the Creme de Cacao and Amaretto into a shot glass. 2. Float enough Bailey's on top to cover the shot. 3. Drop a few drops of grenadine into the shot. It looks just like a jellyfish!
Top Shelf Margarita: Fill mixing glass with ice Pour in all ingredients Shake well Pour into salt rimmed glass Add lime wedge or wheel
Mandarine Summertime: Pour Mandarine Napoleon and gin. Fill with orange juice and add a touch of grenadine. Add ice cubes and garnish with a slice of lemon.
The Vaitkus: shake ingredients together and pour into a cocktail glass. drink quickly!
Summer Splash: Mix together in shaker, pour into glass over ice. Lime juice can be added to taste. Makes 2 drinks.
Noche de Phoof: Put ice in a shaker and add ingredients. Shake vigorously. Drink should be frothy on top. Pour into highball glass and garnish with a cherry.
Darth Vader: Collins glass filled with ice add ingredients up to sour mix shake fill with Jägermeister
Southern Santa: Fill highball half full with ice. Add coconut rum. Fill with eggnog. Stir in grenadine to desired red (no more than 1 oz).
Kiss From Rudy: Its a great drink to give to a twenty-first birthday girl .
Midori Sour #2: In a Highball glass, add Midori, fill to 3/4 with sweet and sour, finish by filling to brim with Sprite. Stir.
Liquid Cocaine #1: Combine 4 alchohols and pineapple juice in cocktail mixer with ice. Shake well. Strain into shot glass. Enjoy. It'll get you flyin'!
Buttered Toffee: Pour amaretto, irish cream, and Kahlua over ice cubes. Add half-and-half, and stir well.
Kir Royale: Pour Creme de cassis in glass, gently pour champagne on top
Mona-Lisa: Stir ingredients and poor into a highball glass. Dance while drinking to the song "Mona-Lisa" with Rob'n'Raz. Oh! boy will you get drunk!
Fuzzy Chartreuse: Fill Glass half full with crushed ice Add Midori Then fill glass the rest of the way full with Ginger Ale This should result in a Chartreuse colored drink. Add more Midori to your taste.
Choker: In a mixing glass half-filled with ice cubes, combine all of the ingredients. Stir well. Strain into a cocktail glass.
Miami Vice: Should have seperation in color between mixes. Stir slightly to enhance apperance. Drink up!
The Event Horizon: Called "Event Horizon" because all the chocolate sinks to the bottom of the glass.
Frozen Daiquiri: Combine all ingredients (except for the cherry) in an electric blender and blend at a low speed for five seconds, then blend at a high speed until firm. Pour contents into a champagne flute, top with the cherry, and serve.
Electric Storm: Combine all 4 ingredients into a shot glass and slam it.
Cornwall-Nash: Pour the rum, gin, triple sec, and grapefruit juice into a highball glass almost filled with ice cubes. Stir well. Drop the cherry brandy into the center of the drink. Garnish with the cherry.
Bullshot: Combine the ice, vodka and beef boullion in a mixing glass, add salt and pepper to taste. Stir. Strain into a chilled wineglass.
Jolly Rancher: Shake melon liqueur and blueberry schnapps with ice and strain into an old-fashioned glass over ice cubes. Fill with sweet and sour, add grenadine for color, and stir. Add cherry on top and serve.
Almond Shrub: Put into gallon or half-gallon jar the spirits, thin lemon peel, orange juice, and sugar. Now take the essence of bitter almonds (you can use any amount you please) and add it to the glass of milk. Mix thoroughly and pour into the jar. Cover, put in a warm place (65-70 degrees fahrenheit), and keep it there until the milk has curdled. This takes from one to three hours. Then filter through filter paper and bottle. Rest it for two weeks before drinking it.
Nutz 'n Berries: This shot was taught to me by another bartender. I have been serving it constantly for two years now.
Kill the cold Smoothie: Juice ginger and lemon and add it to hot water. You may add cardomom.
Kavorkien: Combine all ingredients into a mixing tin with ice. Shake and strain. Can be served over ice or up.
57 T-Bird with Hawaiian License Plates: A good choice for a pitcher drink!!
Pure Exstacy: Great for a quick buzz with any girl.
Sailor Venus: Named after the Anime character Sailor Venus.
Chocolate Martini #2: Shake ingredients with ice, then strain into a shot glass.
Black Pagoda: In a mixing glass half-filled with ice cubes, combine all of the ingredients. Stir well. Strain into a cocktail glass.
Tripple Pleasure: dump it in a glass of ice and enjoy
Cliffhanger: mix the kahlua, brandy, and irish creme and garnish with whipped creme. chill
Italian Soda: Vanilla vodka is my personal favorite, but any flavored vodka will work.
Rum Cobbler: In an old-fashioned glass, dissolve the sugar in the club soda. Add crushed ice until the glass is almost full. Add the rum. Stir well. Garnish with the cherry and the orange and lemon slices.
Melzinho: Mix the two ingredients and shake it well.You may serve it pure or with ice on a small cafe glass
Black and Blue #2: Gently shake ingredients with ice and strain into cocktail glass.
Miami Ice: It's a VERY refreshing, Summery Orange-ish Cocktail that was developed by a bartender "LADY FRIEND" of mine because she thought I could use a change from my "NORMAL" *S* Long Island Ice Tea.
Raspberry Cooler: This is a very good drink for the new flavor of Stoli Vodka.
Cibola: Enjoy your search for the Seven Cities of Gold!
The Lindy: You can use Mountain Dew if you want.
Strawberry Zima: Adds a nice, very agreeable flavor to Zima. Especially enjoyable to those who do not enjoy the taste of alcohol.
Bloody Tampon: This drink is sure to give the weak PMS (Pump My Stomach) symptoms.
BlackJack Margarita: This drink can, as any Margarita can, be served strait up, on the rocks, or frozen. Also, when serving straight up or on the rocks, salting the rim is optional. Since I like it on the rocks with no salt, that is what I presented here...
Droog's Date Cocktail: In a shaker half-filled with ice cubes, combine all of the ingredients. Shake well. Strain into a cocktail glass.
Pink Fizzy: It is just like a watermelon Jolly Rancher. Kind of a girlie drink. But I admire the men who drink it. *wink, wink*
Cinnamon Road: Shake with ice. Serve with a slice of dried apple.
Springbok: Traditional South African Shooter. Everybody knows it here but I just thought I'd Share it with everybody out there!
Porch Monkey: Mix all ingredients together over ice. Stir well. Enjoy
Screaming Epsilon: Tastes just like a Orange Julius.
McShake: For a low fat drink just use skim milk and frozen yogurt instead.
Martini #4: In a mixing glass half-filled with ice cubes, combine the gin and vermouth. Stir well. Strain into a cocktail glass. Garnish with the lemon twist or the olive.
Bay Breeze: First, add cubed ice, then add the three parts stoli, then add the pineapple juice and last but not least, add the cranberry juice for color.
Comfortable Screw: Pour Southern Comfort and O.J together and serve chilled
Sweet Satisfaction: Fill highball glass with ice and combine ingredients, stir and enjoy.
Something Peachie #1: serve in a tall glass over ice garnish with a cherry and orange
Bloody Pearl Harbor: stir well with ice. Adding a few drops of hot sauce for flavor is optional.
Hurricane Laura: A College Adventure that ended in the creation of a drink being drank at UMBC.
Metropolitan Cocktail: Stir all ingredients with ice, strain into a cocktail glass, and serve.
Nut Case: Amaretto is made from almonds, frangelico from hazelnuts, hence the name.
Green Apple Cider: Add the Cider to the liqueur. Serve Cold
Jamaican Jambaylaya: This drink came about one of those nights when you have nothing for mix and you have to improvise. Lo and behold the fruit punch proved to be very tasty.
Cranberry Juice Cocktail: Wash the cranberries and put them into a nonreactive saucepan with the water, a pinch of salt and if you wish, the orange slices. Cook over medium heat until all the berries burst -- about 10 minutes. Pour the fruit and liquid into a cheesecloth-lined sieve. Strain the juice to the saucepan, add the sugar and boil for two or three minutes. Taste and add more sugar if it is needed. Cool and chill the juice before serving.
Sunding Over the top: Created by some of the staff at O'learys restaurant in Östersund, Sweden.
Milpsi: Pour milk in first then pepsi and drink before it starts to seperate.
The Naked Lady: Mix in a tall glass and serve over ice.
Two-by-Four: The drink was originally invented in my home town Arendal. Me and a friend was looking for something that really gave a "kick". The name Two-by-Four was given, because its like to be hit in the head with one.
Sangria #2: Peel the apples and cut into small cubes. Peel the oranges, take out the pips, and cut into small cubes. Warm the orange juice, the sugar and the mandarin peels until the sugar dissolves. Mix all the ingredients in a pitcher, except the ice and the soda which you add just before serving. Serve in wine glsses.
Blue Bomber: Developed for the Yukon Sourdough Rendezvous(Winter Carnival) at the Skyjacker Lounge, in Whitehorse, Yukon, Canada. ** For a kicker you can add 1oz of vodka and decrease the 7-Up and Soda water by 1/2 oz.
Foxy Lady: Shake all ingredients with ice, strain into a chilled cocktail glass, and serve.
Four Horsemen #2: A larger glass, such as a 5-oz. rocks glass can be used.
Daiquiri: Shake all ingredients with ice, strain into a cocktail glass, and serve. (See also Frozen Daiquiri.)
Virgin Mary: Shake all ingredients (except lime wedge) with ice and strain into an old-fashioned glass over ice cubes. Add salt and pepper to taste. Add the wedge of lime and serve.
Harley Davidson (the company way): Pour alcohol into the shot glass. Occassionally mix with ice then put into a shot glass. Serve with a lemon wedge.
Golden Eye: pour 1 oz of goldshlager shapps then pour in the baileys. This is a layered drink with the baileys on the bottom. Garnish with a nut in the middle of the drink.
Rooster Piss: Pour both ingredients into shot glass and enjoy!
Pearl Diver #1: Mix all ingredients shake and strain over ice
Once-Upon-A-Time: In a mixing glass half-filled with crushed ice, combine all of the ingredients. Stir well. Strain into a cocktail glass.
Fire on Ice: Pour vodka in a highball glass. Fill balance of glass with cider, stir, and serve. Add ice cubes if you like.
Purple Rain #1: Fill glass with ice. Add gin, fill with cranberry juice and add a splash of Blue Curacao, sour mix and soda. Shake gently, add more Curacao for correct color (should be Royal Purple).
Gege: Björn Brandberg, F.B.S.K., Finland 4. I.B.A.s I.C.C., Danmark 1958 -- Category: Pre Dinner
Dream: Shake and strain into highball glass with ice.
Pond water: Pour 1/2 bottle beer into mug. Fill rest with 1/2 can of Coke.
Gumbys' Ruby Red: If you can find Pineapple Rum use instead of White Rum and omit Pineapple Juice, fill to the top with Ruby Red Grapefruit Juice, stir and add ice.
Aranov: Drink straight from the bottle. Rybb & Decker is great, 'cause it got the fruitpulp.
Headcrack: It taste like a chocolate milk shake and it sneaks up on you.
Slaughtering the Slothman: This drink came about late one night on Smith 2 of Watterson Towers at Illinois State University. (1997-1998) It is dedicated to guys of Suite D, Chris Mansfield from Smith 4, and GoNINzo - The only person who could defeat me (Lucifer) at Quake.
The Lynchmob: People have never said anything other than that this drink is amazing the first time they had it, it is very sweet and people have said it tastes like a pixy stick.
Liquid Heroine: Mix Rumple Minze and Jägermeister in an iced shaker and strain into shot glass
Vodka Ricki: If you mix it right all you should taste is the sprite. It has a bit of a twang to it.
Purple Motherfucker: Combine first five ingredients in a mixing glass half-filled with ice. Shake. Pour into a Collins glass and top with 7-Up.
Orgasmic Fantasy: Pour first vodka, then Bailey's, then Kahlua into a cocktail glass over crushed ice. Add vanilla extract. Stir and serve.
Dirty Bastard: Fill glass with ice. Pour Vodka, Brandy and Cranberry. Squeeze Lime.
Nagel Nectar: This is a great nightcap drink. It is often referred to as the Sleeping Pill.
Russian Boilermaker: Pour cold beer into a large glass, and drop whole shot glass full of vodka into beer. Guzzle as fast as you can, and let out a roar, a REAL man.
Sid Vicious: To create a drink that smacked of skinny, strung-out Britpunks, we came up with this. The poppy seeds are tribute to his heroin habit (poppy seeds cause blood tests for heroin and opium to be positive).
A Night In Old Mandalay: In a shaker half-filled with ice cubes, combine the light rum, añejo rum, orange juice, and lemon juice. Shake well. Strain into a highball glass almost filled with ice cubes. Top with the ginger ale. Garnish with the lemon twist.
B-52 #2: Layer equal parts in the order given. This is the ONLY way to make a B-52
Juicy Tiger: Mix all ingredients and blend well. Add more Coca-cola if needed. Serve with a slice of lemon put a straw in and drink.
The Mad Hungarian: An easy mix of rum and root beer, on the rocks, or without. The rum is a definite 2 shot minimum, as that it blends seamlessly with the root beer. The Captains can be substituted with Malibu rum for a more island flare.
Ebola: The name says it all. Don't expect to survive the next three days.
Linstead Cocktail: Shake all ingredients with ice, strain into a cocktail glass, and serve.
Glow-Worm: This is a party drink. For however many people you are with (5 max.) get the same amount of straws. On the count of three, everyone sucks as fast as they can. The last one done buys the next one!
Chocalate Covered Martini: Chill cocktail glass. Mix Vodka, Godiva, and Vanilla Schnapps. Stir, do not shake. Place single cherry with stem in chilled cocktail glass. Strain over cherry.
Creamsicle: Pour all ingredients into a collins glass over ice cubes, stir, and serve.
Cotton Candy: Taste just like the cotton candy you buy at the fair!
Sweet Dream: Pour 2 oz. of Malibu Rum into a 10 oz. glass. Then fill the rest of the glass with orange juice, strawberry juice, and a splash banana syrup.
Royal Temptation: Created by George Liddle, Great Britain. Winner of the 1993 I.B.A. international cocktail competition.
Jamaican Zombie: The first few sips are potent, just relax and enjoy!
Blonde on Ice: Fill highball glass with ice. Add creme de banane, followed by peppermint schnapps and vodka. Fill with cream. Short shake.
Screaming Orgasm II: Stir together and serve over ice
Maple Lake Irish Shock: From Maple Lake, MN - "Home of the Irish".
Dog Biscuit: Can substitute 1 oz. root beer for 1/2 oz. root beer schnapps.
Hairy Armpit: The Hairy Armpit can be surprisingly tasty, but it depends on fresh ingredients. One made with pasteurized grapefruit juice and old, partially-evaporated ouzo has proven to be an unpleasent experience. Sambuca can be used instead of ouzo, especially if the grapefruit juice used is particularly sour. As far as I know, this drink was invented by James Clippinger and named by Matt Calef. If someone has an earlier reference to either the name or receipe, please let me know.
Alamo Splash: Mix with cracked ice and strain into collins glass.
Bullfrog (The Party Mix): Pour in the soda, and then add the Vodka. After mixing pour in the grain alcohol. Use a knife and cut the lemons and limes and squeeze the juice out of them. store bought lime and lemon juice can be substituted. Now you have a great party drink and should have a good night.
Gin And Sin: In a shaker half-filled with ice cubes, combine all of the ingredients. Shake well. Strain into a cocktail glass.
Glogg Extract: Of course in Norway most people just buy an extract. Anyway, this makes a pretty nice Glogg: Add cloves, cardamon pods, cinnamon, and citrus peel to a glass with a generous measure of snaps (akvavit) or vodka. Let sit for a day or so. This makes a cery nice extract that can be added to any decent red wine. Just heat up the wine slowly (dont let it boil!!), and add sugar and extract to taste.
Iceberg in Radioactive water: Place all drinks into glass and add ice-cream at the end.
Jungle Boogie Punch: Featured on BBC's The Naked Chef with Jamie Oliver.
Ginny's Slammin' Goddess: Usally two of these will get you pretty fuzzy so Be Careful! I got the name idea from my ex-husband who is pagan, when he first tried it he said "Oh Godess thats Good!" so the name goddess stuck and I hope there are one's that will agree.
Photon Torpedo: Mix the Aftershock with vodka, in no particular order.
Gorilla Snot #1: Measure the port into a brandy glass, the pour the Bailey's in. As the Bailey's enters the port it will solidify, forming a glob.
Black Martini #2: combine in shaker. shake vigorously. strain into cocktail glass
The A-Rock: Pour each ingredient one at a time. Rum first, then JD, and finally SoCo.
Big Stick: Build over ice in an 11 oz. glass Looks and tastes like a big stick popsicle
Love Potion #9: Pour Kool-aid into jug, add vodka and rum. add 1 pouch of Kool-aid (cherry or orange) cover and shake give to best looking girl in the room and party
The Big Banana!: From Banana's Bar and Grill, Portsmouth, NH.
Mint Julep #1: Muddle mint leaves, powdered sugar, and water in a collins glass. Fill glass with shaved or crushed ice and add bourbon. Top with more ice and garnish with a mint sprig. Serve with a straw.
Lombomba: pour the ingredients into a norma drink glass with a few ice-cubes. stirr.
Picon Biere: Just mix Amer Picon and beer in a pilsner.
Chocolate Covered Cheery: Very mild and not too sweet!
Mr. Freeze: One of the few drinks that will give you a good breath.
Purple Shroud: Help in creation: B. and J. Bursik.
Green Poison: Created for St Patrick's Day - A real killer!
Falix: Pour the Baccardi into the shot glass. Add the Margarita mix. Top it with lemon juice and shoot it.
Tie Me To The Bedpost, Baby: Mix with ice in a hurricane glass.
Hot Spiced Cider #2: Combine the cider, sugar and spices in a large saucepan. Heat slowly to boiling. Boil 3-5 minutes. remove spices. Serve hot garnished with orange slices, lemon slices, or rings of unpared red apple with whole cloves forced through peel. 16 servings. If desired, chill spiced cider and serve over ice cubes made from apple juice.
Cerebral Hemorage: This is an excellent tasting drink....it can be done with out the Grenadine, if you don't like the taste, but then it's just a "brain". Regardless, this is one of the better drinks around simply for taste....it'll get ya drunk, too, though! Get to it!!!!
San Juan Tea: Shake liquor and sour mix. Garnish with lemon wedge.
The Blue Fin: Shake well with ice. Strain into an ice-filled old-fashioned glass. Garnish with a twist of lemon.
Long Island Sunset: Shake after poured, add a cherry and slice of orange
Southwest Cooler: This drink is best done to taste. If you prefer cranberry juice go heavier on that, and the same with the pineapple juice. The liqueur should be approximately half the amount of the smallest quantity of juice you put in.
Sex on Ice: Combine all ingredients in a blender with crushed ice and blend until the drink has reached the desired consistency. Pour unstrained into cocktail glass and garnish with whiped cream and a cherry.
Tropical Heat: Mix with ice and strain into a chilled cocktail glass. Garnish with a orange spiral.
Owen Moore: In a shaker half-filled with ice cubes, combine the rum, creme de cacao, and havy cream. Shake well. Strain into a cocktail glass. Drop the Curacao into the center of the drink.
Fuzzy Russian: Mix both ingredients in a shot glass. Tilt head back. Swallow.
Key Lime Pie: Compliments of the Merry Go Round Bradenton Fl.
Pimm's Cup: In a highball glass add Pimm's No. 1 and twist of lemon. Fill with 7-up. Garnish with cucumber slice.
Hudson Bay: Shake all ingredients with ice, strain into a cocktail glass, and serve.
Southern Hospitality: There is noting better to warm up with on a cold Carolina night than a hot Southern Hospitality.
Double Intention: The consitency should be quite thick, so you can make an initial, or a love heart while pouring. I've served it to loads of people, but women tend to prefer it rather than men. Hope you like it.
Clara: The amount can be slightly more or less, depending on the drinker's preference. Women tend to prefer more 7-Up and men tend to prefer more beer when asked. BUT, half and half are the ususal measurements. -- This drink is very popular in most of Spain, but especially in Madrid. You order it if you really don't want to drink a lot. It's a very "social" drink. People not used to drinking find it very gentle. In Spain, 7-Up is known, but "gaseosa" is what's used in the drink. My Spanish friends who visit the USA prefer 7-Up to other "gaseosa" substitutes.
Blazing Fire: I made this one up as I went along when a patron asked for "something like a Long Island Iced Tea, but sweeter." It's an easy one to drink, plus the color is very cool.
Mexican H'ors d'oeuvre: Place the jalapeño on the bottom of a shot glass and fill the glass with tequila. Next cover the surface with Tabasco sauce or Red Hot and shoot it. Be sure to catch the jalapeno in your mouth while swallowing the rest. Chew the jalapeno separately, truly savoring the flavor, and swallow it. Olé!
Pr\u00e6rieb\u00e5l (Norwegian version o: Avoid this drink if you've got a weak heart or gastric ulcer.
Duck Fart: layered- bottom to top Kahlua, Bailey's, Canadian Club
Beakers Blue: Add ice cubes, stir, and garnish with cheery.
Black Tartan: Straight: Float all ingredients. -- On the Rocks: Shake with ice and strain over ice
Kokopa: Have to give some credit here to the man who helped me invent this one: Rad Wintle.
Preakness Cocktail: Stir all ingredients (except lemon peel) with ice and strain into a cocktail glass. Add the twist of lemon peel and serve.
Peekaboo: Pour Absolut Kurant and fill with orange juice.
Creamy Tan: Add ice and all the ingredients into a shaker and shake well. Then serve in a large glass.
Sex with the bartender: 1/2 shot of Bacardi limon or Absolut citron may be added to create a "Wild sex with the bartender"
Kelly's Buttery Nipple: It is really good and I have it at KJ's Tavern all the time. I usually have Ken or Joe leave the whipped cream off.
Brevann (Springwater): Everything goes in a highballglass with ice. Pour Seven Up or Sprite on the top Garnish with lemon and some other fresh fruit. Drink with a straw
Georgia Pie: Very good, fruity drink. Never a complaint with this drink.
Virgin Pussy: Just pour in both of the schnapps and add the pinch of sugar.
Golden Furnace: Pour Goldschlagger into a shot glass. Add a splash of Tabasco sauce. Drink and run for water.
Black Forest Shake: If you like black forest cakes, you'll like this very tasty drink. Not a very sweet drink.
Catherine Of Sheridan Square: Pour all of the ingredients into an Irish coffee glass filled with crushed ice. Stir well.
Horny Bull #1: Not for the faint of heart, but definitely for the weak of mind.
Water your melon: It has a very pleasing taste. It was concocted when my best friend and I raided the refrigerator one night! Enjoy!
Sly Goes To Havana: In a shaker half-filled with ice cubes, combine all of the ingredients. Shake well. Strain into an old fashioned glass alomst filed with crushed ice.
Grizzly Bear: Served over ice. Sounds nasty, but tastes great.
Pink Flamingo #2: Has the taste of Nestles Strawberry milk. I've had many blurry nights drinking them! *laughing*
Beach Sunday: Sweet but light summer drink for a day at the beach
Headhunter: Very potent! Learned the recipe at a Polynesian place in Chicago. Drink the Headhunter thru a straw, and soon you will be speaking Pidgin English like a native of Samoa.
Fuzzy Navel #2: Orange juice last, stir, and enjoy!
Black Forest: Like drinking a liquid Black Forest gateau.
Dick-in-the-Dirt: Mix all ingredients in a tall glass on the rocks.
Kurant Shot: Pour Absolut Kurant in a glass and fill up with sprite and ice
Jack your melon: This is a very good drink, believe it or not! This was concocted by my best friend and I while raiding the refrigerator and cupboards. Enjoy!
Scrumdriver: The only reason this drink was created was to be a play on words of screwdriver. It also tastes good and I like rugby so it works out.
Sand-Martin Cocktail: Stir all ingredients with ice, strain into a cocktail glass, and serve.
151 Florida Bushwacker: Combine all ingredients. Blend until smooth. Garnish with chocolate shavings if desired.
Naked Surfer: This was the first legal drink that I had which was served to me by a bartender who has bartended throughout the states.
Bonfire: This shot will make you feel warm inside. It comes from Texas A&M; University Bonfire as a traditional shot in College Station, Texas.
Mudslide #4: The frozen mudlside is great in the summer, came across this mix in St. Martin several years ago. Tried the mix straight up later found it even better. The addition of Grand Marnier adds a little something extra. At a bar, they do not add Grand marnier, so ask for a B-52 with a shot of vodka.
Kiwi Lemon: Mix in highball glass. Stirr. Garnish with slice of kiwi.
Fantasio Cocktail: Stir all ingredients with ice, strain into a cocktail glass, and serve.
Football: Fill the glass with Fernet Branca and drop a splash of cream in. You can always use also foamed cream.
Small Bomb: Serve as a shot or on the rocks.
Blueberry Tea: Mix amaretto and grand marnier in a brandy snifter or glass. Add hot tea to taste.
Orange Climax: Mix one after the other then shake and top with whip cream
Absolute Chainsaw: My recommendation is Budweiser but choose your favorite beer. Randomly made up on a slow night at 4th Street Cafe in Chattanooga, TN
Napalm: Pour into shot glass putting the 151 in last. Light the 151 and Bombs away!!! (Be sure to blow it out before drinking)
California Lemonade: Shake all ingredients (except carbonated water) with ice and strain into a collins glass over shaved ice. Fill with carbonated water and stir. Decorate with slices of orange and lemon. Add the cherry and serve with a straw.
Fruit Tingle #2: When done properly this drink tastes just like the Allen's lollies of the same name.
Love Game: Fill glass with crushed ice. Add batida de coco and then slowly add the Passoa. Now add the grenadine slowly, so is goes under the batida. You should get three layers: red, white, red. ok? Serve orange juice, but let the customer mix it, because the colors will mix.
Feel like holiday: Stir Vodka and Grenadine with ice. Fill in Champagne-flute without the ice. Fill up with champagne.
Maiden-No-More: In a shaker half-filled with ice cubes, combine all of the ingredients. Shake well. Strain into a cocktail glass.
Sex in the Shower: This drink looks like the waters in the Caribbean and is smooth enough to be sipped all night long. Enjoy!
Red Ruby: In a mixing glass half-filled with ice cubes, combine all of the ingredients. Stir well. Strain into a cocktail glass.
Yummy Bidnis: Combine ingredients in highball glass and stir
Jo-Jo Cool-Aid: Fill glass with ice. Add Southern Coffort and Amaretto. Fill the rest of the glass with cranberry juice
Okapi: Created by the bar staff at Storrowton Tavern
Seadoo: Add the vodka to a tall glass with lots of ice.Throw in a splash or two of cranberry juice and then fill with the soda.
Candy Bar: A nutty chocolate drink guaranteed to go down smooth..
Black Russian #3: Stir briefly or until spoon disentegrates.
Presidential Margarita: Taste is smooth provided you don't skimp on ingredents. El Presidente Imported Brandy and a 100% agave tequila are the key components -- Don't be cheap.
Dubonnet Cocktail: Stir all ingredients (except lemon peel) with ice and strain into a cocktail glass. Add the twist of lemon peel and serve.
Algae: Shake all ingredients over ice and pour into highball glass. No garnish.
Tully's Nuts & Berries: Pour ingredients into chiller and pour into shot glass.
Hina Blast: Heat vine, add raisines and boiled. Mix Coca-Cola, tequila, orange juice and add to boiled vine with raisines. Toss bananas with hot red pepper flakes. Pour Don Perignon over bananas. Mix everything thougether and store in a glass jar. Put in a fridge for 8 hours. Served chilled with fresh cherries. Enjoy !!!
Colonial Rummer: Ice rime will form on outside of glass. Protect surfaces with adsorbing coaster.
Micheal's Downfall: Serve and keep extremely cold. It's gooood.
Venezia: Mix. Serve in a chilled cocktail glass. Garnish with orange zest.
Mumbo Jumbo: In a shaker half-filled with ice cubes, combine all of the ingredients. Shake well. Strain into an old-fashioned glass almost filled with ice cubes.
Midori Hack: Shake Midori, vodka, and sweet & sour with ice. Prepare large rocks glass by juicing lime garnish into glass half filled with ice. Strain in the chilled cocktail, add splash of Pineapple Juice, enjoy.
Kahlua #2: Simmer water, sugar, and coffee until the sugar dissolves. Put vanilla bean and bourbon in a gallon jug and add the coffee syrup you just prepared. Cover and let sit one month.
Belinda's Fuzzy Melon: A brand new bartenders first attempt at creating a drink. Looks good to me says her instructor!!! What do you think?
Thai Iced Tea: Combine Thai tea (i.e., the powder), boiling water, and sweetened condensed milk, stir until blended. Pour into 2 tall glasses filled with ice cubes. Garnish with mint leaves. Makes 2 servings.
Sexual Harrasement: Pour all ingredients in a mixing tin with ice. Shake and strain.
Pucker Sucker: Combine ingredients and serve as a shot.
Colorado Bulldog: In a shaker mix Vodka, Kahlua, and milk. Pour into a rocks glass and add a splash of Coca-Cola
Italian Ice #2: This drink was told to me by a Spring Breaker who had learned about it in Tampa, FL. It is a good drink so I thought I would pass it along. .
Root Beer Fizz: In a shaker half-filled with ice cubes, combine the gin, lemon juice, and sugar. Shake well. Strain into a collins glass almost filled with ice cubes. Add the root beer. Stir well. Garnish with the cherry.
Atlas: Mix in shaker with ice. Strain and serve!
Royal Crown Royal: Fill a highball glass half full with ice cubes. Pour the shot of whiskey over the cubes. Add the RC Cola and stir.
Mexican Clit: Mexican Clit brought to you by: Bill Drew Jeremy Tommy
Green Quencher: Best when tonic and vodka are pre-chilled, but not over ice.
Japanese Slipper #1: Just Mix it and drink it slow!
Mojambo Punch: Inveted Out Of Nescesity By The 3 J's In Rochester NY
Zima Blaster: A very simple, but tasty drink.
Temptress: Toss some ice cubes into a glass. Pour in a shot of grenadine and a shot of vodka. Fill with gingerale or Sprite and enjoy.
Hurricane: Shake all ingredients with ice, strain into a cocktail glass, and serve.
Pinky: Pour Rumple Minze into glass first, add Firewater
Anton's Ecto Cooler: Should taste like hi-c ecto cooler. Also works great as a shot.
Southern Comfort Sour: When straining, fill halfway and begin to strain up and down to provide ample amounts of foam
Fastlap: In a shaker half-filled with ice cubes, combine all of the ingredients. Shake well. Pour into an old-fashioned glass.
Whisky Melba: Created by Roar Hildonen for the Norwegian newspaper Dagbladet's summer drink column the summer of 2000 (http://www.dagbladet.no/kontekst/21440.html).
Leprechaun's Gold: Created by Joe and JR on a random Tuesday night at 5 am.
Fin N' Tonic: mix ingredients and serve over ice.
Italian Sunset: Fill a tall glass with crushed ice. Pour the Amaretto over the ice then slowly add the orange juice and top with club soda to form layers. Add a dash of grenadine and garnish with a cherry and orange slice.
Petite Fleur: Created by D. Waidmann, Germany. Winner of the 1959 I.B.A. international cocktail competition.
Gingerbread Man #2: Mix the ingredients with ice in a shaker and pour in glass.
Batida Abacaxi: Place all of the ingredients into a blender. Blend well. Pour into a wine glass.
Amaretto Stone Sour #3: Taught to me in a Memphis Hot Spot.
Smooth Sailin': Mix all ingredients in a medium-sized bowl. Freeze in small airtight containers. To serve, remove from freezer and let thaw about 10 minutes. Scrape or scoop into stemmed glasses. Serve with straws, if desired. Makes 14 six-ounce drinks.
Bentley: Stir Calvados and Dubonnet with cracked ice and strain into a cocktail glass. Add the twist of lemon peel and serve.
Cryonic Shock: I created this drink last summer when I was looking for something strong yet tropical to drink. The high concentration of alcohol in the brandy, ouzo, etc. provided an array of fullness, while the Blue Curacao, lemon and lime juices provided the tropical flavour. The ice is there simply to chill the mixture and so that you experience brain freeze when you drink the thing. If you're still standing up straight after drinking one of these, let me know you're alive and that you had the balls to take the challenge of drinking one. Enjoy!
Aqueduct: A delicious drink with a wild flavor. Party favorite. Enjoy!
Butterbee: Also known as "Cock Sucker" and "Slippery Nipple".
Sex on the Pool Table: Over ice mix equal parts of each alchohol. Top with the grapefruit juice. Shake to blend.
Sex on the Brain: Can also be made into a blended drink by adding all ingredients into a blender and served in a margarita glass. Garnish with only a orange wedge.
Dumbfuck: Put in shot glass and stir
Green Whale: Can also be served as a shot.
Bernardo: In a shaker half-filled with ice cubes, combine the gin, triple sec, lemon juice, and bitters. Shake well. Strain into a cocktail glass and garnish with the lemon twist.
Kinky Orgasm: Just pour all into a higball glass. For the real funky look you can add some strawberries or even have some vanilla icecream in it
Kung Fu: Take the ice cubes and put them in the glass. Then add Jägermeister and Pisang Ambon. Then fill the glass with Cola.
Betsy Clear: Very light and refreshing. A good summertime drink, but tasty anytime.
Plead the 5th: mix all on the rocks,shake,strain,and serve.
Rum Cooler: Pour the rum and soda into a collins glass almost filled with ice cubes. Stir well and garnish with the lemon wedge.
Lemonade Bomb: This drink makes a person drunk VERY fast, take caution. The after effects are not very pretty, but you will have the time of your life!
My Antonella: In a highball glass, combine Gin and Chambord over ice. Stir. Add two Italian green olives and fill with tonic water. Garnish with lime wedge.
Gold Coast: Best if cherry juice is not pre-sweetened.
Sweaty Mexican Lumber Jack: Fill the shot glass 3/4 with Yukon Jack. Next fill the rest of the shot glass with Tequila. Last add 3 to 4 drops of tabasco sause.
Candy Apple: This was one of those late-in-the-party-what-can-we-make-with-what's-left kind of drinks, but it turned out surprisingly well!
Spudgun: mix it together and hurl it down
Satin Angel: mix all ingredients in glass and enjoy!!
Weep-No-More Cocktail: Shake all ingredients with ice, strain into a cocktail glass, and serve.
Rum Runner by Charles: Pour all ingredients in a cocktail shaker, filled with ice. Shake and strain into a cocktail glass.
Tempter Cocktail: Stir ingredients with ice, strain into a cocktail glass, and serve.
Bumble Bee #1: This is a layered shot. First pour the Bailey's into the shot glass. Then take an upside down spoon and touch it to the inside wall of the glass. Carefully add the Kahlua. Repeat this process for the Sambuca. If done properly, the alcohol will stay separated and resemble a bumble bee. Enjoy!!!
Scotch And Water: Pour the Scotch and the water into a highball glass almost filled with ice cubes. Stir well.
Blue Mountain: In a shaker half-filled with ice cubes, combine all of the ingredients. Shake well. Strain into an old-fashioned glass alomst filled with ice cubes.
Red Dragons Breath: Invented at the Red Bear Lounge, Marion Indiana, October 1996, By Dene "The Dragon" Whelchel. -- 7-up & Ice can be added, as this is a very potent drink.
Scurvy: We developed this drink at our schools winter classic weekend it was so good that we drink it whenever we go out.
Banana Cow: Shake rum, creme de banana, cream, and grenadine with crushed ice and strain into a cocktail glass. Decorate with the banana slice, sprinkle nutmeg on top, and serve.
Malibu Wave: Shake all ingredients (except lime slice) with ice and strain into a chilled cocktail glass. Add the slice of lime and serve.
Creamsicle Dream: Put all ingredients in glass and stir. Served as a float drink. Can also be mixed in a blender and served as a shake.
Long Island Iced Tea #6: First, have all the ingridients cold. Mix the liquor in a glass and then add the iced tea, coca-cola and lemon. Be sure to stir or shake. Serve chilled in a big (beer?) glass.
Mexicola: Pour tequila and juice of lime over ice cubes in a collins glass. Fill with cola, stir, and serve.
Pajama Jackhammer: Mix all ingredients and serve with shaved ice.
Tiffany Marshall: Mix as punch. Add orange or lemon slices, or olives.
Evil Corona: Invented in Alaska on a small wallet and a cold winter night.
Submarine (conventional): Start with the gin, then fill up with the tonic water. And last, add the ginger ale.
Hairball: All the different flavors blend very well, and it will give you a swift kick in the butt!
Black Velvet: Pour stout into a champagne flute. Add champagne carefully, so it does not mix with stout, and serve.
Turf Cocktail: Stir all ingredients (except orange peel) with ice and strain into a cocktail glass. Add the twist of orange peel and serve.
Pour liqour in order listed and layer. Serve and shoot
Mudslide #3: Made this when completely drunk at a staff party (after consuming alot of Tequila) I loved it but had to spend the next week trying to figure out what had gone into it! Once made you will see why I called it the mud slide. It looks horrible but just ignore it and drink (through the straw) ENJOY!!!!
Rikkertje: Add some ICE Put in the shaker Shake your ass off
Cinn's Stop Light: This doesn't come out in the order of a stoplight, because of the weight of the ingredients, but that is what we originally called it. This is rather sweet, but good! An old bartender friend, made it for me, because I don't care for drinks that taste like alcohol. Thank you, Chris!
Clove Cocktail: Stir all ingredients with ice, strain into a cocktail glass, and serve.
Scurvy #2: The first entry into our book of 50 drinks named after diseases.
Lost Cause: Pour Malibu, gin, and lime juice over ice. Stir in club soda.
Sammy Special: Be careful as it is deceptively smooth and potent.
Hot Mulled Cider #2: In a large saucepan combine apple cider/juice, brown sugar, and nutmeg. for spice bag, place cinnamon, allspice, and the 1 teaspoon cloves in cheesecloth and tie, add to cider mixture. Bring to boiling. Reduce heat, cover and simmer 10 minutes. Remove spice bag and discard. Serve cider in mugs with a clove-studded orange wedge in each.
Snake in the grass: Shake with lots of ice, strain into glass
Fury: In a whiskey glass with ice, add equal parts vodka and spiced rum, a splash of sour mix, then top off with orange juice.
Dell Boy: Mix all ingredients except Sprite. Pour into Highball glass over ice cubes and fill with Sprite. Garnish with red Cherry and Lime wheel.
Roffsing: Fill half a glass with ice cubes, add Passoa, vodka, lime and pear soft drink. Stir and top with cream. Enjoy!
Ma Bonnie Wee Hen: In a shaker half-filled with ice cubes, combine all of the ingredients. Shake well. Strain into a cocktail glass.
Aladdin Sane: Like the David Bowie alter-ego for whom the drink is named, the Alladin Sane is a superior variation on a timeless classic -- the Cosmopolitan.
Glogg - Grandfather's: Mix wine and spices, and heat it under cover some minutes on low heat - DO NOT BOIL. Add sugar, lemon peel and stir. Keep on heat and covered for a few more minutes. Serve with raisins and almonds. (You have to throw the almonds in boiling water for maybe a minute, and peel of the brown 'coating'. They should be white for use with glogg.) Serve in irish coffee cup.
Grog: Pour the rum and the water into an old-fashioned glass with no ice cubes. Stir well.
Grape Flip: Shake or blend very well, serve icecold in a burgundy glass. If you wish to garnish, use grapes.
Wahoo: Over ice add 151 and amaretto. Top off with pineapple juice.
Capri: Shake all ingredients with ice, strain into an old-fashioned glass over ice cubes, and serve.
Sweet Treat: Adjust measure of one ingredient if you find it too sweet. Hope you like it!!
B-52 #3: Layer the three ingredients in that order. And, I am terrible sorry, this is the only way to make a B-52 the right way.
Fruit Tingle: Pour Curacao over ice in a tumbler. Add Raspberry cordial and Lemonade at the same time so that the combined effect mixes the drink. Consume!!! The drink is meant to taste like the lollies called Fruit Tingles, and it succeeds very well in this..
Sir Francis: First, pour all 3 vodkas over ice in highball glass. Fill with lemonade, top with grenadine, shake & serve.
Tumbleweed: Found at 3 am at a cocktail party. We had the ingredients. It's a keeper.
Skipper's Ripper: Add rum, whiskey, and grenadine to glass. Fill the rest of the way with Coke. Stir once to mix.
San Francisco Cocktail: Shake all ingredients (except cherry) with ice and strain into a cocktail glass. Add the cherry on top and serve.
Captain Morgan's Steamy Applecolada Drea: This very tasty, and warms-you-from-the-inside-out adult beverage started with a request for Spiced Apple Rum at a holiday party. The bartender's interpretation of Captain Morgan's was Captain Morgan's 'Parrot Bay' vs. the spiced rum our favorite pirate is known for. We added the remaining ingredients anyway, and voila--a star is born.
Green Dragon: Shake all ingredients with ice, strain into a cocktail glass, and serve.
Gary's Poison: Pour in Rum and then triple sec. Next pour in OJ and Pinapple. Grab that Gary.
Flaming Yager: Light the Jägermeister on fire and drop it in the glass of Guinness. Now pound it quick. There you go!
Stardust: Fill shaker cup with ice. Pour in all ingredients. Shake and strain into shooter glass of preference.
Apocolypse: Combine alcohol in a coffee mug. Fill with hot chocolate. Garnish with whipped cream.
Screw-Up: Fill glass with ice cubes, add all ingredients, mix then drink!
Surf Rider: Shake all ingredients (except orange slice) with ice and strain into a cocktail glass. Add the orange slice, top with a cherry, and serve.
Sweet Tarts: Add all into Shot glass. Slam the shot glass down as to mix up the ingrediants and give it a fizz. Then just drink it down and enjoy.
Aggie Punch: Straight cranberry juice works just as well, but its not as sweet.
White Bull: Pour ice into glass, add tequila and kahlua, fill with cream, shake and serve.
City Slicker: In a shaker half-filled with ice cubes, combine all of the ingredients. Shake well. Strain into a cocktail glass.
Monkey in a tree: A really tropical taste created by the bartender at The Fontana Elks Lodge, Rialto, CA. Come join us! Tell him you saw it on Webtender and the first one is free!!!
Chocolate Chip: Can be served as a drink or as a shot.
Sea Fizz: Shake with ice and strain into a highball glass and fill with seltzer.
Flaming Lamborgini: In a cocktail glass, mix Kalhua, Amaretto, and Vodka. Float the Chartreusse. In a liqueur glass, put the Blue Curaco and float the Milk. Light the cocktail glass and drink quickly through a straw. When it's almost gone, pour the Blue Curaco and milk into the Cocktail glass and suck until all gone.
Purple Gecko: Shake with ice and pour into salt-rimmed cocktail or margarita glass. Garnish with a lime wedge.
Italian Stallion: I do believe that this is my own creation. Try it, I think you will like it.
Panther: Pour ingredients into an old-fashioned glass over several ice cubes. Stir well and serve.
Poison: mix the Vodka and the Parfait d'Amour in the glass and fill of with Bitter Lemon
The Lady in Red: You will taste a hint of peppermint at first, and then the peach kicks in. It's really smooth.
Good Fortune: This is a house specialty drink from the Bellagio Hotel and Casino in Las Vegas.
Friday Freeze: Designed, tested and appoved by the brave men and women of the West Virginia University Drink Research Center.
Sloe Tequila: Combine ingredients with a half-cup of crushed ice in blender. Blend at low speed and pour into old-fashioned glass. Add ice cubes and twist of cucumber peel.
Martinez Cocktail: Stir all ingredients (except cherry) with ice and strain into a cocktail glass. Top with the cherry and serve.
Coco Channel: Shake all with ice, serve in lowball over ice, or neat in a martini glass.
Ironlung: Toss this one down fast and watch it 'take your breath away'. Surprisingly good.
Stoner On Acid: Recommended as a shooter. Serve cold. Enjoy!
Eskimo Joe: Layer Bailey's First ,milk, Creme de Menthe and Cinnamon Schnapps.
Pink Squirrel #2: Pour ingredients over ice filled glass and shake or stir to mix and then strain.
The Peg: Put ice cubes in glass. Add bourbon, coke and lime juice. Garnish with slice of lime (optional)
Vesuvio: Shake all ingredients with ice, strain into an old-fashioned glass over ice cubes, and serve.
Carabinieri: Shake well with ice, serve in high glass half filled with ice.
William's Rainbow: high ball glas fill it with ice. poor vodka over the ice, then fill up with sprite. poor slowly 1cl blue curacao, after that poor 1cl grenadine. Ready to serv. The guest will now stir it and the drink will turn purple.
Blue Blazer #2: A warming drink on cold winter nights.
Pisang Pistace: The drink taste like Pistace-ice. Espacilly women love this drink.
Robitussin: Stirred, best without the rocks. Tastes just like the real thing
Archbishop: In an old-fashioned glass almost filled with ice cubes, combine all of the ingredients. Stir well.
Fluffy Dog: Two customers from Fairfax England asked me to make their "favorite back home drink".
Burn: You can make a full shot of this, but it goes down VERY hot! Make sure it does not touch your mouth! Just pour it into your throught. Great drink if you are starting to get sleepy at a party!!
Gremlin: Into a mason jar filled with cracked ice, pour 6 oz Canadian Whisky and 3 oz Sweetened lime juice. Stir with a fork.
Green Sneaker: Shake with ice and strain into shot glass.
Tini Rita: Chill martini glass with ice and water. Fill cocktail shaker with ice, vodka, Cointreau, Grand Marnier, lime juice, and sour mix. Shake vigorously until shaker is frosty. Empty martini glass and rim with salt and sugar mix. Pour contents into glass and garnish with lime wedge. Serve.
Bahama Mama Sunrise: Serve over ice in a tall glass
Shake ingredients with ice, strain into a cocktail glass, and serve.
Tropical dream: Shake the three ingredients together and poor in a cocktail glass. Garnish with a red cherry on the rim of the glass.
Chocolate-Mint Martini: Creme de menthe and Creme de cacao amounts may be vaired depending on taste.
Mocha-Berry: you can substitute chocolate liqueur or syrup for the cocoa mix.
Scotch Bird Flyer: Shake all ingredients with ice, strain into a champagne flute, and serve.
Orgasm a la Denmark: Stir it together until it just looks like Bailey's.
Festrus: Created by Bjarne Eriksen, Norway. Winner of the 1973 I.B.A. international cocktail competition.
Peter Pan Cocktail: Shake all ingredients with ice, strain into a cocktail glass, and serve.
Yellow Motherfuckers: It is best to use a large cooler with a spout. The amount of Vodka and Gin you use depends on the size of your cooler. Add the ingredients to your prefered taste.
Bailey's Shake #1: Measurements given above are approximate: you can vary them to your liking.
Fort Lauderdale: Shake all ingredients (except orange slice) with ice and strain into an old-fashioned glass over ice cubes. Add the slice of orange and serve.
Patmcpacke: Throw em all together and stir
Pumpkin pie (tavern style): A favorite at The Tavern in Albany, NY.
Scotch Cobbler: Pour scotch, brandy, and curacao over ice in an old-fashioned glass. Add the orange slice, top with the mint sprig, and serve.
South Padre Island: The cranberry should fload above the alcohol and sour mix with the orange and pineapple bleeding through. This makes for an attractive drink. Actually looks great in a brandy snifter. (The ladies love it)
Amaretto Tea: Pour hot tea into a pousse-cafe glass, using a spoon in glass to prevent cracking. Add amaretto, but do not stir. Top with chilled whipped cream and serve.
Jacobs Haze: Mix vodka, Jägermeister and Red Bull in a glass. Add ice and a slice of kiwi.
Fizzy Fuzzy Navel: An excellent alternative to a mimosa!
Red nail: Mix the vodka and the Campari in a cocktailglass. Put in 4 ordinary icecubes. Let the drink "rest" seven minutes before served.
Special K: Named after a friend of mine, Karen Bregitzer, who helped create the drink.
Beadlestone Cocktail: Stir ingredients with ice, strain into a cocktail glass, and serve.
Muppet: This is a famous drink in all the beaches in Mexico
