Peach Blow Fizz: Shake all ingredients (except carbonated water) with ice and strain into a highball glass over ice cubes. Fill with carbonated water, stir, and serve.
Papaya Milk Splash: This is a popular drink in Taiwan and Southeast Asia. This easy to make drink helps cools and refreshes lost summer appetite. The amount of ingredients can be changed accordingly to taste.
Tanqueray and Tonic: Add ice to glass. Fill 2/3 of the way up with Tanqueray Gin, and the remaining 1/3 with tonic water. Add lime.
Dirty Mother: Pour ingredients into an old-fashioned glass filled with ice cubes, stir well, and serve.
Sazerac Cocktail: Chill an Old Fashioned glass by filling with crushed ice. In another glass mix the sugar with the bitters dissolving the sugar. Add some ice, stirring to chill. In the Old Fashioned glass remove the ice and pour in the absinthe coating the entire glass. Remove the excess absinthe. Add the Rye Whiskey and bitters/sugar mixture. Add the Lemon Twist.
The Seminole: This drink comes from the bars of Tennessee St. at Florida State University. The way to slam it is easy. Everyone has seen the tomahawk chop, so you slam the shot and then you have to do the tomahawk chop right afterward. Use beer as a chaser, or water if you are from the University of Florida. GO NOLES!!!
Croc Punch: This is a great tasting drink spectacular for those patio days. If all portions are mixed properly, the drink should almost appear to glow..
Strawberry Mojito: Copied from The Webtender Forums, message posted April 22. 2004.
Jamaica Kiss: I never thought I would like a sweet drink in hot weather until I found this in Jamaica last winter. It tastes like an adult's idea of a chocolate milk shake. Try one - tasting is believing.
Maxim: Shake all ingredients with ice, strain into a cocktail glass, and serve.
The Nomad: Mix vodka, lemonade and fresca and serve over ice, add dash of grenadine
Purple Hardon: Fill pilsner with ice and build. Serve in frosted glass.
Tequila Sour: Shake tequila, juice of lemon, and powdered sugar with ice and strain into a whiskey sour glass. Add the half-slice of lemon, top with the cherry, and serve.
Matisse: Chill glass. Shake Stoli Oranj over ice. Glaze glass with Chambord. Pour Stoli and garnish with twist of lime.
Hot Spiced Cider #1: Add allspice, clove and cinnamon stick to the apple cider and let simmer for 1 hour (or longer). This may not look like much spice, but it really does make a pleasantly spicey cider.
K-Dawg's Apple Pie: I came up with this after being griped at for not having any dessert for a dinner date. So, I whipped out what I could on the fly and 'voila...instant dessert that'll lead to a gooood date later. Tastes just like a hot, cinnamon-filled, hot apple pie. Enjoy!
Duck Fart #2: Pour Crown in first...Then the Kahlua, and Float the Baileys on top. Then Slam!
North Dakota Special: Use a glass that this will fit in. add one at a time.
Jo Jo Original: This is an old Seattle party drink. It is rumored to have been originaly made with eight(!) different Rums, Amaretto and a Mason Jar by some of this cities best "mixologists". Legend says that it was mixed to appease a large group of people who were tired of drinking "rum and cokes" using only the ingrediants from a bar that was stocked almost entirely with rum. This drink is a great example of how similar ingrediants can be used to create drinks with entirely different tastes. Enjoy.
Frozen Grasshopper: This drink is best served with a spoon and a straw. An oreo cookie can be added for flavor and appearance. My dad used to make me these when I was a kid, he taught me how to make them, hiccup.
Rob Roy: Stir ingredients with ice, strain into a cocktail glass. Garnish with a cherry.
Vaginal Secretions: Mix vigorously, and enjoy until drunk.
Flaming Hurley: Add one shot of Southern Comfort and a splash of Dr. Pepper in a shot glass.
Pink Lemonade: Mix Shake Can be made as an up cocktail or on the rocks
Crack Juice: In a large container, fill half way with ice. Pour in all contents and mix well. You are ready to serve.
Riedinger: Mix rum, Midori, and lime juice in highball glass with crushed ice. Fill glass to top with cola. Garnish with maraschino cherry.
Gogl-Mogl: This is essentially a hot eggnog. You beat an egg, add a tablespoon of honey and a jigger of whisky. Pour this into a irish coffe cup and then fill the glass with warm milk and stir until it's well mixed.
Tiger Jack: This was introduced to me by a friend whos girlfriend came accross it in a London pub. Its great for the beach and a J&D; Team favourite.
White Trash: The crisp snap of ginger ale makes this cocktail perfect for an afternoon nip, or if you're in the mood for something light, fancy and bubbly. Variations: Poor White Trash: Substitute Sprite for Ginger Ale. Trailer Trash: Substitute Lemon-Lime Slice for Sprite.
Glogg #2: Combine all the non-alcoholic ingredients in a heavy enamel or stainless steel saucepan, bring to a boil and simmer 5 minutes. Add the red wine and the port and bring to a boil again. Remove from heat and let steep, covered, for at least 2 hours. Then bring back to a simmer, add the brandy, and heat for 1 minute. If you want to be fancy you can put it into a warmed metal bowl, turn down the lights and ignite it before serving. Serve in irish coffee cup.
Yah Yah: Pour the alcohol (except 151 proof rum) and ice first, then fill with orange juice. Top off with 151 proof rum. Optional, garnish with orange wedge, cherry and pineapple chunk.
Delicias de la Habana: Mix blue curacao with rum and ice. pour it into a glass and add the rest of the ingredients slowly. Granish with a pice of peach, a cherry and a piece of celery.
S2C3: Its a sweet, but yet refreshing taste. This drink was invented by April O'Connor, Ryan Cassidy and Brad Blosat at a Country Club in CT.
Vesper: This drink was created by James Bond in the 1953 book "Casino Royale" by Ian Fleming. It is named for his femme fatale - Vesper Lynd - and Bond remarked: "I never have more than one drink before dinner. But I do like that one to be large and very strong and very cold and very well-made. I hate small portions of anything, particularly when they taste bad."
Aqua: Shake Vodka, Bailey's and Blue Curacao with ice. Pour into glass and fill up with 7-UP.
Mussolini: Basically a Screaming Nazi with a part of Sambuca.
Lunch Box: Fill a pint glass almost full with beer. Then fill the rest with orange juice (careful not to fill it to the top). Then take the shot of Amaretto and drop it in.
Twin Sisters: Shake with ice and strain into shot glass.
Mandarin Split: Created at "Bensons" a night club In Fort Wayne, Indiana
Pirate's Punch: This doesn't sound like it will work, but it does. The sweetness of the rum mixes very well with the punch.
Hillinator: Mix the Captain Morgan, Mountain Dew, and sugar in one class. Pour the fire water into a shot glass. Take the shot, then follow it with the mixed drink. Make sure to drink the mixed drink quickly
Italian Sombrero: Shake amaretto and cream well, pour into a champagne flute, and serve.
Black Bitch: Q: how many trashed blokes does it take too chate de chate de chaytch? A: Two!! -- Steve and Simon@British Embassy Rock Bar, Redhill, Surrey, England .
Raspberry Kiss: Mix all ingredients with ice in mixing glass. Shake and strain.
T-Bone's Cough Syrup: You can add as much Hot Damn as you can stand. This is not a really strong shot but it is fun and unique. I was on a creative kick with Hot Damn 100 and this is the only one I could remember.
Tropical Orgasm #2: Add OJ to taste. The drink can be very sweet if wanted. Peach schnaps, lemonade, and other juices are all optional.
Gooseberry Jam: Jam will never be the same again
Reality Twist: Invented by my buddy Morgan Wesley.
Yukon Dew Me: A taste born of EXTREMELY hoary nights! Best enjoyed with a friend.
Kool First Aid: If done correctly, this drink should fizz. Be sure to shoot this drink quickly, or you'll have a mess and a party foul.
Jocose Julep: Blend all ingredients (except carbonated water) in an electric blender at a low speed for a short length of time. Pour into a collins glass over ice cubes. Fill with carbonated water and serve.
Smashing Pumpkin: small shaker with ice add ingredients stir strain into shot glass
Addison Special: If grenadine or orange juice are not handy, you may substitute with grapefruit juice.
Crushed Orange: Sweet, citrus taste remnisicent of eating a tangerine.
Carribean pineapple: Mix in a lowball glass and serve over ice
Thunder: Shake all ingredients with ice, strain into a cocktail glass, and serve.
Gin Bucket: The best way to drink this drink is to pass the bucket around the room until its finished and eat the cherries.
Monkey Brain #2: SPECIAL EFFECT: Use a large flashlight on the bar and put the shot on top of light.
Frisco Sour: Shake all ingredients (except slices of lemon and lime) with ice and strain into a whiskey sour glass. Decorate with the slices of lemon and lime and serve.
Cloudy Day: This is only for tequila lovers! Though it sounds ok, it is really strong. Not a personal favorite, but must give credit to the flag BEARer at Cal for this one.
The Whole Maryann: Created by Maryann, with the help of her customers at the Spar Tree Resturant and Lounge in Stevenson Washington
Mexican Mouthwash: Pour into shaker chill, and gently swirl together.
Jade: Shake all ingredients (except lime slice) with ice and strain into a cocktail glass. Add the slice of lime and serve.
Wolf (Howlin'): A tasteful drink with a fresh mint flavor.
Zoot: The Jack Daniels will float on top of the drink. It has an interseting colour, and the flavours of Jack, and Gin, go well together.
Sacrilicious: chill and strain into a shot glass
Rocky Mountain Bear Fuck: Mix blue curacao and melon liqueur (cold strain for best results) and top off with 2 splashes of Canadian Club Rye.
Green Apple #1: Enjoy many of these. Taste just like a green apple piece of candy.
Frozen Pineapple Daiquiri: Combine all ingredients with 1 cup of crushed ice in an electric blender. Blend at a low speed for a short length of time. Pour into a champagne flute and serve.
Black Stripe Cold: Pour all of the ingredients into a mixing glass and stir well to dissolve the honey and molasses. Pour into an old-fashioned glass filled with crushed ice. Stir well.
Naked Shake: Just one of the creations invented at The RoadHouse NightClub in International Falls, Minnesota. Bailey's Irish Cream can be substituted for the Swiss Mocha Cream Liqueur.
Brandy Highball: Pour brandy into a highball glass over ice cubes. Fill with carbonated water, add the twist of lemon peel, stir gently, and serve. (Ginger ale may be substituted for carbonated water, if preferred.)
Gorilla Fart #4: This shot is for those gung-ho fuckers that think they can drink anything, a few of these, heavin' is believin'. Have fun. Don't get scared. (In San Antonio lingo: don't puke.)
Rum Punch: Mix all ingredients in a punch bowl and serve.
Screwdriver with Color: Its about 1 part Vodka, 3 part Orange Juice and 1 part Kahlua. You can add more alchol to your prefrence. The ice adds a bit more taste and its nicely chilled.
Bacardi Stinger: Consume slowly, this drink packs a punch.
Cooter Cork: Layer ingredients in a tall shot glass: Grenadine, Chambord, Aftershock and Absolut Kurant. Drink should have varying layers of red.
Magic Punch: fill glass with ice add ingredients then shake
Jamaican Banana: Blend all ingredients (except sliced banana) in an electric blender at a low speed for a short length of time. Pour into a large brandy snifter and add sliced banana. Sprinkle lightly with nutmeg, top with a whole strawberry, and serve.
White Cosmopolitan: Far from the classic Cosmopolitan, but an interesting experiment with the new white cranberry juice.
Surf City Lifesaver: Lots of ice and soda top up in tall glass with cherry and a grin.
Fino Martini: In a mixing glas half-filled with ice cubes, combine the gin or vodka and the sherry. Stir well. Strain into a cocktail glass. Garnish with the lemon twist.
Moon Quake Shake: Shake all ingredients with ice, strain into a cocktail glass, and serve.
Cunnilingus: Mix Bailey's, Peach Schnapps and pineapple juice with ice. Pour in shot glass Top with whipped cream
Fuzzy Watermelon: You can try to replace the peach schnapps with vodka or experiment with other kinds of alcohol.
Bailey's Comet #2: layer in order given, splash 151 on top light on fire, sprinkle cinnamon on top to produce sparks instead of just a flame
Liquid Ecstasy: A sweet summer drink... Thanks to Pangy at The Purple Emerald for the Recipe
666: Very hot and spicy. Will wake up your taste buds.
Fancy Bourbon: In a shaker half-filled with ice cubes, combine the bourbon, triple sec, sugar, and bitters. Shake well. Strain into a coktail glass and garnish with the lemon twist.
Gotland Summer Night: Pour gin, Cointreau and orange juice over ice. Gently pour grenadine along the inside of the glass so it sinks to the bottom.
Dit Kicker: Pour the fruit punch into a glass. Add the Vodka and Schnapps. The correct amount of lemon juice all depends on personal preference. A couple of splashes is a good mix to start with.
Cocoa Chanel: Shake with ice. Strain into a cocktail glass and garnish with a maraschino cherry.
Shalom: Shake all ingredients (except orange slice) with ice and strain into an old-fashioned glass over ice cubes. Add the slice of orange and serve.
Teal Squeal: Combine all ingredients in blender. Blend well. Serve in highball glass. Garnish with pineapple.
IAS-Special: mix aquavit and banana liqueur insert dash with lime fill up with 7-up Served with ice cubes strawberry
Three Musketeers: Shake with ice and strain into a shot glass.
Adam Sunrise: Favorite party drink at Gordon College, Barnseville, GA.
Casino Royale: In a shaker half-filled with ice cubes, combine all of the ingredients. Shake well. Strain into a sour glass.
Shrub: Begin with gentle fruit juices. Put a little less than 1 pint orange juice and the juice of 2 or 3 lemons into a half-gallon or gallon jar. Before squeezing the lemons, peel the rinds very thinly and add them as well. -- Add 2 quarts rum. Cover and let stand for three days. -- Put 2 pounds sugar into 1 quart water and bring to boil. Add the sugared water to the rum and fruit juice, cover, and let stand for two weeks. Then strain and bottle.
Flaming Soda: Originally created at the Coyote Grill, Brisbane Australia. Thanks to Doc Miles for use of alcohol. It certainly took a long time to perfect it, but I think you'll agree its certainly worth it.
Cosmopolitan Martini: Pour all ingredients in mixing glass half filled with ice, shake and strain into chilled Martini glass.
Whiskey Rickey: Pour blended whiskey and juice of lime into a highball glass over ice cubes. Fill with carbonated water and stir. Drop the wedge of lime in glass and serve.
Red Tequila: Eat the lemon and swallow the drink immediately - in one gulp, if you can. See, how many you can take! This is a great, entertaining drink for those who want to expand the macho image of tequila - and themselves!
USD Sunset: This looks like a really bright sunset-it's a pretty drink to serve, and very easy to make.
Caribbean Sunset: Women love these! Becareful to avoid making these when you are busy. If you make one you will almost certainly make ten.
Dewing the Captain: This Drink is dedicated to Mr.Jeff Hoffer
Gorilla Fart #5: Pour 1oz of Yukon Jack into shot glass. Pour 1oz of Bacardi 151 into shot glass.
Black Widow: Twist of lemon & citrus vodka cuts the sweetness of the Opal Nera, but still retains the classic licorice flavor from Sambuca. Hence, a Black Licorice Martini that can kill. Entered in OPAL NERA contest 1989 by yours truly.
Fleet Street: In a shaker half-filled with ice cubes, combine all of the ingredients. Shake well. Strain into a cocktail glass.
Vermouth Cassis #2: Pour the vermouth and crème de cassis into an old-fashioned glass. Add ice cubes and fill with club soda.
Pearl Harbour Revisited: It was known to us as Pearl Harbour (invented while watching a war film) but there already is one, so it's Pearl Harbour Revisited - no relation to the other
Roadrunner Punch: Tastes fruity but packs a punch. A great summer drink.
Tropical Cocktail: Stir all ingredients with ice, strain into a cocktail glass, and serve.
Smurf: This drink is made by Magnus Jones in Norway.
Alley Shooter: Pour all ingredients over ice and mix together. Strain into a glass and shoot it.
The Equator: Layer ingredients in the exact order. Grenadine should sit on top for a little bit before sliding down the inside of the shot glass.
Root Beer Float #2: This is a good drink to start out with, but I wouldn't recomend it toward the end of a night. you can also use 100 proof Root Beer Schnapps.
Purple Haze #3: Add the Amaretto and root beer schnapps, then slowly add the milk. Next add the grape soda to change the color of the milk to purple.
Keith Jackson: Kinda peachy, very sweet...a Simrell's original!
Jake-Knife: Pour Jägermeister in shaker over ice. Fill with coke and shake til your arms are sore. Pour into glass and top with a smidgen of Bacrdi 151. If your feeling mean, feel free to light it!
The Two: This drink has a very unique taste and look about it. The orange juice and the cherry juice are not miscable in one another and the cherry juice settles in the bottom. It forms two seperate and distinct layers hence the name The Two.
Carrot Cake #1: As far as mixing goes, I personally like to use Bailey's Irish Creme and Kuluha. If you love carrot cakes and like the nippy taste they have, add a little more Goldschlager, BUT BECAREFULL! Remember the Goldschlager is powerfull stuff, so even doubling the amount may kill the intended taste.
Puerto Rican Punch: Also known as Panty Remover PJ's Style
Smoked Martini: Has an incredibly smooth "smoky" taste, hence the name. Substitutes for single malt and Absolut not recommended (I've tried)
Jack Rose Cocktail: Shake all ingredients with ice, strain into a cocktail glass, and serve.
Green Monster Party Punch: Mix all ingredients(in any order) in a large tub, which can hold several gallons. Stir so that the Sherbert is completely dissolved. With the exception of the kool-aid and sherbert, as much or little of the other ingredients may be used.
Hawaiian Volcano: This shot can be made into a drink as well.
Swamp Water: in a glass 1/2 full of ice,mix one shot lime vodka, one shot apricot brandy and fill the rest with half sweet and sour and half 7-up. (sorry no fancy glass, we usually get it in the standard plastic cups!!)
Santa Fe: The Santa Fe is a variation on the Margarita for those who like a more bubbly and less sour taste. Cactus Juice is an even better substitute for the Tequila.
This-n-That: Pour ingredients over ice and stir.
Maria Theresa: Combine with ice. Shake. Strain and add ice.
Genuine Singapore Sling: I've got this recipe from Raffles Hotel, Singapore, where it was originally invented. Singapore Sling was created at Raffles Hotel at the turn-of-the-century by Hainanese-Chinese bartender Mr Ngiam Tong Boon. Originally, the Singapore Sling was meant as a woman's drink, hence the attractive pink colour.
Roll Me Over: Add the ingredients to a glass with ice in the order they are listed.
Nham Zoom: Pour a shot of vodka and a shot of brandy into a straight glass. Fill nearly to the top with orange juice. Then take a teaspoon of blackcurrant cordial and gently dribble it onto the surface of the drink so it slowly sinks down to make a lovely pattern. Add a straw, so the drinkee can create swirls if desired.
Black Cow #3: Pour Coke into glass of milk
Malaria Killer: The name is due to the high amount of malaria-protective quinine involved.
Flamingo Cocktail: Shake all ingredients with ice, strain into a cocktail glass, and serve.
Man In A Man Suit: Try it without the fruit juice in shot form taking turns to fill your shot glasss' from the bowl. Originated in a military boarding school in Kent.
Affinity: In a mixing glass half-filled with ice cubes, combine all of the ingredients. Stir well. Strain into a cocktail glass.
Jagnog: Mix in punchbowl or make individual drinks.
Dead Dog Vomit: In a high-ball glass add 0ne shot of 151 rum and then layer each if the other ingredents on top.
Balmoral: In a mixing glass half-filled with ice cubes, combine all of the ingredients. Stir well. Strain into a cocktail glass.
Kris Kringle: Just one of the creations invented at The RoadHouse NightClub in International Falls, Minnesota
A Little Green Man From Mars: Great drink for Saint Patrick's Day. You can find Mint Green Maraschino Cherries at most supermarkets in the canned fruit section.
Slippery Dick: pour over ice in rock glass
Duck's Ass: mix in tumbler with ice strain in shot glass.
Snowboard: This drink tastes real good. The first time i experienced the great taste of the drink was on a cruise to Finland. Check it out!
Sex in the Desert: Nice. To be enjoyed in Baja, California. Cheers.
Turby's Amaretto: No matter what size glass used, make sure the amount of pepsi to Amaretto is at least 2 to 1. Stir the drink lightly and add ingredients to suit your personal taste.
Egg Nog #3: Separate eggs and refrigerate the whites. Beat ylks until light in color. Gradually beat in sugar, then slowly beat in 1 cup of rum. Let stand covered for atleast 1 hr. Add rest of liquor, cream, and peack brandy, beating constantly. Refrigerate, covered, for 3 hours. Beat egg whites until stiff, fold in. Serve sprinkled with nutmeg. Serve in a punch bowl or another medium sized bowl.
Summer Fling: Layer Blue Curacao and Bailey's in a shot glass over crushed ice. Mix to drink.
Velvet Presley: Inspired by the late, great Elvis Presley. All Hail Commander Thorn!
Green Alien: Shake midori, lemon juice and lime juice with ice, pour in a highball glass filled with ice. Fill up with sprite and soda according your taste. Garnish with lime wedge, add straw.
Merry Widow: Stir maraschino and cherry brandy with ice and strain into a cocktail glass. Add the cherry and serve.
Club Tropix: Drink is awesome and looks great, using sloe gin works also instead of grenadine. It will suspend in the drink, looks like an american flag. My husband and I own a nightclub, and I made this up the third night open, never bartended before, didn't even get to taste it until open for almost two months.
Invisible Parrot: Invented by a bored freshman at Texas A&M; University. Thanks, and Gig 'em.
Bronx Silver Cocktail: Shake all ingredients with ice, strain into a whiskey sour glass, and serve.
Fl\u00fcgel: Found in bars in Austria. Makes you happy when your tired after a long day of skiing.
Lawhill Cocktail: Stir all ingredients with ice, strain into a cocktail glass, and serve.
Kentucky Wildcat: From a small bar in DC. Random Bartender that a friend knew.
Sex on the Beach #3: This is how we make sex on the beach in Michigan!
Kursk: Pour vodka and curacao in a glass filled with ice. Fill it up with Battery.
Sugar Daddy: In a shaker half-filled with ice cubes, combine all of the ingredients. Shake well. Strain into a cocktail glass.
Passion Beach: My contibution to all those who dislike "Sex on the beach", a very fresh and fruity drink!
Boku's Blend: This drink is dedicated to Boku, the host of Tropic de Maitai, on 88.3 WAIF, in Cincinnati Ohio.
Dog House Dew: This is a great tasting drink that packs a punch. Enjoy it from the Dog House Boys in West Milford, NJ!!!!
Gorilla Snot #2: Layer the creme de banane over the melon liqueur. Then drop the Advocaat into the middle of the creme de banane. The Advocaat should hang in the middle if poured correctly.
Gun Barrel: Named after a ski run in Tahoe.
Pussy Paws: Stir Cranberry, amaretto, sour mix. Pour into a frosted highball glass over ice cubes. Fill with club soda; add twist of lime. Garnish with a wedge of lime.
Lone Tree Cooler: Stir powdered sugar and 2 oz. carbonated water in a collins glass. Fill glass with ice, add gin and vermouth, and stir. Fill with carbonated water and stir again. Add the twist of lemon peel and the orange spiral so that the end dangles over rim of glass.
Machine: Take this drink as if it were a shot. You will only tast orange juice--enjoy!!
Red Hurricane: Goes down very easily, and gets to work immediately. Be careful with this one!
Dirtiest Ernie: Mix the three ingredients in a shot glass and slam
Rock And Rye Cocktail: Stir all ingredients with ice, strain into a cocktail glass, and serve.
Incredible Hulk #2: For one shot, just mix right in the shot glass. For a larger amount, use a shaker with the same proportions.
Zipper: A unique way to drink this shooter is to ask a man to sit and unzip his fly. The shooter is then placed in his opened zipper. A woman is then asked to kneel in front of him and place her hands behind her back. She must then bend over, take the glass with her mouth and shoot back. Have fun!!
Neon Voodoo: I just made this drink one night with what happened to be in the apartment. These instructions should be close to what I originally made but I was too messed up to remember how many ice cubes I added etc. Enjoy!!!!!!!!!!!
Geisha: mix first two ingredients: fill with pineapple juice.
Frapp\u00e9: Mix together. Blend at highest blender speed for about 1 minute. Pour into a glass and drink with a straw. Notes: This works best if everything is cold (if you make fresh coffee, mix it with the milk and let it sit in the fridge for 1/2 hour. If it is not frothy, add more milk, or even just some more milk powder. The froth gradually turns to liquid at the bottom of the glass, so you will find that you can sit and drink this for about 1/2 hour, with more iced coffee continually appearing at the bottom. Very refreshing.
Cheesecake: I can't serve enough of these shots, they taste exactly like New York style cheesecake!
Grapefruit Teaser: Very good drink with/without the lime. Most prefer without the lime.
Anestesia: Origin: Tipsy Pub in Villalba P.R.
Tea Toddy: Perfect for a day when it is cold, rainy or snowy outside. Tastes great.
Voodoo Dew: Poor shots into jar or glass and then poor can of dew in!! Mix well and enjoy!!!
Kool-Aid Slammer: Fill half the shot glass with the kool-aid first. Then put a paper towel over the top of the glass and slowly pour in the vodka. If you do it right, you should be able to see that the two liquids are separated, with the vodka on top. Now slam it! The last thing you'll taste is the kool-aid.
Cioccolato e cocco: Mix all ingredients thoroughly and pour in glass.
Moose Piss: Surprisingly good taste that will bring back folks for more. A friend and I made this for a convention. If guests ask what it is you are supposed to recite the ingredients at the top of your lungs and finish with, "And what does it taste like?? It tastes like piss!!"
Bobby Burns Cocktail: Stir all ingredients (except lemon peel) with ice and strain into a cocktail glass. Add the twist of lemon peel and serve.
Albysj\u00f6n: Pour vodka in glass then the rest, stir well. By the way for best results add Kiwi juice concentrate last
Joe's Killer Bee: Mix all ingredients then top with 151 Rum.
Killer Kool-Aid #2: Unless you're a candy-ass, you should be able to handle two or three of these. Great drink for you guys who want to buy your girl a sweet-but-strong drink, to get lucky that night. Don't be a candy-ass.
Funky Filly: Mix ingredients and strain over ice.
Nutty Banana: Its a very cool and tropical drink that is popular here in the northwest part of the states
Millionare's Coffee: This is a great drink for those cold winter nights when regular hot chocolate doesn't do the trick.
P.S.U. Victory Dance: A very smooth tasting drink and a little on the sweet side. It is a nice change from Long Island Ice Teas! Go Lions!
Caribbean Ice Tea: Tastes like a Long Island Ice Tea, but with a Caribbean Sea appearance. Use Malibu Rum and you will think you in the islands. Hey Mon and Wo-Mon, enjoy !!!
Lemon Splash Martini: Mix Vodka, Amaretto, Tripple Sec and a 1/2 squeeze of Lemon wedge in a shaker with ice. Shake. Squeeze remaining lemon juice into Martini glass. Pour mixture into glass. Garnish with a lemon twist.
Golden Miller: Mix above ingred. together with LOTS of crushed ice. Enjoy!
Atheist's Best: Came from a cracker named Atheist
Nutty Belgian: Very sweet, good for after dinner as a dessert.
Gin And Pink: In a highball glass almost filled with ice cubes, combine the gin, gonic, and bitters. Stir well and garnish with the lemon twist.
Crap Schnapps: Notice the first letters of each ingredient. My own creation 20 years ago
King Kong: Just visualize yourself on the white sands of and Aruban beach. Nothing beats it!
Gunfire: Good on a cold morning. Wakes you up like gunfire would.
Poop Shoot: I highly recommend using "Red Pop" soda instead of fruit punch.
Panama Deluxe: Shake all ingredients together, serve in a tumbler over ice.
Kumoniwannalaya: Fruity, with a bit of a kick. Tis is another creation from the Delta chi archives!!!!
Wet Dream: Mix all ingredients except Chambord. Chill and strain mixture into a martini glass. Float Chambord to the bottom of the glass.
Full Moon Fever: Add the three rums and the Midori in highball glass with ice. Add a little Sour mix for flavor and fill the rest with pineapple juice. It's a nice light green color. Garnish with a pineapple wedge and a cherry.
Sweet Death: Fill glass with ice then pour ingrediants in order then stir.
Klingon Blood Wine: Start with ice filled beer mug. Add tabasco first. Shake twice, a bad blend is terrible!
Circus Peanut Margarita: Mix well in a blender with ice and serve in a highball glass that has been rimmed with jimmies. Garnish with a day-glo orange circus peanut.
Coffee Liqueur: Combine coffee, sugar and water. Simmer 1 hour and let cool. Add vanilla and vodka. Age in sealed jar 2 to 3 weeks.
The Hot Churchill: Great for a late evening by the fire or for a ski lodge. Try adding a bit of loose chamomile tea for a soother before bed
Georgian Sunrise: Combine and blend all four ingredients and serve in a highball glass with a lime garnish.
Flaming Confederate: Start with dash of grenadine. Layer godiva Liqueur, then float 151 proof rum. Light rum on fire. Blow out shot, then drink.
Platinum Grand Margarita: I created this margarita variation to utilize the very best top shelf ingredients and impart a smooth citrus-lime-orange taste. All of the liqueurs used are derived from the orange (and most are quite high in alcohol content). This margarita is surprisingly sweet and smooth. Make one of these and you'll probably make another. A variation of this recipe would be to add 1/4 oz. Blue Curacao.
Mary Garden Cocktail: Stir ingredients with ice, strain into a cocktail glass, and serve.
Maurizio's Dream: This is a proven drink for Caribbean Cocktail Partys and get's going without alcohol. This is a Gambrinus Classic!!!
Aqua Fodie: Fill glass with ice. Pour in 1 oz. of gin followed by 1 oz. of Blue Curaco. Fill glass with orange juice, garnish with orange and cherry and serve.
Extreme Valentine: Mix all ingredients into glass. Enjoy.
Flying Squirrel: This drink was created during a Monday Night Football game. It is named after one of my fraternity brothers, Squirrel.
Tina Baker: Fill highball glass with ice. Add 1/1/2 oz. of peach scnapps. Then fill the glass about 1/2 full with o.j. Next fill the rest of the glass with 7-up or Sprite. Top the drink off with a dash of grenadine. Garnish with a flag.
Purple Cow: Can be made with grain alcohol under carefully controlled circumstances. White, red or purple grape juice can be used: 100% juice is best (none of that grape 'drink' garbage, please).
Elmer Fuddpucker: Well, it's the best summertime, hot weather drink going. Trust me...these babies grow on you. ! And believe me, you absolutely can't taste the beer! (As long as you use LITE beer, that is>) This drink is a favorite of folks from Wisconsin, those wild and crazy
Peanut Butter and Jelly: Just pour and drink. No chill.
Kahlua and Iced Cream: If you can't taste it, wait 'til you hit bottom..
Honolulu Cooler: Pack a tall glass with crushed ice, add lime juice and southern comfort. Fill with pineapple juice and stir.
James The Second Comes First: In a mixing glass half-filled with ice cubes, combine all of the ingredients. Stir well. Strain into a cocktail glass.
Abe's Tropical Night in Hell: Based on the drink Abe's Tropical Night while watching the Crocodile Hunter!
Funnel Cloud #1: Pour beer, ginger ale, vodka, light rum, and ameretto in a funnel. Turn the funnel while you drink it.
Chicago Fizz: Shake all ingredients (except carbonated water) with ice and strain into a highball glass over two ice cubes. Fill with carbonated water, stir, and serve.
Mystery Date: The Mystery Date comes from a party the first weekend of August 1998 - looking for a slightly sweeter alternative to the martini (and a change of pace from the manhattans served that night) I created this to rave reviews. I feel that it combines the essence of a classic cocktail with some of the sweeter variations of today, providing a refreshing drink for some of the more delicate imbibers at a gathering.
The Graduate: This is for the May 1999 class of Texas Tech University. Don't use too much Amaretto- makes it taste pretty funky.
Widow Maker: Drinking to many of these will eventually lead to someone becoming a widow
Russian Brunch: mix vodka and o.j. in blender with ice. add champaine and stir in.
Union Jack Cocktail: Shake all ingredients with ice, strain into a cocktail glass, and serve.
Scotch Toddy: Perfect winter drink. The headmaster of a private school from the west Hollywood, California area taught me this drink at a christmas beach party in 1973. This one will warm you clear to your toes!
Jackson 5: Mix the shots of Rum, Vodka, Amaretto over ice, add a dash of Sour Mix, then fill the rest with Cranberry Juice.
Midori Sour - Frozen: Mix all indredients in a blender with enough ice to freeze. Serve in a tall glass with a lime twist garnish
Belgian Blue: Just pour all ingredients in the glass and stir...
Buttafuoco: In a cocktail shaker, combine all ingredients except club soda and cherry with cracked ice. Shake well. Strain into glass over ice cubes and fill with club soda. Stir, then add cherry.
Bayou Backwater: It looks like the backwater in a dirty river, but it tastes great. Use high quality lemonade or fresh lemonade if available.
Slippery Nipple #3: Put the Irish cream in first. Then slowly pour the Kahlua down the side of the glass so it doesn't mix. Then add the Butterscoth Schnapps on top nice and slow.
Captain Cook: In a shaker half-filled with ice cubes, combine all of the ingredients. Shake well. Strain into a cocktail glass.
The Big-V: Try to layer in shot glass.
Purple Rain #3: Should have a nice light violet colour
Haidin-Haidin: In a mixing glass half-filled with ice cubes, combine the rum, vermouth, and bitters. Stir well. Strain into a cocktail glass and garnish with the lemon twist.
Pink Heart: Perfect sipper. We use it for Valentines Day.
Candy Cane: Just one of the creations invented at The RoadHouse NightClub in International Falls, Minnesota
'57 Chevy with a White License Plate: 1. Fill a rocks glass with ice 2.add white creme de cacao and vodka 3.stir
Fluxuation Cocktail: Sometimes it is best to make it right in the can of Mountain dew.
Sour Death: Mix with ice and pour into glass.
Mark and Coke: Impeccably smooth for a bourbon, Makers Mark mixes exceptionally well with Coca-cola. You need not destroy the flavor of the bourbon with too much Coca-cola, however. The ice should effectivly mellow the drink and you will find that the Makers Mark and Coca-Cola complement one another very well. Sweeter than a "Jack and Coke".
Brandy Flip: In a shaker half-filled with ice cubes, combine the brandy, egg, sugar, and cream. Shake well. Strain into a sour glass and garnish with the nutmeg.
Grapefruit Nog: Blend all ingredients with 1/2 cup crushed ice in an electric blender at a low speed for a short length of time. Pour into a collins glass over ice cubes and serve.
Blue in the Face: Tonic and sugar can be replaced with Sprite.
Super Bloody Screwdriver: Be careful, this on will knock you on your ass. This will teach you a lesson. I had a hard-core drinker slam a few of these, he puked on my couch in his sleep!
Warped Thursday: When we make it, we empty half a can of Cherry Coke, pour the vodka into the can, then pour in the Kool-aid. I'm sure it would work in a 12oz glass. Stir - a kabob stick works well in the can.
Gumby Dammit: Careful, this one tastes great but it really sneaks up on you!
Tummy Blower: Just Mix together and drink fast !!
The Captain's Martini: Created during "Liqu'or Treat" Oct. 31/1997 on 9th Henday.
Great Pumpkin Punch: Serve in a hollowed out pumpkin with floating pumpkin chunks.
Supersonic Sunshine: This drink is dedicated to a wonderfull girl in my class.
Hot Devilish Daiquiri: In 2 qt. microproof casserole, combine hot water, sugar, spices, and concentrated juices. Stir, then cook on HI 5-6 minutes or until mixture boils. Heat rum in microproof container on HI for 30 seconds. Ignite and pour over hot beverage. Ladle into punch cups for serving.
Shit on the Grass: In a shot glass add Creme de Menthe on bottom of glass and then add baileys on top of creme de methe, thus making the effect as what the cocktail is called.
Lemon Drop #3: Bite the lemon and hold the juice in your mouth. Shoot the rum and then lick your lips. A very tasty treat!
Rubber Chicken: This is the first drink we ever had. We got someone to go in and buy us some rum (when we were under age) but they bought us rye whiskey instead. We did not know what to mix it with so we got ginger ale and then some limeade. We mixed 3 oz drinks and it was smooth! We recommend Canadian Club Rye Whiskey as that is the BEST and it is what we used that night. The name came from a Phil Collins video," living in a nuclear world", when we were trying to figure out a name, a Rubber Chicken flew by on the video. That's all folks!
Berry Breeze: Fill highball glass with ice. Add 1 oz. each of Chambord, Kahlua, and Baileys. Top with cream. Short Shake.
Pink Police: In a pitcher add one can of beer. Next add one can of frozen pink lemonade. Note: do not mix the lemonade with water. Finally use the empty lemonade container to measure and add the vodka. Stir and enjoy.
Clousseau: Invented by the famous homebartender, Taffarello
Liquid cocaine 8 ball: Mix it and wait for the effects. Its called a liquid cocaine. Because it's expensive and once you try it your hooked.
Peach Bunny: Shake all ingredients with ice, strain into a cocktail glass, and serve.
Joy Ride: This is a house specialty drink from the Bellagio Hotel and Casino in Las Vegas.
Tirade: Takes a 2 oz shot glass. First put in the triple sec, then tequila, last the spiced rum.
Pina Colada #2: Add some crumbled ice, mix it well and pour it into a tall glass. Garnish with a slice of fresh pineapple.
T-52: A drink I made up to replace a B-52, just changed irish creme with Tequila Rose. Tastes like a B-52 but with a Strawberry flavor.
Dirty Ocean: A fruity carribean drink. Originated at O'Charley's in Lafayette, IN by Chris Verville.
Jager Tonic: Add Jägermeister to a highball glass whith three ice cubes. Fill with tonic Water and garnish whith orange slice.
Ethnic Sugar: The stuff will froth and foam when you mix all of your ingrediants together because of the kool-aid.
Watermelon Crawl #2: This drink was concieved at the now defunct Almonte Roadhouse in Almonte, Ontario. It is a very sweet drink with not a lot of bite. Gin can be substituted for the vodka.
Poison Ivy: This drink was created while I had a case of Poison Ivy. It has a special meaning. The Kahlua stands for the poison, and the Aftershock stands for the body. When layered, the poison has been touched. When mixed, the poisonous oils have been drank.
Astral Gateway: Put ingredients into the glass, fill with ice.
Apricot Breeze: Fill hurricane glass with ice. Add Vodka and apricot nectar to glass then fill with tonic. Stir.
Park Avenue: Stir all ingredients with ice, strain into a cocktail glass, and serve.
Firetruck: Serve in a Shotglass, and toss it straight down.
Flaming Jesus: Be aware NOT to let the 151 burn too long or you will burn your lips on the shot glass. Embarassingly enough, I know this from personal experience.
Pouce Coupe Puddle: Good start on a warm glow during the summer nights! This drink originated from a group of crazies. A group that partakes in the eventfull fun of skinny dipping at Pouce Coupe River. Drink 5 and I promise you'll join us in skinny dipping:) Here's to Northern Lights and *Cheers*
Attitude: Stir. Garnish with a lemon & lime slice.
Caribbean Breeze: Created by SKYY Vodka in honor of Desmond Dekker's birthday.
Butch's Pink Panties: Consume a six pack of Miller Lite before attempting to make this drink. -- This drink can cause severe problems with the authorities. Jim Beam and gravel are not good mixers. Special thanks go out to Jenny and Arika for all their dedicated efforts in the research and development of this drink. Be sure to check out the Butch Harper Web Page.
Sphinx Cocktail: Stir all ingredients (except lemon slice) with ice and strain into a cocktail glass. Add the slice of lemon and serve.
Gypsy: In a mixing glass half-filled with ice cubes, combine gin and vermouth. Stir well. Strain into a cocktail glass and garnish with the cherry.
Cherry Comfort: Pour about 4 oz of your favorite Cherry Cola into a cup. Add about 1 shot (1 oz) of Southern Comfort 100 (or 2 depending on how your college football team is doing). Ice is optional.
Vanilla Liqueur: Split vanilla beans first lengthwise, then in 1/2 inch pieces. Put in a bottle, add brandy and sugar, and shake *very* well until the sugar has dissolved. Now leave the mixture about 1 month so that the vanilla flavour has time to develop properly. After one month you can strain the liqueur so that the vanilla particles are removed. The vanilla liqueur keeps a very long time. To serve you have two possibilities: either use the liqueur as it comes out of the bottle, or mix with half'n'half or whipping cream. The latter doesn't keep too long though, it should be used in the next days (or right now). You can also pour a small amount of the liqueur in a glass of milk as a kind of alcoholic vanilla milk.
YoYo Blow Out: Throw it all together and have fun. Adjust sour mix for a stiffer or weaker drink.
GTV: The drink is best drank at once.
Pooky and Chooky: Shake with ice. Pour into glass without ice.
Cranberry Cordial: Place the chopped cranberries in a 2 liter jar that has a tight-fitting lid. Add the sugar and rum. Adjust the lid securely and place the jar in a cool, dark place. Invert the jar and shake it every day for six weeks. Strain the cordial into bottles and seal with corks.
Boardwalk Breeze: Garnish is optional, required if serving to the public, but at home, I don't generally have flags in my fridge! This Cocktail is best when consumed on a cool summer eve while lying on your hammock! - Dedicated to my fabulous June '98 bartending class in Atlantic Beach, NC. Good luck to you all, and may you be blessed with lots of TIPS!!
John's Bomb: pour very cold tequila with Benedictine in a shot glass.You serve it with a slice of orange that has cinnamon on it nad kalo methisi(that was Greek)
Watermelon: Shake all ingredients with ice, strain into a collins glass over ice cubes, and serve.
Hilde's Special: Try it, it will blow your socks off !!
Homecoming: Fill rocks glass with ice, add Amaretto and Baileys and serve with a stirrer.
Killer Kool-Aid: Fill a cocktail glass with ice. Layer ingredients. Do not stir.
Sex With An Alligator: Cute drink for girls, or people who like drinks with funny names.
Bairn: Mix over ice and shake. Strain into an old fashioned glass on the rocks.
Bitchin' Apple Cider: Try it warm during the winter months.
Pixie Stix: Pour SoCo and Amaretto over ice in a highball glass. Fill with sweet and sour mix and top off with a splash of sprite. Float grenadine on top. Garnish with maraschino cherries.
Egg Nog #2: Separate 6 eggs. Beat yolks well. Beat in 1/2 cup sugar. Clean/degrease beaters and bowl. Beat egg whites until stiff peaks form. Beat in 1/2 cup sugar. Fold in yolks to whites. Gently stir in 1 pt heavy cream, 1 pt milk, 1 pt bourbon, and 1 oz rum. Serve as is or well chilled. Double recipe to fill a punch bowl.
The Texas Mudslide: Just think of a chocolate milk shake when you try this.
Russian Qualude: Pour alchol over ice, top with milk, stir and serve
Blue Banana: Pour creme de banana into the glass and layer blue curacao on top.
Hotel Plaza Cocktail: Stir all ingredients (except pineapple) with ice and strain into a cocktail glass. Decorate with the crushed slice of pineapple and serve.
Boomerang Shot: This one's for Kevin Pshar!!! Thanx Corpral!
The Evil Blue Thing: This drink was invented by my friends, Nathan Smith and Dave Calam. Dave said "let's make a blue drink" and the rest is history. It's evil because it tastes like candy but packs a big alcoholic punch! It's a great drink, if a little on the expensive side.... The taste is like those orange ovation chocolates, only better (less orange).
Fruit Basket: Also makes a great frozen drink if ingredients are blended with ice. This drink is well worth the effort!
Skip And Go Naked #2: Pour beer into mug. Add lemonade. Float SoCo on top.
J. R.'s Godchild: In a shaker half-filled with ice cubes, combine the boubon, amaretto, and milk. Shake well. Pour into an old-fashioned glass.
Alien Secretion: Just mix all in equal portions. Its good!
Doug's Modified Cement Mixer: This is one of my favorites!
Bayou Juice: Pour equal parts of all ingrediants into a shaker filled with ice. Chill, shake and strain!
Black Baltimore: In a shaker half-filled with ice cubes, combine all of the ingredients. Shake well. Strain into a cocktail glass.
Mountain Cocktail: Shake all ingredients with ice, strain into a cocktail glass, and serve.
Three Day Weekend: A friend of mine who used to be a bartender introduced me to this drink. It's actually his creation, so many thanks to Clint Galliano!
Orange Lion: Stir with ice and strain into cocktail glass.
Donivan Flowers' Rocks: Put each of the ingredients into a punch bowl. Mix, and with a straw, SHOOT.
Tokyo Rose: Mix equal parts in a mixing glass half-filled with ice cubes. Shake well. Strain into a cocktail glass. Garnish with a cherry.
J. R.'s Godfather: In an old-fashioned glass almost filled with ice cubes, combine both of the ingredients. Stir to mix the flavors.
911: Mix equal proprtions of each in one shot glass.
Lorraine's Delight: We created this by mixing all of the ingredients we had available in Lorraine's kitchen. You may need to adjust to your personal taste but it is quite delicious. The peach schnapps give it a wonderful flavor.
Betty Paige: This drink is named Betty Paige after the 50's pin-up model because the drink is as red as her lipstick. You can also experiment by adding more liqueur or by trying the drink sweet or dry.
Passion Chi-Chi: It's a very nice tropical drink, good for warm days (nights, sure!).
Sazerac #2: This recipe, with slightly different quantities, came originally from the Carrousel Bar in New Orleans' Monteleone Hotel.
Harry Denton Martini: I got this out of Cheers magazine, and I happened to know the guy it is named after. He owns a few really snazzy joints in San Francisco, but he's from southern Idaho like me. Happy cocktailing :-) P.S. It is very important that it is Bombay Sapphire ... So says the creator.
Traffic Light Cooler: Into pilsner glass filled with ice cubes, first pour the melon liqueur, then the tequila, to create a green layer. Add sour mix. Slowly pour orange juice against side of glass to create the yellow layer. Add a few more ice cubes, if needed. Carefully float the sloe gin on top for the red layer. Garnish with a cherry and lemon and lime wheels. Stir just before drinking.
Purple Nipple: Inspired by the ladies at the Starboard Restaurant in Dewey Beach, Del!
Quentin: In a shaker half-filled with ice cubes, combine the rum, Kahlua, and cream. Shake well. Strain into a cocktail glass and garnish with the nutmeg.
To Hell With Swords And Garter: In a shaker half-filled with ice cubes, combine all of the ingredients. Shake well. Strain into an old-fashioned glass almost filled with ice cubes.
Fucked up Float: Mix together Kahlua, schnapps, vodka, ice-cream and cola until blended. Fill with milk.
Fruit Flip-Flop: Place all ingredients in the blender jar - cover and whiz on medium speed until well blended. Pour in one tall, 2 medium or 3 small glasses and drink up.
C*m Scorcher: Standing will allow drink to layer, always drink safe.
Orgeat Lemonade: Mix lemon juice and orgeat syrup in a tumbler with 2-3 small ice cubes. Fill up with soda water and stir.
3rd Street Promanade: This is an incredibly delicious drink, like an alcoholic orange sherbert. Its a great party drink, and a great kickback drink.
Cocaine Lady: Sometimes referred to as the "Crack Lady".
J\u00e4germonster: Fruit punch with a kick in the ass.
Cookie Monster #2: Use a spoon to layer the alcohol and float 151 on the top. Lite on fire, let it burn for about 5 seconds, then blow it out and suck it up through a straw.
Jen's Mountain Gin: If you can't find lemon gin, regular gin and some lemon juice might work as well.
The Race: Pour in a shaker and shake well, then serve in a cocktail glass frosted with tangerine.
Pink Gin Tonic: Pour the gin and the tonic water into a highball glass almost filled with ice cubes. Stir well. Top with Campari to add more colour and taste. Garnish with the lime wedge.
Mithering Bastard: In a shaker half-filled with ice cubes, combine all of the ingredients. Shake well. Strain into an old-fashioned glass almost filled with ice cubes.
Cul-De-Sac: In a mixing glass half-filled with ice cubes, combine both of the ingredients. Stir well. Strain into a cocktail glass.
Melonoma: Shake ice, vodka and melon liquer. Strain into shot glass.
Petit Zinc: Shake with cracked ice and strain into a chilled cocktail glass. Garnish with a cherry or a slice of orange.
Cokaretto: Fill tall glass with ice. Pour Coca-Cola into glass. Add amaretto and stir. Drink with straw.
Malibu Jane: Pour in Coconut Rum. Pour in Milk. Mix in two teaspoons of cocoa powder. Add one last teaspoon of cocoa powder: called "One to grow one." Let stand for one minute.
Affirmative Action: fill glass about 1/4 with chilled orange juice. add vodka at a 2:1 ratio with cognac and add to highball glass with orange juice. optional squeeze of lemon.
Raspberry Stupid: Mix Well. Drink. Repeat until stupid.
Screaming Blue Viking: A "loose" Nordic interpretation of the "Screaming Viking" from 'Cheers'. The rather potent ingredients tend to cancel each other out, making for an easy to drink concoction that packs quite a punch. (Kind of tastes like Minty Scope) Born in a small pub in New Jersey.
Dive Bomber: Fill shot glass with 1/3 oz Amaretto and 2/3 oz root beer schnapps, next drop shot glass into mug of beer and drink before it fizzes over the mug.
Forza FCK: This is a tribute to the best footballteam (soccer) in Denmark!
Mozart: In a mixing glass half-filled with ice cubes, combine the rum, vermouth, triple sec and orange bitters. Stir well. Strain into a cocktail glass and garnish with the lemon twist.
Mountain Sunrise: Complements of Kyle Brooks and Victor Lange. May 12, 2000 a reunion of lost buds.
Lager & Lime: A great drink on a warm summer day!
Dogg piss: Dump the ingredients into a container and stir it. It's very simple and very delicious.
Taco-Mancer: This drink was invented when, surprise, the dishes were dirty, and all I had was my huge-assed coffee mug with a shot of espresso left in the bottom. I put everything in, and Wow! Don't let the ingredients scare you, it's marvelous!
White Lion Cocktail: Shake all ingredients with ice, strain into a cocktail glass, and serve.
Lemon Shot: Mix Galliano and Absolut Citron in a shot glass, lay lemon wedge sprinkled with sugar over glass and pour a rum over wedge and glass. light rum with a lighter and let burn for a second. Do shot quickly and suck on lemon. If it is done correctly, this will taste like a shot of sweet lemonade.
Backfire: Russian B-52 (i.e. the Soviet Backfire Bomber)
Tijuana Carbomb: Taught to me by my Mexican ex-roommate,during siesta one lazy summer morning.Best cure for a hangover
Cooperstown Cocktail: Shake all ingredients (except mint) with ice and strain into a cocktail glass. Add the sprig of mint and serve.
Bourbon Slush: Be careful - it tastes like lemonade and goes down smooth but is really potent.
Fuzzy Martini: Wonderful on a hot summer day!
Yaps: Mix 1part apple schnapps with 1 part Yukon Jack and serve in shot glass.
Gorilla Milk #2: Petey's Summertime on Rye Beach in NH
Old Fashioned Hot Buttered Rum: In 2-quart suacepan combine sugar, brown sugar and butter. Cook over low hear, stirring occasionally, until butter is melted (6-8 min). In large mixing bowl, combine cooked mixture with ice-cream, beat at medium speed, scraping bowl often until smooth (1-2 min). Store refrigerated up to 2 weeks or frozen up to one month. For each serving, fill mug with 1/4 cup mixture, 1 oz. rum and 3/4 cup boiling water, sprinkle with nutmeg.
Brent's Tequila Head Slam: This drink can be made as a regular or tall shot or can be built gently (so as to preserve the fizz) in a bottle for pouring into many individual shot glasses for a 'Group Head Slam'. Keep doing these 'til you understand the expression, "Eppa, Eppa, Andele!"
Iced Lemonade Tea: Use a big bowl and mix the sugar and lemonade together. Pour the tea over the top while it is still boiling. That way the sugar and lemonade mix properly. Let it cool before serving.
Bahama Mama #2: Shake with cracked ice. Serve in a 12 oz. glass. Garnish with a cherry and 1/2 slice orange in a tooth pick.
Bogomip: A very strange tasting drink, but also a very nice one.
Schnapp It Up: stir all ingredients together - pour over ice - enjoy!!
Faust: Careful with this one, it may make you sick: but if it doesn't, you'll be fine until the next morning. Don't drink to much of this one!
Vodka Gimlet: Stir all ingredients with ice, strain into a cocktail glass, and serve.
Tomato Cocktail: Stir in a mixing glass Worcestershire sauce, lemon juice, tomato juice, and a little salt and pepper over ice cubes. Strain off into a large cocktail glass.
Vixen: I didn't invent it, but everyone I've made it for wanted the receipe!
AT&T;: Pour Vodka and Gin over ice, add Tonic and Stir
Gideon's Green Dinosaur: Add all ingredients in collins glass with ice and stir.
Fire Engine With Alarm: Pour it in a highball glass. Should be severed Cold. Also use Ice if preffered. Realy the same as an Fire Engine.
Shamrock #2: As served aboard the "Princess of Scandinavia".
Peach Fuzz: Warning - this is a simple, but very sneaky drink. It really can be habit forming.
Mirage: A sweet cocktail to conquer a sweet lady. Created in Fregene, Italy by Tony
Scrumptious Coffee: Sweeten the coffee with brown sugar to taste. Mix coffee, liquor, and orange peel in a pan. Heat gently, but do not boil. Let infuse for a couple of minutes. Pour into pre-warmed heat-resistent glasses. Float whipped cream on top. Garnish with thin strip of peel of orange and nutmeg.
Peach Kazi: Combine ingredients with ice, shake and pour into a shot glass.
Kahlua Sour: Mix Kahlua and lemon juice, add sugar and enjoy.
Diablo: Put ice in glass, pour Casa Noble Reposado Tequila, Creme de cassis, fresh lime juice and fill with ginger ale, stir. Pud wedge of lime on top.
Fruit Salad Daiquiri: Fill blender 1/2 to 3/4 with ice and add strawberries, pieces of watermelon, and slices of star fruit. Last add rum and mix. Blend until smooth and garnish with a slice of star fruit and an umbrella.
Brandy Collins: Shake juice of lemon, brandy, and powdered sugar with cracked ice and strain into a collins glass. Add ice cubes, fill with carbonated water, and stir. Garnish with a slice of orange and top with a cherry. Serve with a straw.
Riley's Sparrow: In a mixing glass half-filled with ice cubes, combine all of the ingredients. Stir well. Strain into a cocktail glass.
Piccadilly Cocktail: Stir all ingredients with ice, strain into a cocktail glass, and serve.
Mad Scientist: Fill shot glass less than 1/2 full with blueberry schnapps, add same amount of raspberry schnapps. Slowly top off with grenadine. Dribble a small amount of Bailey's on top..
Villa Park: Mix bourbon, orange juice and pineapple juice in mixer. Shake well. Pour into highball glass with ice.
Gorilla's Tit: Be very careful lighting this drink.
Brass Monkey: Basically, toss the Rum & Vodka together and stir gently. Next, pour in the orange juice . Shake well. Pour over ice.
Amaretto Sweet & Sour: I only make this in the blender, so my measurements are somewhat crude. It's usually just made to taste. It is an excellent party drink and a favorite of ALL my female friends.
Monkey La La: This drink originates from Anthony's Key Resort on Roatan, Honduras, C.A. I went there on my vacation in the spring of 1999 and lived on these.
Russian seven: In a tall glass with ice add 1.5 oz of vodka, fill to top with seven-up. Garnish with lime peel.
Latin Love: Developed by the Naked Fish Restaurants in Boston, MA. Voted America's Most Sensual Cocktail by Penthouse Magazine.
Bob's Moscow Mule: Using a chilled cooper mug,fill with ice. Pour ingredients over ice. Garnish with sprig of fresh mint.
Boswandeling (A walk in the woods): Drink from Amsterdam from one of the oldest bars and alcohol manufacturors/distillers.
Steamboat: Very popular drink in Chico in the 80's
Haus Special: Created in the winter of 1998. Co-created by Kevin, Kris, and Cody. Another Chambana classic.
Xeres Cocktail: Stir ingredients with ice, strain into a cocktail glass, and serve.
LaPaglia's Punch: Shake everything and serve on the rocks
Flying Dutchman: In an old-fashioned glass almost filled with ice cubes, combine the gin and triple sec. Stir well.
Fancy Brandy: Shake all ingredients (except lemon peel) with ice and strain into a cocktail glass. Add the twist of lemon peel and serve.
Squished Smurf: Layer peach schnapps, then Bailey's. Slowly dribble blue curacao over top so that it curtles around the Bailey's. Drip Grenadine in different areas of the shooter glass so that it swirls around the already 'disgusting' mixture.
Centipede: Combine vodka and rum in cocktail shaker with ice. Shake well and strain into old-fashioned glass with ice. Top off with grapefruit soda and stir gently.
Fulminator: Cut lemons into wedges and mix into large container.
Applecar: Shake all ingredients with ice, strain into a cocktail glass, and serve.
Saurian Brandy: The recipe comes from the 'Official Star Trek Cooking Manual' (Bantam Books 1978) by Mary Ann Piccard, but not even Paramount will acknowledge it anymore.
Jamaican Sunset #2: Very tropical, made up this drink at Rick's Cafe in Negril, Jamaica while on our honeymoon.
Paisley Martini: Stir all ingredients (except lemon peel) over ice cubes in an old-fashioned glass. Add the twist of lemon peel and serve.
Absolut Lemonade: Simple and great in the Blazing summer sun.
Dirty White Mother: Pour brandy and Kahlua into an old-fashioned glass filled with ice cubes and stir. Float cream on top and serve.
Combo: Shake all ingredients with ice, strain into an old-fashioned glass over ice cubes, and serve.
Dead Little Green Frog: Mix Lemon-Lime mix in a large pitcher or punch bowl and add the other ingredients and pour over ice, top each drink off with 1/2 oz of Cherry liqueur.
French 125: Pour brandy and sweet and sour into a collins glass over ice cubes and stir well. Fill with chilled champagne and stir lightly. Add the slice of lemon and serve.
Strawberry Starburst: This is a John Steve original. He now resides in L.A. serving the stars these for breakfast.
Windy Beach: It was an awfully windy day and we were experimenting with blender drinks. We thought we'd name it after the day, but it also tasted like a drink you'd have on the beach in the Caribbean. Hence, Windy Beach.
KoolShock: Place a few ice cubes into the glass, add the Aftershock, then the Kool-Aid. Stir to mix. Enjoy
Tequila Colagallo: A very popular drink in Gudalajara, Mexico, right in the center of the only region in the world where tequila is produced. Makes a great appetizer and is an all-time favorite.
The Gold, The Bad, and The Ugly: The drink ends up layered if you leave it for a minute or so. The Goldschlager will be on top, the milk and Bailey's stay mixed, and there's a sort of Kahlua sludge at the bottom. This is how I prefer to drink it. My roommate, however, likes to continually stir his as he's drinking it. I don't normally measure out the ingredients when I start playing alchemist. I just pour until it looks right. To that end, the measurements here are estimations. You can vary the ingredients to suit your taste. Modifications I've tried include sprinkling cinnamon on the top and adding chocolate syrup. Cheers.
The Terminator: Pour in your favorite shot glass and enjoy. Ahh... so smoothe!
Fluorescent Dream: A very sweet drink with a funky colour.
Russian Iceberg: This will taste like a shot of scope, but the effects of one drink will make you wish it was just scope. For added effect, make all liquids 1.5oz. This drink was given to me by some Texas Tech frat guys who were working as bartenders at an Outback Steakhouse.
Titty Twister-Rita: pour ingredients into blender over crushed ice blend until you see the top of the mix stop moving pour into margarita glass and garnish with a lemon or lime slice... (by the way, this makes 1 to 2 servings only) hope ya enjoy it...
Peppermint Stick: Shake all ingredients with ice, strain into a champagne flute, and serve.
Pink Limon: This is a house specialty drink from the Bellagio Hotel and Casino in Las Vegas.
Finn Roses: G.Brandberg, F.B.S.K., Finland 3. I.B.A.s I.C.C. 1962 -- Category: Pre Dinner
Big Unit: Blue and gold are the colors of the Houston Astros uniforms. This drink was invented during the '98 play-off fiasco vs. the Padres.
Peach Passion: A fruity drink that the ladies will like
Hispaniola: Add ice and a cherry. Stir.
Timberwolf: Mix together in a a large glass and fill remainder with Orange Juice. Serve Cold
Blue Lemonade: Mix into punch bowl and make sure that the koolaid is already pre measurable with sugar already added. Be careful, hard to taste alcohol so intoxication sets in quickly!
Pink Floyd: Finished drink should look, smell, and taste like Hawaiian Punch, but don't let that fool you. Developed at O'Riley's Bar and Grill in Universal City, TX in 1986
Sloe Comfortable Screw #1: stir or shake ingredients & serve with ice
Mahwah Iced Tea: This is good if you want to get blasted, I know from experience.
Small Bomb #2: This drink is VERY powerful and doesn't taste like it, please use caution while drinking it.
Daring Dylan: Let the Mexican hot chocolate cool to room temperature. Pour all of the ingredients into an Irish coffee glass almost filled with crushed ice. Stir well.
Spring Feeling Cocktail: Shake all ingredients with ice, strain into a cocktail glass, and serve.
Neon Ghost: Shake it with ice, and serve it in a cocktail glass.
JimPop's Margarita: Lightly rub the rim of a cocktail glass with some lime juice, dip glass rim in the salt. Mix all ingredients with ice, strain into fresh ice in the salt-rimmed glass, and enjoy!
Sour Cow: Created by the insane people from the Louisville Australian Rules Football Club.
Bernardete: The Bernardete was created during one of the very famous sessions of Antares, a very well known and respected jazz club in Lleida, Spain during Christmas of 1996. It quickly expanded all over Spain and it is very usual to see it being served in the most prestigious clubs of Spain. Perfect drink for coloquial sessions where one needs to be aware of the conversation yet desires to have a nice touch of alcohol running through the veins. Wonderful drink created by fantastic people!!! Visca Lleida i l'Antares!!
Baduizm: This cocktail was created in Buenos Aires, Argentina. My inspiration was listen the music of Erykah Badu her song Appletree.
Teresa's Dream Shake: Tastes like a strawberry milk, with a little kick. Real ladies drink, however i have many men hooked on them also. Vodka can be added also.
Sloe Gin Flip: Shake all ingredients (except nutmeg) with ice and strain into a whiskey sour glass. Sprinkle nutmeg on top and serve.
Mindfuck: Just mix over ice in the glass.
Burnt Embers: In a shaker half-filled with ice cubes, combine all of the ingredients. Shake well. Strain into a cocktail glass.
Vodka Collins: Shake vodka, juice of lemon, and powdered sugar with ice and strain into a collins glass. Add several ice cubes, fill with carbonated water, and stir. Decorate with slices of orange, lemon, and top with the cherry. Serve with a straw.
Beam Scream: To my knowledge, my brother Gary invented this drink.
Pink California Sunshine: Pour the champagne into a cocktail glass. Add the orange juice and creme de cassis.
B-69: Add ingredients to shaker with cubed ice, stir till shaker frosts, strain into rocks glass.
Johanna: The name of this drink is dedicated to my girlfriend Johanna. It was to her I made this drink the first time.
Fuzzy Cooter: 2 shots of vodka, 2 shots of Peach Schnapps. Fill the rest with Ginger Ale, Lemonade, and OJ to taste
Alexander (Original): This drink was created by Albert the Bartender at the Chatam Hotel in Paris in 1928.
Morgan's Mountain: In a shaker half-filled with ice cubes, combine the rum, creme de cacao, and cream. Shake well. Strain into a cocktail glass. Drop the Kahlua into the center of the drink.
Hurricane Hugo: Mix all ingredients over ice in large Shaker. Add more juice to taste for the lightweights. Shake well and strain into shot glass. This recipe may be doubled or quadrupled. We strongly encourage this. Enjoy!!
Greenham's Grotto: In a shaker half-filled with ice cubes, combine all of the ingredients. Shake well. Pour into an old-fashioned glass.
Redneck: If you want to drink this outside (the way it should be), use a sports cup instead of a mason jar. This is best enjoyed while watching some sort of outdoor, college music concert. I usually mix acording to color, the lighter the weaker. Overall, this is a very sweet drink.
Whoomp: Add all the shit into one large cooler or what ever you have that will hold it add one block of ice and mix then consume till it whomps you in the ASS
Carmel Apple: Mix equal parts of freezer cold schnapps.
Soother Cocktail: Shake all ingredients with ice, strain into a cocktail glass, and serve.
Caucasian: A Caucasian/White Russian is the favorite drink of "The Dude" in the movie "The Big Lebowski."
Irish Flag: Layer: creme de menthe, irish cream and brandy
Tequila Manhattan: Shake tequila, vermouth, and lime juice with ice and strain into an old-fashioned glass over ice cubes. Add the slice of orange, top with the cherry, and serve.
Yoda: Like Yoda, this drink is green and powerful. If you want a slightly less powerful Yoda, you can leave the Vodka out. If you want a more powerful drink, obviously add more Vodka. This drink is very sour, but if you like Midori sours, or pucker, you should love this.
Hasty Cocktail: Stir all ingredients with ice, strain into a cocktail glass, and serve.
Misty Loch: Pour the 3 first ingredients into a shaker with ice, shake, strain into a brandy snifter and add the 2 little dashes of Kahlua.
Canada Dream: This is a lady's drink and my salute to the Indian summer in Toronto
Sex on the Beach #2: For the shooter you mix all ingredients together over ice. For the shot you decrease the Pineapple Juice to 1 ct. Chill and then strain.
Apple Cider Punch #1: If you use the whole all spice and cloves, tie them in cheesecloth. Heat the mixture. Stir occasionally. If you want an alcoholic drink, rum would be nice.
The Bozek: The drink creater is one Greg Bozek who is currently at Southern Illinois University. Greg is a wild guy with bit of a temper. The same can be said for his drink.
Planter's Punch: Combine all ingrdients. Serve over ice in a collins glass. Garnish with lime wedge and maraschino cherry.
A joy of Almond: Shoot or suck with staw from bottom to top.
Adios Motherfucker (A.M.F.): Pour all ingredients except the 7-Up into a chilled glass filled with ice cubes. Top with 7-Up and stir gently.
Mister Christian: In a shaker half-filled with ice cubes, combine all of the ingredients. Shake well. Strain into a cocktail glass.
Vanilla Vargas: You may add more than one can of pepsi to the drink, depending on your tastes. If you prefer coke to pepsi, then you can use it as a substitute. Ice may need to be added if you are a slow drinker. This drink goes especially well with
Beachcomber: Place sugar in a saucer. Rub the rim of a cocktail glass with lime wedge and dip glass into sugar to coat rim thoroughly, reserve lime. In a shaker half-filled with ice cubes, combine rum, maraschino liqueur, cherry brandy, and lime juice. Shake well.
Perfect Manhattan: Not too sweet...not too dry...just Perfect!
Zimartini: Takes away Zima's sweetness and gives it more kick
Silver Bronx: In a shaker half-filled with ice cubes, combine all of the ingredients. Shake well. Strain into a sour glass.
Red Orange: Shake in jigger with ice and pour into martini glasses
